input: grammar: Assessing Gas-cooled Fast Reactors for Generation IV Services To meet the energy demand in the 21st century , a new generation of nuclear reactors termed as Generation IV , are being developed .
target: Assessing Gas-cooled Fast Reactors for Generation IV Services To meet the energy demands of the 21st century , a new generation of nuclear reactors termed as Generation IV , is being developed .

input: grammar: One of the most popular concepts of the Generation IV is gas-cooled fast reactors ( GFR ) , which uses a direct-cycle helium turbine for electricity generation or hydrogen production with a high efficiency CITATION Hej05 \ l 1033 ( Hejzar , Pope , Williams , & Driscoll , 2005 ) .
target: One of the most popular concepts of the Generation IV is gas-cooled fast reactors ( GFR ) , which use a direct-cycle helium turbine for electricity generation or hydrogen production with a high efficiency ( Hejzar , Pope , Williams , & Driscoll , 2005 ) .

input: grammar: However , there are concerns about its impact of its radioactive waste on environment and its safety in operation CITATION But04 \ l 1033 ( Butler , 2004 ) .
target: However , there are concerns about the impact of its radioactive waste on the environment and its safety in operation ( Butler , 2004 ) .

input: grammar: Although GFR has certain deficiencies at this stage ; further R&D funding should be supported because it has three main advantages in terms of sustainability , safety and industrial applications .
target: Although GFR has certain deficiencies at this stage , further R&D funding should be supported because it has three main advantages in terms of sustainability , safety and industrial applications .

input: grammar: Opponents of GFR point out that it is inevitable for nuclear reactors to produce radioactive waste which has destructive effects and due to the high cost of pollutant management , it seems impossible to install nuclear reactors without any radioactive emissions .
target: Opponents of GFR point out that it is inevitable for nuclear reactors to produce radioactive waste which has destructive effects , and due to the high cost of pollutant management , it seems impossible to install nuclear reactors without any radioactive emissions .

input: grammar: However , a research conducted by the MIT GFR development team CITATION Hej05 \ l 1033 ( Hejzar , Pope , Williams , & Driscoll , 2005 ) shows that it is possible to develop a closed fuel cycle with full transuranics ( TRU ) recycling so that all TRU will be recycled with losses of 0.1 % or less .
target: However , a research conducted by the MIT GFR development team ( Hejzar , Pope , Williams , & Driscoll , 2005 ) , shows that it is possible to develop a closed fuel cycle with full transuranics ( TRU ) recycling so that all TRUs will be recycled with losses of 0.1 % or less .

input: grammar: The long-term waste will be substantially reduced with a core with a conversion ratio to be close to 1.0 CITATION Gir08 \ l 1033 ( Girardin , et al. , 2008 ) .
target: The long-term waste will be substantially reduced in the core with a conversion ratio to be close to 1.0 ( Girardin , et al. , 2008 ) .

input: grammar: Consequently , GFR has a significant improvement on radioactive waste minimization over the previous generations .
target: Consequently , GFR has a significant improvement on radioactive waste minimization over the previous generations .

input: grammar: Hence the GFR system is highly-ranked in sustainability among all the nuclear reactors and this makes it a favorable energy supply in the future .
target: Hence , the GFR system is highly-ranked in sustainability among all the nuclear reactors and this makes it a favorable energy supply in the future .

input: grammar: There are also worries about the accidents caused during processes of coolant depressurization and decay heat removal because GFR has to be operated in an environment of both high pressure and temperature .
target: There are also worries about the accidents caused during processes of coolant depressurization and decay heat removal because GFR has to be operated in an environment of both high pressure and temperature .

input: grammar: Fortunately , under Generation IV International Forum , a number of researches are dealing with this safety problem using " passive decay heat removal options " CITATION Gir08 \ l 1033 ( Girardin , et al. , 2008 ) .
target: Fortunately , under Generation IV International Forum , a number of research deals with this safety problem using " passive decay heat removal options " ( Girardin , et al. , 2008 ) .

input: grammar: In the design of GFR system , combined systems of both active cooling and passive cooling is applied : active systems are used to remove the decays of heat at high power level then passive systems will take over after 24 hours when decay heat is reduced to 0.5 % .The active part defends the system at the first place and the passive part only dues with the pressure achieved after depressurization .
target: In the design of the GFR system , combined systems of both active cooling and passive cooling are applied : active systems are used to remove the decays of heat at high power level , then passive systems will take over after 24 hours when decay heat is reduced to 0.5 % .The active part defends the system in the first place and the passive part only with the pressure achieved after depressurization .

input: grammar: In this way , less human labor is involved into the operation of GFR and thus accident risk in minimized .
target: In this way , less human labor is involved in the operation of GFR and thus accident risks are minimized .

input: grammar: Some also claim that GFR can hardly change the energy supply scenario in the globe because the nuclear energy today is mainly utilized to generate electricity , which only accounts for 16 % of the total energy consumption CITATION Her09 \ l 1033 ( Herranz , Linares , & Moratilla , 2009 ) .
target: Some also claim that GFR can hardly change the energy supply scenario in the globe because nuclear energy today is mainly utilized to generate electricity , which only accounts for 16 % of the total energy consumption ( Herranz , Linares , & Moratilla , 2009 ) .

input: grammar: However , except for electricity generation , the future GFR is predicted to achieve an excellent thermal performance based on a direct Brayton cycle configurations .
target: However , except for electricity generation , the future GFR is predicted to achieve an excellent thermal performance based on a direct Brayton cycle configuration .

input: grammar: Herranz , Linares , & Moratilla ( 2009 ) predicts that GFR can use a few hunderds MWs to produce heat at a very high temperature.This will satisfy most heat applications of industrial processes .
target: Herranz , Linares , & Moratilla ( 2009 ) predict that GFR can use a few hundred MWs to produce heat at a very high temperature.This will satisfy most heat applications of industrial processes .

input: grammar: Besides , some scientists suggest that the thermal efficiency of GFR can probably be increased from the present level 30 % to higher than 50 % with no additional economic penalty CITATION Her09 \ l 1033 ( Herranz , Linares , & Moratilla , 2009 ) .
target: Besides , some scientists suggest that the thermal efficiency of GFR can probably be increased from the present level 30 % to higher than 50 % with no additional economic penalty ( Herranz , Linares , & Moratilla , 2009 ) .

input: grammar: Hence , this will reinforce the competitiveness of GFR in the energy market of most industries .
target: Hence , this will reinforce the competitiveness of GFR in the energy market of most industries .

target: To summarize , GRF can be a favorable energy supply because it can achieve a wider range of industry applications with minimized radioactive waste .

input: grammar: On March 27 1977 at Los Rodeos airport , a massive shockwave shook the control towers as the airport witnessed the collision of 2 Boeing 747s , PA1736 and KLM4805 , taking the lives of 522 people .
target: On March 27 , 1977 , at the Los Rodeos airport , a massive shockwave shook the control towers as the airport witnessed the collision of 2 Boeing 747s , PA1736 and KLM4805 , taking the lives of 522 people .

input: grammar: Some argue that the cause of this accident was mainly the result of human errors , thus it would be inevitable even with the best procedures and equipment in place .
target: Some argue that the cause of this accident was mainly the result of human errors , thus it would be inevitable even with the best procedures and equipment in place .

input: grammar: However , in my opinion , the implementation of psychology can help to anticipate some events that led to the accident ; therefore allowing designers to prepare for such emergencies .
target: However , in my opinion , the implementation of psychology could have helped to anticipate some events that led to the accident , therefore allowing designers to prepare for such emergencies .

input: grammar: This might have changed the course of action of the pilots and thereby preventing the accident .
target: This might have changed the course of action of the pilots and thereby preventing the accident .

input: grammar: Two major areas that psychology could have helped include the design of the airport and the communication equipment and procedures .
target: Two major areas that psychology could have helped include the design of the airport and the communication equipment and procedures .

input: grammar: Skeptics claim that the region usually sees few people and thus there is no need for a larger airport that can accommodate larger planes to be built .
target: Skeptics claim that the region usually sees few people and thus there is no need for a larger airport that can accommodate larger planes to be built .

input: grammar: On the contrary , the construction of the Tenerife south airport in 1978 suggests that more people , rather than less , were visiting the region .

input: grammar: Still , designers failed to improve the airport to accommodate larger planes such as the Boeing 747 , even when was widely used at that point in time .

input: grammar: The use of psychology in this case can help designers to anticipate that the airport would eventually see a Boeing 747 and thus make the necessary preparations .

input: grammar: One step that can be taken would be to remove sharp 148- degree turns that the PA1736 , a 747 , would not be able to take .

input: grammar: This might have allowed the PA1736 to make an earlier exit rather than stay on the runway and hence prevent the accident from ever occurring .

input: grammar: Argumentative Essay for the Supercritical-Water-cooled Reactor
target: Argumentative Essay for the Supercritical-Water-cooled Reactor

input: grammar: Nuclear power plants , which produce minimum global warming emissions when they operate , give a relatively high thermal efficiency .
target: Nuclear power plants , which produce minimum global warming emissions when they operate , give a relatively high thermal efficiency .

input: grammar: Therefore , nuclear power is considered as potential energy options to ease the deteriorating energy problem we are facing today .

input: grammar: For example , the United States now acquires roughly 20 percent of its electricity from 104 nuclear plants ( Butler , D. 2004 ) .
target: For example , the United States now acquires roughly 20 percent of its electricity from 104 nuclear plants ( Butler , D. 2004 ) .

input: grammar: However , the further research and development of nuclear power plants could also raise widespread concern for human safety that results from worries about both massive radioactive releases due to power plant meltdown or terrorist attack and the access these nuclear reactors provide to the materials that can be used to make nuclear weapons .
target: However , further research and development of nuclear power plants could also raise widespread concern for human safety that results from worries about both massive radioactive releases due to power plant meltdown or terrorist attack and the access these nuclear reactors provide to the materials that can be used to make nuclear weapons .

target: Although this nuclear reactor concept faces issues of high requirement of materials , past record of cost overruns , and nuclear safety threat , it still prevails because of the promising research on needed materials , simplified design , and advanced design features in proliferation and safety .

input: grammar: Opponents claim that the Supercritical-Water-cooled Reactor is supposed to operate at superior thermodynamic condition , which refers to the operating pressure as high as 25MPa and the maximum temperature of more than 500  C .

input: grammar: Compared with current Light-Water-cooled Reactors , the Supercritical-Water-cooled Reactor raises the operating temperature in outlet coolant from 300  C to 500  C .
target: Compared with current Light-Water-cooled Reactors , the Supercritical-Water-cooled Reactor raises the operating temperature in outlet coolant from 300  C to 500  C .

input: grammar: Furthermore , the supercritical water environment may also cause some compatibility issues in practice .

input: grammar: The materials used in this reactor must be capable to withstand various supercritical water conditions that range from the low temperature inlet at 280  C to the outlet at above 500  C , and from a compressed liquid to a fluid nearly an order of magnitude less dense than ordinary water as the supercritical water traverses the core from bottom to top .
target: The materials used in this reactor must be capable to withstand various supercritical water conditions that range from the low temperature inlet at 280  C to the outlet at above 500  C , and from a compressed liquid to a fluid nearly an order of magnitude less dense than ordinary water as the supercritical water traverses the core from bottom to top .

target: A clean energy source like nuclear power seems to be the ideal solution for the energy crisis .

target: Safety is a major point , and it is important for the Generation 4 reactors to prove its safety .

input: grammar: The SFR has a passive cooling system ; this is because the thermal difference between the coolant boiling temperature and the operational temperature is quite large .
target: The SFR has a passive cooling system ; this is because the thermal difference between the coolant boiling temperature and the operational temperature is quite large .

input: grammar: Hence in case of a meltdown or any terrorist activities the system can avoid a meltdown without any human interaction .
target: Hence in case of a meltdown or any terrorist activities the system can avoid a meltdown without any human interaction .

input: grammar: On the other hand the VHTR has an active cooling system , which means a human interaction is required in case of an emergency .
target: On the other hand the VHTR has an active cooling system , which means a human interaction is required in case of an emergency .

target: The SFR boasts a recycling system where 99.9 % of the actinides are recycled back as fuels , such as plutonium and since the SFR is a closed fuel system , fuel can be used again in the system .

target: Unlike the SFR , the VHTR has no waste recycling system and hence It goes directly into the repository where the nuclear waste has a half life of about a few centuries only ( research is currently going on to reduce the half life ) .

target: This could be a serious security flaw ; in case the plutonium is stolen it could be used to fuel nuclear weapons .

input: grammar: The robotic surgery is usually defined as the surgery performed with the use of robot .
target: The robotic surgery is usually defined as the surgery performed with the use of robot .

input: grammar: This technology has been in use since 1985 with the invention of PUMA 560 robot ( Savatta , 2007 ) .
target: This technology has been in use since 1985 with the invention of PUMA 560 robot ( Savatta , 2007 ) .

input: grammar: Robotic surgery is beneficial because it is precise and accurate such that it minimizes the incisions , decreases the blood loss and reduces the healing time .
target: Robotic surgery is beneficial because it is precise and accurate such that it minimizes the incisions , decreases the blood loss and reduces the healing time .

input: grammar: However , there are several concerns about robotic surgery especially in terms of safety , cost and efficiency .
target: However , there are several concerns about robotic surgery especially in terms of safety , cost and efficiency .

input: grammar: First of all , most people are questioning about the safety when talking about robotic surgery .
target: First of all , most people are questioning about the safety when talking about robotic surgery .

input: grammar: As robotic surgery is a new medical technology , most patients may not be familiar with it .
target: As robotic surgery is a new medical technology , most patients may not be familiar with it .

input: grammar: Thus they have no doubt on the robots and feel uneasy during the surgery with no human present .
target: Thus they have doubt on the robots and feel uneasy during the surgery with no humans present .

input: grammar: In case of emergency , it will be even harder for the surgeon , who controls the robot , to know the feeling of the patient and handle the situation .
target: In case of emergency , it will be even harder for the surgeon , who controls the robot , to know the feeling of the patient and handle the situation .

input: grammar: Thus , some people prefer surgery done by surgeon as they believe such surgery will have lower risk level .
target: Thus , some people prefer surgery done by a human surgeon as they believe such surgery will have lower risk level .

input: grammar: However , this is not true and in fact , robotic surgery has a relative low risk level than conventional surgery .
target: However , this is not true and in fact , robotic surgery has a relatively lower risk level than conventional surgery .

input: grammar: As mentioned before , robotic surgery is more precise and causes smaller incision .
target: As mentioned before , robotic surgery is more precise and causes smaller incision .

input: grammar: For example , according to Livingston ( New York Health News , 2009 ) , the all-robotic kidney transplant surgery is easier and less painful with its tiny robot incision and the patient is able to be back to normal activities within few weeks .
target: For example , according to Livingston ( New York Health News , 2009 ) , the all-robotic kidney transplant surgery is easier and less painful with its tiny robot incision and the patient is able to be back to normal activities within few weeks .

input: grammar: Furthermore , to avoid the risk , the professional engineers are required to check and maintain the system before and after every surgery to ensure the functionality of robot .
target: Furthermore , to avoid the risk , the professional engineers are required to check and maintain the system before and after every surgery to ensure the functionality of robot .

input: grammar: Surgeons are also well trained before they actually use the robot in performing the surgery .
target: Surgeons are also well trained before they actually use the robot in performing the surgery .

input: grammar: The robot is designed in the way that in case of emergency , it will stop operating immediately and the surgeon will take over the surgery himself .
target: The robot is designed in the way that in case of emergency , it will stop operating immediately and the surgeon will take over the surgery himself .

input: grammar: In this way , the safety of the patients is not more an issue .
target: In this way , the safety of the patients is no longer an issue .

input: grammar: Another concern by the general public is the cost of surgery .
target: Another concern by the general public is the cost of surgery .

input: grammar: According to Sherman ( Science News , 2009 ) , the prices of da Vinci Surgical Systems , one of the newest robotic surgery systems , range from $ 700,000 to $ 2.25 million per system .
target: According to Sherman ( Science News , 2009 ) , the prices of da Vinci Surgical Systems , one of the newest robotic surgery systems , range from $ 700,000 to $ 2.25 million per system .

input: grammar: Hence , the public are afraid that the poor patients can not afford the robotic surgery .
target: Hence , the public are afraid that the poor patients can not afford the robotic surgery .

input: grammar: Although it is true that the cost of the robotic surgery system is high , we have several solutions to solve this problem .
target: Although it is true that the cost of the robotic surgery system is high , we have several solutions to solve this problem .

input: grammar: The most important part is government subsidy .
target: The most important part is government subsidy .

input: grammar: The robotic surgery is expensive because the robot is costly .
target: The robotic surgery is expensive because the robot is costly .

input: grammar: Hence , if the government could subsidize the hospital in purchasing the system , the cost of robotic surgery will dramatically drop to an affordable price to the general public .
target: Hence , if the government could subsidize the hospital in purchasing the system , the cost of robotic surgery will dramatically drop to an affordable price to the general public .

input: grammar: Also , according to an article ( Bonsor and Strickland , 2009 ) , the number of surgeons and nurses required for robotic surgery will be much less than conventional surgery and the hospital stays are generally shorter due to quicker healing time .
target: Also , according to an article ( Bonsor and Strickland , 2009 ) , the number of surgeons and nurses required for robotic surgery will be much less than conventional surgery and the hospital stays are generally shorter due to quicker healing time .

input: grammar: These will also cut the cost of robotic surgery .
target: These will also cut the cost of robotic surgery .

input: grammar: In addition , more and more patients prefer robotic surgery as they agree that robots will perform more accurate surgeries with shorter healing time .
target: In addition , more and more patients prefer robotic surgery as they agree that robots will perform more accurate surgeries with shorter healing time .

input: grammar: Thus , even the cost of robotic surgery is relatively higher than conventional surgery ; most people believe that the money is worthy spent .
target: Thus , even if the cost of robotic surgery is relatively higher than conventional surgery , most people believe that the money is worthy spent .

input: grammar: Last but not least , people may concern about the efficiency of robotic surgery .
target: Last but not least , people may be concerned about the efficiency of robotic surgery .

input: grammar: There are doubts about whether the surgeons will be able to perform robotic surgeries effectively .
target: There are doubts as to whether the surgeons will be able to perform robotic surgeries effectively .

input: grammar: Recently , there was one case that one patient died from complications during the robotic surgery because the surgeon was not familiar with the system and could not perform effectively ( Science News , 2006 ) .
target: Recently , there was one case that one patient died from complications during the robotic surgery because the surgeon was not familiar with the system and could not perform effectively ( Science News , 2006 ) .

input: grammar: This concern is reasonable because if the surgeon is not familiar with the system , he may take longer time for the surgery and thus create a risk .
target: This concern is reasonable because if the surgeon is not familiar with the system , he may take longer time for the surgery , thus creating a risk .

input: grammar: To avoid this kind of risk happening in Singapore , a training center should be set up in each hospital .
target: To avoid this kind of risk happening in Singapore , a training center should be set up in each hospital .

input: grammar: Professional engineers and foreign experts are invited to train the local surgeons with certain hours of practicing to ensure the surgeons are fully familiar with the system and will be able to perform in real situation .
target: Professional engineers and foreign experts are invited to train the local surgeons with certain hours of practicing to ensure the surgeons are fully familiar with the system and will be able to perform in real situations .

input: grammar: Now , if the surgeons are well trained , the robot will eventually increase the efficiency of the surgeons .
target: Now , if the surgeons are well trained , the robot will eventually increase the efficiency of the surgeons .

input: grammar: According to Wiley ( ScienceDaily , 2009 ) , if the surgeon is well trained , using robots could help him perform many surgical tasks without other human assistants .
target: According to Wiley ( ScienceDaily , 2009 ) , if the surgeon is well trained , using robots could help him perform many surgical tasks without other human assistants .

input: grammar: This is beneficial especially in case of Singapore as there are limited skilled assistants available in hospital .
target: This is beneficial especially in the case of Singapore as there are limited skilled assistants available in hospital .

input: grammar: Also , with the help of robots , the fatigue of the surgeon will reduce as most work is done by robot and time taken for each surgery is generally shortened .
target: Also , with the help of robots , the fatigue of the surgeon will be reduced as most work is done by robots and time taken for each surgery is generally shortened .

input: grammar: All these will increase the efficiency of robotic surgery .
target: All these will increase the efficiency of robotic surgery .

input: grammar: In conclusion , robotic surgery is a safe and effective prototype with a worthy cost .
target: In conclusion , robotic surgery is a safe and effective prototype with a worthy cost .

input: grammar: In the future , with our advanced innovations of technology , most patients will be able to enjoy benefits of robotic surgery in the setting of minimal pain , low blood loss and early recovery .
target: In the future , with our advanced innovations of technology , most patients will be able to enjoy benefits of robotic surgery in the setting of minimal pain , low blood loss and early recovery .

target: In addition , Bouchard ( 2008 ) mentions the uses of process heat for various types of industries such as chemical plants , petroleum refineries and hydrogen production .

input: grammar: Of course , some might be doubtful over the advantages gained through the performances of SWCR in the upcoming decades due to the slow development process .
target: Of course , some might be doubtful over the advantages gained through the performances of SWCR in the upcoming decades due to the slow development process .

input: grammar: However , Heber ( 2008 ) has explained that fact of the slow process in the new designs of SWCR is due to the great emphasize over the overall safety performances of the nuclear plants .
target: However , Heber ( 2008 ) has explained that the fact of the slow progress in the new designs of SWCR is due to the great emphasis over the overall safety performances of the nuclear plants .

input: grammar: With the implementation of SCWR , they could tackle some of environmental issues faced by modern man today and in the near future .
target: With the implementation of SCWR , they could tackle some of the environmental issues faced by modern man today and in the near future .

input: grammar: Firstly , SCWR would improve on current designs by recycling all the actinides used in plutonium and its nuclear waste .
target: Firstly , SCWR would improve on current designs by recycling all the actinides used in plutonium and its nuclear waste .

input: grammar: This could eliminate the toxicity of the radioactive substances and the heat produced by the waste by converting it to low-lived fission products .
target: This could eliminate the toxicity of the radioactive substances and the heat produced by the waste by converting it to low-lived fission products .

input: grammar: ( Bouchard , & Bennett , 2008 ) Furthermore , the use of nuclear power to generate electricity would not increase the risks of global warming .
target: ( Bouchard , & Bennett , 2008 ) Furthermore , the use of nuclear power to generate electricity would not increase the risks of global warming .

input: grammar: Unlike coal , the process used by nuclear power does not emit carbon dioxide to the environment .
target: Unlike coal , the process used by nuclear power does not emit carbon dioxide to the environment .

input: grammar: Similarly , Schiermeier ( 2009 ) explains the fact that the nuclear energy is seen as an important alternative source of energy with the growing concern of global warming from the over-reliance of fossil fuel and the future energy security .
target: Similarly , Schiermeier ( 2009 ) explains the fact that the nuclear energy is seen as an important alternative source of energy with the growing concern of global warming from the over-reliance of fossil fuels and the future energy security .

input: grammar: Critics may argue that the environmental effects caused by the nuclear accidents are dangerous and harmful .
target: Critics may argue that the environmental effects caused by nuclear accidents are dangerous and harmful .

input: grammar: The land at the nuclear accident site would eventually transform into a wasteland .
target: The land at the nuclear accident site would eventually become a wasteland .

input: grammar: Nevertheless , with the ongoing research and development in the Generation IV reactors designs , it could ensure the environmental effects caused by any nuclear accident by new reactors will be minimal compared to Chernobyl incidents .
target: Nevertheless , with the ongoing research and development in the Generation IV reactors designs , it could ensure the environmental effects caused by any nuclear accident from new reactors will be minimal compared to the Chernobyl accident .

input: grammar: It is evident that the funding in the area of research and development of SWCR will provide benefits in the aspects of security , performance and environment .
target: It is evident that the funding in the area of research and development of SWCR will provide benefits in the aspects of security , performance and environment .

input: grammar: With strong performance in the SCWR concept , mankind would experience better protection with the construction of new nuclear plants .
target: With strong performance in the SCWR concept , mankind would experience better protection with the construction of new nuclear plants .

input: grammar: In the long run , the development of SWCR could also provide solutions to the environmental issues Ultimately , mankind need to accept new technology confidently and ethnically that might bring about unexpected improvements to the world .
target: In the long run , the development of SWCR could also provide solutions to the environmental issues . Ultimately , mankind needs to accept new technology confidently that might bring about unexpected improvements to the world .

input: grammar: One of the world 's most devastating gas leak accidents occurred on December 3 , 1984 , in Bhopal , India .
target: One of the world 's most devastating gas leak accidents occurred on December 3 , 1984 , in Bhopal , India .

input: grammar: The accident caused thousands of death and many are still suffering from its aftermath effect .
target: The accident caused thousands of death and many are still suffering from its aftermath effect .

input: grammar: Methyl isocyanate ( MIC ) gas escaped from a pesticide producing plant owned by the Union Carbide India Limited ( UCIL ) and intoxicated the people in Bhopal .
target: Methyl isocyanate ( MIC ) gas escaped from a pesticide producing plant owned by the Union Carbide India Limited ( UCIL ) and intoxicated the people in Bhopal .

input: grammar: After investigation , it was found that someone deliberately added water into the storage tank of the highly reactive MIC , causing a runaway reaction , pressure built up and caused large volume of toxic gas to escape and intoxicate the area .
target: After investigation , it was found that someone deliberately added water into the storage tank of the highly reactive MIC , causing a runaway reaction , pressure built up , which then caused a large volume of toxic gas to escape and intoxicate the area .

input: grammar: Safety systems such as the alarm system , a refrigeration unit ( for cooling down the storage tank ) , a caustic soda scrubber ( to neutralized the toxic gases ) , and the flare system ( to incinerate excess gases or toxic gases ) were all not in operation at that time .
target: Safety systems such as the alarm system , a refrigeration unit ( for cooling down the storage tank ) , a caustic soda scrubber ( to neutralized the toxic gases ) , and the flare system ( to incinerate excess gases or toxic gases ) were all not in operation at that time .

input: grammar: According to Psychology and design processes ( Bernhard.W .
target: According to Psychology and design processes ( Bernhard.W .

input: grammar: 2007 ) , the article defines design as a strategy allowing the final product to meet the user requirements in many different areas and accidents usually occurs when there are miscommunications , inadequate organization or errors contributed by individuals .
target: 2007 ) , the article defines design as a strategy allowing the final product to meet the user requirements in many different areas and accidents usually occur when there are miscommunications , inadequate organization or errors contributed by individuals .

input: grammar: Summing up , accidents occur when the outcome is not within the expectation of the designers .
target: Summing up , accidents occur when the outcome is not within the expectation of the designers .

input: grammar: Bernhard suggests idea of adopting psychology during the design phase of a project , because engineers are humans and humans are prone to mistakes .
target: Bernhard suggests the idea of adopting psychology during the design phase of a project , because engineers are humans and humans are prone to mistakes .

input: grammar: Implementing psychology in the design does have advantages .
target: Implementing psychology in the design does have advantages .

input: grammar: It can be use as a reminder to engineers if there are any areas neglected during the process , allowing better communication to take place within the team and reduces the possibility of problems arising from miscommunication or individual 's action .
target: It can be used as a reminder to engineers if there are any areas neglected during the process , allowing better communication to take place within the team and reducing the possibility of problems arising from miscommunication or individual actions .

input: grammar: Also , instead of having the traditional feedback controls of safety , use of psychology predicts the consequences of having mistakes in design and take corrective actions immediately , this will greatly reduce the probability of accidents occurring due to design errors .
target: Also , instead of having the traditional feedback controls of safety , the use of psychology predicts the consequences of having mistakes in design and take corrective actions immediately , thus greatly reducing the probability of accidents occurring due to design errors .

input: grammar: Adopting psychology in the initial or design phase of the project seems to benefit in short term , however , it may not be beneficial in the long term .
target: Adopting psychology in the initial or design phase of the project seems to benefit in the short term ; however , it may not be beneficial in the long term .

input: grammar: This is because most of the design changes over time due to expansion , maintenance and more .
target: This is because most of the designs change over time due to expansion , maintenance and more .

input: grammar: In most cases , the root cause of accidents is due to human errors example operational error ( BI-ME , 2009 ) and usually arises during operation instead of the designing phase .
target: In most cases , the root cause of accidents is due to human errors . For example , operational errors ( BI-ME , 2009 ) usually arise during operation instead of the designing phase .

input: grammar: For example , the Bhopal incident occurs due to lack of maintenance work for the plant and the workers neglected the importance of the safety in plant operations .
target: For example , the Bhopal incident occurred due to lack of maintenance work for the plant and the workers neglected the importance of the safety in plant operations .

input: grammar: The main cause of accident is due to a worker 's mistake of adding water to MIC causing a runaway reaction .
target: The main cause of the accident is due to a worker 's mistake of adding water to MIC causing a runaway reaction .

input: grammar: Thus , implementing psychology in the design does not help , regardless how well the plant is constructed or having many safety devices installed , as long as the operators neglect the importance of working safely , possibility of accidents occurring is definite .
target: Thus , implementing psychology in the design does not help , regardless of how well the plant is constructed or how many safety devices have been installed . As long as the operators neglect the importance of working safely , the occurrence of accidents is definite .

input: grammar: Psychology can be use in areas to promote safety within workers or reinforce the importance of it .
target: Psychology can be used in areas to promote safety within workers or reinforce the importance of it .

input: grammar: Another factor that often leads to accidents is the approach the company or supervisors take on .
target: Another factor that often leads to accidents is the approach the company or supervisors take on .

input: grammar: In the case of Bhopal incident , the plant manger should have immediately rectified the problem like failure of safety device systems .
target: In the case of the Bhopal incident , the plant manger should have immediately rectified the problem like safety device systems .

input: grammar: It was later discovered that the storage tank alarm system has not been working for four years and flare system is down for five months ( E.Ingrid , 2004 ) Therefore , if a superintendent of a company shows no concern about safety , it is very likely that workers will take on the similar stand in long run .
target: It was later discovered that the storage tank alarm system had not been working for four years and the flare system had been down for five months ( E.Ingrid , 2004 ) Therefore , if a superintendent of a company shows no concern about safety , it is very likely that workers will take a similar attitude in the long run .

input: grammar: In spite of having detailed and careful design , if the company decided to cut edges especially in safety , it is very likely that accidents can still occur .
target: In spite of having a detailed and careful design , if the company decides to cut edges especially in safety , it is very likely that accidents can still occur .

input: grammar: In current engineering practices , a method has already been use to update and reinforce safety , known as Hazard and Operability studies or HAZOP .
target: In current engineering practices , a method has already been used to update and reinforce safety , known as Hazard and Operability studies or HAZOP .

input: grammar: HAZOP is conducted every 3 years ( varies with different company ) and it is used to update the design of the plant or equipment in case of any changes .
target: HAZOP is conducted every 3 years ( but it varies with different companies ) and it is used to update the design of the plant or equipment in case of any changes .

input: grammar: It allows the representative from different departments to collaborate and discuss the best possible solution to enhance safety in the plant .
target: It allows the representatives from different departments to collaborate and discuss the best possible solution to enhance safety in the plant .

input: grammar: Hence , psychology in design phase maybe unnecessary and replaced by a set of regulations obliged by the company .
target: Hence , psychology in the design phase may be unnecessary and replaced by a set of regulations enforced by the company .

input: grammar: In conclusion , adopting psychology does have benefits in the initial phase , as it reduces accidents arise from design errors .
target: In conclusion , adopting psychology does have benefits in the initial phase , as it reduces accidents due to design errors .

input: grammar: However , the usage maybe limited to the design phase , as root causes like operation error , human behavior and company 's stand are common causes for accidents .
target: However , the usage may be limited to the design phase , as root causes like operation errors , human behavior and company 's stand are common causes for accidents .

input: grammar: Thus , psychology maybe use in areas like promoting safety issues among the workers , reduce the behavior of bad practices in workplace and enhancing the communication between the different departments .
target: Thus , psychology may be used in areas like promoting safety issues among the workers , reducing the behavior of bad practices in a workplace and enhancing the communication between different departments .

input: grammar: Of this , 9.9 % are due to road ( cars , trucks , and so forth ) activities [ 1 ] .
target: Of this , 9.9 % are due to road ( cars , trucks , and so forth ) activities [ 1 ] .

input: grammar: On the average , fossil fuels powered cars emit 6 tons of carbon dioxide each year [ 2 ] .
target: On the average , fossil fuels powered cars emit 6 tons of carbon dioxide each year [ 2 ] .

input: grammar: Hence , there is much interest in research and development of solar powered cars which produce zero harmful emission .
target: Hence , there is much interest in research and development of solar powered cars which produce zero harmful emission .

input: grammar: Since 1987 , the World Solar Challenge has been showcasing latest advances in solar cars .
target: Since 1987 , the World Solar Challenge has been showcasing latest advances in solar cars .

input: grammar: Subsequently , the first prototype solar car that travelled 52,000 kilometers across 38 countries was developed and driven by a Swiss school teacher in 2008 [ 3 ] .
target: Subsequently , the first prototype solar car that travelled 52,000 kilometers across 38 countries was developed and driven by a Swiss school teacher in 2008 [ 3 ] .

input: grammar: He demonstrated that this concept is indeed viable .
target: He demonstrated that this concept is indeed viable .

input: grammar: Unfortunately , solar cars are not too safe compared to conventional cars .
target: Unfortunately , solar cars are not too safe compared to conventional cars .

input: grammar: The first fatal accident of a solar car occurred on August 12 , 2004 due to a head-on collision with a Chrysler minivan .
target: The first fatal accident of a solar car occurred on August 12 , 2004 due to a head-on collision with a Chrysler minivan .

input: grammar: The driver of the solar car died instantly while the minivan 's driver was unhurt [ 4 ] .
target: The driver of the solar car died instantly while the minivan 's driver was unhurt [ 4 ] .

input: grammar: There are numerous reasons why the solar car is unsafe .
target: There are numerous reasons why the solar car is unsafe .

input: grammar: The best solar panel in the market today is less than 30 % efficient at converting solar energy to usable electrical power .
target: The best solar panel in the market today is less than 30 % efficient at converting solar energy to usable electrical power .

input: grammar: Hence , solar cars must be made of very light materials .
target: Hence , solar cars must be made of very light materials .

input: grammar: Unfortunately , in any collision , a lighter car would suffer greater damages than a heavier car .
target: Unfortunately , in any collision , a lighter car would suffer greater damages than a heavier car .

input: grammar: Ever since that fatal accident in 2004 , organizers of solar racing have imposed safety regulations on the cars .
target: Ever since that fatal accident in 2004 , organizers of solar racing have imposed safety regulations on the cars .

input: grammar: Safety aspects include the design of the steering wheels , roll bars for the cockpit , safety belts , brakes , tyres , electrical insulation of the car and others [ 5 ] .
target: Safety aspects include the design of the steering wheels , roll bars for the cockpit , safety belts , brakes , tyres , electrical insulation of the car and others [ 5 ] .

input: grammar: Unfortunately and much surprisingly , there are no requirements for airbags .
target: Unfortunately and much surprisingly , there are no requirements for airbags .

input: grammar: It is important that such an idea is explored as the concept of these prototype solar cars will one day be translated to cars of the future .
target: It is important that such an idea is explored as the concept of these prototype solar cars will one day be translated to cars of the future .

input: grammar: Having airbags is a common safety feature in cars today .
target: Having airbags is a common safety feature in cars today .

input: grammar: However , there is an opposing view stating that airbags can cause major injuries [ 6 ] .
target: However , there is an opposing view stating that airbags can cause major injuries [ 6 ] .

input: grammar: Fortunately , since the introduction of the first airbag , the technology has advanced .
target: Fortunately , since the introduction of the first airbag , the technology has advanced .

input: grammar: Today , scientists are studying on " smart airbags " which can tell the size of a person in the seat and how fast the airbag inflates , so as to minimize injuries [ 7 ] .
target: Today , scientists are studying " smart airbags " which can tell the size of a person in the seat and the speed of the airbag inflation , so as to minimize injuries [ 7 ] .

input: grammar: For comparison , safety belts which have widely been accepted on all cars including solar cars , can also cause injuries such as sternal fracture , bowel trauma or spinal injuries [ 8 ] .
target: For comparison , safety belts which have widely been accepted on all cars including solar cars , can also cause injuries such as sternal fracture , bowel trauma or spinal injuries [ 8 ] .

input: grammar: A study done by the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration showed that the seat belt contributed 16 % while the airbag only 8 % of the injuries sustained in the vehicle [ 9 ] .
target: A study done by the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration showed that the seat belt contributed 16 % while the airbag only 8 % of the injuries sustained in the vehicle [ 9 ] .

input: grammar: So , what is the reason airbags can not be accepted as a safety device in solar cars too ?
target: So , what is the reason why airbags can not be accepted as a safety device in solar cars too ?

input: grammar: In recent studies , airbag deployment with or without seat belt used , has shown to decrease the risk of head , thorax and spine injuries [ 10 ] .
target: In recent studies , airbag deployment with or without seat belts used , has shown to decrease the risk of head , thorax and spine injuries [ 10 ] .

input: grammar: In another study , airbags have reduced fatal injuries by an overall 11 % for drivers and a reduction of fatalities of 31 % for purely frontal crash [ 11 ] .
target: In another study , airbags have reduced fatal injuries by an overall 11 % for drivers and a reduction of fatalities of 31 % for purely frontal crash [ 11 ] .

input: grammar: Like conventional fossil fuel driven cars , the airbag can be installed in the steering wheel or dashboard of the solar car , although some research still needs to be done on the exact location of the airbag , the crash sensors and the inflators .
target: Like conventional fossil fuel driven cars , the airbag can be installed in the steering wheel or dashboard of the solar car , although some research still needs to be done on the exact location of the airbag , the crash sensors and the inflators .

input: grammar: Last but not least , I believe that an addition of a few airbags would not vary the cost of the solar car too much .
target: Last but not least , I believe that an addition of a few airbags would not vary the cost of the solar car too much .

input: grammar: Just like in conventional cars , the addition of airbags only cost an increase by two to five hundred dollars at the most .
target: Just like in conventional cars , the addition of airbags only cost an increase by two to five hundred dollars at the most .

input: grammar: Of course , this also has to depend on branding and quality of the car and the airbag .
target: Of course , this also has to depend on branding and quality of the car and the airbag .

input: grammar: Also , the airbag weighs less than one kilogram [ 12 ] and hence should not affect the performance of the solar car significantly .
target: Also , the airbag weighs less than one kilogram [ 12 ] and hence should not affect the performance of the solar car significantly .

input: grammar: Thus , I stand strong on my point of view that solar cars should be improved and designed with airbags to enhance safety .
target: Thus , I stand strong on my point of view that solar cars should be improved and designed with airbags to enhance safety .

input: grammar: " ( Dick , 1986 ) Data and reviews also showed that there were actually essential design flaws of the Challenger , especially lying in the fact that the O-rings in the SRB could not seal the joint when it was very cold .

input: grammar: Design , as Wilpert ( 2007 ) defines , is a human activity that produces something in the future which does not currently exist .

target: The most fundamental pursuit of any design is the guarantee of the product to be usable , functional , safe and competent .

input: grammar: For many cases , safety is the most important aspect of a product , since it may be connected with countless lives .
target: For many cases , safety is the most important aspect of a product , since it may be connected with countless lives .

input: grammar: On the morning of June 3 , 1998 , a tragic train accident happened in a small town in Germany .
target: On the morning of June 3 , 1998 , a tragic train accident happened in a small town in Germany .

input: grammar: The passengers on the fast travelling Inter City Express were comfortably enjoying the journey when they felt an unusual shaking sensation .
target: The passengers on the fast travelling Inter City Express were comfortably enjoying the journey when they felt an unusual shaking sensation .

input: grammar: After a while , the whole train was pulled away from the railway and the bridge , bringing the road down onto itself .
target: After a while , the whole train was pulled away from the railway and the bridge , bringing the road down onto itself .

input: grammar: ( Eschede , n.d. ) The tragedy happened just like that .
target: ( Eschede , n.d. ) The tragedy happened just like that .

input: grammar: When people try to analyze the causes of the train accident , many believed that the use of psychology during the process of design could have prevented it .
target: When people try to analyze the causes of the train accident , many believed that the use of psychology during the process of design could have prevented it .

input: grammar: ( Wilpert , 2007 ) They claim that human actions , which tightly related to psychology , play a major role in the process of design .
target: ( Wilpert , 2007 ) They claim that human actions , which are tightly related to psychology , play a major role in the process of design .

input: grammar: However , some people oppose this argument .
target: However , some people oppose this argument .

input: grammar: In their point of view , psychology is not the deciding factor of the design process , and it is certainly not only the design process that contributes to the accident .
target: In their point of view , psychology is not the deciding factor in the design process , and it is certainly not only the design process that contributes to the accident .

input: grammar: As far as am concerned , the use of psychology may help prevent the tragedy , but it 's far from enough .
target: As far as I am concerned , the use of psychology may help prevent the tragedy , but it 's far from enough .

input: grammar: Rather , developing high technology and taking proper safety precaution when the accident happened are more important .
target: Rather , developing high technology and taking proper safety precaution when an accident happens are more important .

input: grammar: Design engineers can make mistake .
target: Design engineers can make mistakes .

input: grammar: Their design errors eventually would result in the malfunction of the products , thus cause accidents .
target: Their design errors eventually would result in the malfunction of the products , thus causing accidents .

input: grammar: Some people accuse that the design engineers of ICE did n't handle the safety design of the train in a careful way .
target: Some people accuse that the design engineers of ICE did n't handle the safety design of the train in a careful way .

target: They claim that the engineers were being unprofessional ( Eschede , n.d. ) , because the engineers were concerned more about the interior facilities of the train .

target: According to them , the facilities of ICE trains are second to none .

target: Passengers could enjoy the radio , the newspaper as well as refreshment , including wonderful meals provided from the luxurious dining car .

target: The design engineers were said to put so much effort into these trivial factors rather than safety issues .

target: On the other hand , some people defend the engineers .

target: They believe that the engineers should not take the responsibilities and be blamed for the accident .

target: In fact , over the years ICE expanded throughout Germany , and the safety record was perfect .

target: They were unprotected by any form of crash barrier .

target: ( Eschede , n.d. ) If only the work had been done well , countless lives would have been saved .

target: Some people always claim that engineers tend to focus on component failures , but they lack the understanding of the breakdown of the whole system .

target: In other words , they did not take the safety issues into account when they were designing the train .

target: ( Wilpert , 2007 ) However , some people argue , it is not fair to the engineers .

input: grammar: For decades , people have been searching for better energy sources .
target: For decades , people have been searching for better energy sources .

input: grammar: Nuclear power is always a controversial choice .
target: Nuclear power is always a controversial choice .

input: grammar: Although nuclear power is effective and efficient , it can be incredibly dangerous .
target: Although nuclear power is effective and efficient , it can be incredibly dangerous .

input: grammar: Now nuclear reactors come to their forth generation , including six different types of safety enhanced reactors .
target: Now nuclear reactors come to their forth generation , including six different types of safety enhanced reactors .

input: grammar: The molten salt reactor is one of the generation IV reactors .
target: The molten salt reactor is one of the generation IV reactors .

input: grammar: It uses fluoride salts as coolant and the uranium fuel is reacting in a liquid environment ( Butler , 2004 ) .
target: It uses fluoride salts as coolant and the uranium fuel is reacting in a liquid environment ( Butler , 2004 ) .

input: grammar: The prospect of molten salt reactor is promising as its safety is enhanced within the reaction system as well as out of the system and it can profit in a long run .
target: The prospect of molten salt reactor is promising as its safety is enhanced within the reaction system as well as out of the system and it can profit in a long run .

input: grammar: Due to these reasons , it is worthy of supporting the research on the molten salt reactor .
target: Due to these reasons , it is worthy of supporting the research on the molten salt reactor .

input: grammar: Many people believe that nuclear power plant is dangerous as reaction cores have the potential to explode and fuels can release radioactivity which may be fatal to creatures .
target: Many people believe that nuclear power plant is dangerous as reaction cores have the potential to explode and fuels can release radioactivity which may be fatal to creatures .

input: grammar: People oppose research on nuclear power because they do not want to see the Chernobyl tragedy happening again .
target: People oppose research on nuclear power because they do not want to see the Chernobyl tragedy happening again .

input: grammar: However , for the molten salt reactor , this is definitely not a problem .
target: However , for the molten salt reactor , this is definitely not a problem .

input: grammar: Compared to the old generation reactors which use light water as coolant , the molten salt cooled reactor operates at low pressure which prevents explosion caused by steam .
target: Compared to the old generation reactors which use light water as coolant , the molten salt cooled reactor operates at low pressure which prevents explosion caused by steam .

input: grammar: Due to the low pressure , a high-pressure steel vessel is not necessary for a molten salt reactor ( " Molten salt reactor , " 2009 ) .
target: Due to the low pressure , a high-pressure steel vessel is not necessary for a molten salt reactor ( " Molten salt reactor , " 2009 ) .

input: grammar: This makes the reactor smaller and lighter so that plant controlling and emergency handling will be easy .
target: This makes the reactor smaller and lighter so that plant controlling and emergency handling will be easy .

input: grammar: In addition , the inert property of fluoride salts and the liquid reacting environment further prevent core explosion ( Gat and Dodds , 2006 ) .
target: In addition , the inert property of fluoride salts and the liquid reacting environment further prevent core explosion ( Gat and Dodds , 2006 ) .

input: grammar: For radioactivity leakage , it is unlikely to happen in a molten salt reactor as the salts will freeze to prevent dispersal ( Gat and Dodds , 2006 ) .
target: For radioactivity leakage , it is unlikely to happen in a molten salt reactor as the salts will freeze to prevent dispersal ( Gat and Dodds , 2006 ) .

input: grammar: Moreover , the on-line reprocessing reduces fission products .
target: Moreover , the on-line reprocessing reduces fission products .

input: grammar: The long-term radioactive waste generated in a plant with reprocessing is a thousand times less than that in an ordinary plant ( " Molten salt reactor , " 2009 ) .
target: The long-term radioactive waste generated in a plant with reprocessing is a thousand times less than that in an ordinary plant ( " Molten salt reactor , " 2009 ) .

input: grammar: In a word , the probability of major accidents is significantly reduced in a molten salt reactor .
target: In a word , the probability of major accidents is significantly reduced in a molten salt reactor .

input: grammar: Besides the major accidents , security in the reprocessing is another concern of opponents .
target: Besides the major accidents , security in the reprocessing is another concern of opponents .

input: grammar: They worry that plutonium , which is the material used for producing nuclear weapons , can be stolen during reprocessing .
target: They worry that plutonium , which is the material used for producing nuclear weapons , can be stolen during reprocessing .

input: grammar: In fact , this problem can be solved and prevented .
target: In fact , this problem can be solved and prevented .

input: grammar: In a molten salt reactor , plutonium is separated from nuclear waste and added back to the reactor as fuel .
target: In a molten salt reactor , plutonium is separated from nuclear waste and added back to the reactor as fuel .

input: grammar: This indicates that the separated plutonium will not be discarded but can be well monitored .
target: This indicates that the separated plutonium will not be discarded but can be well monitored .

input: grammar: Besides , the amount of weapons-grade fission generated in the molten salt reactor is small ( " Generation IV nuclear reactor , " 2009 ) .
target: Besides , the amount of weapons-grade fission generated in the molten salt reactor is small ( " Generation IV nuclear reactor , " 2009 ) .

input: grammar: Furthermore , scientists have been developing reprocessing technologies that maintain high proliferation resistance .
target: Furthermore , scientists have been developing reprocessing technologies that maintain high proliferation resistance .

input: grammar: Currently , there are technologies like Plutonium and Uranium Recovery by Extraction ( PUREX ) , Uranium Extraction ( UREX ) and Mixed Oxide ( MOX ) .
target: Currently , there are technologies like Plutonium and Uranium Recovery by Extraction ( PUREX ) , Uranium Extraction ( UREX ) and Mixed Oxide ( MOX ) .

input: grammar: The PUREX and the MOX both can handle the weapons-grade plutonium as the reactors-grade plutonium is hard to be stolen due to lethal radioactivity .
target: The PUREX and the MOX both can handle the weapons-grade plutonium as the reactors-grade plutonium is hard to be stolen due to lethal radioactivity .

input: grammar: The UREX can ensure relatively high proliferation resistance which results in high radioactivity ( " Nuclear reprocessing , " 2005 ) .
target: The UREX can ensure relatively high proliferation resistance which results in high radioactivity ( " Nuclear reprocessing , " 2005 ) .

input: grammar: In France , the plant at La Hague deals with more than one thousand metric tons of spent nuclear fuel per year by adopting an improved version of the PUREX ( Kingery , 2009 ) .
target: In France , the plant at La Hague deals with more than one thousand metric tons of spent nuclear fuel per year by adopting an improved version of the PUREX ( Kingery , 2009 ) .

input: grammar: If there is more research being carried out , better outcomes can be achieved .
target: If there is more research being carried out , better outcomes can be achieved .

input: grammar: Lastly , opponents point out that reprocessing costs a lot of money and there is research demanding expenses too .
target: Lastly , opponents point out that reprocessing costs a lot of money and there is research demanding expenses too .

input: grammar: In fact , despite the fact that reprocessing and research cost too much money , the molten salt reactor is profitable in a long term and it is economy compared to other reactors .
target: In fact , despite the fact that reprocessing and research cost too much money , the molten salt reactor is profitable in a long term and it is economical compared to other reactors .

input: grammar: Firstly , the molten salt reactor does not need the high-pressure steel vessel which is expensive .
target: Firstly , the molten salt reactor does not need the high-pressure steel vessel which is expensive .

input: grammar: There is no requirement for fuel fabrication .
target: There is no requirement for fuel fabrication .

input: grammar: All these can compensate part expense on the reprocessing and research .
target: All these can compensate for part of the expenses on the reprocessing and research .

input: grammar: Secondly , the molten salt reactor is highly effective and efficient .
target: Secondly , the molten salt reactor is highly effective and efficient .

input: grammar: With less fuels , it produces electricity and hydrogen four to six times greater than high temperature reactors do ( " Generation IV nuclear reactor , " 2009 ) .
target: With less fuel , it produces electricity and hydrogen four to six times greater than high temperature reactors do ( " Generation IV nuclear reactor , " 2009 ) .

input: grammar: Thus it is worthy of investment .
target: Thus it is worthy of investment .

input: grammar: With the demand for energy increasing , it is urgent to find an economy and efficient energy source .
target: With the demand for energy increasing , it is urgent to find an economical and efficient energy source .

input: grammar: Nuclear power is inevitably becoming one of the most important supplies .
target: Nuclear power is inevitably becoming one of the most important supplies .

target: As a generation IV reactor , the molten salt reactor has outstanding safety advantage in both reactor and reprocessing , and it is profitable in a long run .

input: grammar: Hence , it will be reasonable and wise to support the research .
target: Hence , it will be reasonable and wise to support the research .

input: grammar: In term of efficiency , there is criticism regarding the high fuel burn up and the need to periodically change the graphite core .
target: In terms of efficiency , there is criticism regarding its high fuel burn up and the need to periodically change the graphite core .

input: grammar: The initial design of the VHTR also does not allow the system to produce electricity directly as modification are required to be make to the plant to achieve generation of electricity .
target: The initial design of the VHTR also does not allow the system to produce electricity directly as modifications are required to be made to the plant to achieve generation of electricity .

input: grammar: Whereas for the MSR it is considered a better choice as it is safer to operate at lower pressure and temperature .
target: In comparison , the MSR is considered a better choice as it is safer to operate at lower pressures and temperatures .

input: grammar: The efficiency of the MSR will improves in the near future as scientists are working to increase the output of hydrogen and electricity ( NERAC ) .
target: The efficiency of the MSR will improve in the near future as scientists are working to increase the output of hydrogen and electricity ( NERAC ) .

input: grammar: Despite the negative points of the VHTR , it is still way ahead of the MSR and all other generation IV models , only VHR has an efficiency of more than fifty percent .
target: Despite the negative points of the VHTR , it is still way ahead of the MSR and all other generation IV models , as only VHR has an efficiency of more than fifty percent .

input: grammar: Not only it produces more electricity , the high temperature generated is actually not useless .
target: Not only does it produce more electricity , but the high temperature generated is actually not useless .

input: grammar: The extreme heat produced can be used for heat application process such as the petrochemical industries ( Billot,P .
target: The extreme heat produced can be used for heat application process such as the petrochemical industries ( Billot,P .

input: grammar: and Barbier , D ) .
target: and Barbier , D ) .

input: grammar: The final issue brought up by people opposing the usage of VHTR is related to the safety aspect of the system .
target: The final issue brought up by people opposing the usage of VHTR is related to the safety aspect of the system .

input: grammar: This is due to the fact that the VHTR runs on very high temperature and it will have a higher chance of failure of parts due to creep .
target: This is due to the fact that the VHTR runs on very high temperatures and it will have a higher chance of failure .

input: grammar: The isolation of the reactor when failure occurs is another issue being widely debated .
target: The isolation of the reactor when failure occurs is another issue being widely debated .

input: grammar: For VHTR the safety features are manned manually by safety officers and it is not as reliable as human will make mistake .
target: For VHTR safety is maintained manually by safety officers and it is not reliable as humans will make mistakes .

input: grammar: Then for the MSR about 200 million dollars were spent on safety testing .
target: Then for MSR about 200 million dollars have been spent on safety testing .

input: grammar: Since the safety of the system is tested intensively , it is unforgivable if failure occurs .
target: Since the safety of the system is tested intensively , it is unforgivable if failure occurs .

input: grammar: Although the safety aspect is being widely debated , the safety feature of VHTR is improving with time ( INL ) .
target: Although the safety aspect is being widely debated , the safety feature of VHTR is improving with time ( INL ) .

input: grammar: In conclusion , the VHTR is still one of the better choices when compared to the MSR .
target: In conclusion , VHTR is still one of the better choices when compared to MSR .

input: grammar: This is so as it will be ready in the year 2025 , five years earlier than the MSR .
target: This is so as it will be ready by the year 2025 , five years earlier than MSR .

input: grammar: With the operation of the VHTR five years ahead , the revenue generate by the VHR will provide more funds for further research and improvement .
target: With the operation of VHTR five years ahead , the revenue generated by VHR will provide more funds for further research and improvement .

input: grammar: Then in term of efficiency it is ahead of the MSR and there is no guarantee that after intensive research the efficiency will improve .
target: Then in term of efficiency it is ahead of MSR and there is no guarantee that after intensive research the efficiency will improve .

input: grammar: Hence VHTR has the potential to be the main provider of electricity of the future .
