input: grammar: Nuclear energy as a more efficient method to produce electricity attracts many scientists ' attention .
target: Nuclear energy as a more efficient method to produce electricity attracts many scientists ' attention .

input: grammar: In 2000 , The Generation IV International Forum ( GIF ) , an international collective representing government of 13 countries , was initiated .
target: In 2000 , The Generation IV International Forum ( GIF ) , an international cooperative project representing governments of 13 countries , was initiated .

input: grammar: Scientists from these countries cooperate to get the development of the next generation of nuclear technology , the Generation IV Nuclear Reactor ( World Nuclear Association , 2008 ) .
target: Scientists from these countries cooperate to develop the next generation of nuclear technology , the Generation IV Nuclear Reactor ( World Nuclear Association , 2008 ) .

input: grammar: Six concepts are put forward .
target: Six concepts are put forward .

input: grammar: William Magwood ( 2004 ) , chairman of GIF 's board , predicts that no more than three of these six concepts will become research prototypes and be put into practice .
target: William Magwood ( 2004 ) , chairman of GIF 's board , predicts that no more than three of these six concepts will become research prototypes and be put into practice .

input: grammar: In my point of view , among all the six reactors , the Sodium-cooled fast reactor ( SFR ) is the one should be chosen as one of the prototypes .
target: In my point of view , among all the six reactors , the Sodium-cooled fast reactor ( SFR ) is the one that should be chosen as one of the prototypes .

input: grammar: The generation IV SFR is a new concept which is safe not only when it operates for electric producing , but also when it meets the problem of nuclear weapons and the terrorism attack .
target: The generation IV SFR is a new concept which is safe not only when it operates during electric production , but also when it meets the problem of nuclear weapons and the terrorism attack .

input: grammar: Moreover , by now the research on reducing the cost of this reactor has received significant achievement and the research is still undergoing .
target: Moreover , by now the research on reducing the cost of this reactor has received significant achievement and the research is still undergoing .

input: grammar: Scientists are still looking forward to more research findings in the coming years .
target: Scientists are still looking forward to more research findings in the coming years .

input: grammar: Many people think that comparing with traditional ways of producing electricity , using nuclear reactor is not safe .
target: Many people think that compared with traditional ways of producing electricity , using nuclear reactors is not safe .

input: grammar: In fact , the SFR is a very safe nuclear reactor operating under low pressure , at low temperature as well .
target: In fact , SFR is a very safe nuclear reactor operating under low pressures and low temperatures .

input: grammar: The operating temperature of the SFR ranges from 500 to 550 , one of the two reactors with the lowest temperature among all the six together with Supercritical-water-cooled reactor .
target: The operating temperatures of SFR range from 500 to 550 , one of the two reactors with the lowest temperatures among all the six together .

input: grammar: Moreover the sodium-cooled technique was started to use since the year 1951 .
target: Moreover the sodium-cooled technique has been in use since 1951 .

input: grammar: " It builds on more than 300 reactor-years experienced with sodium-cooled fast neutron reactors over five decades and in eight countries ( World nuclear association , 2008 ) " .
target: " It builds on more than 300 reactor-years experienced with sodium-cooled fast neutron reactors over five decades and in eight countries ( World nuclear association , 2008 ) " .

input: grammar: Scientists from Japan also concerned about the chemical reaction between sodium and water .
target: Scientists from Japan have also been concerned about the chemical reaction between sodium and water .

input: grammar: They add double-wall piping to their Japanese sodium-cooled fast reactor ( JSFR ) to improve the security of the reactor .
target: They add double-wall piping to their Japanese sodium-cooled fast reactor ( JSFR ) to improve the security of the reactor .

input: grammar: Nuclear weapon and terrorism are always sensitive topics to both government and ordinary people .
target: Nuclear weapon and terrorism are always sensitive topics to both governments and ordinary people .

input: grammar: Because the waste of the nuclear reactor can be used by terrorists to produce nuclear weapons , many people doubt whether it can provide true safety if scientists can only promise that the reactor is safe during the operation .
target: Because the waste of the nuclear reactor can be used by terrorists to produce nuclear weapons , many people doubt whether it can provide true safety if scientists can only promise that the reactor is safe during the operation .

input: grammar: However , this is not a problem for SRF .
target: However , this is not a problem for SRF .

input: grammar: New design for SRF is likely to have all the neutron action in the core .
target: The new design for SRF is likely to have all the neutron action in the core .

input: grammar: That is to say " the new processing technologies will enable the fuel to be recycled without separating the plutonium ( World Nuclear Association , 2008 ) " .
target: That is to say " the new processing technologies will enable the fuel to be recycled without separating the plutonium ( World Nuclear Association , 2008 ) " .

input: grammar: In this case , the waste will all be recycled in the reactor and terrorists will not get a chance to reach the nuclear raw materials .
target: In this case , the waste will all be recycled in the reactor and terrorists will not get a chance to reach the nuclear raw materials .

input: grammar: Closing the nuclear fuel cycle through the use of advanced reprocessing and fast reactor technologies is a good way to improve the security of the reactor and avoid duplication of effort at the same time .
target: Closing the nuclear fuel cycle through the use of advanced reprocessing and fast reactor technologies is a good way to improve the security of the reactor and avoid duplication of effort at the same time .

input: grammar: Opponents say that comparing with the other five generation IV reactors , the cost of the SFR is relatively high .
target: Opponents say that comparing with the other five generation IV reactors , the cost of the SFR is relatively high .

input: grammar: Yes , this is a drawback of the SFR ; however , scientists are working hard on it to find out the way to reduce the capital cost of the SFR and they have already received some achievements .
target: Yes , this is a drawback of the SFR ; however , scientists are working hard on it to find out the way to reduce the capital cost of the SFR and they have already made some achievements .

input: grammar: On November 27-28 , 2006 , Mr. Kazuo Mukai , from the Advanced Nuclear System Research and Development Directorate Japan Atomic Energy Agency ( JAEA ) , had an international seminar on " Coolants and Innovative Reactor Technologies " in Cadarache which is a research center for nuclear energy in France .
target: On November 27-28 , 2006 , Mr. Kazuo Mukai , from the Advanced Nuclear System Research and Development Directorate Japan Atomic Energy Agency ( JAEA ) , had an international seminar on " Coolants and Innovative Reactor Technologies " in Cadarache , which is a research center for nuclear energy in France .

input: grammar: In this seminar he talked about the JSFR and the achievements Japanese scientists got to reduce the cost of the SFR .
target: In this seminar he talked about the JSFR and the achievements Japanese scientists had made to reduce the cost of the SFR .

input: grammar: Kazuo ( 2006 ) said that by adopting high chromium steel with higher strength and lower thermal expansion , the capacity of the heat exchangers and the heat exchangers and the flow rate in the pipe got enlarged , so that the piping could be shortened and the loop number also got reduced .
target: Kazuo ( 2006 ) said that by adopting high chromium steel with higher strength and lower thermal expansion , the capacity of the heat exchangers and the flow rate in the pipe got enlarged , so that the piping could be shortened and the loop number also got reduced .

input: grammar: In this way , the capital cost of the SFR was reduced .
target: In this way , the capital cost of the SFR was reduced .

input: grammar: This is just an example of the received achievements .
target: This is just an example of the achievements .

input: grammar: The research is still undergoing and scientists have confidence that they will have more findings in the future .
target: The research is still ongoing and scientists have confidence that they will have more findings in the future .

input: grammar: According to The U.S. Department of Energy ( DOE ) , the sodium-cooled fast reactor technology is one of the most advanced nuclear technologies being researched to date and could potentially be used as an advanced recycling reactor ( " U.S. , France " , 2008 ) .
target: According to The U.S. Department of Energy ( DOE ) , the sodium-cooled fast reactor technology is one of the most advanced nuclear technologies being researched to date and could potentially be used as an advanced recycling reactor ( " U.S. , France " , 2008 ) .

input: grammar: The Importance of Psychology in Design Process
target: The Importance of Psychology in Design Process

input: grammar: The Chernobyl disaster was one of the worst engineering accidents ever happened in history .
target: The Chernobyl disaster is one of the worst engineering accidents that has ever happened in history .

input: grammar: Not many people died that day but thousands of people were exposed to radiation that caused them to suffer severe health problems ( BBC News , 2000 ) .
target: Not many people died that day but thousands of people were exposed to radiation that caused them to suffer severe health problems ( BBC News , 2000 ) .

input: grammar: Unfortunately , the cause of this incident was found to be unnecessary mistakes made by the nuclear plant operators .
target: Unfortunately , the cause of this incident was found to be unnecessary mistakes made by the nuclear plant operators .

input: grammar: People usually say that mistakes are inevitable and nuclear is in fact extremely dangerous so that working with it will always involve a high chance of accidents .
target: People usually say that mistakes are inevitable and nuclear power is in fact extremely dangerous so that working with it will always involve a high chance of accidents .

input: grammar: However , there are ways to reduce the possibility of this human-caused accident .
target: However , there are ways to reduce the possibility of this human-caused accident .

input: grammar: Including psychological factors consideration during the design process is found to be one of the ways to improve safety which might have prevented the Chernobyl incident .
target: Including psychological factors during the design process is found to be one of the ways to improve safety which might have prevented the Chernobyl incident .

input: grammar: Opponents claim that as a human being , we make mistakes and it can not be avoided .
target: Opponents claim that as a human being , we make mistakes and it can not be avoided .

input: grammar: I agree to the point that human can make mistakes .
target: I agree to the point that humans can make mistakes .

input: grammar: However , it does not mean that mistakes can not be avoided .
target: However , it does not mean that mistakes can not be avoided .

input: grammar: This includes the mistakes made by the Chernobyl nuclear plant operators .
target: This includes the mistakes made by the Chernobyl nuclear plant operators .

input: grammar: They did not request to maintain the power which caused it to run down rapidly until it was below the permitted safety level ( Onisawa and Nishiwaki , 1988 ) .
target: They did not request to maintain the power which caused it to run down rapidly until it was below the permitted safety level ( Onisawa and Nishiwaki , 1988 ) .

input: grammar: This mistake was actually unnecessary since this was not their first time doing the safety test .
target: This mistake was actually unnecessary since this was not their first time doing the safety test .

input: grammar: The problem lies on the behavior of the plant operators .
target: The problem lies in the behavior of the plant operators .

input: grammar: They took light of their task since for them this was just another safety test .
target: They took light of their task since for them this was just another safety test .

input: grammar: They did not have any sense of responsibility and were not aware of the consequences if anything went wrong .
target: They did not have any sense of responsibility and were not aware of the consequences if anything went wrong .

input: grammar: Therefore , during the design process , these plant operators are supposed to be 'designed ' as well .
target: Therefore , during the design process , these plant operators are supposed to be 'designed ' as well .

input: grammar: They should be given the required knowledge and should also be warned about the worst thing that may happen if they make even a simple mistake .
target: They should be given the required knowledge and should also be warned about the worst thing that may happen if they make even a simple mistake .

input: grammar: In this way , they will be more careful in doing their task and as a result able to avoid making mistakes .
target: In this way , they will be more careful in doing their task and will as a result be able to avoid making mistakes .

input: grammar: Opponents also state that nuclear power is indeed dangerous for that reason , it is impossible not to have accident while working with it .
target: Opponents also state that while nuclear power is indeed dangerous for that reason , it is impossible not to have accidents while working with it .

input: grammar: Accident is a situation when there is a failure in the interaction between man and machine ( Stoop , 1995 ) .
target: An accident is a situation when there is a failure in the interaction between man and machine ( Stoop , 1995 ) .

input: grammar: Therefore , even though nuclear power is certainly dangerous , it can still be safe to work with as long as the interaction between man and machine is designed carefully so that it will not fail .
target: Therefore , even though nuclear power is certainly dangerous , it can still be safe to work with as long as the interaction between man and machine is designed carefully so that it will not fail .

input: grammar: Again , this shows the importance of considering psychological factors in design process .
target: Again , this shows the importance of considering psychological factors in design process .

input: grammar: Most of the times , while designing a system , engineers are likely to overestimate the ability of the user ( Wilpert , 2007 ) .
target: Most of the time , while designing a system , engineers are likely to overestimate the ability of the user ( Wilpert , 2007 ) .

input: grammar: As a result , most users are not able to properly use the equipments .
target: As a result , most users are not able to properly use the equipments .

input: grammar: In the case of Chernobyl , the plant operators failed to make the right decision which then caused the reactor to explode .
target: In the case of Chernobyl , the plant operators failed to make the right decision which then caused the reactor to explode .

input: grammar: Instead of following the safety procedure , the plant operators even blocked the reactor 's protection system ( making it impossible for automatic shut down ) in order to keep the test running ( Onisawa and Nishiwaki , 1988 ) .
target: Instead of following the safety procedure , the plant operators even blocked the reactor 's protection system ( making automatic shut down impossible ) in order to keep the test running ( Onisawa and Nishiwaki , 1988 ) .

input: grammar: If the plant operators were familiar with the system and the procedure , they would have known which one was more important and would definitely have prioritized safety rather than keeping the test running .
target: If the plant operators were familiar with the system and the procedure , they would have known which one was more important and would definitely have prioritized safety rather than keeping the test running .

input: grammar: Thus , in designing a system engineers alone are not enough .
target: Thus , in designing a system engineers alone are not enough .

input: grammar: The final argument proposed by the opponents is that psychologists are also humans who can make mistakes just like engineers .
target: The final argument proposed by the opponents is that psychologists are also humans who can make mistakes just like engineers .

input: grammar: Hence , even with their help mistakes are still inevitable .
target: Hence , even with their help mistakes are still inevitable .

input: grammar: The point of involving psychologists in the design process is not because they are better than engineers .
target: The point of involving psychologists in the design process is not because they are better than engineers .

input: grammar: It is rather to balance the engineers ' point of view which is usually machine-centered .
target: It is rather to balance the engineers ' point of view which is usually machine-centered .

input: grammar: Since man and machines are equally important to achieve safety in design , psychologists ' role is to concern about the human resources which are usually neglected by engineers .
target: Since men and machines are equally important to achieve safety in design , psychologists ' role is to be concerned about the human resources which are usually neglected by engineers .

input: grammar: If both machines and man are well designed , safety will definitely improve and the possibility of accidents will be reduced .
target: If both machines and men are well designed , safety will definitely improve and the possibility of accidents will be reduced .

input: grammar: In conclusion , carefully designing a system 's safety is useless unless psychological factors are also considered .
target: In conclusion , carefully designing a system 's safety is useless unless psychological factors are also considered .

input: grammar: Without considering psychological factors , there is a big possibility that there will be a bad interaction between man and machine which will then results in an accident such as Chernobyl 's .
target: Without considering psychological factors , there is a big possibility that there will be a bad interaction between man and machine which will then result in an accident such as Chernobyl 's .

input: grammar: Therefore , psychological factors play an important role in reducing the possibility of accident as well as improving the system 's safety .
target: Therefore , psychological factors play an important role in reducing the possibility of accidents as well as improving a system 's safety .

input: grammar: The world has been searching for different sources of energy to reduce its dependence on fossil fuels .
target: The world has been searching for different sources of energy to reduce its dependence on fossil fuels .

input: grammar: In some countries , they have turned to nuclear power .
target: In some countries , they have turned to nuclear power .

input: grammar: Despite producing less carbon footprints , nuclear power is a relatively dangerous source of energy .
target: Despite producing less carbon footprints , nuclear power is a relatively dangerous source of energy .

input: grammar: One unmistakable example is the 1986 Chernobyl disaster .
target: One unmistakable example is the 1986 Chernobyl disaster .

input: grammar: Some psychologists have wondered whether the use of psychology in the design process would have prevented the accident .
target: Some psychologists have wondered whether the use of psychology in the design process would have prevented the accident .

input: grammar: While opponents reasoned that there is no distinctive link between psychology and engineering design process , the use of psychology could theoretically have prevented the accident through its intervention in the controls and the safety mechanisms design .
target: While opponents reasoned that there is no distinctive link between psychology and engineering design process , the use of psychology could theoretically have prevented the accident through its intervention in the controls and the safety mechanisms design .

input: grammar: Also , use of psychology could counter the underestimation of the number of errors that will form inevitably .
target: Also , the use of psychology could counter the underestimation of the number of errors that will form inevitably .

input: grammar: Opponents argue that the use of psychology would not be useful as the chief cause for the accident is the lack of knowledge of the operators .
target: Opponents argue that psychology would not be useful as the chief cause for the accident is the lack of knowledge of the operators .

input: grammar: According to Rich ( 1986 ) , the accident was the fault of not complying with strict operating regulations governed by the reactor designers .
target: According to Rich ( 1986 ) , the accident was the fault of not complying with strict operating regulations governed by the reactor designers .

input: grammar: However , one way of how psychology could have averted the accident is that the designers could have anticipated that the operators might not understand the physics behind the reactor .
target: However , one way of how psychology could have averted the accident is that the designers could have anticipated that the operators might not understand the physics behind the reactor .

input: grammar: Since the introduction of nuclear-powered generators , public opposition was one of the reasons why only limited nuclear reactors have been built in the past .
target: Since the introduction of nuclear-powered generators , public opposition is one of the reasons why only limited nuclear reactors have been built in the past .

input: grammar: The public is against the idea of constructing nuclear reactors because they are concerned about the safe operation of nuclear reactors .
target: The public is against the idea of constructing nuclear reactors because they are concerned about the safe operation of nuclear reactors .

input: grammar: Their concern arose because of a few incidents that have happened in the past which includes a partial reactor meltdown in 1979 at Three Mile Island , Pennsylvania and also the 1986 accident at Chernobyl in Ukraine , which the reactor core exploded and caused the death of 31 people and spewed radioactive debris across Europe ( Butler , 2004 ) .
target: Their concern arises because of a few incidents that have happened in the past which includes a partial reactor meltdown in 1979 at Three Mile Island , Pennsylvania and also the 1986 accident at Chernobyl in Ukraine , where the reactor core exploded and caused the death of 31 people and spewed radioactive debris across Europe ( Butler , 2004 ) .

input: grammar: However , I believe that previews of the nuclear reactors should not influence the decision to fund the research and development of the generation IV reactors as people will be more careful not to let the same incidents happen again with the advancement in technology .
target: However , I believe that previews of the nuclear reactors should not influence the decision to fund the research and development of the generation IV reactors as people will be more careful not to let the same incidents happen again with the advancement in technology .

input: grammar: Therefore , I feel that generation IV reactors such as the Supercritical-water-cooled reactors ( SCWR ) should be funded for their research and development .
target: Therefore , I feel that generation IV reactors such as the Supercritical-water-cooled reactors ( SCWR ) should be funded for their research and development .

input: grammar: Nevertheless , the first reason that the public is concerned over the funding of generation IV nuclear reactors is that the nuclear reactors will not reduce the greenhouse-gas emissions as compared to natural gas and oil use ( Nature , 2008 ) .
target: Nevertheless , the first reason that the public is concerned over the funding of generation IV nuclear reactors is that the nuclear reactors will not reduce greenhouse-gas emissions as compared to natural gas and oil use ( Nature , 2008 ) .

input: grammar: However , this is not the case as there are countries constructing nuclear reactors because it can indeed improve the environment .
target: However , this is not the case as there are countries constructing nuclear reactors because they can indeed improve the environment .

input: grammar: For example , reducing greenhouse-gas emissions is the main reason for the endorsement of the construction of nuclear reactors by the UK government ( Nature , 2008 ) .
target: For example , reducing greenhouse-gas emissions is the main reason for the endorsement of the construction of nuclear reactors by the UK government ( Nature , 2008 ) .

input: grammar: Furthermore , according to Butler ( 2004 ) , the SCWR does not emit carbon dioxide , which is a greenhouse-gas that is soaring because of natural gas and oil generated power plants .
target: Furthermore , according to Butler ( 2004 ) , the SCWR does not emit carbon dioxide , which is a greenhouse-gas that is soaring because of natural gas and oil generated power plants .

input: grammar: Therefore , such generation IV reactors will certainly improve the environment and should be funded for their research and development .
target: Therefore , such generation IV reactors will certainly improve the environment and should be funded for their research and development .

input: grammar: Another concern from the public opposition is that nuclear reactors should not be used in medical research because they pose a danger to the people using nuclear power for their medical researches .
target: Another concern from the public opposition is that nuclear reactors should not be used in medical research because they pose a danger to the people using nuclear power for their medical researches .

input: grammar: According to Ruth ( 2009 ) , medical isotopes used in the cancer research can be supplied using accelerators instead of nuclear reactors as it is a safer and cheaper method .
target: According to Ruth ( 2009 ) , medical isotopes used in cancer research can be supplied using accelerators instead of nuclear reactors as using accelerators is a safer and cheaper method .

input: grammar: However , nuclear reactors should continue to be used to supply the medical isotopes as it can produce the isotopes much faster than the accelerators .
target: However , nuclear reactors should continue to be used to supply medical isotopes as they can produce isotopes much faster than accelerators .

input: grammar: Furthermore , the idea of accelerators to supply the medical isotopes has still not been put to practical use as it still requires further research and development unlike the nuclear reactors , which is already vastly used in medical researches .
target: Furthermore , the idea of accelerators to supply medical isotopes has still not been put to practical use as they still require further research and development unlike nuclear reactors , which have already been vastly used in medical researches .

input: grammar: This can be shown as many researchers were lamenting on the shutdown of the nuclear reactor located in chalk river , Ontario , and their medical research has to be put to a halt ( Nature , 2008 ) .
target: This can be shown as many researchers were lamenting on the shutdown of the nuclear reactor located in chalk river , Ontario , and their medical research had to be put to a halt ( Nature , 2008 ) .

input: grammar: Therefore , generation IV reactors will be more stable to maintain the medical research process and should be funded for their research and development .
target: Therefore , generation IV reactors will be more stable to maintain the medical research process and should be funded for their research and development .

input: grammar: The last concern from the public opposition is that nuclear reactors are not safe enough to be built as they are under-designed for earthquakes as the earthquake in Japan killed at least 9 , injured 1000 and caused the evacuation of further 10,000 people and sparked a fire and caused radiation- contaminated water from the nuclear reactor to spill into the sea ( Nature , 2007 ) .
target: The last concern from the public opposition is that nuclear reactors are not safe enough to be built as they are under-designed for earthquakes as the earthquake in Japan killed at least 9 , injured 1000 , caused the evacuation of further 10,000 people , sparked a fire and caused radiation- contaminated water from the nuclear reactor to spill into the sea ( Nature , 2007 ) .

input: grammar: However , damages done from an earthquake on a nuclear reactor is inevitable no matter how well a building is designed and such damages done are already considered very minimal even though the nuclear reactor in Japan was under-designed to deal with an earthquake of magnitude 6.8 .
target: However , damages done from an earthquake on a nuclear reactor is inevitable no matter how well a building is designed and such damages done are already considered very minimal even though the nuclear reactor in Japan was under-designed to deal with an earthquake of magnitude 6.8 .

input: grammar: Furthermore , due to technology advancement , the new generation IV reactors are designed to deal with an earthquake of magnitude 8.0 ( Nature , 2007 ) .
target: Furthermore , due to technology advancement , the new generation IV reactors are designed to deal with an earthquake of magnitude 8.0 ( Nature , 2007 ) .

input: grammar: Therefore , the concern of the public opposition over nuclear reactors which are under-designed for earthquakes is unnecessary because the generation IV reactors are strong enough to handle tough conditions already .
target: Therefore , the concern of the public opposition over nuclear reactors which are under-designed for earthquakes is unnecessary because the generation IV reactors are strong enough to handle tough conditions already .

input: grammar: To wrap up , I believe that the new generation IV reactors such as SCWR is nothing like their previous generation of nuclear reactors because technology is constantly improving each day to make the nuclear reactors safer to be built .
target: To wrap up , I believe that the new generation IV reactors such as SCWR are nothing like their previous generation of nuclear reactors because technology is constantly improving each day to make the nuclear reactors safer to be built .

input: grammar: Thus , the public opposition should look at the new generation IV reactors in a different light and not just based on some of the incidents that had happened in the past .
target: Thus , the public opposition should look at the new generation IV reactors in a different light and not just be based on some of the incidents that happened in the past .

target: Nevertheless , with the new generation IV reactors , especially the sodium-cooled fast reactor ( SFR ) which will be the first generation IV reactor to be completed and more efficient in the usage of the nuclear fuel , nuclear energy will definitely be one of the main sources of energy in the future .

target: There is no denying that nuclear energy is a dangerous source of energy and an example is the Chernobyl accident in 1986 .

input: grammar: It was caused by an error during a safety test and resulted in over 4,000 deaths and many more may die due to the radiation from the accident ( Nature 2006 ) .
target: It was caused by an error during a safety test and resulted in over 4,000 deaths and many more may die due to the radiation from the accident ( Nature 2006 ) .

input: grammar: In recent years , there are also fears that nuclear reactors may be the targets of terrorist attacks .
target: In recent years , there are also fears that nuclear reactors may be the targets of terrorist attacks .

target: As a result , the public has been reluctant about the use of nuclear power as a source of energy .

input: grammar: Nonetheless , there are still over 400 nuclear reactors around the world which make up for 17 % of the world 's electrical consummation ( Butler , 2004 ) .
target: Nonetheless , there are still over 400 nuclear reactors around the world which make up for 17 % of the world 's electrical consummation ( Butler , 2004 ) .

input: grammar: All of which have improved safety precautions and higher security levels to ensure the safety of the public .
target: All of these reactors have improved safety precautions and higher security levels to ensure the safety of the public .

input: grammar: In addition , the new SFR will be equipped with better coolant system to prevent a reactor meltdown and stronger containment structures to guard against terrorist attacks ( Smith , 2009 ) .
target: In addition , the new SFR will be equipped with a better coolant system to prevent a reactor meltdown and stronger containment structures to guard against terrorist attacks ( Smith , 2009 ) .

input: grammar: Out of the six generation IV reactors , SFR is expected to be the first reactor to be developed .
target: Out of the six generation IV reactors , SFR is expected to be the first reactor to be developed .

input: grammar: Therefore , we can tap on the use of safer nuclear energy earlier .
target: Therefore , we can tap on the use of safer nuclear energy earlier .

input: grammar: This is mainly thanks to the fact that sodium-cooled reactors are already in operation in Japan and Russia ( US DOE NERAC/GIF 2002 ) .
target: This is mainly thanks to the fact that sodium-cooled reactors are already in operation in Japan and Russia ( US DOE NERAC/GIF 2002 ) .

input: grammar: Thus , less research will be required for the SFR , which also means that the research cost will be reduced .
target: Thus , less research will be required for SFR , which also means that the research cost will be reduced .

input: grammar: Furthermore , by choosing the SFR 's proven method of cooling the nuclear core , it removes the uncertainties of using new and untested technology which are present in the other reactors .
target: Furthermore , by choosing the SFR 's proven method of cooling the nuclear core , it removes the uncertainties of using new and untested technologies which are present in the other reactors .

input: grammar: The SFR is also chosen by the United States as their front runner for generation IV fast reactors due to its strong technology basis ( US DOE/NE 2006 ) .
target: SFR is also chosen by the United States as their front runner for generation IV fast reactors due to its strong technology basis ( US DOE/NE 2006 ) .

input: grammar: On top of its technological readiness , the SFR is designed for high efficiency as well .
target: On top of its technological readiness , SFR is designed for high efficiency as well .

input: grammar: It recycles nuclear fuel through a process whereby a group of chemical elements called actinides is produced .
target: It recycles nuclear fuel through a process whereby a group of chemical elements called actinides are produced .

input: grammar: Plutonium is also included in this group and it can be used for production of nuclear weapons .
target: Plutonium is also included in this group and it can be used for the production of nuclear weapons .

input: grammar: Therefore , to ensure the nuclear non-proliferation , the SFR is designed such that the plutonium can not be extracted from the nuclear core .
target: Therefore , to ensure the nuclear non-proliferation , SFR is designed such that plutonium can not be extracted from the nuclear core .

input: grammar: Furthermore , 99.9 % of the actinides will be recycled again .
target: Furthermore , 99.9 % of the actinides will be recycled again .

input: grammar: The SFR will also be using spent thermal reactor fuel from other older nuclear reactors as its initial fuel ( US DOE NERAC/GIF 2002 ) .
target: SFR will also be using spent thermal reactor fuel from other older nuclear reactors as its initial fuel ( US DOE NERAC/GIF 2002 ) .

input: grammar: All these designs will lead to a more efficient usage of the nuclear fuel and it also helps solve the current problem of the disposal of nuclear wastes .
target: All these designs will lead to a more efficient usage of the nuclear fuel and also help solve the current problem of the disposal of nuclear wastes .

target: The truth is , we will one day run out of fossil fuels ; hence , we must plan ahead and look for other sources of energy .

input: grammar: And despite its risks , nuclear energy has its significant benefits as well .
target: And despite its risks , nuclear energy has its significant benefits as well .

target: Nuclear power plants may be hazardous , but the new SFR boosts many new safeguards .

target: It also allows us to utilize more capable generation IV reactors sooner and helps reduce the amount of nuclear wastes .

input: grammar: Therefore , governments should continue to fund these nuclear research projects so as to ensure that we can continue with our way of life even after our fossil fuels run out .

input: grammar: Nuclear Power has been a controversial issue ever since the atomic bombings of Hiroshima and Nagasaki during World War II .
target: Nuclear power has been a controversial issue ever since the atomic bombings of Hiroshima and Nagasaki during World War II .

input: grammar: Over the years , Nuclear power has evolved with the help of technological advancement .
target: Over the years , nuclear power has evolved with the help of technological advancement .

input: grammar: Today , scientists have gone a further step in developing what we know as the Fourth Generation Reactors .
target: Today , scientists have gone step further in developing what we know as the Fourth Generation Reactors .

input: grammar: Out of the six new reactors , Very High Temperature Reactor ( VHTR ) is the most favorable .
target: Out of the six new reactors , Very High Temperature Reactor ( VHTR ) is the most favorable .

input: grammar: It is known for being more environmental friendly and less hazardous .
target: It is known for being more environmental friendly and less hazardous .

input: grammar: Nuclear power is encompassed by four main factors .
target: Nuclear power is encompassed by four main factors .

input: grammar: These factors are economic benefits , security , safety and effects on the environment .
target: These factors are economic benefits , security , safety and effects on the environment .

input: grammar: Firstly , the cost of operating and starting cost of a VHTR is truly subjective .
target: Firstly , the cost of operating a VHTR is truly subjective .

input: grammar: Some may feel that the costs are too high .
target: Some may feel that the costs are too high .

input: grammar: According to a survey done by researchers from the Keystone Center , the cost of building a new reactor varied from $ 3600 to $ 4600 per installed kW and the operating cost would be about 30 cents per kWh ( Benjamin , 2008 ) .
target: According to a survey done by researchers from the Keystone Center , the cost of building a new reactor varied from $ 3600 to $ 4600 per installed kW and the operating cost would be about 30 cents per kWh ( Benjamin , 2008 ) .

input: grammar: Naturally , The public would have an impression that VHTR would be much more expensive , comparatively to renewable energy such as solar and wind .
target: Naturally , The public would have an impression that VHTR would be much more expensive , compared to renewable energy such as solar and wind .

input: grammar: However , this is not the case .
target: However , this is not the case .

input: grammar: VHTR will be cheaper as cost incurred on transportation of nuclear waste is redundant .
target: VHTR will be cheaper as cost incurred on transportation of nuclear waste is redundant .

input: grammar: This is because the nuclear waste goes directly to a respiratory which is located within the nuclear plant ( Clayton 2009 ) .
target: This is because the nuclear waste goes directly to a respiratory which is located within the nuclear plant ( Clayton 2009 ) .

input: grammar: Furthermore , VHTR produces cheaper energy compared to solar and wind energy .
target: Furthermore , VHTR produces cheaper energy compared to solar and wind energy .

input: grammar: Barry ( 2009 ) cites that the capital cost of building a solar plant is 25 times more than nuclear plant and the land area solar plant occupies is 400 times more than nuclear plant .
target: Barry ( 2009 ) cites that the capital cost of building a solar plant is 25 times more than that of building a plant and the land area a solar plant occupies is 400 times more than that of a nuclear plant .

input: grammar: With cheaper energy , more people are able to afford electricity .
target: With cheaper energy , more people are able to afford electricity .

input: grammar: Countries going through industrialization will also benefit from the cheap energy .
target: Countries going through industrialization will also benefit from the cheap energy .

input: grammar: In addition , building of VHTR will boost the economy as it creates job opportunities in the areas surrounding the power plant .
target: In addition , building VHTR will boost the economy as it creates job opportunities in the areas surrounding the power plant .

input: grammar: Secondly , ever since the September 11 attack on the World Trade Center in 2001 , the world has heightened global security against terrorism .
target: Secondly , ever since the September 11 attack on the World Trade Center in 2001 , the world has heightened global security against terrorism .

input: grammar: Nuclear plants have become prime targets of terrorists .
target: Nuclear plants have become prime targets of terrorists .

input: grammar: This is because the plutonium waste that the nuclear reactor produces are ingredients for making nuclear weapons .
target: This is because the plutonium waste that the nuclear reactor produces are ingredients for making nuclear weapons .

input: grammar: Hence , security of nuclear plants is strengthened as well to prevent proliferation of nuclear weapons .
target: Hence , security of nuclear plants is strengthened as well to prevent proliferation of nuclear weapons .

input: grammar: If nuclear weapons were to fall in the hands of terrorists , it would pose a great threat to the safety of the public .
target: If nuclear weapons were to fall in the hands of terrorists , it would pose a great threat to the safety of the public .

input: grammar: However in VHTR , plutonium are spiked with heat producing and radioactive elements ( Butler , 2004 ) .
target: However in VHTR , plutonium is spiked with heat producing and radioactive elements ( Butler , 2004 ) .

input: grammar: These elements cause the plutonium waste to increase in temperature such that it is too hot to handle and therefore prevent anyone from stealing them .
target: These elements cause the plutonium waste to increase in temperature such that it is too hot to handle and therefore prevent anyone from stealing it .

input: grammar: Hence , the public does not need to worry about nuclear waste falling in the hands of the terrorists .
target: Hence , the public does not need to worry about nuclear waste falling in the hands of the terrorists .

input: grammar: Thirdly , safety of the employees working at the nuclear plant and the residents near the plant has to be taken into consideration .
target: Thirdly , safety of the employees working at the nuclear plant and the residents near the plant has to be taken into consideration .

input: grammar: The VHTR is actually an evolution from the present High Temperature-grouped reactor ( HTGR ) .
target: The VHTR is actually an evolution from the present High Temperature-grouped reactor ( HTGR ) .

input: grammar: In the VHTR , heat resistant materials are used to build the nuclear reactor so that the heat is carefully contained .
target: In VHTR , heat resistant materials are used to build the nuclear reactor so that the heat is carefully contained .

input: grammar: Moreover , the heat produced during the processing of uranium is used for hydrogen production and desalinization ( Very High Temperature Reactor , n.d. ) .
target: Moreover , the heat produced during the processing of uranium is used for hydrogen production and desalinization ( Very High Temperature Reactor , n.d. ) .

input: grammar: Also radioactive leakage is prevented with the use of corrosion resistant materials .
target: Also radioactive leakage is prevented with the use of corrosion resistant materials .

input: grammar: For example , helium is used as a cooling agent in VHTR as helium is an inert gas and does not provide and hazardous effect .
target: For example , helium is used as a cooling agent in VHTR as helium is an inert gas and does not provide any hazardous effect .

input: grammar: Finally , as global warming becomes more perilous , governments and several communities are placing greater emphasis on being environmental friendly .
target: Finally , as global warming becomes more perilous , governments and several communities are placing greater emphasis on being environmental friendly .

input: grammar: The main environmental concern is the disposal of radioactive wastes .
target: The main environmental concern is the disposal of radioactive wastes .

input: grammar: It is known that these radioactive wastes have very long live shelf and will not decay until a few hundred years later .
target: It is known that these radioactive wastes have very long shelf life and will not decay until a few hundred years later .

input: grammar: Most importantly , the radioactive emission is harmful to human body .
target: Most importantly , the radioactive emission is harmful to human body .

input: grammar: However , in VHTR , an additional processing step is taken to shorten the live span of the wastes and these wastes are carefully contained .
target: However , in VHTR , an additional processing step is taken to shorten the life span of the wastes and these wastes are carefully contained .

input: grammar: In addition , VHTR produces less nuclear wastes .
target: In addition , VHTR produces less nuclear wastes .

input: grammar: This means that there will be minimal chance of weapon proliferation and reduced pollution to the environment .
target: This means that there will be minimal chance of weapon proliferation and reduced pollution to the environment .

input: grammar: Compared to other solar plants , nuclear plants actually produce less carbon dioxide .
target: Compared to solar plants , nuclear plants actually produce less carbon dioxide .

input: grammar: Barry ( 2009 ) writes that solar plants produce 25times more carbon dioxide than nuclear plants .
target: Barry ( 2009 ) writes that solar plants produce 25 times more carbon dioxide than nuclear plants .

input: grammar: In conclusion , VHTR is much safer , more environmental friendly , more efficient and is much cheaper .
target: In conclusion , VHTR is much safer , more environmental friendly , more efficient and much cheaper .

input: grammar: Hence , we should abandon those pessimistic views on nuclear power and embrace this new source of power .
target: Hence , we should abandon those pessimistic views on nuclear power and embrace this new source of energy .

target: Reference :

input: grammar: Safety in Design
target: Safety in Design

input: grammar: Nuclear energy has been a hot topic since several decades age .
target: Nuclear energy has been a hot topic since several decades ago .

input: grammar: It is clear and powerful .
target: It is clean and powerful .

input: grammar: As Declan Butler ( 2004 ) said that nuclear energy is not a source of carbon dioxide , and with the emissions of the green-house gas now soaring , and the energy demands predicted to double by 2050 , the nuclear option is a finding its way back onto the table .
target: According to Butler ( 2004 ) , nuclear energy is not a source of carbon dioxide . With the emissions of green-house gases now soaring , and the energy demands predicted to double by 2050 , the nuclear option is finding its way back onto the table .

input: grammar: Besides , nuclear reactors are great power output of electricity and hydrogen .
target: Besides , nuclear reactors produce a great output of electricity and hydrogen .

input: grammar: However , some opposing controversies appear .
target: However , the use of nuclear energy is not without opposing voices .

input: grammar: Some people hold the opinions that nuclear energy is very dangerous and building nuclear plants requires a large amount of money , etc .
target: Some people hold the opinions that nuclear energy is very dangerous and building nuclear plants requires a large amount of money , etc .

input: grammar: Nevertheless , at present , there is a safe nuclear reactor which is called sodium-cooled fast reactor .
target: Nevertheless , at present , there is a safe nuclear reactor which is called sodium-cooled fast reactor .

input: grammar: Because of its safety , no waste and powerful output , I support further research and development funding for it .
target: Because of its safety , no waste and high output , I support funding for its further research and development .

input: grammar: With memories of the partial reactor meltdown in 1979 at Three Mile Island , Pennsylvania , and of the 1986 accident at Chernobyl in Ukraine , during which the reactor core exploded , killing some 31 people immediately and spewing radioactive debris across Europe , the public consider nuclear reactors as something extremely dangerous and imperils their lives .
target: With memories of the partial reactor meltdown in 1979 at Three Mile Island , Pennsylvania , and of the 1986 accident at Chernobyl in Ukraine , during which the reactor core exploded , killing some 31 people immediately and spewing radioactive debris across Europe , the public consider nuclear reactors as something extremely dangerous .

input: grammar: However , sodium-cooled fast reactors are rather safe because they can react under relatively low temperature of 550 degrees in contrast with the above 700 degrees of other reactors ; it also reacts under low pressure .
target: However , sodium-cooled fast reactors are rather safe because they can react under relatively low temperature of 550 degrees in contrast with the above 700 degrees for other reactors ; it also reacts under low pressure .

input: grammar: The low temperature and pressure lower the demands of the equipment and the conditions of the reaction ; as a result , the reactor becomes safer .
target: The low temperature and pressure requirements lower the demands of the equipment and the conditions for the reaction ; as a result , the reactor becomes safer .

input: grammar: Besides , in order to make the reaction safer , in Japan , the engineers have found out the methods to prevent the chemical reactions of sodium itself and the leak of sodium by using double-wall piping method , high reliable equipment with double-wall tube and sensitive leak detector .
target: Besides , in order to make the reaction safer , the engineers in Japan have found out the methods to prevent the chemical reactions of sodium itself and the leak of sodium by using double-wall piping method , highly reliable equipment with double-wall tube and sensitive leak detector .

input: grammar: Thereby , sodium-cooled fast reactors are very safe and also safer than the other reactors in the fourth generation .
target: Therefore , sodium-cooled fast reactors are very safe and also safer than the other reactors in the fourth generation .

input: grammar: Some pacifists are sceptical about the safety of nuclear energy also because that reprocessing nuclear waste is controversial as it separates out plutonium , a key ingredient of advanced nuclear weapons .
target: Some pacifists are sceptical about the safety of nuclear energy because reprocessing nuclear waste is controversial as it separates out plutonium , a key ingredient of advanced nuclear weapons .

input: grammar: Besides , they are worried about that nuclear reactors would become a terrorist target because of the radioactive waste .
target: Besides , they are worried that nuclear reactors would become a terrorist target because of the radioactive waste .

input: grammar: Nevertheless , these terrible things wo n't happen in sodium-cooled fast reactors , because the reaction is within the core and the recycling is closed which means the recycling is not separated out .
target: Nevertheless , these terrible things wo n't happen in sodium-cooled fast reactors , because the reaction is within the core and the recycling is closed , which means the recycling is not separated out .

input: grammar: As a result , the percentage of plutonium in the waste is reduced effectively .
target: As a result , the percentage of plutonium in the waste is reduced effectively .

input: grammar: Besides , the reprocessing can cut the final amount of waste produced .
target: Besides , the reprocessing can cut the final amount of waste produced .

input: grammar: Moreover , the systems based on mixed uranium-plutonium oxide fuel are primarily under development in Japan , and their preferred recycle option is an advanced aqueous process ; and metal-fuel cycle systems are under development in the United States which use a pyroprocessing recycle as the preferred fuel cycle option .
target: Moreover , the systems based on mixed uranium-plutonium oxide fuel are primarily under development in Japan , and their preferred recycle option is an advanced aqueous process ; and metal-fuel cycle systems are under development in the United States which use a pyroprocessing recycle as the preferred fuel cycle option .

input: grammar: As a consequence , people do not need to worry about the radioactive waste during the producing .
target: As a consequence , people do not need to worry about the radioactive waste during the production .

input: grammar: Except the problem of the safety , the second one is the cost .
target: Besides the problem of safety , another problem is the cost .

input: grammar: The cost of nuclear reactors which consists of the construction cost , operating cost and decommissioning cost are very high .
target: The costs of nuclear reactors which consists of the construction cost , operating cost and decommissioning cost are very high .

input: grammar: It is the fact that several billion dollars is needed to get a nuclear reactor going and the sodium-cooled fast reactors are even more expensive than other ones .
target: Several billion dollars is needed to get a nuclear reactor going and the sodium-cooled fast reactors are even more expensive than the other ones .

input: grammar: However , in order to make the nuclear energy more powerful and safer , the money spent is worthy .
target: However , in order to make the nuclear energy more powerful and safer , the money spent is worthy .

input: grammar: Seen the value of the sodium-cooled fast reactors , many countries are investing in the sodium-cooled fast reactors .
target: Having seen the value of the sodium-cooled fast reactors , many countries are investing in the sodium-cooled fast reactors .

input: grammar: Meanwhile , many engineers are looking for the methods to cut the cost of nuclear reactors .
target: Meanwhile , many engineers are looking for methods to cut the cost of nuclear reactors .

input: grammar: New plants are designed to be much simpler and quicker to build , reducing financing costs by potentially hundreds of millions of dollars .
target: New plants are designed to be much simpler and quicker to build , reducing financing costs by potentially hundreds of millions of dollars .

input: grammar: In details , the cost can be reduced by reducing the refuelling outages ' number , compacting the reactor vessel , sampling the vessel internals , reducing the loop number , shortening the pipes , integrating the primary components and so on .
target: Specifically , the cost can be reduced by reducing the number of refuelling outages , compacting the reactor vessel , sampling the vessel internals , reducing the loop number , shortening the pipes , integrating the primary components and so on .

input: grammar: Thus , we should believe in the bright future of the reducing of the sodium-cooled fast reactors ' cost .
target: Thus , we should believe in the bright future of the cost-effective sodium-cooled fast reactors .

input: grammar: Nuclear energy , the most powerful energy in the world , will attract more and more research and develop further and further .
target: Nuclear energy , the most powerful energy in the world , will attract more and more research and develop further and further .

input: grammar: As one of the fourth generation of nuclear reactors , sodium-cooled fast reactor has its own advantages .
target: As one of the fourth generation of nuclear reactors , the sodium-cooled fast reactor has its own advantages .

input: grammar: It has more factors of safety and it is now under further improvement in many developed countries .
target: It is safer and it is now under further improvement in many developed countries .

input: grammar: Briefly , sodium-cooled fast reactors are with brilliant prospects and the public do not need to be much concerned about its safety .
target: Briefly , sodium-cooled fast reactors have brilliant prospects and the public do not need to be much concerned about their safety .

input: grammar: This way , temperature at the core outlet temperatures can reach more than 1000  C ( Corwin , 2003 ) .

target: This would be more economical than if each plant is uniquely designed .

input: grammar: As is the case for both the reactor and the fuel cycle , technology development to achieve cost competitiveness is necessary .

input: grammar: A key issue on the SFR system is reduction of cost to competitive levels .
target: A key issue on the SFR system is the reduction of cost to competitive levels .

input: grammar: In this way , SFR can competitively serve markets for electricity .

input: grammar: In 1986 , the world 's worst nuclear accident Chernobyl took place in Ukraine .
target: In 1986 , the world 's worst nuclear accident Chernobyl took place in Ukraine .

target: The explosion of the Unit 4 reactor core had spread radioactivity across many areas , claiming lives of some 50 emergency workers and leaving health problems , such as thyroid cancer , and psychological trauma on over 5 million people .

target: With rising economic powers such as China and India , the burning of fossil fuel to meet new energy demand simply will not solve the problem of depleting resources on a long term basis .

input: grammar: An alternative to fossil fuel is nuclear energy which has been used since the 1960s .
target: An alternative to fossil fuel is nuclear energy which has been used since the 1960s .

input: grammar: Still , after many years , there are several factors against building new nuclear reactors .
target: Still , after many years , there are several factors against building new nuclear reactors .

input: grammar: The nuclear accident in Chernobyl and nuclear weapon proliferation are just two reasons why few reactors have been built in recent years .
target: The nuclear accident in Chernobyl and nuclear weapon proliferation are just two reasons why few reactors have been built in recent years .

input: grammar: However , with more than 40 years of knowledge and experience in nuclear reactors , scientists and engineers have developed research in safe and high performance nuclear reactors known as Generation IV reactors .
target: However , with more than 40 years of knowledge and experience in nuclear reactors , scientists and engineers have developed research in safe and high performance nuclear reactors known as Generation IV reactors .

input: grammar: Six reactors concepts have been selected for further research by the Generation IV International Forum ( GIF ) .
target: Six reactors concepts have been selected for further research by the Generation IV International Forum ( GIF ) .

input: grammar: Of the six reactors , the Very High Temperature Reactor ( VHTR ) and the Molten Salt Reactor ( MSR ) are often debated among scientists .
target: Of the six reactors , the Very High Temperature Reactor ( VHTR ) and the Molten Salt Reactor ( MSR ) are often debated among scientists .

input: grammar: Although VHTR is designed to be a high-energy-efficient system , there is evidence that proves MSR is the better concept .
target: Although VHTR is designed to be a high-energy-efficient system , there is evidence that shows MSR is the better concept .

input: grammar: Safety features are one of the main considerations when designing a nuclear reactor .
target: Safety features are one of the main considerations when designing a nuclear reactor .

input: grammar: Proponents of VHTR claim that it has an inherent passive safety features for both the fuel and the reactor ( Goethem 2008 ) .
target: Proponents of VHTR claim that it has an inherent passive safety feature for both the fuel and the reactor ( Goethem 2008 ) .

input: grammar: For example , the core of the reactor will be able to withstand temperatures way above the normal operating temperatures .
target: For example , the core of the reactor will be able to withstand temperatures way above the normal operating temperatures .

input: grammar: In the event of an accident , the probability of a meltdown occurring is minimized .
target: In the event of an accident , the probability of a meltdown occurring is minimized .

input: grammar: However , passive safety features are present in the MSR too .
target: However , passive safety features are present in the MSR too .

input: grammar: Unlike the VHTR which produces high pressure steam at the core , MSR produces low pressure .
target: Unlike the VHTR which produces high pressure steam at the core , MSR produces low pressure .

input: grammar: This is due to the nature of molten fluoride salts , which is used as coolant and is mechanically and chemically stable at sea-level pressures ( Forsberg 2004 ) .
target: This is due to the nature of molten fluoride salts , which are used as coolant and are mechanically and chemically stable at sea-level pressures ( Forsberg 2004 ) .

input: grammar: In other words the MSR 's core can not have a steam explosion , thus it eliminates the need for additional advance technology to control the high pressure .
target: In other words the MSR 's core can not have a steam explosion ; thus , it eliminates the need for additional advanced technology to control the high pressure .

input: grammar: Due to VHTR 's high temperature and corrosive operating conditions , the materials used must have high dimensional stability and be able to withstand high pressure .
target: Due to VHTR 's high temperature and corrosive operating conditions , the materials used must have high dimensional stability and be able to withstand high pressure .

input: grammar: New ultra hard materials that can resist continued high temperatures and intense bombardment by neutrons have to be developed ( Butler ) .
target: New ultra hard materials that can resist continued high temperatures and intense bombardment by neutrons have to be developed ( Butler ) .

input: grammar: Practical advantages of MSR 's high temperature low pressure cooling result in higher efficiency in removing heat from the core ( Fosberg 2004 ) .
target: Practical advantages of MSR 's high temperature low pressure cooling result in higher efficiency in removing heat from the core ( Fosberg 2004 ) .

input: grammar: This also implies that MSR does not need to spend additional money developing new materials to withstand the high pressure .
target: This also implies that MSR does not need to spend additional money developing new materials to withstand the high pressure .

input: grammar: Uranium is the main source of fuel for the VHTR 's main system of operation .
target: Uranium is the main source of fuel for the VHTR 's main system of operation .

input: grammar: A once-through uranium fuel cycle allows the reactor to produce high temperature at the outlet core .
target: A once-through uranium fuel cycle allows the reactor to produce high temperature at the outlet core .

input: grammar: But unlike the VHTR , the MSR uses another kind of fuel cycle called thorium , which is much more abundant in nature than uranium ( David.S 2007 ) The first advantages of using a thorium fuel cycle are the ability to burn up most of the actinides which produces radioactivity .
target: But unlike VHTR , MSR uses another kind of fuel cycle called thorium , which is much more abundant in nature than uranium ( David.S 2007 ) . The first advantage of using a thorium fuel cycle is the ability to burn up most of the actinides which produce radioactivity .

input: grammar: Radioactivity is unwanted as it can remain active for hundreds of years if it is not properly contained .
target: Radioactivity is unwanted as it can remain active for hundreds of years if it is not properly contained .

input: grammar: ( David.s 2007 ) The second advantage is an enhanced nuclear weapons proliferation resistance .
target: ( David.s 2007 ) The second advantage is an enhanced nuclear weapons proliferation resistance .

input: grammar: Due to the nature of a thorium based fuel cycle , essential elements for nuclear weapons like enriched uranium can not be chemically separated from thorium .
target: Due to the nature of a thorium based fuel cycle , essential elements for nuclear weapons like enriched uranium can not be chemically separated from thorium .

input: grammar: Unlike thorium , enriched uranium used in the VHTR and it can potentially produce a bomb .
target: Unlike thorium , enriched uranium used in VHTR can potentially produce a bomb .

input: grammar: Moreover uranium is limited in supply and not as abundant as Thorium .
target: Moreover uranium is limited in supply and not as abundant as thorium .

input: grammar: The need for expensive fuel-enrichment facilities is unnecessary when Thorium is being used as the main fuel cycle too .
target: The need for expensive fuel-enrichment facilities is unnecessary when thorium is being used as the main fuel cycle too .

input: grammar: Both MSR and VHTR are state-of-the-art nuclear reactors .

target: In the modern world , nuclear power is widely used . There are more than 400 nuclear power plants operating in 30 countries , which supply almost 17 percent of the world 's electricity .

input: grammar: However , after the research , I support the Gas- cooled fast reactor is the better one .
target: However , after research , I think the Gas- cooled fast reactor is the better one .

target: First , for the sodium-cooled fast reactor , it is top-ranked in sustainability because of its closed fuel cycle and excellent potential for actinide management .

input: grammar: Actually , it can make the use of 99 % of fuel .
target: Actually , it can make use of 99 % of fuel .

input: grammar: The outlet temperatures in the range of 510-650 makes the resulting thermal efficiencies range from 39 % to 47 % .
target: The outlet temperatures in the range of 510-650 makes the resulting thermal efficiencies range from 39 % to 47 % .

input: grammar: The performance of sodium-cooled fast reactor seems so perfect , however , compared with the Gas-cooled fast reactor , these data is not perfect anymore .

input: grammar: For gas-cooled fast reactor , it is also a closed fuel cycle and the use of fuel can reach 99 % as well .
target: The gas-cooled fast reactor is also a closed fuel cycle and the use of fuel can reach 99 % as well .

input: grammar: The outlet temperatures in the range of the gas-cooled fast reactor is around 850 , so it makes the theoretical value of its thermal efficiency is 50 % .
target: The outlet temperatures in the range of the gas-cooled fast reactor are around 850 , so its theoretical value of thermal efficiency is 50 % .

input: grammar: This limit of the sodium-cooled fast reactor is just 47 % .
target: That of the sodium-cooled fast reactor is just 47 % .

input: grammar: Second , safety is another important factor .
target: Second , safety is another important factor .

input: grammar: For the sodium-cooled fast reactor , it is a primary system that operates near atmospheric pressure and important features of the system include a long thermal response time which is a large margin to cool the boiling .
target: For the sodium-cooled fast reactor , it is a primary system that operates near atmospheric pressure and important features of the system include a long thermal response time which is a large margin to cool the boiling .

input: grammar: It also offers a high level of safety reliability .
target: It also offers a high level of safety reliability .

input: grammar: This fact is based on active safety countermeasures for self-controlled shutdown function and cooling function .
target: This fact is based on active safety countermeasures for self-controlled shutdown function and cooling function .

input: grammar: However , dynamic simulations indicate that an accidental reduction of flow up to 2-3 can be tolerated ( with no control action ) without sodium boiling or fuel melting .
target: However , dynamic simulations indicate that an accidental reduction of flow up to 2-3 can be tolerated ( with no control action ) without sodium boiling or fuel melting .

input: grammar: From it we can find the most significant part for safety features of sodium- cooled fast reactor is the control action .
target: Obviously , the most significant part of the safety features of the sodium- cooled fast reactor is the control action .

input: grammar: Thus , no matter which kind of generation IV reactor , if its system has control action , it is also relatively safety .
target: Thus , no matter which generation IV reactor is used , if its system has control action , it is also relatively safe .

input: grammar: Furthermore , the gas-cooled fast reactor also has its own control action of the system .
target: Furthermore , the gas-cooled fast reactor also has its own control action in the system .

input: grammar: This control makes the gas-cooled fast reactor can be as safe as the sodium-cooled fast reactor .
target: This control makes the gas-cooled fast reactor as safe as the sodium-cooled fast reactor .

input: grammar: Third , the cost of the fast reactor is also significant .
target: Third , the cost of the fast reactor is also significant .

input: grammar: Some evident shows the sodium-cooled fast reactor can reduce the cost of the raw material by changing it .
target: Some evidence shows the sodium-cooled fast reactor can reduce the cost of the raw material by changing the materials used .

input: grammar: However , as the sodium-cooled fast reactor was developed later than the other kinds of factors , especially later than the gas-cooled fast reactor , the cost of research and investigation of the sodium-cooled fast reactor is so huge .
target: However , as the sodium-cooled fast reactor was developed later than the other kinds of reactors , especially later than the gas-cooled fast reactor , the cost of research and investigation of the sodium-cooled fast reactor is so huge .

input: grammar: Just because of it , many developed countries do not have enough money to afford this expense .
target: Because of this , many developed countries do not have enough money to build a sodium-cooled fast reactor .

input: grammar: Therefore , it obstructs the application of the sodium-cooled fast reactor .
target: Therefore , the application of the sodium-cooled fast reactor is hindered .

input: grammar: Compared with sodium-cooled fast reactor , the gas-cooled fast factor is an old one which has been developed and widely used since 1979 .
target: Compared with the sodium-cooled fast reactor , the gas-cooled fast factor is an old one which has been developed and widely used since 1979 .

input: grammar: Its cost of development is far less than the sodium-cooled fast reactor .
target: Its cost of development is far less than that of the sodium-cooled fast reactor .

input: grammar: It does not need to be changed or improved so much .
target: It does not need to be changed or improved so much .

input: grammar: The main cost of it is just the annual depreciation which is far less than the development cost of the sodium- cooled reactor .
target: Its main cost is just the annual depreciation which is far less than the development cost of the sodium- cooled reactor .

input: grammar: In addition , we should consider the cost of time of the reactors .
target: In addition , we should consider the cost of time of the reactors .

input: grammar: The gas-cooled fast reactor can be used directly at once .
target: The gas-cooled fast reactor can be used directly at once .

input: grammar: However , the sodium-cooled fast reactor should be checked for several years by the fact .
target: However , the sodium-cooled fast reactor should be checked for several years before it could be used .

input: grammar: Therefore , the gas-cooled fast reactor is better than the sodium-cooled fast reactor by cost .
target: Therefore , the gas-cooled fast reactor is better than the sodium-cooled fast reactor in terms of cost .

input: grammar: In conclusion , even though the sodium-cooled fast reactor is a good type of generation IV reactor , the gas-cooled fast reactor is a much better one .
target: In conclusion , even though the sodium-cooled fast reactor is a good type of generation IV reactor , the gas-cooled fast reactor is a much better one .

input: grammar: Compared with the sodium-cooled fast reactor , the gas-cooled reactor has its obvious advantages of performance and cost .
target: Compared with the sodium-cooled fast reactor , the gas-cooled reactor has its obvious advantages of performance and cost .

input: grammar: It has the larger thermal efficiency and less cost of expense and time .
target: It has the larger thermal efficiency and lower cost of expense and time .

input: grammar: Even though the safety of sodium-cooled fast reactor may be better than the gas-cooled fast reactor , it can not change the fact that the gas-cooled fast reactor is better than the sodium-cooled fast reactor in contemporary time , because there is still no way to make the nuclear power totally safe by now .
target: Even though the safety of sodium-cooled fast reactor may be better than that of the gas-cooled fast reactor , it can not change the fact that the gas-cooled fast reactor is better than the sodium-cooled fast reactor at the present stage , because there is still no way to make the nuclear power totally safe now .

input: grammar: Therefore , the gas-cooled fast reactor is better than the sodium-cooled fast reactor .
target: Therefore , the gas-cooled fast reactor is better than the sodium-cooled fast reactor .

target: In addition , unlike the heat-energy reactor , the gas emitted by the nuclear reactor during the operation has little influence on the environment and global warming .

target: Lastly , the achievement obtained from the research can also be applied into other fields .

target: Secondly , numerous people are holding the view that the nuclear reactor still holds huge potential safety risks .

target: Reviewing the history , the Chernobyl and the Three Mile Island catastrophes indeed witnessed the enormous harm the nuclear reactor could cause .

target: Nevertheless , this kind of worry is still needless .
