input: grammar: Global warming has been the main concern of the governments around the world for the past decade .
target: Global warming has been the main concern of the governments around the world for the past decade .

input: grammar: High carbon dioxide emission has been one of the main culprits for global warming .
target: High carbon dioxide emission has been one of the main culprits for global warming .

input: grammar: Thus there is a need to find alternatives to produce energy instead of relying on the conventional ones .
target: Thus there is a need to find alternatives to produce energy instead of relying on the conventional ones .

input: grammar: Although it is not commonly seen , some countries are already using nuclear reactors to produce energy .
target: Although it is not commonly seen , some countries are already using nuclear reactors to produce energy .

input: grammar: These nuclear reactors unlike the conventional power plants , they do not produce greenhouse gases ( Gerstner , 2009 ) .
target: These nuclear reactors , unlike the conventional power plants , do not produce greenhouse gases ( Gerstner , 2009 ) .

input: grammar: However , these nuclear reactors also have their own disadvantages such as producing radioactive wastes , high cost and safety issues .
target: However , these nuclear reactors also have their own disadvantages such as producing radioactive wastes , high cost and safety issues .

input: grammar: Research has shown that it is possible to have a nuclear reactor that is cleaner , safer and cheaper ( Butler , 2004 ) .
target: Research has shown that it is possible to have a nuclear reactor that is cleaner , safer and cheaper ( Butler , 2004 ) .

input: grammar: Thus , there should be funding for research and development for Generation IV nuclear reactor .
target: Thus , there should be funding for research and development for Generation IV nuclear reactors .

input: grammar: Some people think that the radioactive wastes produced by the nuclear reactors are more dangerous than the greenhouse gases .
target: Some people think that the radioactive wastes produced by nuclear reactors are more dangerous than the greenhouse gases .

input: grammar: The radioactive waste could be used as an ingredient for nuclear weapons ( Butler , 2004 ) .
target: The radioactive waste could be used as an ingredient for nuclear weapons ( Butler , 2004 ) .

input: grammar: Furthermore , the nuclear plant produces a large amount of waste ( 12,000 tonnes ) , thus disposal became an issue ( Gerstner , 2009 ) .
target: Furthermore , the nuclear plant produces a large amount of waste ( 12,000 tonnes ) ; thus , disposal becomes an issue ( Gerstner , 2009 ) .

input: grammar: However , these problems could be solved by the new Generation IV reactors .
target: However , these problems could be solved by the new Generation IV reactors .

input: grammar: Currently , most of the nuclear reactors use nuclear fission to produce energy and large volume of radioactive wastes is produced .
target: Currently , most of the nuclear reactors use nuclear fission to produce energy and a large volume of radioactive wastes is produced .

input: grammar: It was found that through thermonuclear fusion , it could reduce the radioactivity and volume of wastes produced by nuclear fission ( Gerstner , 2009 ) .
target: It was found that through thermonuclear fusion , it could reduce the radioactivity and the volume of wastes produced by nuclear fission ( Gerstner , 2009 ) .

input: grammar: Thus by combining the nuclear fission and fusion , the waste produced will be less and less radioactive .
target: Thus by combining the nuclear fission and fusion , the waste produced will be less and less radioactive .

input: grammar: With less amount of wastes produced , it would mean that less plutonium is produced .

target: However , the designers failed to understand that aircrafts were to be piloted by humans , and not some fearless beings .

input: grammar: Psychology should be used in the Design Process
target: Psychology should be used in the Design Process

input: grammar: Some bad memories will never fade away , like the Challenger accident , which took place in January 28 , 1986 , killing all the 7 astronauts just 72 seconds after being launched into the sky ( Challenger STS 51-L Accident , n.d. ) .
target: Some bad memories will never fade away , like the Challenger accident , which took place in January 28 , 1986 , killing all the 7 astronauts just 72 seconds after being launched into the sky ( Challenger STS 51-L Accident , n.d. ) .

input: grammar: The common explanation for this painful accident is that O-ring joint problem leads to the leakage of fuel and eventually results in the explosion of space shuttle .
target: The common explanation for this painful accident is that O-ring joint problem leads to the leakage of fuel and eventually results in the explosion of space shuttle .

input: grammar: ( NASA-STS-51L , n.d ) However , this technical failure is only the surface reason .
target: ( NASA-STS-51L , n.d ) However , this technical failure is only the surface reason .

input: grammar: What causes the failure of the O-ring is due to the irresponsibility and ignorance of the person in charge .
target: What causes the failure of the O-ring is due to the irresponsibility and ignorance of the person in charge .

input: grammar: Hence , by applying psychology to the design process , which means individuals involved in the design process can make commitments to their tasks and make decisions out of consideration , the chance of accident prevention might be largely enhanced .
target: Hence , by applying psychology to the design process , which means individuals involved in the design process can make commitments to their tasks and make decisions out of consideration , the chance of accident prevention might be largely enhanced .

input: grammar: To begin with , the leading person in the design process should consider the practicability of the whole system , and hence makes the pragmatic plan and approach .
target: To begin with , the leading person in the design process should consider the practicability of the whole system , and hence makes the pragmatic plan and approach .

input: grammar: In the case of Challenger accident , the management committee made an inaccessible schedules and 'modify the technical and procedural standard ' for the engineers ( Craig L. Howe ) .
target: In the case of Challenger accident , the management committee made an inaccessible schedules and 'modify the technical and procedural standard ' for the engineers ( Craig L. Howe ) .

input: grammar: Without sufficient time given , how could those managers expect the high qualitative component parts of the space shuttle to be produced ?
target: Without sufficient time given , how could those managers expect the high qualitative component parts of the space shuttle to be produced ?

input: grammar: Even though some of them would probably argue that they were not familiar with engineering process , they could not refuse to take the blame .
target: Even though some of them would probably argue that they were not familiar with engineering process , they could not refuse to take the blame .

input: grammar: In this respect , the use of psychology during design process requires them to make a schedule based on practicability after consultations with engineers , which will help to guarantee each individual process of the system to operate well .
target: In this respect , the use of psychology during design process requires them to make a schedule based on practicability after consultations with engineers , which will help to guarantee each individual process of the system to operate well .

input: grammar: The second perspective to illustrate why psychology is an essential factor to avoid the occurrence of the accident is that engineers who produce numerous tiny component parts could minimize 'erroneous actions ' by applying psychology in their design ( Wilpert.B , 2006 ) .
target: The second perspective to illustrate why psychology is an essential factor to avoid the occurrence of the accident is that engineers who produce numerous tiny component parts could minimize 'erroneous actions ' by applying psychology in their design ( Wilpert.B , 2006 ) .

input: grammar: For instance , because of the limited time , the engineers working for Challenger space shuttle failed to comply with the criteria of producing individual high qualitative parts of the space shuttle ( R. P. Feynman , 1996 ) .
target: For instance , because of the limited time , the engineers working for Challenger space shuttle failed to comply with the criteria of producing individual high qualitative parts of the space shuttle ( R. P. Feynman , 1996 ) .

input: grammar: In order to finish their tasks promptly , engineers threw away their occupational ethic .
target: In order to finish their tasks promptly , engineers threw away their occupational ethic .

input: grammar: The basis of psychology is completing one 's own task in high quality , yet this basic requirement is sometimes ignored by people , and consequently , extremely painful accident is triggered .
target: The basis of psychology is completing one 's own task in high quality , yet this basic requirement is sometimes ignored by people , and consequently , extremely painful accident is triggered .

input: grammar: The contrary viewpoints tend to attribute the O-ring problem to a simply technical failure that the 'factual account ' of the accident is " frozen , brittle O ring " which causes the leakage of fuel and induces the exploration of the space shuttle Challenger ( D.Vaughan , 1996 ) .
target: The contrary viewpoints tend to attribute the O-ring problem to a simply technical failure that the 'factual account ' of the accident is " frozen , brittle O ring " which causes the leakage of fuel and induces the exploration of the space shuttle Challenger ( D.Vaughan , 1996 ) .

input: grammar: However , it is just the surface cause of the accident .
target: However , it is just the surface cause of the accident .

input: grammar: The deep reason behind is the insufficient low-temperature testing of O-ring which conceals the potential risk from engineers .
target: The deep reason behind is the insufficient low-temperature testing of O-ring which conceals the potential risk from engineers .

input: grammar: It is not an excuse for them to quibble that they have no idea of the quality of O-ring because they have not collected sufficient data to prove that the O-ring can not stand low temperature .
target: It is not an excuse for them to quibble that they have no idea of the quality of the O-ring because they have not collected sufficient data to prove that the O-ring can not stand low temperature .

input: grammar: It is a problem of engineers ' attitude that no one bothers to detect that 'apparent ' problem .
target: It is a problem of engineers ' attitude that no one bothers to detect that 'apparent ' problem .

input: grammar: Unfortunately , the launch date of the Challenger space shuttle was extremely cold and this error turned out to be fatal ( McConnell , M , 1987 ) .
target: Unfortunately , the launch date of the Challenger space shuttle was extremely cold and this error turned out to be fatal ( McConnell , M , 1987 ) .

input: grammar: Apart from the engineering errors , psychology should also be taken into account with respect to safety issue .
target: Apart from the engineering errors , psychology should also be taken into account with respect to safety issue .

input: grammar: The management committee of the Challenger space shuttle actually got a warning report about the high risk before the launch .
target: The management committee of the Challenger space shuttle actually got a warning report about the high risk before the launch .

input: grammar: They were informed that the O-ring might fail to seal the fuel tank due to the low temperature .
target: They were informed that the O-ring might fail to seal the fuel tank due to the low temperature .

input: grammar: However , in response to such a crucial warning report , they put it aside and left it to chance ( The Space Shuttle Challenger Disaster , 2009 ) .
target: However , in response to such a crucial warning report , they put it aside and left it to chance ( The Space Shuttle Challenger Disaster , 2009 ) .

input: grammar: It was a totally irresponsible action .
target: It was a totally irresponsible action .

input: grammar: Conceding that officials in NASA may have been used to high risk operation and there are certain times when the system needs to operate at high risk ( Feynman , Richard Phillips,1992 ) , the managers can not straightaway ignore the problem just because the chance for the accident to take place is slim .
target: Conceding that officials in NASA may have been used to high risk operation and there are certain times when the system needs to operate at high risk ( Feynman , Richard Phillips,1992 ) , the managers can not straightaway ignore the problem just because the chance for the accident to take place is slim .

input: grammar: Their underestimation of the danger resulted in the Challenger accident directly .
target: Their underestimation of the danger resulted in the Challenger accident directly .

input: grammar: If psychology could been used in their decision , if they could have thought more about their work which related to the safety of other people and the outcome of the entire program , if they really have had the sense of responsibility which results from the essence of their job , they would not rush their work and make irresponsible decision .
target: If psychology could been used in their decision , if they could have thought more about their work which related to the safety of other people and the outcome of the entire program , if they really have had the sense of responsibility which results from the essence of their job , they would not rush their work and make irresponsible decision .

input: grammar: Thus psychology helps to evaluate the danger of the event correctly and avoid the accident to occur .
target: Thus psychology helps to evaluate the danger of the event correctly and avoid the accident to occur .

input: grammar: In sum , instead of technical shortcomings , the accounts of the Challenger disaster are largely due to the ignorance and irresponsibility of both the engineers and programme managers .
target: In sum , instead of technical shortcomings , the accounts of the Challenger disaster are largely due to the ignorance and irresponsibility of both the engineers and programme managers .

input: grammar: Conceding that all human beings may make mistake in the unfamiliar field , and certain constraints may affect people 's actions and decisions , however , we can not deny that the importance of psychology during the design process .
target: Conceding that all human beings may make mistake in the unfamiliar field , and certain constraints may affect people 's actions and decisions , however , we can not deny that the importance of psychology during the design process .

input: grammar: By applying psychology , we can avoid certain mindset and learn to be more responsible and considerate .
target: By applying psychology , we can avoid a certain mindset and learn to be more responsible and considerate .

input: grammar: Therefore , psychology helps to prevent the engineering accident and design failure .
target: Therefore , psychology helps to prevent the engineering accident and design failure .

input: grammar: Owing to the public 's concerns about the safe operation nuclear power , research and development , funding for nuclear power was rather minimal .
target: Owing to the public 's concerns about the safe operation nuclear power , research and development , funding for nuclear power has been rather minimal .

input: grammar: More recently , environmental concerns and rising energy demands are putting nuclear power back into the energy equation .
target: More recently , environmental concerns and rising energy demands are putting nuclear power back into the energy equation .

input: grammar: However , if nuclear power is to win the approval of the previously disapproving public , it will have to be more cost-effective , environmentally-friendly and almost void of security concerns .
target: However , if nuclear power is to win the approval of the previously disapproving public , it will have to be more cost-effective , environmentally-friendly and almost void of security concerns .

input: grammar: Keeping this in mind the pioneer nations of nuclear power have come up with a few generation-IV reactor concepts ( Butler , 2004 ) .
target: Keeping this in mind the pioneer nations of nuclear power have come up with a few generation-IV reactor concepts ( Butler , 2004 ) .

input: grammar: The earliest concept that is going to be introduced is the Sodium- Cooled fast reactor concept , which requires relatively new low pressure and temperature to operate and recycles its nuclear waste .
target: The earliest concept that is going to be introduced is the Sodium- Cooled fast reactor concept , which requires relatively new low pressure and temperature to operate and recycles its nuclear waste .

input: grammar: Examining the public 's concerns with respect to the Sodium-Cooled fast reactor will give us a useful insight on the potential of nuclear power .
target: Examining the public 's concerns with respect to the Sodium-Cooled fast reactor will give us a useful insight on the potential of nuclear power .

input: grammar: However , nuclear power would never be a major source of energy simply because its drawbacks far outweigh its advantages .
target: However , nuclear power would never be a major source of energy simply because its drawbacks far outweigh its advantages .

input: grammar: One of the most critical factors while considering the various power sources is cost .
target: One of the most critical factors while considering the various power sources is cost .

input: grammar: The general public will only approve of a power source if it is cost-effective .
target: The general public will only approve of a power source if it is cost-effective .

input: grammar: An obvious advantage of nuclear power is the massive amounts of energy it can generate .
target: An obvious advantage of nuclear power is the massive amounts of energy it can generate .

input: grammar: For instance , a single nuclear plant can generate four times as much energy as a coal-powered plant in its lifetime ( Max , 2009 ) .
target: For instance , a single nuclear plant can generate four times as much energy as a coal-powered plant in its lifetime ( Max , 2009 ) .

input: grammar: Sodium-Cooled fast reactors are also able to recycle spent fuel rods .
target: Sodium-Cooled fast reactors are also able to recycle spent fuel rods .

input: grammar: Moreover , analysts have estimated Uranium to last us for at least another century ( Leipoldt , 2007 ) .
target: Moreover , analysts have estimated Uranium to last us for at least another century ( Leipoldt , 2007 ) .

input: grammar: Uranium is not so expensive to mine as its ores are found near the surface of the earth .
target: Uranium is not so expensive to mine as its ores are found near the surface of the earth .

input: grammar: All these suggest that nuclear power is actually very energy-efficient and cost effective .
target: All these suggest that nuclear power is actually very energy-efficient and cost effective .

input: grammar: However , the capital needed to set up a nuclear plant is extremely high .
target: However , the capital needed to set up a nuclear plant is extremely high .

input: grammar: This can be attributed to a few factors .
target: This can be attributed to a few factors .

input: grammar: Firstly , nuclear plants , according to the safety standards set by authorities , must have a 'cordon area ' of at least 30km .
target: Firstly , nuclear plants , according to the safety standards set by authorities , must have a 'cordon area ' of at least 30km .

input: grammar: Setting aside such a vast amount of land just for one nuclear plant is clearly not feasible .
target: Setting aside such a vast amount of land just for one nuclear plant is clearly not feasible .

input: grammar: Secondly , machinery required in nuclear plants is extremely costly because it has to be constructed with high precision to prevent any form of nuclear leak .
target: Secondly , machinery required in nuclear plants is extremely costly because it has to be constructed with high precision to prevent any form of nuclear leak .

input: grammar: Thirdly , substantial testing that needs to take place to prevent any accidents will also add to the escalating costs .
target: Thirdly , substantial testing that needs to take place to prevent any accidents will also add to the escalating costs .

input: grammar: Governments under-insure nuclear plants to make it cost- effective so as to cater to the public .
target: Governments under-insure nuclear plants to make it cost- effective so as to cater to the public .

input: grammar: Nuclear plants are indeed high-risk considering the huge capital outlay by the authorities .
target: Nuclear plants are indeed high-risk considering the huge capital outlay by the authorities .

input: grammar: Therefore , nuclear power , in terms of cost , is not exactly a viable option even though its very energy- efficient .
target: Therefore , nuclear power , in terms of cost , is not exactly a viable option even though its very energy- efficient .

input: grammar: Another critical factor that needs to be considered is how environmentally- friendly the energy source is .
target: Another critical factor that needs to be considered is how environmentally- friendly the energy source is .

input: grammar: Although this factor does not involve the public , recent studies have shown that the public is increasingly aware of the environmental problems and are prepared to take measures to arrest the slide .
target: Although this factor does not involve the public , recent studies have shown that the public is increasingly aware of the environmental problems and are prepared to take measures to arrest the slide .

input: grammar: Nuclear power is usually lauded as the " environmentally-friendly " energy and rightly so too .
target: Nuclear power is usually lauded as the " environmentally-friendly " energy and rightly so too .

input: grammar: Nuclear energy does not emit toxic pollutants in the atmosphere nor does it emit combustion by-products like carbon dioxide , a greenhouse gas that punctures our ozone-layer further , giving rise to global-warming .
target: Nuclear energy does not emit toxic pollutants in the atmosphere nor does it emit combustion by-products like carbon dioxide , a greenhouse gas that punctures our ozone-layer further , giving rise to global-warming .

input: grammar: Carbon dioxide is the reason for about half of the global warming experienced by Earth ( Kallen , 2005 ) .
target: Carbon dioxide is the reason for about half of the global warming experienced by Earth ( Kallen , 2005 ) .

input: grammar: In comparison with burning fossil fuels , it has to be said that nuclear power is far more environmentally-friendly .
target: In comparison with burning fossil fuels , it has to be said that nuclear power is far more environmentally-friendly .

input: grammar: The final factor that we are considering is the safety of the public .
target: The final factor that we are considering is the safety of the public .

input: grammar: Firstly , it is almost impossible to build something that is perfectly safe .
target: Firstly , it is almost impossible to build something that is perfectly safe .

input: grammar: The chance of a failure , although minute , is still present .
target: The chance of a failure , although minute , is still present .

input: grammar: The consequences of any accident are vast .
target: The consequences of any accident are vast .

input: grammar: If there is a leak , these radioactive substances can kill at high doses and cause cancer and birth defects at low doses .
target: If there is a leak , these radioactive substances can kill at high doses and cause cancer and birth defects at low doses .

input: grammar: Sodium-Cooled reactors recycle the nuclear waste so it is highly improbable that nuclear waste will end up in the wrong hands .
target: Sodium-Cooled reactors recycle the nuclear waste so it is highly improbable that nuclear waste will end up in the wrong hands .

input: grammar: However , one can never be too sure .
target: However , one can never be too sure .

input: grammar: The information on creating " dirty nuclear bombs " is readily available in the Internet and in several books too .
target: The information on creating " dirty nuclear bombs " is readily available in the Internet and in several books too .

input: grammar: So there could be mass destruction if terrorists somehow get hold of uranium and decide to make nuclear bombs .
target: So there could be mass destruction if terrorists somehow get hold of uranium and decide to make nuclear bombs .

input: grammar: Finally , nuclear power might give rise to strained relation between nations .
target: Finally , nuclear power might give rise to strained relations between nations .

input: grammar: For instance , if a country is utilizing nuclear power , neighbouring countries might view that country as a military threat .
target: For instance , if a country is utilizing nuclear power , neighbouring countries might view that country as a military threat .

input: grammar: Therefore , nuclear power , although very environmentally- friendly , invokes many security concerns amongst the public .
target: Therefore , nuclear power , although very environmentally- friendly , invokes many security concerns amongst the public .

input: grammar: In conclusion , the public might be tempted to switch to nuclear energy because nuclear energy , like wind energy and light energy , is environmentally friendly and very energy-efficient .
target: In conclusion , the public might be tempted to switch to nuclear energy because nuclear energy , like wind energy and light energy , is environmentally friendly and very energy-efficient .

input: grammar: However , nuclear power still raises many concerns with regards to cost and security .
target: However , nuclear power still raises many concerns with regards to cost and security .

input: grammar: Until these concerns are eradicated , other safer and cheaper sources of energy would be preferred ahead of nuclear power .
target: Until these concerns are eradicated , other safer and cheaper sources of energy would be preferred ahead of nuclear power .

target: Nuclear power , as a powerful new energy , stands out with its high energy-generating potential and relatively low emission of green house gas , such as carbon dioxide .

input: grammar: However , considering the nuclear plant accidents happened in the past few decades , the public is very concerned about the security issues and high cost of nuclear plants .
target: However , considering the nuclear plant accidents happened in the past few decades , the public is very concerned about the security issues and high cost of nuclear plants .

target: They say that it is technologically impossible to build up a 100 % secure nuclear plant .

target: Every nuclear plant must have a possibility to face operation failure ; with the number of nuclear plants increases , the sum of the possibility increases as well .

input: grammar: Their argument seems to be persuasive , but they forget the fact that every energy workspace has a chance to face failure .
target: Their argument seems to be persuasive , but they forget the fact that every energy workspace has a chance to face failure .

target: Moreover , the Generation = 3 \ * ROMAN III reactors which we are using now and the Generation = 4 \ * ROMAN IV reactors which are under research and test , use the design called ''defense in depth " .

input: grammar: Every reactor has several back-up systems .
target: Every reactor has several back-up systems .

target: If there was something wrong , the first back-up system would start to work to limit the harm .

input: grammar: If the first back-up system failed , another back-up system would take the place , etc .
target: If the first back-up system failed , another back-up system would take the place , etc .

input: grammar: Certainly , it is possible that all the back-up systems fail in the same accident , but the probability is extremely small3 .
target: Certainly , it is possible that all the back-up systems fail in the same accident , but the probability is extremely small3 .

input: grammar: Therefore , we should believe that modern science and technology can ensure the security of nuclear plants .
target: Therefore , we should believe that modern science and technology can ensure the security of nuclear plants .

target: In addition , there are people worrying about the sustainability of nuclear power .

target: According to the theory , uranium is the necessary energy source , yet the quantity of the element uranium on the earth is very limited .

input: grammar: If we keep using the current technology , the supply of uranium may only last 30 to 60 years depending on the needs for energy1 .
target: If we keep using the current technology , the supply of uranium may only last 30 to 60 years depending on the needs for energy1 .

input: grammar: However , this kind of calculation is not accurate .
target: However , this kind of calculation is not accurate .

input: grammar: It is because the heat efficiency in current nuclear plants is only 1 % , which means 99 % of the energy generated by nuclear plants is wasted4 , but Scientists have already found out ways to increase the heat efficiency .
target: It is because the heat efficiency in current nuclear plants is only 1 % , which means 99 % of the energy generated by nuclear plants is wasted4 , but Scientists have already found ways to increase the heat efficiency .

target: Furthermore , a Chinese engineer , Wang Hongqing , has found out the technology to increase the heat efficiency from 1 % to over 60 % 4 .

target: As a result , we can extend the life of nuclear power by at least several hundreds of years .

target: Another concern about nuclear power is that the radioactive waste is very hard to be dealt with .

target: The waste needs to be carefully kept away from people for several thousand years .

input: grammar: In addition , nuclear waste may become tools for terrorists , which is very dangerous .
target: In addition , nuclear waste may become tools for terrorists , which is very dangerous .

target: However , one of the concepts of the Gen = 4 \ * ROMAN IV reactors , very-high-temperature reactors ( VHTR ) , can solve this problem .

target: In the design of VHTR system , the radioactive uranium and plutonium will run automatically into the recycle so that it can offer an enhanced waste typo .

target: Therefore , there will be no need to worry about the nuclear waste reprocessing .

target: Furthermore , it is much easier for us to develop nuclear technology than explore other new energy resources .

target: People have already had a relatively mature technology on nuclear power .

target: We have known the theory and been aware of the process .

target: This turns out to be the truth .

target: Within a few years , people have come up with the concepts of the Gen = 4 \ * ROMAN IV reactors .

target: In addition , the Gen = 4 \ * ROMAN IV reactors will achieve more than what we expect .

target: The new nuclear plants will not only generate huge amount of electricity , but also a considerable amount of hydrogen which is also a prosperous and useful green energy .

target: In conclusion , we should not be afraid of the failures or difficulties .

target: Instead , we need to try our best to overcome any difficulties and improve our technology .

input: grammar: There are many engineering accidents happened in the past and now they are still not avoided .
target: There have been many engineering accidents in the past and now they are still not avoided .

input: grammar: Chernobyl nuclear plant explosion is one of the incidents occurred on 26 April 1986 .
target: Chernobyl nuclear plant explosion is one of the incidents occurred on 26 April 1986 .

input: grammar: This accident killed 30 people and the radioactive effect has caused 56 fatalities till the year of 2004 ( WNA , 2009 ) .
target: This accident killed 30 people and the radioactive effect has caused 56 fatalities till the year of 2004 ( WNA , 2009 ) .

input: grammar: The main cause of the most accidents is directed to operators ' error .
target: The main cause of most accidents is the error .

input: grammar: It can be insufficient knowledge of operators , inadequate training of operators , poor design and poor communication among team members .
target: It can be due to knowledge of operators , inadequate training of operators , poor design and poor communication among team members .

input: grammar: However , further investigations showed that these could be prevented at the initial stage which was at the design stage .
target: However , further investigations have shown that these could be prevented at the initial stage which was at the design stage .

input: grammar: In the journal written by Wilpert ( 2007 ) , the use of psychology in the design process could help to prevent accidents from happening or at least minimize the damage from the accidents .
target: In the journal written by Wilpert ( 2007 ) , the use of psychology in the design process could help to prevent accidents from happening or at least minimize the damage from the accidents .

input: grammar: It is currently encouraged to all design process especially in engineering design to have psychology knowledge involved .
target: It is currently encouraged to all design process especially in engineering design to have psychology knowledge involved .

input: grammar: A design engineer is also a human , thus he/she may make mistakes at the design stage too .
target: A design engineer is also a human , thus he/she may make mistakes at the design stage too .

input: grammar: This could be noticed from the design being corrected after an accident and even including the operation manual .
target: This could be noticed from the design being corrected after an accident and even including the operation manual .

input: grammar: In Chernobyl nuclear plant , reactor unit 4 had a very high positive void coefficient which led to a rapid increase of power when there was steam generated ( Chernobyl , n.d. ) .
target: In Chernobyl nuclear plant , reactor unit 4 had a very high positive void coefficient which led to a rapid increase of power when there was steam generated ( Chernobyl , n.d. ) .

input: grammar: This was very dangerous when excess steam was produced ; especially this system was not incorporated with good safety features .
target: This was very dangerous when excess steam was produced ; especially this system was not incorporated with good safety features .

input: grammar: After the incident occurred , the reactor was modified to have much lower positive void coefficient .
target: After the incident occurred , the reactor was modified to have much lower positive void coefficient .

input: grammar: From this point , it showed that the reactor was an error design product .
target: From this point , it showed that the reactor was an error design product .

input: grammar: Furthermore , the accident could have been prevented if designer had done it right at the beginning .
target: Furthermore , the accident could have been prevented if designer had done it right at the beginning .

input: grammar: As Wilpert ( 2007 ) suggested , psychology , in fact , could help the design process to consider on how human mistakes could be prevented or at least reduced .
target: As Wilpert ( 2007 ) suggested , psychology , in fact , could help the design process to consider on how human mistakes could be prevented or at least reduced .

input: grammar: If the designer could have thought the fatal effects from the reactor explosion , he/she would have thought the possibility causes and conditions , thus the designer might not use such a high positive void coefficient and more appropriate safety features would be integrated .
target: If the designer could have thought the fatal effects from the reactor explosion , he/she would have thought the possibility causes and conditions , thus the designer might not use such a high positive void coefficient and more appropriate safety features would be integrated .

input: grammar: Wilpert ( 2007 ) also mentioned that the most common problem encountered in everyday design product including engineering product is the different perspective between designer and user .
target: Wilpert ( 2007 ) also mentioned that the most common problem encountered in everyday design product including engineering product is the different perspective between designer and user .

input: grammar: Designer usually thinks that user may know how to use the product by reading through the manual provided .
target: The designer usually thinks that the user may know how to use the product by reading through the manual provided .

input: grammar: This is also experienced by design engineers .
target: This is also experienced by design engineers .

input: grammar: They make assumption that operators would know how to handle the equipments when the process is offset , thus a potential safety features are not necessary .
target: They make assumption that operators would know how to handle the equipments when the process is offset , thus a potential safety features are not necessary .

input: grammar: On the other hand , operators assume that designers have set all the equipment in such a way that is easy and safe for operation .
target: On the other hand , operators assume that designers have set all the equipment in such a way that is easy and safe for operation .

input: grammar: In worse condition , alarms would be triggered and equipments would be shut down .
target: In worse condition , alarms would be triggered and equipments would be shut down .

input: grammar: As a result , in most accidents , operators would be pointed as the main cause of the accident .
target: As a result , in most accidents , operators would be pointed as the main cause of the accident .

input: grammar: Insufficient knowledge and training of operators result in panic under offset condition and also violating the normal procedures .
target: Insufficient knowledge and training of operators result in panic under offset condition and also violating the normal procedures .

input: grammar: It occurred in Chernobyl disaster where the operators shut down the cooling system and removed control rods in order to maintain the power level for carrying out the test .
target: It occurred in Chernobyl disaster where the operators shut down the cooling system and removed control rods in order to maintain the power level for carrying out the test .

input: grammar: When there was a surge of power , they tried to put back control rods , hoped that power level could be lowered .
target: When there was a surge of power , they tried to put back control rods , hoping that the power level could be lowered .

input: grammar: In fact , it did not happen as expected ; the power increased dramatically and explosion occurred .
target: In fact , it did not happen as expected ; the power increased dramatically and an explosion occurred .

input: grammar: When psychology is incorporated in design engineer 's thoughts , this accident could be prevented .
target: When psychology is incorporated in design engineer 's thoughts , this accident could be prevented .

input: grammar: Psychology could lead the design engineer to be aware of others either in physical or mental behaviour ( Wagner , n.d. ) .
target: Psychology could lead the design engineer to be aware of others either in physical or mental behaviour ( Wagner , n.d. ) .

input: grammar: Design engineer would try to see the situation from the perspective of operators .
target: Design engineer would try to see the situation from the perspective of operators .

input: grammar: As a result , easy-understood manual will be provided , more accurate safety systems would be installed and sufficient training and sharing session between design engineers and operators would be conducted to have common opinions instead of assumptions .
target: As a result , easily-understood-understood manuals will be provided , more accurate safety systems would be installed and sufficient training and sharing session between design engineers and operators would be conducted to have common opinions instead of assumptions .

input: grammar: In fact , psychology had been used in the past for improving human behaviours by selecting , training and motivating the operators in industries .
target: In fact , psychology had been used in the past for improving human behaviours by selecting , training and motivating the operators in industries .

input: grammar: However , this might have been avoided due to time constraints and financial limit which result in insufficient time for design engineers to analyse the design and looking for other cheaper materials for substitution .
target: However , this might have been avoided due to time constraints and financial limit which result in insufficient time for design engineers to analyse the design and looking for other cheaper materials for substitution .

target: As a result , one small mistake of a worker could lead to a huge damage to the plant and also to the surrounding environment especially for nuclear plant .

target: Therefore , nowadays there is encouragement to have human scientists ( psychologists ) in the design team ( Wilpert , 2007 ) .

target: Psychologist is not only a scientist seeking knowledge for others to use , but also a technologist who is actively involving in the planning and design man-operated system ( Taylor , 1957 ) .

target: In other words , system design is an applied psychology because of its human reference ; by converting design engineers to psychologists or at least having psychology knowledge may help in design process as they would take into account of human behavior .

target: Most of the accidents occurred because of human errors either done by operators or even designer at the design stage .

target: 7 ) Imprecise definition of responsibilities ............. 1 %

input: grammar: Therefore , we can see that the use of psychology might reduce the chance of an accident caused by engineering failure but would not prevent it .

target: Similarly , the use of psychology might reduce the chance of engineers making mistakes in their design .

target: However , it does not mean that they will not make mistakes as they are still factors like human error which can not be eliminated through the use of psychology .

input: grammar: Moreover , the MSR saves fuel by reusing it .
target: Moreover , the MSR saves fuel by reusing it .

target: It utilises Actinide Management ( Pickard & Forsberg , 2002 ) that allows for efficient recycling of fissile fuel .

input: grammar: The VHTR , instead , uses a once-through fuel cycle that does not reuse waste material .
target: The VHTR , instead , uses a once-through fuel cycle that does not reuse waste material .

input: grammar: Fuel has to be replaced constantly .
target: Fuel has to be replaced constantly .

input: grammar: With both recycled fuel and higher efficiency , the MSR saves cost making it cost saving in the long term .
target: With both recycled fuel and higher efficiency , the MSR saves cost making it cost saving in the long term .

input: grammar: Though changing the molten salts will come across as time consuming and uneconomical , technological advances in that area can further reduce cost by making it fully automated .
target: Though changing the molten salts will come across as time consuming and uneconomical , technological advances in that area can further reduce cost by making it fully automated .

input: grammar: Secondly , the VHTR has high efficiency in converting heat to electricity .
target: Secondly , the VHTR has high efficiency in converting heat to electricity .

input: grammar: As a result , the VHTR need not use liquid to gas exchangers , unlike the MSR .
target: As a result , the VHTR need not use liquid to gas exchangers , unlike the MSR .

input: grammar: However , heat is hard to contain and is easily lost to the environment .
target: However , heat is hard to contain and is easily lost to the environment .

input: grammar: The VHTR is a thermal reactor while the MSR is a fast reactor .
target: The VHTR is a thermal reactor while the MSR is a fast reactor .

input: grammar: In a thermal reactor , fast neutrons are slowed down to produce heat .
target: In a thermal reactor , fast neutrons are slowed down to produce heat .

input: grammar: In a fast reactor , it optimises the high speeds of the neutrons instead .
target: In a fast reactor , it optimises the high speeds of the neutrons instead .

input: grammar: Since it would be practical to use the already fast speeds of the neutrons , slowing them down will produce a lot of heat in the VHTR .
target: Since it would be practical to use the already fast speeds of the neutrons , slowing them down will produce a lot of heat in the VHTR .

input: grammar: The MSR , though it includes the liquid to gas exchanger , this generates $ 4.5 mil per percentage increase in efficiency .

input: grammar: Thirdly , the VHTR employs stringent security measures to combat intruders .

target: Furthermore , in an event of a nuclear leak , they have a system distributing iodine pills to residents within a 10 mile radius .

target: The MSR is highly protected from nuclear proliferation due to its clever waste recycling of fission materials .

target: It converts Uranium-233 into unusable fissile material by adding Thorium .

target: U-233 is more radioactive compared to the conventional U-235 used today .

target: However this additional safety cost incurred would be well spent if the threat of nuclear proliferation can be obliterated .

target: The safety performance of nuclear plant has improved through the years .

input: grammar: Electricity is the most important source of energy in modern times .
target: Electricity is the most important source of energy in modern times .

input: grammar: In order to generate enough electricity for all the human beings , numerous tons of coal and barrels of oil are burnt every day .
target: In order to generate enough electricity for all the human beings , numerous tons of coal and barrels of oil are burnt every day .

input: grammar: However , according to energy statistics from the World Coal Institute , more than 66 % of the electricity is generated from fossil fuels , namely coal , gas and oil .
target: However , according to energy statistics from the World Coal Institute , more than 66 % of the electricity is generated from fossil fuels , namely coal , gas and oil .

input: grammar: An urgent problem confronting us nowadays is that most of the fossil fuels that are widely used will be exhausted in decades or few centuries .
target: An urgent problem confronting us nowadays is that most of the fossil fuels that are widely used will be exhausted in decades or few centuries .

input: grammar: Known economically workable oil deposits and coal deposits will be exhausted in 2050 and in 2158 respectively .
target: Known economically workable oil deposits and coal deposits will be exhausted in 2050 and in 2158 respectively .

input: grammar: Besides , people have suffered a lot from global warming , acid rain and air pollution , which are all largely related to the consumption of fossil fuels in the electricity generation industry .
target: Besides , people have suffered a lot from global warming , acid rain and air pollution , which are all largely related to the consumption of fossil fuels in the electricity generation industry .

input: grammar: What was worse , electricity demand is increasing dramatically due to speeded economic development worldwide .
target: What is worse , electricity demand is increasing dramatically due to speeded economic development worldwide .

input: grammar: It is estimated that electricity demand will have doubled by 2030 .
target: It is estimated that electricity demand will have doubled by 2030 .

input: grammar: Under such harsh circumstances , many energy experts strongly advise that we should approach other new energy sources , such as bio-energy , solar energy and wind energy .
target: Under such harsh circumstances , many energy experts strongly advise that we should approach other new energy sources , such as bio-energy , solar energy and wind energy .

input: grammar: Nuclear power is also a promising alternative that we should not overlook .
target: Nuclear power is also a promising alternative that we should not overlook .

input: grammar: Till now nuclear scientists and engineers have already put forward the new six generation IV nuclear reactor concepts .
target: Till now nuclear scientists and engineers have already put forward the new six generation IV nuclear reactor concepts .

input: grammar: Molten salt reactor is one of them and it adopts a molten salt mixture as a coolant in its reactor core .
target: Molten salt reactor is one of them and it adopts a molten salt mixture as a coolant in its reactor core .

input: grammar: Here is an evaluation of the MSRs in terms of performance , safety , waste and cost , compared to traditional nuclear reactors .
target: Here is an evaluation of the MSRs in terms of performance , safety , waste and cost , compared to traditional nuclear reactors .

input: grammar: * Performance
target: * Performance

input: grammar: Molten salt reactors adopt molten salt mixture as a primary coolant , instead of traditional molten sodium coolant .
target: Molten salt reactors adopt molten salt mixture as a primary coolant , instead of traditional molten sodium coolant .

input: grammar: This modification allows the reactor to run at higher temperatures , which means higher thermodynamic efficiency .
target: This modification allows the reactor to run at higher temperatures , which means higher thermodynamic efficiency .

input: grammar: And there is no high pressure steam in the core either , thus the mechanical stress is reduced .
target: And there is no high pressure steam in the core either , thus the mechanical stress is reduced .

input: grammar: In many designs of MSRs , the nuclear fuel is dissolved in the molten salt itself .
target: In many designs of MSRs , the nuclear fuel is dissolved in the molten salt itself .

input: grammar: As a result , the preparation of the ingredients , uranium or thorium , are simplified and reactor structure can be quite easy to handle .
target: As a result , the preparation of the ingredients , uranium or thorium , are simplified and reactor structure can be quite easy to handle .

input: grammar: * Safety
target: * Safety

input: grammar: Unlike solid-fuel fast reactors , fast-spectrum MSRs have large negative temperature and void coefficients because as the temperature rises or voids are formed , the fuel is expelled from the reactor core .
target: Unlike solid-fuel fast reactors , fast-spectrum MSRs have large negative temperature and void coefficients because as the temperature rises or voids are formed , the fuel is expelled from the reactor core .

input: grammar: This is a unique advantage of MSRs compared to traditional solid-fuel reactors ( Charles W. Forsberg , 2007 ) .
target: This is a unique advantage of MSRs compared to traditional solid-fuel reactors ( Charles W. Forsberg , 2007 ) .

input: grammar: [ 2 ] There is no high pressure steam in the core and the molten salt is of low pressure .
target: [ 2 ] There is no high pressure steam in the core and the molten salt is of low pressure .

input: grammar: We wo n't worry about fire hazard or explosion hazard .
target: We wo n't worry about fire hazard or explosion hazard .

input: grammar: Thus the molten salt reactors are considered inherently safe because they are chemically stable .
target: Thus the molten salt reactors are considered inherently safe because they are chemically stable .

input: grammar: They do not react rapidly with moisture or air because the fuel salt does not burn in air or water .
target: They do not react rapidly with moisture or air because the fuel salt does not burn in air or water .

input: grammar: However , in traditional nuclear reactors or solid-fuel reactors , there is always boiling water or molten metal as coolant involved , which dramatically reduces their safety level .
target: However , in traditional nuclear reactors or solid-fuel reactors , there is always boiling water or molten metal as coolant involved , which dramatically reduces their safety level .

input: grammar: Besides , since the nuclear fuel is often dissolved in the molten salt , in case an accident happened , most of radioactive materials would not be dispersed into the atmosphere and spread to the environment nearby .
target: Besides , since the nuclear fuel is often dissolved in the molten salt , in case an accident happened , most of radioactive materials would not be dispersed into the atmosphere and spread to the environment nearby .

input: grammar: And there is also a passively cooled storage which can secure the reactor by dumping the fuel to the cooled tanks if there is a leak .
target: And there is also a passively cooled storage which can secure the reactor by dumping the fuel to the cooled tanks if there is a leak .

input: grammar: * Waste
target: * Waste

input: grammar: As is mentioned above , the molten salt reactors are operated at high temperatures and low pressure , thus utilization of the fuel is significant , which in turn means that there will be less waste produced during the process .
target: As is mentioned above , the molten salt reactors are operated at high temperatures and low pressure , thus utilization of the fuel is significant , which in turn means that there will be less waste produced during the process .

input: grammar: According to the modern design of a molten salt reactor , the fuel chosen is often thorium , which means the nuclear process in a molten salt reactor involves a thorium cycle .
target: According to the modern design of a molten salt reactor , the fuel chosen is often thorium , which means the nuclear process in a molten salt reactor involves a thorium cycle .

input: grammar: The thorium fuel cycle can potentially burn all the actinides that generate most of the radioactive waste after use , compared to the traditional uranium-238 and plutonium cycle .
target: The thorium fuel cycle can potentially burn all the actinides that generate most of the radioactive waste after use , compared to the traditional uranium-238 and plutonium cycle .

input: grammar: * Cost
target: * Cost

input: grammar: Thorium is three times more abundant in nature compared to uranium and occurs mainly as 'fertile' .
target: Thorium is three times more abundant in nature compared to uranium and occurs mainly as 'fertile' .

input: grammar: [ 3 ] It is widely used as the fuel in MSRs , so this can commercially reduce the cost in terms of fuel source .
target: [ 3 ] It is widely used as the fuel in MSRs , so this can commercially reduce the cost in terms of fuel source .

input: grammar: Thanks to its different operation that involves molten salt , a MSR eliminates the fuel enrichment and fuel fabrication , both of which are major expenses for traditional reactors .
target: Thanks to its different operation that involves molten salt , a MSR eliminates the fuel enrichment and fuel fabrication , both of which are major expenses for traditional reactors .

input: grammar: Molten salt reactors can be built in small sizes , yet also operates very well .
target: Molten salt reactors can be built in small sizes , yet also operates very well .

input: grammar: The cost is reduced and business risks are not so high as those of the traditional reactors .
target: The cost is reduced and business risks are not so high as those of the traditional reactors .

input: grammar: They are much easier to become commercially available .
target: They are much easier to become commercially available .

input: grammar: In conclusion , it is quite reasonable for us to consider doing more research on and commercialise the molten salt reactor concept , as well as other types of generation IV reactors .
target: In conclusion , it is quite reasonable for us to consider doing more research on and commercialise the molten salt reactor concept , as well as other types of generation IV reactors .

input: grammar: In retrospect to our history , when some new techniques were developed , they all had the priority .
target: In retrospect to our history , when some new techniques were developed , they all had the priority .

input: grammar: It was and also is consensus that new technology means our future development .
target: It was and also is consensus that new technology means our future development .

target: As a cutting-edge technology , nuclear power should get more support and be on the way to prosperity .

target: The fossil fuels on the Earth are towards exhaustion soon , we have to take precautions before it is too late .

target: Psychology can prevent the Space Shuttle Columbia disaster

input: grammar: On April 12 , 1981 , the 20th anniversary of the first human spaceflight , Columbia - the first space shuttle in the world successfully launched .
target: On April 12 , 1981 , the 20th anniversary of the first human spaceflight , Columbia - the first space shuttle in the world successfully launched .

input: grammar: Unfortunately , after flying a total of 27 times , Space Shuttle Columbia died at a very young age during re-entry on February 1st , 2003 .
target: Unfortunately , after flying a total of 27 times , Space Shuttle Columbia died at a very young age during re-entry on February 1st , 2003 .

input: grammar: According to the Columbia Accident Investigation Board ( CAIB ) 's final report , the direct cause of the accident is a breach in the heat shielding panels on the shuttle 's left wing , which was caused by a suitcase-size piece of insulating foam 's hitting with around 240m/s relative speed 81.7 seconds after launch ( Columbia Accident Investigation Board , 2003 ) .
target: According to the Columbia Accident Investigation Board ( CAIB ) 's final report , the direct cause of the accident is a breach in the heat shielding panels on the shuttle 's left wing , which was caused by a suitcase-size piece of insulating foam 's hitting with around 240m/s relative speed 81.7 seconds after launch ( Columbia Accident Investigation Board , 2003 ) .

input: grammar: The breach allowed the heated gases entered the initial structure and finally resulted in the disintegration .
target: The breach allowed the heated gases entered the initial structure and finally resulted in the disintegration .

target: The Space Shuttle Columbia disaster is one of the most serious engineering accidents throughout the history .

target: It alerted and re-emphasized to us how important the safety design is .

input: grammar: As the mankind has entered the 21 century , the need for fuel has become increasingly pressing , which has exceeded the amount of fuel required in the past century by most 50 percent .
target: As mankind has entered the 21 century , the need for fuel has become increasingly pressing , which has exceeded the amount of fuel required in the past century by most 50 percent .

input: grammar: To solve the complex function of the world 's need for more fuel , the solution lies in , as suggested by scientists and engineers worldwide , the generation IV nuclear reactors , which are capable of generating the power needed at a far more efficient rate compared to the contemporary power plants .
target: To solve the complex function of the world 's need for more fuel , the solution lies in , as suggested by scientists and engineers worldwide , the generation IV nuclear reactors , which are capable of generating the power needed at a far more efficient rate compared to the contemporary power plants .

input: grammar: There are altogether six designs for the generation IV reactors while this essay will focus on one of them named very-high-temperature reactor or VHTR in short and expound on the reasons why it is worth all the researches and money put into it .
target: There are altogether six designs for the generation IV reactors while this essay will focus on one of them named very-high-temperature reactor or VHTR in short and expound on the reasons why it is worth all the research and money put into it .

input: grammar: Generation IV reactors are designed to achieve certain goals , some of which involve generating clean and efficient energy , replacing fossil fuel and increasing resource utilization .
target: Generation IV reactors are designed to achieve certain goals , some of which involve generating clean and efficient energy , replacing fossil fuel and increasing resource utilization .

input: grammar: The VHTR is specially designed to achieve these goals because it can withstand core temperature as high as 1000 degrees , even the highest among all the generation IV reactors .
target: The VHTR is specially designed to achieve these goals because it can withstand core temperature as high as 1000 degrees , even the highest among all the generation IV reactors .

input: grammar: Having established some common understanding of the VHTR , there are basically three reasons why the VHTR should receive continuous funding and research .
target: Having established some common understanding of the VHTR , there are basically three reasons why the VHTR should receive continuous funding and research .

input: grammar: First and the most concerned reason of all is that the VHTR guarantees a high degree of safety .
target: First and the most concerned reason of all is that the VHTR guarantees a high degree of safety .

input: grammar: Being graphite-moderated and helium-cooled , it does n't melt easily due to the extremely high melting point of graphite nor does it allow any corrosion of the chamber as helium is a very inert gas which is resistant to reactions that lead to corrosive substances .
target: Being graphite-moderated and helium-cooled , it does n't melt easily due to the extremely high melting point of graphite nor does it allow any corrosion of the chamber as helium is a very inert gas which is resistant to reactions that lead to corrosive substances .

input: grammar: This property should well fend off the critics using the meltdown accidents that happened at Three Mile Island and Ukraine , as the possibility of such accidents happening to a reactor able to function properly at 1000 degrees is insignificant .
target: This property should well fend off the critics using the meltdown accidents that happened at Three Mile Island and Ukraine , as the possibility of such accidents happening to a reactor able to function properly at 1000 degrees is insignificant .

input: grammar: Secondly , the VHTR produces energy in a very efficient manner .
target: Secondly , the VHTR produces energy in a very efficient manner .

input: grammar: The VHTR allows for more than 50 % of more electricity to be produced from the same amount of fuel intake compared to the conventional reactors .
target: The VHTR allows for more than 50 % of more electricity to be produced from the same amount of fuel intake compared to the conventional reactors .

input: grammar: It burns up to 65 % of uranium compared to only 5 % for conventional reactors .
target: It burns up to 65 % of uranium compared to only 5 % for conventional reactors .

input: grammar: As the non-renewable resources are running out , the VHTR provides an excellent alternative solution to energy generation .
target: As the non-renewable resources are running out , the VHTR provides an excellent alternative solution to energy generation .

input: grammar: Thirdly , the VHTR produces a by-product , hydrogen gas , which is considered as another environmental-friendly source of energy .
target: Thirdly , the VHTR produces a by-product , hydrogen gas , which is considered as another environmental-friendly source of energy .

input: grammar: At high temperature ( 700-900 ) , H2 is split from water and can be further utilized as fuel for transportation and factories .
target: At high temperature ( 700-900 ) , H2 is split from water and can be further utilized as fuel for transportation and factories .

input: grammar: This reduces burning of fossil fuels , like oil , which generates toxic gases .
target: This reduces burning of fossil fuels , like oil , which generates toxic gases .

input: grammar: This property , which can never be reached by the current reactors , serves to preserve the environment by replacing the contaminating fossil fuels using hydrogen gas .
target: This property , which can never be reached by the current reactors , serves to preserve the environment by replacing the contaminating fossil fuels using hydrogen gas .

input: grammar: Despite the fact that the VHTR brings tons of benefits to the mankind , there are certain negative facts which impede the officials from making up their minds on the funding .
target: Despite the fact that the VHTR brings tons of benefits to the mankind , there are certain negative facts which impede the officials from making up their minds on the funding .

input: grammar: The cost issue is certainly the most depressing thing among all .
target: The cost issue is certainly the most depressing thing among all .

input: grammar: For each nuclear reactor , an astounding amount of one billion has to be pumped into the construction .
target: For each nuclear reactor , an astounding amount of one billion has to be pumped into the construction .

input: grammar: As predicted , a generation IV reactor design is not to be realized before 2030 .
target: As predicted , a generation IV reactor design is not to be realized before 2030 .

input: grammar: With some degree of uncertainty over the possibilities of putting a VHTR into operation , such a huge bill is difficult to be issued anytime soon .
target: With some degree of uncertainty over the possibilities of putting a VHTR into operation , such a huge bill is difficult to be issued anytime soon .

input: grammar: Moreover , alternative solutions of fuel are not necessarily constrained by generation IV reactors as sources like solar power which require much less funding than the reactors are being intensely researched upon .
target: Moreover , alternative solutions of fuel are not necessarily constrained by generation IV reactors as sources like solar power which require much less funding than the reactors are being intensely researched upon .

input: grammar: Hence the realization of VHTR is not as cost competitive as those alternatives .
target: Hence the realization of VHTR is not as cost competitive as those alternatives .

input: grammar: Another problem is that the researches into the materials required by the containers and pipes are not going to produce useful results in the near future .
target: Another problem is that the researches into the materials required by the containers and pipes are not going to produce useful results in the near future .

input: grammar: Due to the fact that the VHTR should withstand extremely high temperatures , the materials for the chamber must be ultra hard and corrosion resistant , many times better than those that we have already discovered .
target: Due to the fact that the VHTR should withstand extremely high temperatures , the materials for the chamber must be ultra hard and corrosion resistant , many times better than those that we have already discovered .

input: grammar: These two problems , together with a few others , may disrupt further researches into and funding for the VHTR .
target: These two problems , together with a few others , may disrupt further research into and funding for the VHTR .

input: grammar: However , scientists and engineers worldwide have come together and discussed on the solutions to the problems .
target: However , scientists and engineers worldwide have come together and discussed on the solutions to the problems .

input: grammar: As for reducing the cost of construction , the government can impose a carbon tax on the citizens and therefore use the tax revenue to fund the researches .
target: As for reducing the cost of construction , the government can impose a carbon tax on the citizens and therefore use the tax revenue to fund the researches .

input: grammar: Moreover the cost of over-night construction can be cut off , which will save up a great deal of money .
target: Moreover the cost of over-night construction can be cut off , which will save up a great deal of money .

input: grammar: There are more cost cutting plans to be made .
target: There are more cost cutting plans to be made .

input: grammar: As for the materials , scientists have already found Oxide Dispersion Strengthened ( ODS ) alloys and fibre reinforced ceramic , which are very hard and corrosion resistant materials .
target: As for the materials , scientists have already found Oxide Dispersion Strengthened ( ODS ) alloys and fibre reinforced ceramic , which are very hard and corrosion resistant materials .

input: grammar: With this remarkable breakthrough , there will sure be more new materials to be discovered .
target: With this remarkable breakthrough , there will sure be more new materials to be discovered .

input: grammar: In conclusion , for the long term consideration , the VHTR is worth the researches into and money spent on it as it not only generates energy highly efficiently but produces a by-product which is also a source of clean energy .
target: In conclusion , for the long term consideration , the VHTR is worth the research into and money spent on it as it not only generates energy highly efficiently but produces a by-product which is also a source of clean energy .

input: grammar: The fact that the potential problems will be well dealt with should further strengthen people 's belief in the VHTR .
target: The fact that the potential problems will be well dealt with should further strengthen people 's belief in the VHTR .
