input: grammar: From statistics , 20 % to 50 % of incidents , including failures , accidents and near-accidents , were caused by poor designs ( Wilpert , 2007 , p. 296 ) and these figures were actually underestimated for two reasons .
target: From statistics , 20 % to 50 % of incidents , including failures , accidents and near-accidents , were caused by poor designs ( Wilpert , 2007 , p. 296 ) and these figures were actually underestimated for two reasons .

input: grammar: The first being that single design errors tend not to cause mishaps because of the defense- in-depth designs in many installations of complex and high-hazard nature .
target: The first being that single design errors tend not to cause mishaps because of the defense- in-depth designs in many installations of complex and high-hazard nature .

input: grammar: The second reason is simply because some design errors were picked up and corrected before any mishaps could happen .
target: The second reason is simply because some design errors were picked up and corrected before any mishaps could happen .

input: grammar: However , in both cases , it was highly probable that there were occurrences of some form of failure due to poor design .
target: However , in both cases , it was highly probable that there were occurrences of some form of failure due to poor design .

input: grammar: By incorporating psychology into engineering design processes , failures and incidents can be prevented , if not , minimized .
target: By incorporating psychology into engineering design processes , failures and incidents can be prevented , if not , minimized .

input: grammar: This essay will argue how the incorporation of psychology into design processes could have prevented the major engineering accident , in the case of the Three Mile Island nuclear plant mishap on March 28 , 1979 , which was a " snowball effect " , caused by a minor and simple fault .
target: This essay will argue how the incorporation of psychology into design processes could have prevented the major engineering accident , in the case of the Three Mile Island nuclear plant mishap on March 28 , 1979 , which was a " snowball effect " , caused by a minor and simple fault .

input: grammar: First of all , opponents of this psychological approach towards engineering design insist that the faulty valve was the key factor and main cause of the incident , and that psychology could not have prevented it .
target: First of all , opponents of this psychological approach towards engineering design insist that the faulty valve was the key factor and main cause of the incident , and that psychology could not have prevented it .

input: grammar: However , operators could have picked up this fault if the design of the instrument gave clear and proper signals .
target: However , operators could have picked up this fault if the design of the instrument gave clear and proper signals .

input: grammar: In this case , the instruments that were used did not ( U.S.NRC , 2009 ) .
target: In this case , the instruments that were used did not ( U.S.NRC , 2009 ) .

input: grammar: Consequently , it resulted in a " Design Induced Human Error " ( Nelson & Associates ) , and this led to an aggravation of the situation .
target: Consequently , it resulted in a " Design Induced Human Error " ( Nelson & Associates ) , and this led to an aggravation of the situation .

input: grammar: It can be seen that if psychology was incorporated into the design of the instruments , the engineers of the instruments could have anticipated such a problem and included a device to alert the operators in a case when the valve and its related parts fail .
target: It can be seen that if psychology had been incorporated into the design of the instruments , the engineers of the instruments could have anticipated such a problem and included a device to alert the operators in a case when the valve and its related parts fail .

input: grammar: Secondly , opponents may also argue that this accident was caused by human error , because the operators failed to trace back the fault to the valve , leading to an aggravation to the point when emergency signals were shown .
target: Secondly , opponents may also argue that this accident was caused by human error , because the operators failed to trace back the fault to the valve , leading to an aggravation to the point when emergency signals were shown .

input: grammar: In this event , operators picked up signals that caused confusion ( U.S.NRC , 2009 ) .
target: In this event , operators picked up signals that caused confusion ( U.S.NRC , 2009 ) .

input: grammar: Operators then made the best judgments and took the best actions based on whatever information they could obtain .
target: Operators then made the best judgments and took the best actions based on whatever information they could obtain .

input: grammar: These judgments and actions were correct with respect to the information that was shown on the instruments .
target: These judgments and actions were correct with respect to the information that was shown on the instruments .

input: grammar: Therefore , this is yet another " Design Induced Human Error " ( Nelson & Associates ) .
target: Therefore , this is yet another " Design Induced Human Error " ( Nelson & Associates ) .

input: grammar: Once again , if psychology , in the form of cognitive ergonomics , had been implemented in the design process of the instruments to improve the human-machine interface , errors and misjudgments could have been reduced ( Budnick & Michael , 2001 ) , and events like this would not have happened .
target: Once again , if psychology , in the form of cognitive ergonomics , had been implemented in the design process of the instruments to improve the human-machine interface , errors and misjudgments could have been reduced ( Budnick & Michael , 2001 ) , and events like this would not have happened .

input: grammar: The final two arguments brought forth by the opponents may be the poor quality of machinery parts that led to the malfunction of the valve , and the inadequacies in the training of operators .
target: The final two arguments brought forth by the opponents may be the poor quality of machinery parts that led to the malfunction of the valve , and the inadequacies in the training of operators .

input: grammar: These arguments pointed out by the opponents are in actual fact very related to psychology and are factors part of Organizational Ergonomics ( International Ergonomics Association , 2009 ) .
target: These arguments pointed out by the opponents are in actual fact very related to psychology and are factors part of Organizational Ergonomics ( International Ergonomics Association , 2009 ) .

input: grammar: By looking at the system as a whole , that is , to include the managerial departments , we can see that if psychology was employed in the design and planning processes of how the plant is run , proper schedules for checks on machineries and also re-training can be planned .
target: By looking at the system as a whole , that is , to include the managerial departments , we can see that if psychology was employed in the design and planning processes of how the plant is run , proper schedules for checks on machineries and also re-training can be planned .

input: grammar: By predicting such problems , measures can be taken before an accident can happen .
target: By predicting such problems , measures can be taken before an accident can happen .

input: grammar: It is evident that psychology is able to reduce and also prevent errors by applying to both the micro and macro aspects of design processes of a system .
target: It is evident that psychology is able to reduce and also prevent errors by applying to both the micro and macro aspects of design processes of a system .

input: grammar: As we can see from the case of Three Mile Island , by anticipating problems that operators would face , the instruments could have been more accurate and reliable , which will then allow operators to remedy the fault straightaway .
target: As we can see from the case of Three Mile Island , by anticipating problems that operators would face , the instruments could have been more accurate and reliable , which will then allow operators to remedy the fault straightaway .

input: grammar: In addition , by employing psychological approaches and methods , planners will be able to foresee problems that may arise .
target: In addition , by employing psychological approaches and methods , planners will be able to foresee problems that may arise .

input: grammar: The planners can then come up with appropriate schedules not only for regular checks on machineries , but also for retraining and refresher courses .
target: The planners can then come up with appropriate schedules not only for regular checks on machineries , but also for retraining and refresher courses .

input: grammar: In conclusion , it is not uncommon for engineers and planners to commit mistakes and neglect what they think are not important .
target: In conclusion , it is not uncommon for engineers and planners to commit mistakes and neglect what they think are not important .

input: grammar: Thus , by employing psychology , whether it is hiring a psychologist or just the employment of psychological approaches , problems that used to be unpredictable can be foreseen .
target: Thus , by employing psychology , whether it is hiring a psychologist or just the employment of psychological approaches , problems that used to be unpredictable can be foreseen .

input: grammar: Improvements and enhancements can then be implemented pertaining to these problems and , as a result , lower the chances of accidents happening .
target: Improvements and enhancements can then be implemented pertaining to these problems and , as a result , lower the chances of accidents happening .

input: grammar: The nuclear reactor meltdown in Chernobyl in the year 1986 has became a dark age in the implementation of nuclear power .
target: The nuclear reactor meltdown in Chernobyl in the year 1986 has became a dark age in the implementation of nuclear power .

input: grammar: Since then , nuclear power was often thought to be dangerous and therefore undermining the benefits that it can bring about .
target: Since then , nuclear power has often been thought to be dangerous and therefore undermining the benefits that it can bring about .

input: grammar: In his article , Butler ( 2004 ) states six generation four reactor concepts including the sodium cooled fast reactor , which is much safer compared to older generations of nuclear reactors .
target: In his article , Butler ( 2004 ) states six generation four reactor concepts including the sodium cooled fast reactor , which is much safer compared to older generations of nuclear reactors .

input: grammar: Therefore , technology can reduce the risks of nuclear power and therefore ensuring the safety of it .
target: Therefore , technology can reduce the risks of nuclear power and therefore ensure the safety of it .

input: grammar: Thus , the implementation of nuclear energy to generate electricity should be encouraged .
target: Thus , the implementation of nuclear energy to generate electricity should be encouraged .

input: grammar: Firstly , the reactor meltdown accident in Chernobyl , 1986 has became a reason to prove that nuclear power is dangerous and should not be encouraged .
target: Firstly , the reactor meltdown accident in Chernobyl , 1986 has became a reason to prove that nuclear power is dangerous and should not be encouraged .

input: grammar: However , the accident occurred in the year 1986 and there has been no similar major accidents since then .
target: However , the accident occurred in the year 1986 and there have been no similar major accidents since then .

input: grammar: Thus , it can be observed that technological advancements can increase the safety of nuclear power .
target: Thus , it can be observed that technological advancements can increase the safety of nuclear power .

input: grammar: Donald ( 2004 ) indicates that the accident in Chernobyl was allowed to happen because the reactor was not placed in a containment building , therefore allowing the nuclear radiation to be released into the atmosphere , causing huge losses in human lives .
target: Donald ( 2004 ) indicates that the accident in Chernobyl was allowed to happen because the reactor was not placed in a containment building , therefore allowing the nuclear radiation to be released into the atmosphere , causing huge losses in human lives .

input: grammar: Donald ( 2004 ) also states that the Chernobyl accident would not happen in other nuclear power plants as they are all placed in a containment building .
target: Donald ( 2004 ) also states that the Chernobyl accident would not happen in other nuclear power plants as they are all placed in a containment building .

input: grammar: This is the main reason as to why the reactor meltdown accident in Three Mile Island did not cause any deaths or injuries .
target: This is the main reason as to why the reactor meltdown accident in Three Mile Island did not cause any deaths or injuries .

input: grammar: Therefore , it can be shown that technology can be used to reduce the dangers of nuclear power .
target: Therefore , it can be shown that technology can be used to reduce the dangers of nuclear power .

input: grammar: Secondly , nuclear power plants were often thought to be much dangerous than other sources of electricity generation due to the unstable nuclear reactors .
target: Secondly , nuclear power plants were often thought to be much dangerous than other sources of electricity generation due to the unstable nuclear reactors .

input: grammar: For example , coal burning generators and hydroelectric power plants .
target: For example , coal burning generators and hydroelectric power plants .

input: grammar: However , this is not true as advancements in technology has allowed nuclear power plants to be safer than any other types of power plants .
target: However , this is not true as advancements in technology has allowed nuclear power plants to be safer than any other types of power plants .

input: grammar: The sodium cooled fast nuclear reactor which Butler ( 2004 ) states , produces only electricity and no other outputs,it also has a low operating temperature of 550 degrees Celsius and pressure compared to older generations of reactors .
target: The sodium cooled fast nuclear reactor which Butler ( 2004 ) states , produces only electricity and no other outputs,it also has a low operating temperature of 550 degrees Celsius and pressure compared to older generations of reactors .

input: grammar: Furthermore , other types of power plants produce harmful gases like carbon dioxide and sulfur dioxide .
target: Furthermore , other types of power plants produce harmful gases like carbon dioxide and sulfur dioxide .

input: grammar: Donald ( 2004 ) also states that third generation nuclear reactors are already able to reduce possibility of a nuclear reactor meltdown from 1 in 20,000 to 1 in 800,000 .
target: Donald ( 2004 ) also states that third generation nuclear reactors are already able to reduce possibility of a nuclear reactor meltdown from 1 in 20,000 to 1 in 800,000 .

input: grammar: Donald ( 2004 ) also states that there were more deaths in other types of electricity generation plants than nuclear power plants .
target: Donald ( 2004 ) also states that there were more deaths in other types of electricity generation plants than nuclear power plants .

input: grammar: For example , hydroelectric power plants caused 110 times more deaths , coal 45 times and natural gases 45 times respectively .
target: For example , hydroelectric power plants caused 110 times more deaths , coal 45 times and natural gases 45 times respectively .

input: grammar: NS & T ( n.d ) states that unlike fossil fuel or natural gases , uranium is mined and is in solid form , therefore it will not cause problems such as spillage during transportation , unlike the liquid fossil fuels and gaseous natural gases , which are considered as old -age forms of raw materials for generating electricity .
target: NS & T ( n.d ) states that unlike fossil fuel or natural gases , uranium is mined and is in solid form , therefore it will not cause problems such as spillage during transportation , unlike the liquid fossil fuels and gaseous natural gases , which are considered as old -age forms of raw materials for generating electricity .

input: grammar: Thus , we can observe that technological advancements in nuclear power can allow it to be safer than other kinds of nuclear power plants .
target: Thus , we can observe that technological advancements in nuclear power can allow it to be safer than other kinds of nuclear power plants .

input: grammar: Lastly , nuclear waste disposal are often thought to be as one of the most important reasons impeding the safety of nuclear power plants .
target: Lastly , nuclear waste disposal are often thought to be as one of the most important reasons impeding the safety of nuclear power plants .

input: grammar: However , due to recent technological advancements , nuclear waste disposal has become much safer .
target: However , due to recent technological advancements , nuclear waste disposal has become much safer .

input: grammar: The sodium-cooled fast nuclear reactor which Butler ( 2004 ) lists can allow most of the nuclear wastes produced after the generation of electricity to be recycled for a large amount of times .
target: The sodium-cooled fast nuclear reactor which Butler ( 2004 ) lists can allow most of the nuclear wastes produced after the generation of electricity to be recycled for a large amount of times .

input: grammar: Therefore , reducing the amount of nuclear wastes produced and thus reducing the dangers of nuclear waste disposal .
target: Therefore , reducing the amount of nuclear wastes produced and thus reducing the dangers of nuclear waste disposal .

input: grammar: Both Parta ( n.d ) and Donald ( 2004 ) have state in their articles that nuclear power produces small amount of nuclear waste , the size of an aspirin tablet per person 's electricity consumption per year .
target: Both Parta ( n.d ) and Donald ( 2004 ) have state in their articles that nuclear power produces small amount of nuclear waste , the size of an aspirin tablet per person 's electricity consumption per year .

input: grammar: Therefore , due to the small amount of nuclear waste produced from nuclear power plants , and the ease of recycling the already small amount of nuclear waste due to technological advancements , nuclear waste disposal is much safer than before .
target: Therefore , due to the small amount of nuclear waste produced from nuclear power plants , and the ease of recycling the already small amount of nuclear waste due to technological advancements , nuclear waste disposal is much safer than before .

input: grammar: In conclusion , due to technology , misconceptions on the accident of Chernobyl can be cleared and future similar accidents can be prevented .
target: In conclusion , due to technology , misconceptions on the accident of Chernobyl can be cleared and future similar accidents can be prevented .

input: grammar: Furthermore , technology has allowed the generation of nuclear power to be much safer than other forms of power generation .
target: Furthermore , technology has allowed the generation of nuclear power to be much safer than other forms of power generation .

input: grammar: Moreover , the disposal of nuclear waste has become much safer due to technological advancements .
target: Moreover , the disposal of nuclear waste has become much safer due to technological advancements .

input: grammar: Thus , opposition of implementation of nuclear power should be reduced and nuclear power should be used as the new source of energy .
target: Thus , opposition of implementation of nuclear power should be reduced and nuclear power should be used as the new source of energy .

target: incomplete sentence

input: grammar: The public are afraid that the high temperatures in the nuclear reactors will be a major hazard for the people working in and those living near the reactors .
target: The public are afraid that the high temperatures in the nuclear reactors will be a major hazard for the people working in and those living near the reactors .

input: grammar: People fear that the high temperatures will increase the possibilities of having an explosion in the reactors .
target: People fear that the high temperatures will increase the possibilities of having an explosion in the reactors .

input: grammar: VHTR uses helium , an inert and fireproof gas , as the coolant instead of water used by the conventional reactors .
target: VHTR uses helium , an inert and fireproof gas , as the coolant instead of water used by the conventional reactors .

input: grammar: Thus , it will not result in steam explosion , which can happen in reactors using water as a coolant .
target: Thus , it will not result in a steam explosion , which can happen in reactors using water as a coolant .

input: grammar: In addition , VHTR is designed to work under high temperatures .
target: In addition , VHTR is designed to work under high temperatures .

input: grammar: It has a reliable safety backup system whereby in case of machinery failures , the reactor will submissively fall to a safe energy level , without damaging the reactor vessels or the fuel spheres , allowing corrections to be made safely ( MIT , 2003 ) .
target: It has a reliable safety backup system whereby in case of machinery failures , the reactor will submissively fall to a safe energy level , without damaging the reactor vessels or the fuel spheres , allowing corrections to be made safely ( MIT , 2003 ) .

input: grammar: Hence , this shows that safety precautions have been set to prevent accidents .
target: Hence , this shows that safety precautions have been set to prevent accidents .

target: On the other hand , instead of being a threat , the high temperatures can be used to produce hydrogen , which can eventually be converted into electricity for the public , making VHTR more efficient compared to coal reactors and even some of the other Generation IV reactor concepts .

input: grammar: In short , the high temperatures will not become a threat to the public as safety measures are taken to prevent accidents ; instead , the high temperatures can be used to improve the efficiency of VHTR .
target: In short , the high temperatures will not become a threat to the public as safety measures are taken to prevent accidents ; instead , the high temperatures can be used to improve the efficiency of VHTR .

target: The high initial start up costs is also a crucial factor in the opposition of VHTR .

target: Hence , it has to have relatively lower operating costs to stay competitive with fossil fuel reactors .

input: grammar: Hence , being a much more efficient reactor , it lowers the operating and capital costs .
target: Hence , being a much more efficient reactor , it lowers the operating and capital costs .

target: It is also stated that VHTR can generate electricity at prices that are comparable with coal and gas .

target: Furthermore , VHTR does not emit greenhouse gases .

target: By cutting down on greenhouse gases emissions , it will eventually have a long term benefit for the public .

target: The risks of greenhouse effects should also be taken into consideration in the decision to use nuclear energy .

target: The high start up costs can not outweigh the detrimental effects on the Earth by greenhouse gases .

target: Moreover , although in the short run , companies running VHTR may incur losses , in the long run , they will be able gain profits .

input: grammar: Finally , opponents of nuclear reactors fear that plutonium which can be found in nuclear waste will be used for terrorism .
target: Finally , opponents of nuclear reactors fear that plutonium which can be found in nuclear waste will be used for terrorism .

target: Plutonium is an element which can be made into nuclear weapons ; it is only available when the nuclear waste is reprocessed .

target: However , according to Butler ( 2004 ) , VHTR does not reprocess nuclear waste .

target: As a result , plutonium will not be separated out from the waste .

target: This can ease the fears of the public that terrorists will make nuclear reactors their potential target .

target: In brief , nuclear weapons can not be made without plutonium ; as a consequence , VHTR will less likely be a target for terrorist .

target: In conclusion , the arguments against the setting up of VHTR are debatable .

input: grammar: With the explosion of global population , the world is demanding more energy than ever .
target: With the explosion of global population , the world is demanding more energy than ever .

target: Non-renewable energy sources such as fossil fuels will soon be depleted within decades and we need to find new sources of energy to sustain the global civilisation .

input: grammar: Current renewable sources such as solar power , wind power and hydroelectric power are not sufficient to keep up with the growing demands .
target: Current renewable sources such as solar power , wind power and hydroelectric power are not sufficient to keep up with the growing demands .

input: grammar: Hence nuclear power is becoming a more viable option as it produces consistent output of electricity in large amounts .
target: Hence nuclear power is becoming a more viable option as it produces consistent output of electricity in large amounts .

input: grammar: However , conventional fears and concerns from the public that radiation , risk of nuclear explosion and nuclear meltdown can have catastrophic impact on the environment and public health .
target: incomplete sentence .

input: grammar: Furthermore , the consequences of it not so well-known and researched on yet as nuclear technology has not been around for a very long time .
target: Furthermore , the consequences of it are not so well-known and researched yet as nuclear technology has not been around for a very long time .

input: grammar: But in reality , burning of fossil fuels for energy are damaging the environment and public health too , which may , to a certain extent , causes even more damage than a safe operating nuclear power plant .
target: But in reality , burning of fossil fuels for energy are damaging the environment and public health too , which may , to a certain extent , causes even more damage than a safe operating nuclear power plant .

input: grammar: Nuclear power is a feasible choice to meet the demands of the world energy needs as the output is highly efficient and consistent out of all the renewable sources , new generation nuclear reactors are safer and cheaper to operate and are more secure not just with the heavy fortification but also simplified fail-safe mechanisms which can automatically prevent disasters triggered by accident .
target: Nuclear power is a feasible choice to meet the demands of the world energy needs as the output is highly efficient and consistent out of all the renewable sources , new generation nuclear reactors are safer and cheaper to operate and are more secure not just with the heavy fortification but also simplified fail-safe mechanisms which can automatically prevent disasters triggered by accident .

input: grammar: The cost of power generation by nuclear means is still higher as compared to that of fossil fuels .
target: The cost of power generation by nuclear means is still higher as compared to that of fossil fuels .

input: grammar: And this in turn , leads to higher market prices for electricity generated by nuclear means .
target: And this in turn , leads to higher market prices for electricity generated by nuclear means .

input: grammar: But in the long run , nuclear power may even be cheaper .
target: But in the long run , nuclear power may even be cheaper .

input: grammar: One of the leading concept of generation IV reactor , Very-high-temperature reactors ( VHTR ) , uses advanced technology to increase the efficiency of electricity generation by 50 % ( Butler , 2004 ) .
target: One of the leading concept of generation IV reactor , Very-high-temperature reactors ( VHTR ) , uses advanced technology to increase the efficiency of electricity generation by 50 % ( Butler , 2004 ) .

input: grammar: This allows the reactor to lower the cost of production by producing 50 % more electricity with the same amount of input , since nuclear reactors does not require consistent inputs of fuel frequently as compared to fossil fuel plants which requires constant inputs of fuels to burn .
target: This allows the reactor to lower the cost of production by producing 50 % more electricity with the same amount of input , since nuclear reactors does not require consistent inputs of fuel frequently as compared to fossil fuel plants which requires constant inputs of fuels to burn .

input: grammar: The VHTR is designed to be a highly efficient system and is able to supply process heat to industries that require high-temperature , energy-intensive and non-electric processes ( Idaho Laboratories , 2009 ) .
target: The VHTR is designed to be a highly efficient system and is able to supply process heat to industries that require high-temperature , energy-intensive and non-electric processes ( Idaho Laboratories , 2009 ) .

input: grammar: The VHTR concept is based on what is judged to be the minimal risk technology that will achieve commercial functional requirements to provide an economically competitive nuclear heat source and hydrogen production capability ( Idaho Laboratories , 2009 ) .
target: The VHTR concept is based on what is judged to be the minimal risk technology that will achieve commercial functional requirements to provide an economically competitive nuclear heat source and hydrogen production capability ( Idaho Laboratories , 2009 ) .

input: grammar: This in turn saves energy that is needed to power these industries .
target: This in turn saves energy that is needed to power these industries .

input: grammar: Conventional fears of catastrophic nuclear accidents can be put to rest with the new generation nuclear plants which use the latest technology to ensure maximum safety .
target: Conventional fears of catastrophic nuclear accidents can be put to rest with the new generation nuclear plants which use the latest technology to ensure maximum safety .

input: grammar: Nuclear power is safer with new technology that saves production cost .
target: Nuclear power is safer with new technology that saves production cost .

input: grammar: New generation reactors are designed to be " meltdown proof " which cools themselves down in the event of an accident ( Butler , 2004 ) .
target: New generation reactors are designed to be " meltdown proof " which cools themselves down in the event of an accident ( Butler , 2004 ) .

input: grammar: It incorporates a simplified safety features without relying too much on sophisticated backup systems and competent personals , and thus any attempt to sabotage the facility will be in vain .
target: It incorporates a simplified safety features without relying too much on sophisticated backup systems and competent personals , and thus any attempt to sabotage the facility will be in vain .

input: grammar: The best part of this is that all will be done without human intervention .
target: The best part of this is that all will be done without human intervention .

input: grammar: Hence the plant will be very safe even if an accident occurs .
target: Hence the plant will be very safe even if an accident occurs .

input: grammar: The security of a nuclear installation is of utmost importance given the threats of sabotaging by terrorists .
target: The security of a nuclear installation is of utmost importance given the threats of sabotaging by terrorists .

input: grammar: All nuclear installations around the world are heavily fortified with security personnel and defence mechanisms , hence the nuclear plants will be safe and secure .
target: All nuclear installations around the world are heavily fortified with security personnel and defence mechanisms , hence the nuclear plants will be safe and secure .

input: grammar: Concerns from the public regarding the implications of radiation exposure of an operating nuclear plant are all but unfounded as ironically , conventional fossil fuel plants emit more pollutants such as sulphur dioxide and nitrous oxide which causes acid rain , carbon dioxide which causes global warming .
target: Concerns from the public regarding the implications of radiation exposure of an operating nuclear plant are all but unfounded as ironically , conventional fossil fuel plants emit more pollutants such as sulphur dioxide and nitrous oxide which causes acid rain , carbon dioxide which causes global warming .

input: grammar: This in fact causes more damage to the environment than a safe operating nuclear plant which has no emissions as all radioactive fuels are kept in containers with thick lead walls to prevent any radiation leakage .
target: This in fact causes more damage to the environment than a safe operating nuclear plant which has no emissions as all radioactive fuels are kept in containers with thick lead walls to prevent any radiation leakage .

input: grammar: Statistics show that there are more deaths due to overexposure to these pollutants .
target: Statistics show that there are more deaths due to overexposure to these pollutants .

input: grammar: Apart from the Chernobyl accident , and subsequent major accidents , radiation released during normal operation have been found to be almost undetectable as compared to natural background radiation ( Gabbard , n.d ) .
target: Apart from the Chernobyl accident , and subsequent major accidents , radiation released during normal operation have been found to be almost undetectable as compared to natural background radiation ( Gabbard , n.d ) .

input: grammar: In fact coal combustion produces carbon dioxide and other greenhouse and also sulphur oxides and nitrogen oxides , which are harmful to human health , are responsible for acid rain .
target: In fact coal combustion produces carbon dioxide and other greenhouse and also sulphur oxides and nitrogen oxides , which are harmful to human health , are responsible for acid rain .

input: grammar: And there is another shocking fact : releases from coal combustion contain naturally occurring radioactive substances such as uranium and thorium ( Gabbard , n.d ) .
target: And there is another shocking fact : releases from coal combustion contain naturally occurring radioactive substances such as uranium and thorium ( Gabbard , n.d ) .

input: grammar: All in all , nuclear power is not exactly more hazardous than conventional power plants given the newer generation of nuclear plants which promises maximum safety and security with enhanced efficiency .
target: All in all , nuclear power is not exactly more hazardous than conventional power plants given the newer generation of nuclear plants which promises maximum safety and security with enhanced efficiency .

input: grammar: With continual research and advancement of nuclear power technology , the nuclear reactors of the generations to come will be safer to operate , more efficient and are accident-safe due to more sophisticated automatic shutdown mechanisms .
target: With continual research and advancement of nuclear power technology , the nuclear reactors of the generations to come will be safer to operate , more efficient and are accident-safe due to more sophisticated automatic shutdown mechanisms .

input: grammar: Public concerns over safety and nuclear proliferation have retarded the growth of nuclear technology .
target: Public concerns over safety and nuclear proliferation have retarded the growth of nuclear technology .

input: grammar: According to Butler ( 2004 ) , " the partial reactor meltdown in 1979 at Three Mile Island , Pennsylvania , and the 1986 accident at Chernobyl in Ukraine " have convinced the public that nuclear technology is extremely dangerous .
target: According to Butler ( 2004 ) , " the partial reactor meltdown in 1979 at Three Mile Island , Pennsylvania , and the 1986 accident at Chernobyl in Ukraine " have convinced the public that nuclear technology is extremely dangerous .

input: grammar: Besides , there were questions over proliferation of uranium and plutonium waste to generate Weapons of Mass Destruction ( WMD ) .
target: Besides , there were questions over proliferation of uranium and plutonium waste to generate Weapons of Mass Destruction ( WMD ) .

input: grammar: Moreover , renewable energy technologies such as wind , biomass , geothermal and solar energy have proven to be effective in achieving electricity production with small carbon footprints ( MIT , 2009 ) .
target: Moreover , renewable energy technologies such as wind , biomass , geothermal and solar energy have proven to be effective in achieving electricity production with small carbon footprints ( MIT , 2009 ) .

input: grammar: However , on the other hand , the Generation IV International Forum envisions nuclear as the best alternative for coal and has proposed six best prospects for the reactors of the future , known as Generation IV reactors ( Butler,2004 ) .
target: However , on the other hand , the Generation IV International Forum envisions nuclear as the best alternative for coal and has proposed six best prospects for the reactors of the future , known as Generation IV reactors ( Butler,2004 ) .

input: grammar: Amongst all , the Very High Temperature Reactor ( VHTR ) proves to be promising with advantages such as passive safety , flexibility , higher efficiency and non-proliferation of nuclear waste .
target: Amongst all , the Very High Temperature Reactor ( VHTR ) proves to be promising with advantages such as passive safety , flexibility , higher efficiency and non-proliferation of nuclear waste .

input: grammar: The VHTR should thus be accepted as the next generation of reactor and funds should be allocated for the research and development of the VHTR .
target: The VHTR should thus be accepted as the next generation of reactor and funds should be allocated for the research and development of the VHTR .

input: grammar: First of all , oppositions of nuclear technology have argued that nuclear power is unsafe due to its radioactive and explosive nature , and a leakage or accident is likely to cause severe damages and even deaths.TS In the context of VHTR , though explosive and radioactive in nature , it is able to prevent radioactive materials from escaping in the event of a leakage or accident .
target: First of all , oppositions of nuclear technology have argued that nuclear power is unsafe due to its radioactive and explosive nature , and a leakage or accident is likely to cause severe damages and even deaths.TS In the context of VHTR , though explosive and radioactive in nature , it is able to prevent radioactive materials from escaping in the event of a leakage or accident .

input: grammar: This is commonly termed as passive safety design .
target: This is commonly termed as passive safety design .

input: grammar: The VHTR uses helium as a coolant for the reaction and helium is extremely inert towards radioactive materials .
target: The VHTR uses helium as a coolant for the reaction and helium is extremely inert towards radioactive materials .

input: grammar: The core is composed of prismatic graphite , and has high heat capacity and structural stablility at high temperature and pressure .
target: The core is composed of prismatic graphite , and has high heat capacity and structural stablility at high temperature and pressure .

input: grammar: This was demonstrated in a test conducted in Beijing when a prototype of VHTR reactor , HTR-10 , is able to shut down with no cooling gas ( Next Big Future , 2008 ) .
target: This was demonstrated in a test conducted in Beijing when a prototype of VHTR reactor , HTR-10 , is able to shut down with no cooling gas ( Next Big Future , 2008 ) .

input: grammar: However , there is still a possibility that human error might occur and in an event of a nuclear accident , consequences are detrimental to people living around the area .
target: However , there is still a possibility that human error might occur and in an event of a nuclear accident , consequences are detrimental to people living around the area .

input: grammar: This has been illustrated by the Three Mile Island and Chernobyl accident .
target: This has been illustrated by the Three Mile Island and Chernobyl accident .

input: grammar: Secondly , nuclear power is not as cost competitive as compared with coal and natural gas ( MIT,2009 ) .TS Based on a study conducted by the MIT , with reference to year 2007 , it is estimated that electricity generated by coal cost $ 0.062 per kilowatt hour , and electricity generated by natural gases cost $ 0.065 per kilowatt hour ; electricity generated by nuclear power cost $ 0.084 per kilowatt hour ( MIT , 2009 ) .
target: Secondly , nuclear power is not as cost competitive as compared with coal and natural gas ( MIT,2009 ) .TS Based on a study conducted by the MIT , with reference to year 2007 , it is estimated that electricity generated by coal cost $ 0.062 per kilowatt hour , and electricity generated by natural gases cost $ 0.065 per kilowatt hour ; electricity generated by nuclear power cost $ 0.084 per kilowatt hour ( MIT , 2009 ) .

input: grammar: Though expensive , VHTR is able to generate H2 which is useful as a non-polluting fuel to generate large amounts of energy .
target: Though expensive , VHTR is able to generate H2 which is useful as a non-polluting fuel to generate large amounts of energy .

input: grammar: Many countries are betting on H2 as the next generation of fuel and the VHTR complements the situation .
target: Many countries are betting on H2 as the next generation of fuel and the VHTR complements the situation .

input: grammar: Thirdly , oppositions of nuclear energy have also questioned the performance of nuclear technology.TS According to Butler ( 2004 ) , the VHTR is able to squeeze out 50 % more energy from the same amount of fuel comapred with conventional plants ( Butler , 2004 ) .
target: Thirdly , oppositions of nuclear energy have also questioned the performance of nuclear technology.TS According to Butler ( 2004 ) , the VHTR is able to squeeze out 50 % more energy from the same amount of fuel comapred with conventional plants ( Butler , 2004 ) .

input: grammar: In addition , the heat generated by VHTR can be applied to most of the industry fields and its gas turbine system can generate electricity at an efficiency of 50 % .
target: In addition , the heat generated by VHTR can be applied to most of the industry fields and its gas turbine system can generate electricity at an efficiency of 50 % .

input: grammar: This is 17 % higher than existing nuclear plants with electricity output of 33 % ( Japan Atomic Energy Agency , no date ) .
target: This is 17 % higher than existing nuclear plants with electricity output of 33 % ( Japan Atomic Energy Agency , no date ) .

input: grammar: Thus , the VHTR offers a higher efficiency conversion of heat to electricity as compared to conventional power plants and perform better than existing nuclear plants .
target: Thus , the VHTR offers a higher efficiency conversion of heat to electricity as compared to conventional power plants and perform better than existing nuclear plants .

input: grammar: Lastly , opponents argued that reprocessing of nuclear waste gives countries an excuse to proliferate raw materials for advanced nuclear weapons.TS Among the six design reactors as proposed by the GIF , the Supercritical- water-cooled Reactor ( SCWR ) and the VHTR are be able to operate without having to depend on the controversial processing of plutonium ( Butler , 2004 ) .
target: Lastly , opponents argued that reprocessing of nuclear waste gives countries an excuse to proliferate raw materials for advanced nuclear weapons.TS Among the six design reactors as proposed by the GIF , the Supercritical- water-cooled Reactor ( SCWR ) and the VHTR are be able to operate without having to depend on the controversial processing of plutonium ( Butler , 2004 ) .

input: grammar: This reduces the possibility of countries proliferating nuclear raw materials for WMD .
target: This reduces the possibility of countries proliferating nuclear raw materials for WMD .

input: grammar: In conclusion , the VHTR offers good prospect to be the next generation of reactors .
target: In conclusion , the VHTR offers good prospects to be the next generation of reactors .

target: The flexibility and higher efficiency of VHTR allow it to be competitive in the near future .

target: Furthermore , non-proliferation of plutonium through VHTR process reduces the production of WMD .

input: grammar: However , the threat of nuclear accidents still persist and it is up to our own engineers to further resolve this threat .

target: In recent years , a new type of power source , nuclear power has sparked a heated controversy .

target: First of all , opponents state that nuclear power has some safety problems .

target: First , they say that the generation IV actors are very-high-temperature reactors ( VHTR ) , which react in both high temperature and pressure .

target: Furthermore , the molten salts reaction facilities are made of thick reinforced concrete .

target: Reinforced concrete has the characteristics of firmness and anti high temperature .

target: This kind of material can absorb radiation produced by the plutonium , so that the radiation will be greatly reduced .

target: Therefore , the high temperature and pressure in process and radioactivity of the element are not big problems to affect nuclear power research .

target: Since most reactions of generation IV reactors are waste recycling reactions , the main element Plutonium may be stolen in the process of recycling .

input: grammar: As global warming is intruding our daily life , the public begins to keep an eye on the green house emission , which have increased 70 percent since 1994 compared to the pre-industrial times ( GEN 4 international forum , 2008 ) .
target: As global warming is intruding our daily life , the public begins to keep an eye on the green house emission , which have increased 70 percent since 1994 compared to the pre-industrial times ( GEN 4 international forum , 2008 ) .

input: grammar: In the international forum of nuclear energy system 2008 , the panel puts forward that nuclear energy is the option that provides " clean " energy which emits no green house gas .
target: In the international forum of nuclear energy system 2008 , the panel puts forward that nuclear energy is the option that provides " clean " energy which emits no green house gas .

input: grammar: On the other hand , with the concern of the natural resources shortage , more and more people are in favour of the nuclear energy because it kindles the hope of solving energy crisis .
target: On the other hand , with the concern of the natural resources shortage , more and more people are in favour of the nuclear energy because it kindles the hope of solving energy crisis .

input: grammar: It seems that nuclear energy points to the way to meet future energy demands without destroying the environment .
target: It seems that nuclear energy points to the way to meet future energy demands without destroying the environment .

input: grammar: Nowadays the focus is turned to how to ensure the nuclear energy is safer , more economic-benefited and efficient than other energy choices .
target: Nowadays the focus has turned to how to ensure the nuclear energy is safer , more economic-benefited and efficient than other energy choices .

input: grammar: Within the six methods of the fourth generation of nuclear energy reactor , some may argue that the Very High Temperature Reactor ( VHTR ) should be applied considering its high efficiency and security .
target: Within the six methods of the fourth generation of nuclear energy reactor , some may argue that the Very High Temperature Reactor ( VHTR ) should be applied considering its high efficiency and security .

input: grammar: This essay will focus on the view that Sodium-cooled Fast Reactor ( SFR ) is the prior option to meet the safety and efficiency criteria after the comprehensive analysis .
target: This essay will focus on the view that Sodium-cooled Fast Reactor ( SFR ) is the prior option to meet the safety and efficiency criteria after the comprehensive analysis .

input: grammar: First of all , safety is always the primary concern when introducing a newly developed technology .
target: First of all , safety is always the primary concern when introducing a newly developed technology .

input: grammar: The researchers who are in favour of VHTR argue that the resource of VHTR , helium - an inertia gas with low chemical activity is much safer than sodium , the coolant of SFR .
target: The researchers who are in favour of VHTR argue that the resource of VHTR , helium - an inertia gas with low chemical activity is much safer than sodium , the coolant of SFR .

input: grammar: If the sodium leaks from the core then there could be a tremendous explosion .
target: If the sodium leaks from the core then there could be a tremendous explosion .

input: grammar: This could be a serious threat to safety .
target: This could be a serious threat to safety .

input: grammar: Although it is true that sodium is relatively active , there is an extra loop in the SFR producing process in order to prevent the accident ( Carlsson , Tucek , &Wider , 2005 ) .
target: Although it is true that sodium is relatively active , there is an extra loop in the SFR producing process in order to prevent the accident ( Carlsson , Tucek , &Wider , 2005 ) .

input: grammar: Moreover , there are several cycles in the process of SFR and each individual is segregated .
target: Moreover , there are several cycles in the process of SFR and each individual is segregated .

input: grammar: Therefore it is hardly that the reactor will leak out .
target: Therefore it is hardly that the reactor will leak .

input: grammar: Besides the chemical behavior , the operating condition is another element responsible for the safety .
target: Besides the chemical behavior , the operating condition is another element responsible for the safety .

input: grammar: According to Carlsson , Tucek and Wider 's conclusion ( 2005 ) , the probability of incurring the accident of losing coolant is proportional to the operating temperature and pressure .
target: According to Carlsson , Tucek and Wider 's conclusion ( 2005 ) , the probability of incurring the accident of losing coolant is proportional to the operating temperature and pressure .

input: grammar: VHTR requires quite high operating temperature at 1000 Celsius and pressure .
target: VHTR requires quite high operating temperature at 1000 Celsius and pressure .

input: grammar: On the contrary , SFR is best performed under low pressure and only 350 to 500 Celsius degree ( Butler , 2004 ) .
target: On the contrary , SFR is best performed under low pressure and only 350 to 500 Celsius degree ( Butler , 2004 ) .

input: grammar: Hence the operating conditions make the SFR practically safe as a result of the low possibility of incurring the losing coolant accident .
target: Hence the operating conditions make the SFR practically safe as a result of the low possibility of incurring the losing coolant accident .

input: grammar: Lastly , there is no separate plutonium generated in all processes of SFR , which is a highly radioactive and toxic element .
target: Lastly , there is no separate plutonium generated in all processes of SFR , which is a highly radioactive and toxic element .

input: grammar: As a result , the proliferation can be controlled .
target: As a result , the proliferation can be controlled .

input: grammar: Apart from the safety of nuclear power , the high efficiency is another factor that prompts the researchers to promote SFR method .
target: Apart from the safety of nuclear power , the high efficiency is another factor that prompts the researchers to promote SFR method .

input: grammar: The Department of Nuclear Energy of University of California , Berkeley ( 2009 ) , announced that the thermal efficiency of SFR could be upgraded to 47 percent resulting from the reheat and inter-cooling process design , which is a breakthrough in terms of the efficiency of energy conversion .
target: The Department of Nuclear Energy of University of California , Berkeley ( 2009 ) , announced that the thermal efficiency of SFR could be upgraded to 47 percent resulting from the reheat and inter-cooling process design , which is a breakthrough in terms of the efficiency of energy conversion .

input: grammar: Unlike the VHTR , the SFR utilizes metallic fuel with neutron spectrum , which is capable of transmuting the raw materials to green energy efficiently .
target: Unlike the VHTR , the SFR utilizes metallic fuel with neutron spectrum , which is capable of transmuting the raw materials to green energy efficiently .

input: grammar: Not only is the efficiency the breakthrough , but also the recycle of resource is very remarkable .
target: Not only is the efficiency the breakthrough , but also the recycle of resource is very remarkable .

input: grammar: The recycle model of SFR is unique and the best among the six methods in the fourth generation .
target: The recycle model of SFR is unique and the best among the six methods in the fourth generation .

input: grammar: As part of the waste of SFR can be re-utilized again as the resource of the reactor , the whole process acts like a self-supply system .
target: As part of the waste of SFR can be re-utilized again as the resource of the reactor , the whole process acts like a self-supply system .

input: grammar: This quality can solve the resource shortage problem of the majority of energy supply methods .
target: This quality can solve the resource shortage problem of the majority of energy supply methods .

input: grammar: Also , the recycle concept best explains the green technology .
target: Also , the recycle concept best explains the green technology .

target: The columnist Butler ( 2009 ) from Washington Times brings up the idea that the U.S. should give the green light for nuclear energy .

input: grammar: Psychology Help Prevent Engineering Accidents
target: Psychology Help Prevent Engineering Accidents

input: grammar: Chernobyl nuclear accident is one of the most terrible disasters in the history of engineering development .
target: Chernobyl nuclear accident is one of the most terrible disasters in the history of engineering development .

input: grammar: This accident happened on April 26 , 1986 , when the Number 4 reactor of the nuclear power plant in the Soviet Ukraine exploded .
target: This accident happened on April 26 , 1986 , when the Number 4 reactor of the nuclear power plant in the Soviet Ukraine exploded .

input: grammar: The result is that 300 Megacarriers of radioactive isotopes was injected into the atmosphere and millions of people died immediately or consequently .
target: The result is that 300 Megacarriers of radioactive isotopes was injected into the atmosphere and millions of people died immediately or consequently .

input: grammar: More than twenty years have passed while an issue has always been controversial , which is whether the use of psychology during the design process would have prevented the accident .
target: More than twenty years have passed while an issue has always been controversial , which is whether the use of psychology during the design process would have prevented the accident .

input: grammar: In other word , if we can clear all the human factors of the accident , would the accident be prevented ?
target: In other word , if we can clear all the human factors of the accident , would the accident be prevented ?

input: grammar: The people supporting this point of view argue that the design errors play important roles that lead to the accident and these errors can be removed with psychology to avoid the accident .
target: The people supporting this point of view argue that the design errors play important roles that lead to the accident and these errors can be removed with psychology to avoid the accident .

input: grammar: However , other people show the opposite opinion by saying that no matter how well psychology is involved to concern safety problems in design , the accident will always happen since human knowledge and experience are limited .
target: However , other people show the opposite opinion by saying that no matter how well psychology is concerned with safety problems in design , the accident will always happen since human knowledge and experience are limited .

input: grammar: In my point of view , psychology can help prevent the accident .
target: In my point of view , psychology can help prevent the accident .

input: grammar: The view that support the use of psychology could have prevented the accident shows that the design errors directly cause the accident and removing these errors would remove the accident .
target: The view that support the use of psychology could have prevented the accident shows that the design errors directly cause the accident and removing these errors would remove the accident .

input: grammar: As Wilpert ( 2007 ) states , safety of engineering design depends on three things , namely , effective process , production control and failure avoidance .
target: As Wilpert ( 2007 ) states , safety of engineering design depends on three things , namely , effective process , production control and failure avoidance .

input: grammar: However , the Chernobyl reactor , reactor bolshoy moshchnosti kanalniy ( RBMK ) , was designed with problems of all these three aspects .
target: However , the Chernobyl reactor , reactor bolshoy moshchnosti kanalniy ( RBMK ) , was designed with problems of all these three aspects .

input: grammar: Firstly , in the RBMK reactor , the process of insertion of rods , which are to regulate the reaction speed , is inefficient and there is no fast rod for emergency .
target: Firstly , in the RBMK reactor , the process of insertion of rods , which are to regulate the reaction speed , is inefficient and there is no fast rod for emergency .

input: grammar: It takes 20 seconds for a full insertion and this is too slow to prevent the core from running away when the reaction is under the unstable mode ( Frot , 2001 ) .
target: It takes 20 seconds for a full insertion and this is too slow to prevent the core from running away when the reaction is under the unstable mode ( Frot , 2001 ) .

input: grammar: Moreover , the rods are designed with graphite tip which , when first inserted , will increases the reactivity .
target: Moreover , the rods are designed with graphite tip which , when first inserted , will increase the reactivity .

input: grammar: Secondly , the production control of RBMK is poor .
target: Secondly , the production control of RBMK is poor .

input: grammar: The core of the reactor is unstable at low power .
target: The core of the reactor is unstable at low power .

input: grammar: When the accident happened , the reactor was at a test of low power , working with only a quarter of full power .
target: When the accident happened , the reactor was at a test of low power , working with only a quarter of full power .

input: grammar: Thirdly , the RBMK reactor has almost nothing to prepare for out coming gases .
target: Thirdly , the RBMK reactor has almost nothing to prepare for out coming gases .

input: grammar: Without either a system to filter exhaust neither gases nor a containment structure ( Frot , 2001 ) , the release of radioactivity could quickly spread in all directions and causes more serious results .
target: Without either a system to filter exhaust neither gases nor a containment structure ( Frot , 2001 ) , the release of radioactivity could quickly spread in all directions and causes more serious results .

input: grammar: As analyzed , by removing the errors above , the accident can be prevented .
target: As analyzed , by removing the errors above , the accident can be prevented .

input: grammar: Hence psychology should be functional for preventing the accident .
target: Hence psychology should be functional for preventing the accident .

input: grammar: However , the opposite side announces that whatever we can do with psychology would not prevent the happening of the accident .
target: However , the opposite side announces that whatever we can do with psychology would not prevent the happening of the accident .

input: grammar: The main support of this point of view is that human knowledge and experiences are limited and we can not avoid all the mistakes even if we have excellent psychology .
target: The main support of this point of view is that human knowledge and experiences are limited and we can not avoid all the mistakes even if we have excellent psychology .

input: grammar: Twenty years ago , nuclear power engineering had just developed and engineers lacked experiences .
target: Twenty years ago , nuclear power engineering had just developed and engineers lacked experience .

input: grammar: Moreover , the experiences and development may come from testing or even accidents .
target: Moreover , the experience and development may come from testing or even accidents .

input: grammar: The opposite side actually argues with not very concrete reasons since almost all the design errors that causes the Chernobyl accident are within human ability at that time .
target: The opposite side actually argues with not very concrete reasons since almost all the design errors that causes the Chernobyl accident are within human ability at that time .

input: grammar: First of all , this error had already been noted three years before the Chernobyl accident , but it was not removed by any designer ( SFEN , 1996 ) .
target: First of all , this error had already been noted three years before the Chernobyl accident , but it was not removed by any designer ( SFEN , 1996 ) .

input: grammar: Secondly , the instability of the reactor RBMK had already been known by the engineers at that time , but the warning did not change anything ( Segodnio , 1993 ) .
target: Secondly , the instability of the reactor RBMK had already been known by the engineers at that time , but the warning did not change anything ( Segodnio , 1993 ) .

input: grammar: For the third factor , the containment for leaking gases is not a complicated structure and what they should do is no more than investing some more money to build it .
target: For the third factor , the containment for leaking gases is not a complicated structure and what they should do is no more than investing some more money to build it .

input: grammar: For the facts mentioned above , we can conclude that the accident actually could be prevented if the designers gain good enough psychology that concern much for safety problems .
target: For the facts mentioned above , we can conclude that the accident actually could be prevented if the designers gain good enough psychology that concern much for safety problems .

input: grammar: All in all , the use of psychology could play a role to prevent the happening of the Chernobyl accident .
target: All in all , the use of psychology could play a role to prevent the happening of the Chernobyl accident .

input: grammar: How we wish that the designers of the Chernobyl reactor RBMK had gain good psychology , so that they would not use the unstable core , the ineffective control rods and the inflammable moderator , and would kindly design an enclosed containment for exhaust gases .
target: How we wish that the designers of the Chernobyl reactor RBMK had gain good psychology , so that they would not use the unstable core , the ineffective control rods and the inflammable moderator , and would kindly design an enclosed containment for exhaust gases .

input: grammar: The world 's population is growing older .
target: The world 's population is growing older .

input: grammar: By 2050 , one-fifth of the population will be 60 years or older ( United Nations , n.d. ) .
target: By 2050 , one-fifth of the population will be 60 years or older ( United Nations , n.d. ) .

input: grammar: To prepare for the growing demand of the ageing population , more government funding is required in providing better infrastructure and amenities for the elderly .
target: To prepare for the growing demand of the ageing population , more government funding is required for providing better infrastructure and amenities for the elderly .

input: grammar: However , if public spending is not limited , the increased expenditure on the elderly will be at the cost of the country 's development .
target: However , if public spending is not limited , the increased expenditure on the elderly will be at the cost of the country 's development .

input: grammar: Thus , the public spending on the aged should be limited so that money can be diverted to other areas of the country 's development , which in turn can help to solve the problems of aging population .
target: Thus , public spending on the aged should be limited so that money can be diverted to other areas of the country 's development , which in turn can help to solve the problems of the aging population .

input: grammar: Firstly , public spending should be diverted to promote economic growth .
target: Firstly , public spending should be diverted to promote economic growth .

input: grammar: Economic growth is seen as the key to resolving issues relating to aging population .
target: Economic growth is seen as the key to resolving issues relating to an aging population .

input: grammar: With economic growth , the average income will increase , and thus , many people will be able to or even lessen their burden on taking care of their elderly parents .
target: With economic growth , the average income will increase , and thus ,

input: grammar: Furthermore , with the increased income , the government can impose more tax and use it to continue existing or introduce more welfare programs for the elderly .
target: Furthermore , with the increased income , the government can impose more tax and use it to introduce more or to continue existing welfare programs for the elderly .

input: grammar: The Lewin Group and The Nelson A. Rockefeller Institute of Government ( July , 2004 ) found that states of less fiscal capacity on average spent less on social welfare programs than states with higher per capita incomes .
target: The Lewin Group and The Nelson A. Rockefeller Institute of Government ( July , 2004 ) found that states of less fiscal capacity on average , spent less on social welfare programs than states with higher per capita incomes .

input: grammar: Thus , public spending should be channelled to promoting economic growth , in which can help to continue or enhance welfare programs .
target: Thus , public spending should be channelled to promoting economic growth which can help to continue or enhance welfare programs .

input: grammar: Next , public spending should be channelled to the education sector , either to allow more people to get the chance to go to school or to improve the standard of education , and encourage research and development at tertiary levels and beyond .
target: Next , public spending should be channelled to the education sector , to allow more people to get the chance to go to school , to improve the standard of education , and to encourage research and development at tertiary levels and beyond .

input: grammar: With more educated citizens , there will be a more productive workforce ( Ramphele " Rosovsky , 2000 ) .
target: With more educated citizens , there will be a more productive workforce ( Ramphele " Rosovsky , 2000 ) .

input: grammar: In addition , as the standard of education increases , and more research and development is conducted , the likelihood of technological advancement would be higher .
target: In addition , as the standard of education increases , and more research and development is conducted , the likelihood of technological advancement is higher .

input: grammar: Advancement in technology can improve the healthcare of the elderly , as more or better treatments for illnesses due to old aged are discovered .
target: Advancements in technology can improve the healthcare of the elderly , as more or better treatments for illnesses due to old aged are discovered .

input: grammar: Thus , public spending should be diverted to education sector and promoting research and development , which can improve the welfare of the elderly in both long and short run .
target: Thus , public spending should be diverted to the education sector and to promoting research and development , which can improve the welfare of the elderly in both the long and short run .

input: grammar: However , new or improved treatments arising from advancement in technology will incur a higher healthcare cost .
target: However , new or improved treatments arising from advancements in technology will incur higher health care costs .

input: grammar: Furthermore , limiting public spending on the aged is not an easy task .
target: Furthermore , limiting public spending on the aged is not an easy task .

input: grammar: This is simply due to fact that setting a limit that is too low may result in some elderly not receiving adequate medical care and home care , and setting a limit that is too high may result in increased burden on government policies and on the working population in society .
target: This is simply due to fact that setting a limit that is too low may result in some elderly not receiving adequate medical care and home care , and setting a limit that is too high may result in an increased burden on government policies and on the working population in society .

input: grammar: Thus , the government needs to prevent the healthcare cost from escalatng too much and also how much funds should be set aside for the elderly .
target: Thus , the government needs to prevent health care costs from escalatng too much and also to decide how much funding should be set aside for the elderly .

input: grammar: The government can lower healthcare costs by providing the elderly with cheaper but adequate alternatives .
target: The government can lower healthcare costs by providing the elderly with cheaper but adequate alternatives .

input: grammar: The Singapore government is expanding its step-down care sector , by increasing the number of community hospitals , nursing homes and home care , which can provide the elderly patients with sufficient care ( Majid , 2009 ) .
target: The Singapore government is expanding its step-down care sector , by increasing the number of community hospitals , nursing homes and home care , which can provide the elderly patients with sufficient care ( Majid , 2009 ) .

input: grammar: The government should decide on the segment of the population that requires government aid in old age before calibrating the essential funds required for the elderly .
target: The government should decide on the segment of the population that requires government aid in old age before calibrating the essential funds required for the elderly .

input: grammar: Elderly who are financially strapped and/or have no spouse or intermediate family members to take care of them should be taken care of by the government .
target: Elderly people people who are financially strapped and/or have no spouse or intermediate family members to take care of them , should be taken care of by the government .

input: grammar: The government can identify this group of elderly by conducting means testing .
target: The government can identify this group of elderly by conducting means testing .

input: grammar: By adopting the use of means testing , it allows lower income patients to enjoy more subsidies than higher-income patients ( Ministry of Health , 2009 ) .
target: By adopting the use of means testing , it allows lower income patients to enjoy more subsidies than higher-income patients ( Ministry of Health , 2009 ) .

input: grammar: The government should then carefully decide the necessary healthcare spending that has to be supported by the public sector , as excessive spending or spending that exceed the means of the government will lead to future generation having to pay higher tax , as the successor government is left with huge bill ( Tan " .Ho , 2008 ) .
target: The government should then carefully decide the necessary healthcare spending that has to be supported by the public sector , as excessive spending or spending that exceeds the means of the government will lead to the future generation having to pay higher tax , as the successor government is left with huge bill ( Tan Ho , 2008 ) .

input: grammar: Different societies use different methods to finance their healthcare .
target: Different societies use different methods to finance their healthcare .

input: grammar: In Singapore , the government finances the healthcare through a combination of taxation and private or national insurance schemes to provide affordable healthcare to its people ( Lim , 2001 ) 7 However , with limited resources , the government needs to allocate resources in such a way , so that development in one area will not be at the cost of another .
target: In Singapore , the government finances health carehrough a combination of taxation and private or national insurance schemes to provide affordable healthcare to its people ( Lim , 2001 ) . However , with limited resources , the government needs to allocate resources in such a way , so that development in one area will not be at the cost of another .

input: grammar: Thus , public spending on the aged should be limited , so that funds can be used other development which can help solve issues of aging population .
target: Thus , public spending on the aged should be limited , so that funds can be used for other developments which can help solve some of the some of the issues that accompany an an aging population .
