input: grammar: Thus giving rise to the frequency of a person being diagnosed with chronic diseases .
target: Thus giving rise to the frequency of a person being diagnosed with chronic diseases .

input: grammar: According to the World Health Organisation ( WHO ) 2002 , an older person 's independence is threatened when physical or mental disabilities make it difficult to carry out the activities of daily living .
target: According to the World Health Organisation ( WHO ) 2002 , an older person 's independence is threatened when physical or mental disabilities make it difficult to carry out the activities of daily living .

input: grammar: In line with that , there will an increase for demand of medications to prevent and treat chronic illnesses and also to improve quality of life .
target: In line with that , there will an increase for demand of medications to prevent and treat chronic illnesses and also to improve quality of life .

input: grammar: A need for expanding social care services for the elderly suffices as well .
target: A need for expanding social care services for the elderly as well .

input: grammar: In dealing with an ageing population , research and development has pushes countries to move forward in a new paradigm of ageing .
target: In dealing with an ageing population , research and development has pushed countries to move forward in a new paradigm of ageing .

input: grammar: Active ageing is the primary focus .
target: Active ageing is the primary focus .

input: grammar: It is a process for utilizing opportunities in health , contribution and security of society to enhance the quality of life of ageing citizens .
target: It is a process for utilizing opportunities in health , to enhance the quality of life of ageing citizens .

input: grammar: One of the strategies is by encouraging longer employment for citizens and lower barriers for the elderly employment .
target: One of the strategies is to encourage longer employment for citizens and lower barriers for the employment of elderly people .

input: grammar: The current trend towards early retirement in industrialised countries is largely the result of public policies that have encouraged early withdrawal from the labour force ( WHO , 2002 ) .Therefore research and development is essential to change such policies .
target: The current trend towards early retirement in industrialised countries is largely the result of public policies that have encouraged early withdrawal from the labour force ( WHO , 2002 ) .Therefore research and development is essential to change such policies .

input: grammar: Based on research , when people work longer , it can offset increasing costs for public pensions due to the rising of the eligibility age of it .
target: Based on research , when people work longer , it can offset increasing costs for public pensions due to the

input: grammar: Furthermore , working longer keeps one 's mind constantly generating thoughts and ideas .
target: Furthermore , working longer keeps one 's mind constantly generating thoughts and ideas .

input: grammar: Those who remain engaged in activities involving multiple tasks , requiring communication , interaction , and organization , who continue learning , and constantly challenge their brains earn the greatest protection ( Wall Street Journal , 2008 ) .
target: Those who remain engaged in activities involving multiple tasks , requiring communication , interaction and organization , and those who continue learning , and constantly challenge their brains , earn the greatest protection ( Wall Street Journal , 2008 ) .

input: grammar: Hence , he or she is not susceptible to developing old age illnesses and disabilities .
target: Hence , is not susceptible to developing old age illnesses and disabilities .

input: grammar: Research and development is also important to measure to what extent the government should provide sensible solutions in terms of expenditure to support medical requirements for the aged .
target: Research and development is also important to measure to what extent the government should provide sensible solutions in terms of expenditure to support medical requirements for the aged .

input: grammar: As mentioned , an ageing population has high demands for medications and social care services .
target: As previously mentioned , an ageing population has a high demand for medications and social care services .

input: grammar: Through research and development , it is said that the government should support these demands .
target: Through research and development , it is said that the government should support these demands .

input: grammar: However , a limit has to be established so that spending is not extravagant .
target: However , a limit has to be established so that spending is not extravagant .

input: grammar: It is also vital that a perspective is set on the government not being the sole agent to relieve the ageing process .
target: It is also vital that a perspective is set on the government not being the sole agent to relieve the ageing process .

input: grammar: Private practices in healthcare professionals , social care services and organizations for citizens also correspond to the aged .
target: Private practices of healthcare professionals , social care services and organizations for citizens also correspond to the aged .

input: grammar: In Singapore , Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong implemented that healthcare system will be restructured for the ageing population .
target: In Singapore , Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong that the health care system will be restructured for the ageing population .

input: grammar: For instance , he said one key step is to link up acute hospitals with community ones where patients can receive treatment at the acute hospital and then recuperate at the community hospital ( Channel NewsAsia , 2009 ) .
target: For instance , he said one key step is to link up acute hospitals with community ones , where patients can receive treatment at the acute hospital , and then recuperate at the community hospital ( Channel NewsAsia , 2009 ) .

input: grammar: It is undeniable that research and development is important to ease the greying population .
target: It is undeniable that research and development is important to ease the greying population .

input: grammar: However some policies may not only bring positivity .
target: However , some policies may not only bring positivity .

input: grammar: An extension in the working lives of the elderly , can bring negative effects .
target: An extension in the working lives of the elderly , can bring negative effects .

input: grammar: The ageing population is often associated with poor health thus exerts low productivity .
target: The ageing population is often associated with poor health

input: grammar: It will also be harder for them to acquire new skills that can benefit some industries .
target: It will also be harder for to acquire new skills that can benefit industry .

input: grammar: Besides that , some older workers cost more than younger workers due to the seniority payment system .
target: Besides , some older workers cost more than younger workers due to the seniority payment system .

input: grammar: As a consequence , older workers are considered both vulnerable for dismissal , or to be targeted by companies wishing to make workforce reductions , and less able to find new jobs should they loose their current work ( Bernard Casey , 1998 ) .
target: As a consequence , older workers are considered both vulnerable for dismissal , or to be targeted by companies wishing to make workforce reductions . They are also less able to find new jobs should they loose their current work ( Bernard Casey , 1998 ) .

input: grammar: However , these negatives are outweighed when active ageing takes place as the new paradigm for the aged .
target: However , these negatives are outweighed when active ageing takes place as the new paradigm for the aged .

input: grammar: Older people are active contributors in this age-integrated society .
target: Older people are active contributors in this age-integrated society .

input: grammar: They can remain as active providers and beneficiaries of modernization .
target: They can remain as active providers and beneficiaries of modernization .

input: grammar: Research and development plays is relatively important to determine the direction of an ageing population .
target: Research and development is relatively important in determining the direction of an ageing population .

input: grammar: Deterioration of a greying population due to problems associated with it can be addressed via strategies formed from policies for the aged .
target: Deterioration of a greying population due to problems associated with it can be addressed via strategies formed from policies for the aged .

input: grammar: Active ageing as the new paradigm of ageing is the key to overcome healthcare challenges and other problems arise with the ageing population as well .
target: Active ageing ,as the new paradigm of ageing , is the key to overcoming healthcare challenges and other problems arising with the ageing population .

input: grammar: These challenges are not only the concern of the government .
target: These challenges are not only the concern of the government .

input: grammar: Other sectors should collaborate to produce the best solutions to ease the ageing population .
target: Other sectors should collaborate to produce the best solutions to ease the ageing population .

input: grammar: Lastly , it is essential for continuity in research and development for policies to suit needs of the elderly .
target: Lastly , it is essential for there to be continuity in research and development to be able to create policies that suit the the needs of the elderly .

input: grammar: Ageing is a process that all humans have to go through , but inexplicably unavoidable and contentious are the problems that come along with it .
target: Ageing is a process that all humans have to go through , but the problems that come along with it are unavoidable .

input: grammar: Population ageing is experienced in most industrialized countries , and it has certainly affected these countries ' productivity as it brings along problems such as rising social and welfare costs .
target: Population ageing is experienced in most industrialized countries , and it has certainly affected these countries ' productivity as it brings along problems such as rising social and welfare costs .

input: grammar: It can also result in a shrinking and less efficient workforce , and a growing burden on family support .
target: It can also result in a shrinking and less efficient workforce , and a growing burden on family support .

input: grammar: Therefore , to tackle the problems brought about by the ageing process , there is a role for the individual , the family , and most importantly , the state to play .
target: Therefore , to tackle the problems brought about by the ageing process , there is a role for the individual , the family , and most importantly , the state to play .

input: grammar: We look specifically in the case of Singapore 's approach : current research and development ( R " D ) and policies such as the employment policies , the public pensions programs and the health care and community development prepared for the aged have greatly helped in easing the problems posed by the ageing process .
target: Looking specifically at the case of Singapore : current research and development R&D and policies such as the employment policies , the public pensions programs and the health care and community development prepared for the aged have greatly helped in easing the problems posed by the ageing process .

input: grammar: Employment policies in the form of encouraging the hiring or re-hiring of the elderly and in strengthening the workforce by bringing in more immigrants are ways to solve the problem of low productivity in the economy caused by the ageing process .
target: Employment policies in the form of encouraging the hiring or re-hiring of the elderly and in strengthening the workforce by bringing in more immigrants are ways to solve the problem of low productivity in the economy caused by the ageing process .

input: grammar: In the case of Singapore , the state has for example , extended the retirement ages for its people to 62 , and to 65 by 2012 .
target: In the case of Singapore , the state has for example , extended the retirement ages for its people to 62 , and to 65 by 2012 .

input: grammar: This gives the elderly an opportunity to work to supplement his/her own expenses , and it also helps in raising the productivity of the workforce as well .
target: This gives the elderly an opportunity to work to supplement his/her own expenses , and it also helps in raising the productivity of the workforce as well .

input: grammar: Another way to make up for the lack of productivity of the workforce is to encourage more immigrants or 'foreign talents ' to work in Singapore .
target: Another way to make up for the lack of productivity of the workforce is to encourage more immigrants or 'foreign talents ' to work in Singapore .

input: grammar: The state 's readiness to provide financial benefits or aids to 'foreign talents ' , and the conducive and attractive work environment that Singapore provides meant that these people are able to replace the elderly in the workforce and maintain , or even bring the economy to higher levels .
target: The state 's readiness to provide financial benefits or aids to 'foreign talents ' , and the conducive and attractive work environment that Singapore provides meant that these people are able to replace the elderly in the workforce and maintain , or even bring the economy to higher levels .

input: grammar: Thus , employment policies have made the problems associated with the ageing process much negligible .
target: Thus , employment policies have made the problems associated with the ageing process negligible .

input: grammar: Another method that the Singapore government has adopted to deal with the ageing process is the use of the public pensions programs , more familiar to Singaporeans by the name of Central Provident Fund ( CPF ) .
target: Another method that the Singapore government has adopted to deal with the ageing process is the use of public pensions programs , more familiar to Singaporeans by the name of Central Provident Fund ( CPF ) .

input: grammar: More commonly seen as a social security savings plan , contributions are made monthly to the CPF by working Singaporeans and their employers .
target: More commonly seen as a social security savings plan , contributions are made monthly to the CPF by working Singaporeans and their employers .

input: grammar: In such a case , these savings can then be used appropriately , especially after retirement .
target: In such a case , these savings can then be used appropriately , especially after retirement .

input: grammar: It helps to see the elderly through their retirement , provides a retirement income for the elderly and it ensures sufficient savings for future medical uses as one gets older .
target: It helps to see the elderly through their retirement , provides a retirement income for the elderly and it ensures sufficient savings for future medical uses as one gets older .

input: grammar: The CPF policy has seen tremendous success in providing one with sufficient income for rainy days and future uses , and it certainly has lessen the impacts that the ageing process has brought about .
target: The CPF policy has seen tremendous success in providing people with sufficient income for future use , and it certainly has lessened the impact that the ageing process has brought about .

input: grammar: And finally , the state has also implemented policies on health care and community development such as health care insurance schemes and improving facilities and infrastructure for the elderly .
target: And finally , the state has also implemented policies on health care and community development , such as health care insurance schemes and improving facilities and infrastructure for the elderly .

input: grammar: Health care insurance schemes such as the Medisave , Medishield and Eldershield allows Singaporeans to place aside part of his/her own income for health care needs in the future .
target: Health care insurance schemes such as the Medisave , Medishield and Eldershield , allows Singaporeans to place aside part of his/her own income for health care needs in the future .

input: grammar: This greatly encourages independence among the elderly in the future , and also on the emphasis of personal responsibility .
target: This greatly encourages independence among the elderly in the future , as well as personal responsibility .

input: grammar: This reduces the burden on the family brought about by the ageing process .
target: This reduces the burden on the family brought about by the ageing process .

input: grammar: R " D has also allowed the state to improve public infrastructure , such as the creation of wheelchair-accessible buses , upgrading the houses such as the provision of lifts for access to every storey , and the development of retirement housings .
target: Research and Development has also allowed the state to improve public infrastructure , such as the creation of wheelchair-accessible buses , upgrading houses with lifts that access every storey , and the development of retirement housing .

input: grammar: An awareness of more elderly-friendly programs and facilities can also be made through advertisements .
target: An awareness of more elderly-friendly programs and facilities has also been done through advertisements .

input: grammar: As such , the elderly need not be as reliant on the community as before .
target: As such , the elderly need not be as reliant on the community as before .

input: grammar: Thus , there need not be more burdens on the family and the community brought about by the ageing process .
target: Thus , there need not be more burdens on the family and the community brought about by the ageing process .

input: grammar: However successful these policies may turn out to be , there are still contestations as to whether these policies are truly effective , and how it may actually bring in other sets of problems .
target: However successful these policies may turn out to be , there are still arguments as to whether these policies are truly effective , and how they may actually bring about other sets of problems .

input: grammar: For example , the policy of bringing in more 'foreign talents ' has brought disputes from locals in claiming that there is too much competition for jobs in Singapore .
target: For example , the policy of bringing in more 'foreign talents ' has brought disputes from locals in claiming that there is too much competition for jobs in Singapore .

input: grammar: And certainly , when implemented on its own , each policy presents its own sets of problems .
target: And certainly , when implemented on its own , each policy presents its own sets of problems .

input: grammar: In providing employment for the elderly , its effects may be reduced if the health conditions or attitudes of these elderly workers are not seen to .
target: In providing employment for the elderly , its effects may be reduced

input: grammar: The CPF policy may provide cover for the elderly , but they will not be able to use it wisely if the state does not provide useful information or advices in its usage .
target: The CPF policy may provide cover for the elderly , but they will not be able to use it wisely if the state does not provide useful information or advice for its usage .

input: grammar: Therefore , the abovementioned policies will not be as effective as when it is implemented on its own ; it needs to supplement each other for it to work .
target: Therefore , the abovementioned policies will not be as effective as when they are implemented on their own ; They needs to supplement each other for it to work .

input: grammar: The ageing process can be a tough and tumultuous time for the elderly , in terms of their well being and financial stability .
target: The ageing process can be a tough and tumultuous time for the elderly , in terms of their well being and financial stability .

input: grammar: Certainly , without the policies undertaken by the state , the graying population will bring about problems found both in the economy and at home .
target: Certainly , without the policies undertaken by the state , the graying population will bring about problems both in the economy and at home .

input: grammar: Thus , policies such as the employment policies , the social security savings plan and health care and community development have helped to ease the ageing process by allowing the elderly to enjoy a more vibrant and active life in both social and economical aspects .
target: Thus , policies such as the employment policies , the social security savings plan and health care and community development , have helped to ease the ageing process by allowing the elderly to enjoy a more vibrant and active life in both social and economical aspects .

input: grammar: These policies are also most effective when working in tandem , whereas on its own its impacts are limited .
target: These policies are also most effective when working in tandem , whereas on their own , their impact is limited .

input: grammar: The Singapore government has done well in its foresight of the problems regarding the ageing process , but more can be done to achieve better value of integration between the private and public spheres .
target: The Singapore government has done well in its foresight of the problems regarding the ageing process , but more can be done to achieve better integration between the private and public spheres .

input: grammar: As for now , its policies have certainly kept the ageing process a much manageable one .
target: As for now , its policies have certainly kept the ageing process a much more manageable one .

input: grammar: In addition , the money spent on country 's development in the area of education and economy can also help to solve the problems of an aging population .
target: In addition , the money spent on the country 's development in the area of education and economy can also help to solve the problems of an aging population .

input: grammar: For example , the economic growth of the country can help to ensure the continuation of welfare programs due to increased revenues of the country .
target: For example , the economic growth of the country can help to ensure the continuation of welfare programs due to increased revenues of the country .

input: grammar: Education can also help to raise the awareness of the young as well as increasing their understanding of the need for them to play a part in dealing with the problems of an aging population .
target: Education can also help to raise the awareness of the young as well as increasing their understanding of the need for them to play a part in dealing with the problems of an aging population .

input: grammar: In conclusion , it will definitely be best that public spending on the aged is not limited so as to accommodate as much to the needs of the aged .
target: In conclusion , it will definitely be better if public spending on the aged is not limited

input: grammar: However , when making decisions on government spending , the government should also take into consideration the existence of other problems and the need to improve other areas of country .
target: However , when making decisions on government spending , the government should also take into consideration the existence of other problems and the need to improve other areas of the country .

input: grammar: The country is not only made up of the elderly .
target: The country is not only made up of the elderly .

input: grammar: The majority of the population is still the young who are now sweating and toiling for the country just like what the aged had done in the past .
target: The majority of the population is still the young who are now sweating and toiling for the country , just like the aged did in the past .

input: grammar: Hence the government should also divert some of the resources to improve the lives of these people such as subsidies for birth-giving , which not only reduces the cost burden of having a child but also encourages people to have more children , thus increasing the replacement rate .
target: Hence the government should also divert some of its resources to improving the lives of the aged for example by providing subsidies for having children which not only reduces the cost of having a child but also encourages people to have more children , thus increasing the replacement rate .

input: grammar: On the other hand , strategies such as means-testing , currently adopted by the Australian Government , should also be implemented in other affected countries to ensure that all public spending are necessary ( Peter G. Peterson ) .
target: On the other hand , strategies such as means-testing , currently adopted by the Australian Government , should also be implemented in other affected countries , to ensure that all public spending is necessary ( Peter G. Peterson ) .

input: grammar: Should Public spending on the aged be limited
target: Should Public spending on the aged be limited

input: grammar: Ageing population is a fact .
target: Ageing populations are a fact

input: grammar: It is foremost a consequence of the " baby boom " - the rapid increase in birth rates and then its decline after the Second World War.1 This period of increased fertility lasted for thirty years and the number of people born in this era was unusually large .
target: It is foremost a consequence of the " baby boom " - the rapid increase in birth rates and then its decline after the Second World War . [ 1 ] This period of increased fertility lasted for thirty years and the number of people born in this era was unusually large .

input: grammar: Population ageing has also been intensified by increases in life expectancy at older ages because of education , improved healthcare , and technology .
target: Population ageing has also been intensified by increases in life expectancy at older ages because of education , improved healthcare , and technology .

input: grammar: Such demographic changes might bring about severe consequences , most importantly national budgets might be under pressure as growing number of elderly persons are supported fewer younger persons .
target: Such demographic changes might bring about severe consequences , most importantly national budgets might be under pressure as a growing number of elderly persons are supported by fewer younger persons .

input: grammar: The debate now is whether the nation state should limit its public spending so that the saved resources can be utilised to other areas f the country 's development .
target: The debate is now whether the nation state should limit its public spending so that the saved resources can be utilized on other areas of the country 's development .

input: grammar: In this brief essay I would strongly argue that yes , the state should indeed limit its spending and focus more on economic growth so as to not to discriminate against the elderly but rather to aid them in a more fruitful way which is beneficial for both generations .
target: This essay will strongly argue that yes , the state should indeed limit its spending and focus more on economic growth so as to not to discriminate against the elderly , but rather to aid them in a more fruitful way which is beneficial for both generations .

input: grammar: I believe that economic growth has its " trickle down " effect and accompanies numerous positive externalities which would help the old even more efficient way than continuous increase in healthcare spending which restrains GDP growth .
target: Economic growth has a " trickle down " effect and accompanies numerous positive externalities which helps the old in more efficient ways than continuous increases in healthcare spending which restrains GDP growth .

input: grammar: The first and foremost positive consequence of economic growth is that it will not only ensure the continuation of the current social welfare programme but also total spending on such programmes will also increase in real terms .
target: The first and foremost positive consequence of economic growth is that it will not only ensure the continuation of the current social welfare programme , but will also increase the total spending on such programmes in real terms .

input: grammar: For instance if real GDP of a country increases by 3 % , and that the spending on welfare programmes is pegged at 2 % of real GDP , then the real spending in such projects will also increase by 2 % .
target: For instance , if real GDP of a country increases by 3 % , and the spending on welfare programmes is pegged at 2 % of real GDP , then the real spending in such projects will also increase by 2 % .

input: grammar: So growth in real GDP of a country is of immense importance .
target: So growth in real GDP of a country is of immense importance .

input: grammar: However , it must also be noted that any particular country does not enjoy economic growth eternally .
target: However , it must also be noted that

input: grammar: In terms of economic downturn such policy can actually reduce spending on ageing population and healthcare to a great extent .
target: In terms of an economic downturn , such policy can actually reduce spending on the ageing population and healthcare to a great extent .

input: grammar: To counter the government could actually set down some minimum spending regardless of economic condition .
target: To counter this , the government could actually set down some minimum spending regardless of the economic conditions .

input: grammar: The government could establish a bottom line stating the how much to spend , on what aspects of healthcare to spend , how much of a particular facility an individual could use and to what extent .
target: The government could establish a bottom line stating how much to spend , on what aspects of healthcare to spend money on , , and how much of a particular facility an individual could use and to what extent .

input: grammar: Any expenditure outside the boundaries set by the government should be deemed unnecessary .
target: Any expenditure outside the boundaries set by the government should be deemed unnecessary .

input: grammar: For instance free personal care , such as the washing and dressing of elderly people costs Britain an additional forty million pounds which caused its government to adopt such policy.2
target: For instance , free personal care , such as the washing and dressing of elderly people costs Britain an additional forty million pounds which caused its government to adopt a policy similar to the above .

input: grammar: Another great advantage of economic growth is that it raises the real income of people .
target: Another advantage of economic growth is that it raises the real income of people .

input: grammar: As a result Government use of either increase or decrease of taxes could benefit the ageing population .
target: As a result , government increases or decreases in taxes could benefit the ageing population .

input: grammar: Since there is economic growth , government would have more resources and hence require less taxes , as a consequence a family would be able to increase its spending on its older members .
target: Since there is economic growth , the government would have more resources and hence require less taxes , and as a consequence a family would be able to increase its spending on its older members .

input: grammar: On the other hand the state could also receive more taxes now that people have increased income and use the money for further betterment of the healthcare system .
target: On the other hand , the state could also receive more taxes , now that people have increased income , and use the money for further betterment of the healthcare system .

input: grammar: To top things off , economic growth would allow increase in spending in R " D so the medical facilities would be more technologically advanced and be cheaper to produce due to superior technology , hence services from such facilities would become cheaper and hence spending overall would fall .
target: To top things off , economic growth would allow an increase in spending in R&D so the medical facilities would be more technologically advanced and be cheaper to produce due to superior technology . Therefore , services from such facilities would become cheaper and hence spending overall would fall .

input: grammar: The immediate effect of limiting spending will cause a rise is societal costs , and will make individuals and families responsible for a larger share .
target: The immediate effect of limiting spending will cause a rise is societal costs and will make individuals and families responsible .

input: grammar: The societal costs might end up getting shifted back to the public sector in more expensive means.3 Such policies might hurt members of societies who do not have immediate family ties , members with unsound financial management .
target: The societal costs might end up getting shifted back to the public sector .3 Such policies might hurt members of societies who do not have immediate family ties or members with unsound financial management .

input: grammar: Moreover there are also problems of process of setting limits .
target: Moreover there are also problems of setting limits .

input: grammar: How should the limits be imposed ?
target: How should the limits be imposed ?

input: grammar: Is the limit set the right one ?
target: Is the limit set at the right one ?

input: grammar: These questions also need to be answered .
target: These questions also need to be answered .

input: grammar: However these are short run problems , in the long run the society would benefit as a whole .
target: However these are short term problems , in the long run society would benefit as a whole .

input: grammar: Ageing issues are complicated .
target: Ageing issues are complicated .

input: grammar: These problems do not have immediate solutions .
target: These problems do not have immediate solutions .

input: grammar: Although it would take time to overcome the predicaments , it is absolutely necessary to act now .
target: Although it would take time to overcome the predicaments , it is absolutely necessary to act now .

input: grammar: Transitions would be easier if we are better prepared .
target: Transitions would be easier if society is better prepared .

input: grammar: Since it is evident that in the long run economic growth allows flexibility meaning that it does not burden the younger generation and pressurizes the national budget while taking good care of the older generation , it is mandatory that we start focusing more on the economic growth so that everybody wins in the long run .
target: Since it is evident that in the long run economic growth allows flexibility , meaning that it does not burden the younger generation and pressurizes the national budget while taking good care of the older generation , it is mandatory that society starts focusing more on the economic growth so that everybody wins in the long run .

input: grammar: Should a carrier of a known genetic risk be obligated to tell his or her relatives ?
target: Should a carrier of a known genetic risk be obligated to tell his or her relatives ?

input: grammar: The rapid advancements in genetic research and technology over the last few decades have led to a host of important advances in the detection of genetic conditions and diseases .
target: The rapid advancements in genetic research and technology over the last few decades have led to a host of important advances in the detection of genetic conditions and diseases .

input: grammar: These developments have also raised concerns whether a carrier of a known genetic risk have the duty to inform their relatives about their genetic test results .
target: These developments have also raised concerns about whether a carrier of a known genetic risk has the duty to inform his relatives about his genetic test results .

input: grammar: According to the National Human Research Genome Institute ( 2009 ) , genetic testing is a type of medical test that identifies alterations in a person 's gene , chromosome or the level of key proteins coded for by specific genes .
target: According to the National Human Research Genome Institute ( 2009 ) , genetic testing is a type of medical test that identifies alterations in a person 's gene , chromosome or the level of key proteins coded for by specific genes .

input: grammar: An individual who only has one altered copy of a gene is known as a carrier .
target: An individual who only has one altered copy of a gene is known as a carrier .

input: grammar: Carriers will not be diagnosed with the disease but can pass on alteration to their children .
target: Carriers will not be diagnosed with the disease but can pass on the alteration to their children .

input: grammar: On one hand , some may believe that carriers do not have the responsibility to reveal their genetic test results to their relatives as discrimination and excess worrying may occur .
target: On one hand , some may believe that carriers do not have the responsibility to reveal their genetic test results to their relatives as discrimination and excess worrying may occur .

input: grammar: On the other hand , it is more logical to believe that carriers have the duty to inform their relatives regarding their tests results so that their relatives can make informed choices .
target: On the other hand , it is more logical to believe that carriers have the duty to inform their relatives regarding their tests results so that their relatives can make informed choices related to their genes .

input: grammar: Hence , a carrier of a known genetic risk should be compelled to reveal their genetic test results to their relatives .
target: Hence , carriers of known genetic risks should be compelled to reveal their genetic test results to their relatives .

input: grammar: Firstly , critics perceive that there is a risk of stigma and discrimination for the carrier 's relatives , especially in access to employment and health insurance .
target: critics perceive that .

input: grammar: Sociologists note that relatives of carriers of known genetic risks may be denied application of health insurance policies or have to pay higher premiums since they are at higher risk of developing the disease ( Health Plan One , n.d. ) .
target: Sociologists note that relatives of carriers of known genetic risks may be denied health insurance policies or be made to pay higher premiums since they are at higher risk of developing the disease ( Health Plan One , n.d. ) .

input: grammar: This is because insurance companies being mostly profit-orientated would predict any possible added costs and take pre-emptive actions to avoid these costs .
target: This is because insurance companies being mostly profit-orientated would predict any possible added costs and take pre-emptive measures to avoid these costs .

input: grammar: In addition , healthy and qualified relatives of carriers may be denied employment opportunities ( American Medical Association , 1991 ) .
target: In addition , healthy and qualified relatives of carriers may be denied employment opportunities ( American Medical Association , 1991 ) .

input: grammar: Employers may have the misguided belief that they have to pay more money in order to ensure the working environment is safe for these employees .
target: One reason for this could be that employers may have the misguided belief that they have to spend more in order to ensure the working environment is safe for these employees .

input: grammar: The consideration of medical leaves that these employees may take in future may deter the employers from engaging their services for fear of loss in efficiency at work and trouble in finding replacements .
target: The consideration of extended medical leave that these employees may take in future may deter the employers from engaging their services for fear of loss in efficiency at work and trouble in finding replacements .

input: grammar: As such , companies will not tend to employ individuals who have medical history of genetic diseases .
target: As such , companies will tend not to employ individuals who have a medical history of genetic diseases .

input: grammar: However , these arguments fail to consider the measurements in place to protect insurance and employability for relatives of carriers .
target: However , these arguments fail to consider the measurements in place to protect insurance and employability for relatives of carriers .

input: grammar: Paddock ( 2008 ) asserted that the enactment of laws such as the Genetic Information Non-discrimination Act 2008 in the United States would prohibit insurance companies to reject policies due to genetic information and forbid companies to use genetic information for hiring decisions for individuals .
target: Paddock ( 2008 ) asserted that the enactment of laws such as the Genetic Information Non-discrimination Act 2008 in the United States would prohibit insurance companies from rejecting clients due to genetic information and forbid companies from using genetic information for hiring decisions for individuals .

input: grammar: Moreover , a mathematical model to work out the extra mortality for individuals associated with higher risks of illnesses such as Hungtinton 's disease will guide insurance companies to formulate reasonable amount of premiums ( Watts , 1999 ) .
target: Moreover , a mathematical model to work out the mortality for individuals associated with higher risks of illnesses such as Hungtinton 's disease will guide insurance companies to formulate reasonable levels of premiums ( Watts , 1999 ) .

input: grammar: Hence , genetic information will not be used against family members when applying for an insurance policy or a job .
target: Hence , genetic information will not be used against family members who apply for an insurance policy or a job .

input: grammar: Secondly , detractors argue that genetic information of carriers will cause unnecessary worry for their family members , especially for multi- factorial diseases .
target: detractors argue that the genetic information of carriers will cause unnecessary worry for their family members , especially in the case of multi- factorial diseases .

input: grammar: Medical professionals contend that these family members may experience psychological effects such as fear , anxiety and depression , affecting their lifestyle ( Yap , 2005 ) .
target: Medical professionals contend that these family members may experience psychological effects such as fear , anxiety and depression , which would affect their lifestyle ( Yap , 2005 ) .

input: grammar: Multi-factorial diseases such as coronary heart diseases may occur in isolation , with affected children born to unaffected parents .
target: They note that multi-factorial diseases such as coronary heart diseases may occur in isolation , with affected children born to unaffected parents .

input: grammar: Furthermore , the Mendelian pattern of inheritance is unclear even though there may be multiple cases in the same family ( Lobo , 2008 ) .
target: Furthermore , the Mendelian pattern of inheritance is unclear even though there may be multiple cases in the same family ( Lobo , 2008 ) .

input: grammar: As such , family members will be uncertain if the disease is present in the family line and fret about the medical conditions of their future generations .
target: As such , family members will be uncertain if the disease is present in the family line and fret about the medical conditions of their future generations .

input: grammar: Nonetheless , this argument ignores the possibility that counselling sessions can be provided for the family members .
target: Nonetheless , this argument ignores the possibility that counselling sessions can be provided for the family members .

input: grammar: Psychologists assert that some family members can consult genetic counsellors about their risk of contracting the disease , hence overcoming their fears ( Adams , 2003 ) .
target: Psychologists assert that some family members can consult genetic counsellors about their risk of contracting the disease , and hence overcome their fears ( Adams , 2003 ) .

input: grammar: This measure is usually recommended for multi-factorial diseases as there is higher possibility of uncertainty in one 's health .
target: This measure is usually recommended for multi-factorial diseases as there is a higher possibility of uncertainty in one 's health .

input: grammar: Hence , worries of family members can be eliminated .
target: Hence , worries of family members can be eliminated .

input: grammar: Lastly , carriers of a known genetic risk have the duty to inform their relatives as it would aid their relatives in decision makings .
target: Indeed , carriers of a known genetic risk have the duty to inform their relatives as it would aid their relatives in decision making .

input: grammar: Ethicists assert that these relatives will be alarmed .
target: Ethicists assert that these relatives will be alarmed .

input: grammar: They may perform the disease testing in which genetic results may allow them to make informed decisions especially during family planning .
target: However , such information would encourage them to perform the disease testing in which genetic results may allow them to make informed decisions especially during family planning .

input: grammar: Rosner ( 2009 ) argued that this is important for the Jewish community as it is illegal to abort a child during pregnancy .
target: Rosner ( 2009 ) argued that this is important for the Jewish community as it is illegal to abort a child during pregnancy .

input: grammar: With the acquisition of genetic test results , couples may consider adopting a child instead of pregnancy .
target: With the acquisition of genetic test results , couples may consider adopting a child instead of conceiving one .

input: grammar: Also , couples will be mentally prepared for their child 's future as early detection of diseases such as phenylketonuria in newborns can prevent death .
target: In addition , couples could be mentally prepared for their child 's future as .

input: grammar: In all , carriers have the obligation to inform their family members their genetic test results since the advantages clearly outweigh the disadvantages .
target: In all , carriers have the obligation to inform their family members of their genetic test results since the advantages clearly outweigh the disadvantages .

input: grammar: In future , genetic testing may be more common and more people may feel the need to share their genetic results .
target: In future , genetic testing may be more common and more people may feel the need to share their genetic results .

input: grammar: When a person is found to be a carrier though genetic testing , problem is arise as to whether the carrier should tell his or her relatives about the result as a carrier will not get the disease but the carrier can pass the disease to his or her children ( Frequently Asked Questions About Genetic Testing , 2009 ) .
target: When a person is found to be a carrier though genetic testing , the dilemma arises as to whether the carrier should tell his or her relatives about the result as the carrier will not get the disease but the carrier can pass the disease to his or her children ( Frequently Asked Questions About Genetic Testing , 2009 ) .

input: grammar: In my view , a carrier should tell his or her relatives about the result as firstly , there is a possibility that they might get the disease or they might be a carrier too and hence they have a right to know .
target: In my view , a carrier should tell his or her relatives about the result as firstly , there is a possibility that they might get the disease or they might be a carrier too and hence they have a right to know .

input: grammar: Secondly , the carrier can get moral support from the family member despite the fact that the carrier might face discrimination upon disclosure of results .
target: Secondly , the carrier can get moral support from his or her family members despite the possibility that the carrier might face discrimination upon disclosing his results .

input: grammar: A carrier should tell his or her relatives as they might be in risk of getting the disease or being a carrier too ( Lea , Williams and Donahue , 2005 ) .
target: A carrier should tell his or her relatives as they might be at risk of getting the disease or being a carrier too ( Lea , Williams and Donahue , 2005 ) .

input: grammar: This is because the carrier got the disease through his or her parent , and thus the carrier 's siblings and the carrier 's children might have also gotten the altered gene .
target: This is because the carrier got the disease through a parent , and thus the carrier 's siblings and the carrier 's children might have also gotten the altered gene .

input: grammar: Hence it is important to inform the carrier 's relatives so that they could go for the testing to check whether they are carriers or have inherited disposition to the disease .
target: Hence , it is important to inform the carrier 's relatives so that they can go for the testing to check whether they are carriers or have an inherited disposition toward the disease .

input: grammar: If they were found to be carrier , they have the chance to choose to not to reproduce or even having mental preparation about their children 's health in the future if they decided to do so .
target: If they were found to be a carrier , they have the chance to choose to not to reproduce or be mentally prepared about their children 's health in the future if they decide to proceed with having children .

input: grammar: After all , taking care of a child with disease is not an easy task .
target: After all , taking care of a child with a disease is not an easy task .

input: grammar: They should consider whether they are prepared to look after the child if the child gets the disease as it is not only financially exhausting , but mentally as well .
target: They should consider whether they are prepared to look after the child if the child gets the disease as it is not only financially exhausting , but mentally tiring as well .

input: grammar: If they were found to have the probability of getting the disease , they could then be more mentally prepared due to the early notice .
target: If they were found to have the probability of getting the disease , they could then be more mentally prepared due to the early notice .

input: grammar: Thus by informing the relatives about the result , the family member can better plan their future and be mentally prepared for the worst .
target: Thus , by being informed about the genetic results of a carrier , the carrier 's family members can better plan their future and be mentally prepared for the worst .

input: grammar: Another reason why carrier should tell his or her relatives is because his or her relatives might be able to provide support to him .
target: Another reason why a carrier should tell his or her his genetic results is because his or her relatives might be able to provide support to him .

input: grammar: After knowing that he or she is a carrier , he or she will have many worries and even guilt if his or her offspring has got the disease though him or her ( Cancer.net , 2009 ) .
target: After knowing that he or she is a carrier , he or she will have many worries and even guilt if his or her offspring has got the disease though him or her ( Cancer.net , 2009 ) .

input: grammar: The carrier may also feel " imperfect " and have lower self esteem because of this situation .
target: The carrier may also feel " imperfect " and have lower self esteem because of this situation .

input: grammar: During this period of time , support from relatives , which can help in coping with these negative feelings , is especially crucial to the carrier ( Finucane , n.d. ) .
target: During this period of time , support from relatives , which can help in coping with these negative feelings , is especially crucial to the carrier ( Finucane , n.d. ) .

input: grammar: After all , family member are the closest people to the carrier and only their support can make him or her feel better .
target: After all , family members are the closest people to the carrier and only their support can make him or her feel better .

input: grammar: Hence a carrier should tell his or her relatives of the genetic test result .
target: Hence , a carrier should tell his or her relatives of his genetic test result .

input: grammar: Others might argue that by telling relatives about the result , he or she may face discrimination from the relatives .
target: Others might argue that by telling relatives about the result , a carrier may face discrimination from his relatives .

input: grammar: This is supported by a survey conducted in 1997 which has identified more than 200 case of genetic discrimination out of 917 people who responded ( Genetic Information and the Workplace , 1998 ) .
target: This is supported by a survey conducted in 1997 , which has identified more than 200 cases of genetic discrimination out of 917 people who responded ( Genetic Information and the Workplace , 1998 ) .

input: grammar: Some carriers might faced problems such as being isolated as if they have contagious disease ; being talked behind their backs or even blamed for passing the disease when relatives are diagnosed positive ( Finucane , n.d. ) .
target: Some carriers might face problems such as being isolated as if they have a contagious disease , being talked about behind their backs or even being blamed for passing on the disease when relatives are diagnosed positive for the disease ( Finucane , n.d. ) .

input: grammar: These situations will only make the carrier unhappier and hence choosing not to tell his or her relatives about the result .
target: These situations will only make the carrier unhappy and hence many choose not to tell their relatives about their genetic results .

input: grammar: However , the situations mentioned above happen rarely within the family .
target: However , the situations mentioned above rarely happen within a family .

input: grammar: Most of the discriminations are by the employers or the insurance companies .
target: Most of the discrimination come from employers or insurance companies .

input: grammar: This is proven by another survey which has stated that 550 people had been denied employment or insurance , not by family member , due to their genetic defect ( Genetic Information and the Workplace , 1998 ) .
target: This is proven by another survey which has found that 550 people had been denied employment or insurance due to their genetic defect ( Genetic Information and the Workplace , 1998 ) .

input: grammar: Hence by telling relatives about the result will not face discrimination .
target: Hence , telling relatives about one 's genetic result will not result in discrimination .

input: grammar: It is only when the public get to know about it then will you face discrimination .
target: It is only when the public get to know about it will a carrier face discrimination .

input: grammar: Furthermore , family member are the closest people to the carrier and if they do not support each other no one will .
target: Furthermore , family members are the closest people to the carrier and if they do not support each other , no one will support them .

input: grammar: Hence a carrier should tell his or her relatives of the genetic test result as discrimination by relatives is rare .
target: Hence , a carrier should tell his or her relatives of his genetic test result as discrimination by relatives is rare .

input: grammar: In conclusion , a carrier should tell his or her relatives about the result as there is a possibility that they might get the disease or they might be a carrier too and the carrier can get support from them .
target: In conclusion , a carrier should tell his or her relatives about his genetic result as there is a possibility that they might get the disease or they might be a carrier too and the carrier can get support from them .

input: grammar: Although some might argue that by disclosure of the result , the carrier might face discrimination , this is generally not the case hence it should not prevent ones from telling the result .
target: Although some might argue that the carrier might face discrimination if he discloses his results , this is generally not the case ; hence , the fear of such discrimination should not prevent one from revealing his genetic result .

input: grammar: With the advancement in medical technology , people can find out and understand the various causes of diseases .
target: With the advancements in medical technology , people can find out and understand the various causes of diseases .

input: grammar: In the past , people thought that diseases were mainly caused by natural calamities and bacteria or viral infections .
target: In the past , people thought that diseases were mainly caused by natural calamities and bacteria or viral infections .

input: grammar: It is until recently that scientists and researchers have found out that by human 's genes being the cause of certain diseases such as heart diseases , cancers and diabetics type 1 .
target: It was not until recently that scientists and researchers found out that human 's genes are the cause of certain diseases such as heart diseases , cancers and diabetics type 1 .

input: grammar: By making use of genetic testing to test individual 's genes , one will be able to know whether he or she will develop genetic disease or carry any disease-causing genes .
target: By making use of genetic testing to test one 's genes , one will be able to know whether one will develop any genetic disease or carry any disease-causing genes .

input: grammar: Individuals who undergo such tests will find that the outcome of the tests not only affect them but also their family members .
target: Individuals who undergo such tests will find that the outcome of the tests affect not only them but also their family members .

input: grammar: This is because there may be a possibility that they will suffer from the genetic disease as well .
target: This is because there may be a possibility that they will suffer from the genetic disease as well .

input: grammar: Hence , the individual faces a dilemma whether or not to reveal the test results to them as his family members may not accept the fact and will be adversely affected by the harsh reality .
target: Hence , the individual faces a dilemma of whether or not to reveal the test results to them as his family members may not accept the fact and will be adversely affected by the harsh reality .

input: grammar: Nevertheless , individuals should be obligated to inform his family members of the outcome of the genetic testing as by doing so will have benefits to both parties ; such as providing support to each other and taking careful precautions to reduce risks of infection .
target: Nevertheless , an individual should be obligated to inform his family members of the outcome of the genetic testing as doing so will bring benefits to both parties , such as enabling them to provide support to each other and to take careful precautions to reduce risks of infection .

input: grammar: In face of a possibility of getting an incurable disease that will affect a person for life , it is important that family members can accompany and support him along the journey to fight against the illness .
target: In the face of the possibility of getting an incurable disease that will affect a person for life , it is important that family members can accompany and support him along the journey to fight against the illness .

input: grammar: Furthermore , family members will be more understanding to patients and help them financially , such as providing for their daily expenses and medical costs .
target: Furthermore , family members will tend to be more understanding toward relatives who are ill and help them financially , such as providing for their daily expenses and medical costs .

input: grammar: If patient 's family members are not aware of his condition , he will suffer silently and it is more likely for him to be succumbed upon by the illness .
target: If a patient 's family members are not aware of his condition , he will suffer silently and it is more likely for him to succumb to the illness .

input: grammar: For example , a local celebrity , Chew Chor Meng who is suffering from Kennedy 's disease , has revealed his to his family and the public of his genetic disease .
target: For example , a local celebrity , Chew Chor Meng , who is suffering from Kennedy 's disease , has revealed to his family and the public his genetic disease .

input: grammar: Instead of feeling pessimistic towards life and being discriminated by the public , he has received encouragement from the public and support from his family that has made him more resilient and optimistic in fighting against the disease .
target: Instead of feeling pessimistic towards life and being discriminated against by the public , he has received encouragement from the public and support from his family that has made him more resilient and optimistic in fighting against the disease .

input: grammar: Hence , individuals should be obligated to inform their relatives as it is beneficial for themselves to fight against genetic illnesses effectively .
target: Hence , individuals should be obligated to inform their relatives as it is beneficial for themselves in terms of fighting against genetic illnesses effectively .

input: grammar: Secondly , individuals should inform their relatives as it is their moral responsibility towards them .
target: Secondly , individuals should inform their relatives as it is their moral responsibility towards them .

input: grammar: As there is a saying that , " prevention is always better than cure ; " Relatives who are informed earlier of the genetic results can take earlier health precautions to reduce the risks of infection or the severity of the effects of the disease ( Varga & Sturm , 2008 ) .
target: there is a saying that " prevention is always better than cure ; " relatives who are informed earlier of the carrier 's genetic results can take earlier health precautions to reduce the risks of infection or the severity of the effects of the disease ( Varga & Sturm , 2008 ) .

input: grammar: For instance , they can change their decisions about their lifestyle such as changing bad eating habits , saving money for their future and exercise more frequently .
target: For instance , they can change their lifestyle such as changing bad eating habits , saving money for their future and exercising more frequently .

input: grammar: Even if they do not develop the genetic diseases , the precautions taken at an earlier stage of their lives will benefit them against other forms of illnesses that may not be caused by their genes .
target: Even if they do not develop the genetic diseases , the precautions taken at an earlier stage of their lives may protect them from other forms of illnesses that may not be caused by their genes .

input: grammar: Some may argue that individuals who have undergone genetic testing should not be obligated to inform their relatives for fear that they will lost their privacy and cause their relatives to suffer from emotional burden of feeling guilty and anxious whether they would suffer from the disease .
target: Some may argue that individuals who have undergone genetic testing should not be obligated to inform their relatives for fear that they will lose their privacy and cause their relatives to suffer from the emotional burden of feeling guilty and anxious about whether they would suffer from the disease .

input: grammar: However , there have been laws set up to prevent discrimination against individuals who are suffering from genetic diseases .
target: However , there have been laws set up to prevent discrimination against individuals who suffer from genetic diseases .

input: grammar: For example , the United States Government has implemented the Genetic Information Nondiscrimination Act to prevent individuals from discrimination at work and getting an insurance plan ( Genetics and public policy center , 2009 ) .
target: For example , the United States Government has implemented the Genetic Information Nondiscrimination Act to prevent individuals from discrimination at work and from getting an insurance plan ( Genetics and public policy center , 2009 ) .

input: grammar: Hence , with the governments ' efforts to implement laws to protect individuals ' interests , they should feel assured of their privacy .
target: Hence , with the governments ' efforts to implement laws to protect individuals ' interests , they should feel assured of their privacy .

input: grammar: Moreover , genetic counseling groups have been set up to help affected individuals and their family members to handle their emotional distress through counseling sessions ( Norrgard , 2008 ) .With counseling , trained and professional counselors can provide good advice to individuals to help them make better decisions and to clear misconceptions of genetic testing .
target: Moreover , genetic counseling groups have been set up to help affected individuals and their family members to handle their emotional distress through counseling sessions ( Norrgard , 2008 ) .With counseling , trained and professional counselors can provide good advice to individuals to help them make better decisions and to clear misconceptions of genetic testing .

input: grammar: Eventually , individuals and family members will be able to accept the fact and face it positively .
target: Eventually , individuals and family members will be able to accept the fact and face it positively .

input: grammar: Hence , with a healthy mindset set in their minds , they are more likely to win the battle against their illnesses .
target: with a healthy mindset , they are more likely to win the battle against their illnesses .

input: grammar: In conclusion , individuals should be obligated to inform their relatives of the genetic testing results as they can provide support for each other to overcome the illness more effectively .
target: In conclusion , individuals should be obligated to inform their relatives of their genetic testing results as they can provide support for each other to overcome the illness more effectively .

input: grammar: If they do not do so , relatives who are kept in the dark may suffer more as they do not have the tendency to take earlier precautions to mitigate the effects of the illness .
target: If they do not do so , relatives who are kept in the dark may suffer more as they would not know to take earlier precautions to mitigate the effects of the illness .

input: grammar: Therefore , individuals should inform their loved ones of their situations so that they can help each other through the difficult times .
target: Therefore , individuals should inform their loved ones of their situations so that they can help each other through the difficult times .

input: grammar: Since the completion of the Human Genome Project , scientists have been making many breakthroughs in the study of genetics .
target: Since the completion of the Human Genome Project , scientists have been making many breakthroughs in the study of genetics .

input: grammar: Genes that are responsible for inheritable diseases have since been identified .
target: Genes that are responsible for inheritable diseases have since been identified .

input: grammar: Now , genetic testing is available as a way to detect the presence of such genes in patients .
target: Now , genetic testing is available as a way to detect the presence of such genes in patients .

input: grammar: While the results of such tests may cause much grief and unwarranted panic , should reasons such as this justify the nondisclosure to one 's relatives of a genetic time-bomb which may be inherently inside them ?
target: While the results of such tests may cause much grief and unwarranted panic , should reasons such as this justify the nondisclosure to one 's relatives of a genetic time-bomb which may be inherently inside them ?

input: grammar: Firstly , it is imperative that a carrier of a disease related to genetic disorder tell his or her relatives as soon as possible .
target: Firstly , it is imperative that a carrier of a disease related to genetic disorder tell his or her relatives as soon as possible .

input: grammar: Some of these diseases are curable if treatments are sought early .
target: Some of these diseases are curable if treatments are sought early .

input: grammar: Such is the case for the genetic disorder Phenylketonuria which can be identified by genetic testing .
target: Such is the case for the genetic disorder Phenylketonuria which can be identified by genetic testing .

input: grammar: Infants who inherit this disorder will look perfectly normal during the first 6 months of their birth .
target: Infants who inherit this disorder will look perfectly normal during the first 6 months of their birth .

input: grammar: Failure to identify and treat Phenylketonuria in time however may result in mental illness at later stages of an infant 's life .
target: Failure to identify and treat Phenylketonuria in time , however , may result in mental illness at the later stages of the babies ' life .

input: grammar: ( Schuett , 2008 ) There are some who think that the disclosure of a genetic testing result is unnecessary and they argue that it may bring immense grief and worry to their relatives .
target: ( Schuett , 2008 ) There are some who think that the disclosure of a genetic testing result is unnecessary and they argue that it may bring immense grief and worry to relatives of a genetic disease carrier .

input: grammar: However , without being warned of the possible risk of inheriting these diseases , they would probably not go for their own genetic testing and hence would run the risk of having a late treatment to a disease related to genetic disorder which may have catastrophic consequences .
target: However , without being warned of the possible risk of inheriting these diseases , they would probably not go for their own genetic testing and hence would run the risk of undergoing late treatment for a disease related to a genetic disorder , which may have catastrophic consequences .

input: grammar: Secondly , the choice to undergo genetic testing is a personal one , irregardless of the genetic testing result of another family member .
target: Secondly , the choice to undergo genetic testing is a personal one , regardless of the genetic testing result of another family member .

input: grammar: While carriers of such diseases should reveal their result of their genetic testing so as to warn their relatives , it is still up to the choice of their relatives to find out whether they had truly inherited any genetic disorder basing on the nature of the disorder .
target: While carriers of such diseases should reveal the results of their genetic testing so as to warn their relatives about the possibility of the latter being carriers as well , it is still up to their relatives to find out whether they themselves had indeed inherited any genetic disorder .

input: grammar: ( Norrgard , 2008 ) Since it is never certain that one will inherit a disorder from his or her parents , a disclosure of the result of such a test therefore does not bring any direct harm to one 's relatives .
target: ( Norrgard , 2008 ) Since it is never certain that one will inherit a disorder from one 's parents , the disclosure of the result of such a test would therefore not bring any direct harm to one 's relatives .

input: grammar: In addition , people who disclose their genetic information are worried that they may face genetic discrimination , for instance , when applying for jobs and insurance .
target: In addition , people who disclose their genetic information are worried that they may face genetic discrimination , for instance , when applying for jobs and insurance .

input: grammar: However , laws such as the Genetic Information Nondiscrimination Act ( GINA ) in the United States are passed so as to ensure this would not happen .
target: However , laws such as the Genetic Information Nondiscrimination Act ( GINA ) in the United States have been passed so as to ensure this would not happen .

input: grammar: ( Norrgard , 2008 )
target: ( Norrgard , 2008 )

input: grammar: Admittedly , there are bound to be repercussions arising from the disclosure of such information .
target: Admittedly , there are bound to be repercussions arising from the disclosure of such information .

input: grammar: Inheritance ( in terms of money and assets ) that one will receive is one of the aspects that may be affected by the result of one 's genetic testing result .
target: Inheritance ( in terms of money and assets ) that one will receive is one of the aspects that may be affected by the result of one 's genetic testing result .

input: grammar: For instance , the less healthy child of a rich tycoon may be discriminated in a choice of a successor .
target: For instance , the less healthy child of a rich tycoon may be discriminated in the choice of a successor .

input: grammar: However , should such important information that may potentially save the lives of one 's relatives be withheld due to these personal benefits ?
target: However , should such important information that may potentially save the lives of one 's relatives be withheld due to these personal benefits ?

input: grammar: On the other hand , some are worried that revealing such information to the young may affect their psychological well-being ( Living with , 2009 ) .
target: In addition , some are worried that revealing such information to their offspring may affect the latter 's psychological well-being ( Living with , 2009 ) .

input: grammar: Nonetheless , with proper genetic counseling which is usually accompanied by genetic testing itself , parents may decide the best way to deal with this information .
target: Nonetheless , with proper genetic counseling which is usually accompanied by genetic testing itself , parents may decide the best way to deal with this information .

input: grammar: In conclusion , the result of one 's genetic testing may not only affect oneself , but others too .
target: In conclusion , the result of one 's genetic testing may not only affect oneself , but others too .

input: grammar: If this crucial information is shared among relatives without self-interest , it may even save lives .
target: If this crucial information is shared among relatives without self-interest , it may even save lives .

input: grammar: Although this disclosure may inevitably bring about discrimination in both the family and outside the family , it is certain that concerns with health should outweigh monetary benefits .
target: Although this disclosure may inevitably bring about discrimination in both the family and outside the family , it is certain that concerns with health should outweigh monetary benefits .

input: grammar: Moreover , efforts are made by the government to pass laws such as GINA to prevent genetic discrimination .
target: Moreover , efforts have been made by the government to pass laws such as GINA to prevent genetic discrimination .

input: grammar: Hence , with proper guidance such as genetic counseling , a carrier of a known genetic risk should be obligated to tell his or her relatives .
target: Hence , with proper guidance such as genetic counseling , a carrier of a known genetic risk should be obligated to tell his or her relatives about his genetic test results .

input: grammar: Yet , not everyone might have freedom to do so , fearing that family members might not be able to accept the news .
target: Yet , not everyone might have the freedom to do so , fearing that family members might not be able to accept the news .

input: grammar: However , such decisions only have short-term benefits and fail to consider the bigger picture such as situations which one 's family eventually discovers one 's secret .
target: However , decisions to withhold information on one 's genetic test results only have short-term benefits and fail to consider the bigger picture such as situations in which one 's family eventually discovers one 's secret .

input: grammar: Certainly , that may cause an even bigger heartbreak ( Pelletier , 2005 ) .
target: Certainly , that may cause an even bigger heartbreak ( Pelletier , 2005 ) .
