target: Hence , one should be obligated to break the news early to their relatives .

input: grammar: Earlier disclosure of such information allows the family to provide emotional support when one needs it most .
target: Earlier disclosure of such information allows the family to provide emotional support when one needs it most .

input: grammar: Initially , upon receiving the test results , individuals might exhibit a multitude of reactions ranging from depression to anxiety to anger ( Cancer.net Editorial Board , 2009 ) .
target: Initially , upon receiving the test results , individuals might exhibit a multitude of reactions ranging from depression to anxiety to anger ( Cancer.net Editorial Board , 2009 ) .

input: grammar: This is the time where family support is most essential for one as members can help to share the problem and advise how one should handle the problem .
target: This is the time when family support is most essential for one as members can help to share the problem and advise how one should handle the problem .

input: grammar: However , there are cases which one may not have the liberty to share the information with the family due to the unstable condition of another member .
target: However , there are cases where one may not have the liberty to share the information with the family due to the unstable condition of another member .

input: grammar: One may also resort to this in order not to further burden their loved one .
target: One may also resort to this in order not to further burden that loved one .

input: grammar: However , doing this may result in bigger repercussions when the family member involved finds out and is overwhelmed by the news ( Pelletier , 2005 ) .
target: However , doing this may result in bigger repercussions when the family member involved finds out and is overwhelmed by the news ( Pelletier , 2005 ) .

input: grammar: Hence , it is essential that one should notify one 's family .
target: Hence , it is essential that one should notify one 's family about one 's condition as soon as possible .

input: grammar: Besides being able to receive family support , letting others know is also a form of relieving unnecessary stress .
target: Besides being able to receive family support , letting others know about one 's genetic condition is also a form of relieving unnecessary stress .

input: grammar: Conversely , keeping such important secrets to oneself , in the long run it might actually develop into stress which may exacerbate their current condition and trigger certain stress-induced illnesses such as cancer to develop ( Morin & Huot , 2004 ) .
target: Conversely , keeping such important secrets to oneself in the long run might actually develop into stress which may exacerbate one 's current condition and trigger certain stress-induced illnesses such as cancer ( Morin & Huot , 2004 ) .

input: grammar: Critics however may feel that individuals may get discriminated even within family which may be a source of stress for one ( Wolff , 1996 ) .
target: Critics may feel that individuals may get discriminated even within their which may be a source of stress for them ( Wolff , 1996 ) .

input: grammar: Consequently , a disadvantageous situation is created instead of a beneficial one .
target: Consequently , a disadvantageous situation is created instead of a beneficial one .

input: grammar: Nonetheless , not all families are unloving .
target: Nonetheless , not all families are unloving .

input: grammar: Hence more often than not , one should be frank with one 's family and not withhold any results from the genetic test .
target: Hence more often than not , one should be frank with one 's family and not withhold any results of the genetic test .

input: grammar: Early disclosure also allows relatives to take early precautions ( Cancer.net Editorial Board , 2009 ) and prevent themselves from succumbing to the disease as well .
target: Early disclosure also allows relatives to take early precautions ( Cancer.net Editorial Board , 2009 ) and prevent themselves from succumbing to the disease as well .

input: grammar: An example would be one 's family shifting from their usual unhealthy diet to a healthier one .
target: An example of such precautions is to have one 's family shifting from their usual unhealthy diet to a healthier one .

input: grammar: As such , one 's family may be 'empowered ' ( Cancer.net Editorial Board , 2009 ) to make apt decisions which reduce the risk of developing the illness .
target: As such , one 's family may be 'empowered ' ( Cancer.net Editorial Board , 2009 ) to make apt decisions which reduce the risk of developing the illness .

input: grammar: However , even though the disclosure empowers one 's relatives take precaution measures , it might end up causing an increased anxiety among family members ( Cancer.net Editorial Board , 2009 ) .
target: Some note that even though the disclosure empowers one 's relatives to take precautionary measures , it might end up causing anxiety among family members ( Cancer.net Editorial Board , 2009 ) .

input: grammar: In spite of this , some form of prevention may be better than none at all .
target: In spite of this , some form of prevention may be better than none at all .

input: grammar: As the saying goes , " prevention is better than cure " .
target: As the saying goes , " prevention is better than cure " .

target: Thus , it is crucial that one should tell one 's family about his genetic condition .

input: grammar: There are certain disorders that exist such that they would have adverse effects on the health of individuals .
target: There are certain disorders that exist that have adverse effects on the health of individuals .

input: grammar: Genetic testing is then carried out to determine if a person carries genes for certain inherited disorders .
target: Genetic testing is then carried out to determine if a person carries genes for certain inherited disorders .

input: grammar: Of course , if the disorder is treatable , one would not worry so much about the consequences .
target: Of course , if the disorder is treatable , one would not worry so much about the consequences .

input: grammar: However , if the disorder turns out to be non-treatable , the ethical issue as to whether the carrier of the known genetic risk is obligated to tell his or her relatives arises .
target: However , if the disorder turns out to be non-treatable , the ethical issue as to whether the carrier of the known genetic risk is obligated to tell his or her relatives arises .

input: grammar: Privacy and discrimination supports the fact that the carrier should not be obliged to disclose the information to his relatives .
target: The issues of privacy and discrimination support the position that the carrier should not be obliged to disclose the information to his relatives .

input: grammar: Firstly , a carrier should not be obligated to disclose information to his relatives as he has the individual rights as a patient to privacy .
target: Firstly , a carrier should not be obligated to disclose his genetic to his relatives as he has the individual right as a patient to privacy .

input: grammar: Privacy plays a very important role in a person 's life as it " helps individuals maintain autonomy and individuality " ( Privacilla.org , February 12 2001 ) .
target: Privacy plays a very important role in a person 's life as it " helps individuals maintain autonomy and individuality " ( Privacilla.org , February 12 2001 ) .

input: grammar: Everyone has his own rights to decide whether their personal information should be revealed to third parties .
target: Everyone has his own right to decide whether his personal information should be revealed to third parties .

input: grammar: Without privacy , the person would feel violated as he does not have the right to withhold his information of his disorder .
target: Without the right to protect his privacy through withholding genetic information of his disorder , the person would feel violated .

input: grammar: Therefore , the carrier should not feel obliged to reveal his disorder .
target: Therefore , the carrier should not feel obliged to reveal his disorder .

input: grammar: Secondly , discrimination from the relatives affects the carrier 's decision in revealing his condition .
target: Secondly , discrimination from relatives affects the carrier 's decision in revealing his condition .

input: grammar: One might never know how the relatives would react upon knowing the condition of the carrier .
target: One might never know how one 's relatives would react upon knowing the condition of the carrier .

input: grammar: The reactions can be extreme , either keeping a distance away from him or sharing the pain together with the carrier .
target: The reactions can be extreme , either keeping a distance away from him or sharing the pain together with the carrier .

input: grammar: For example , some relatives would have the thinking that the genetic risk of the carrier would bring about bad reputation to them and they would start to distant themselves and try to lose all contact from him .
target: For example , some relatives would have the thinking that the genetic risk of the carrier would bring about a bad reputation to them so they may start to distance themselves and try to eliminate all contact with him .

input: grammar: Discrimination has been found to have harmful effects on people such as a high risk depression .
target: Discrimination has been found to have harmful effects on people such as putting them at a high risk of depression .

input: grammar: It is already bad for a carrier to have a genetic risk , it would be much worse if depression strikes him .
target: It is already bad for a carrier to have a genetic risk ; it would be much worse if depression strikes him .

input: grammar: Thus a carrier should not be obligated in telling his relatives about his genetic risk .
target: Thus , a carrier should not be obligated to tell his relatives about his genetic risk .

input: grammar: Admittedly , " a conflict between the well-being of the relatives could occur " and so , a carrier should be obligated to tell his relatives about his genetic risk as the information could be of importance to them ( World Health Organization ) .
target: Admittedly , " a conflict between the well-being of the relatives could occur " and so , a carrier should be obligated to tell his relatives about his genetic risk as the information could be of importance to them ( World Health Organization ) .

input: grammar: " The genetic relative could adopt preventive health measures if he or she knew the test result " ( Bioethics Advisory Committee Singapore , November 2005 ) .
target: ( Bioethics Advisory Committee Singapore , November 2005 ) .

input: grammar: However , time is the important aspect as one has to think of the consequences before revealing .
target: However , timing is important so one should think of the consequences before revealing one 's genetic condition .

input: grammar: For example , " if a woman discovers she has a disorder and her sister is pregnant " ( Nuffield Council on Bioethics , December 1993 ) .
target: For example , " if a woman discovers she has a disorder and her sister is pregnant " ( Nuffield Council on Bioethics , December 1993 ) .

input: grammar: It would not be the right time to disclose to her pregnant sister as it may affect her foetus .
target: It would not be the right time to her genetic condition to her pregnant sister as the anxiety caused may affect the foetus .

input: grammar: Hence , a carrier should not be obliged to tell his relatives about his genetic disorder .
target: Hence , a carrier should not be obliged to tell his relatives about his genetic disorder .

input: grammar: In conclusion , it is the social and emotional aspects that affect the carrier 's decision on whether or not he should make known his genetic risk to his family members .
target: In conclusion , it is the social and emotional aspects that affect the carrier 's decision on whether or not he should make known his genetic risk to his family members .

input: grammar: Time is also an important factor just like the phrase " the right time " goes .
target: Timing is also an important factor .

input: grammar: Thus , a carrier should not be obligated to tell his relatives about his genetic risk .
target: Thus , a carrier should not be obligated to tell his relatives about his genetic risk .

input: grammar: The controversy of whether carriers of a known genetic risk should be obligated to tell his or her relatives has been highly debated within the bioethics community ( Mehlman , 2009 ) .
target: The controversy of whether a carrier of a known genetic risk should be obligated to tell his or her relatives has been highly debated within the bioethics community ( Mehlman , 2009 ) .

input: grammar: Individuals may choose not to reveal their positive test results to their relatives after taking the test , as they fear that their family will not be able to cope with the pressure since they are potentially at risk as well ( Haidle , 2005 ) .
target: Individuals may choose not to reveal their positive test results to their relatives after taking the test , as they fear that their family will not be able to cope with the pressure since they are potentially at risk as well ( Haidle , 2005 ) .

input: grammar: However , revealing the results may have some positive effects to both individuals and their family psychologically and physically ( Chang & Haber , 2007 ) .
target: However , revealing the results may have some positive effects to both individuals and their family psychologically and physically ( Chang & Haber , 2007 ) .

input: grammar: In addition , families can also help in reducing the risk of the next generation .
target: In addition , families can also help in reducing the risk for the next generation .

input: grammar: Therefore , I agree that carriers of a known genetic risk should be obligated to tell their family .
target: Therefore , I agree that carriers of a known genetic risk should be obligated to tell their family .

input: grammar: Firstly , revealing the results to their family can have a positive psychological effect to the individuals .
target: Firstly , revealing the results to their family can have a positive psychological effect on the individual .

input: grammar: After upon receiving the bad news from the test , individuals may feel discouraged and have a negative view of life , especially those who have family history of relatives who did not survive the disorder , for example , ovarian cancer ( Haidle , 2005 ) .
target: Upon receiving the bad news from the test , individuals may feel discouraged and have a negative view of life . This is for those who have a family history of relatives who did not survive the disorder such as ovarian cancer ( Haidle , 2005 ) .

input: grammar: This will further worsen and hasten their condition ( Chang & Haber , 2007 ) .
target: This will further worsen and hasten their condition ( Chang & Haber , 2007 ) .

input: grammar: By talking to their relatives about their genetic risk , they will gain support and encouragement .
target: By talking to their relatives about their genetic risk , they will gain support and encouragement .

input: grammar: Studies have shown that by sharing the results , individuals will actually feel better as compared to those who keep mum ( Mallet , 2009 ) .
target: Studies have shown that by sharing the results , individuals will actually feel better as compared to those who keep mum ( Mallet , 2009 ) .

input: grammar: It is further substantiated with cases of mothers sharing their ovarian and breast cancer positive results with their children .
target: It is further substantiated with cases of mothers sharing their ovarian and breast cancer positive results with their children .

input: grammar: According to Scientific Blogging , statistics show that only nine percent of the mothers received negative responses while most of them received very encouraging responses ( News Staff , 2009 ) .
target: According to Scientific Blogging , statistics show that only nine percent of the mothers received negative responses while most of them received very encouraging responses ( 2009 ) .

input: grammar: Scientific Blogging is a reliable website where news articles about scientific facts can be found .
target: Scientific Blogging is a reliable website where news articles about scientific facts can be found .

input: grammar: Opponents may argue that it may not be necessary for individuals to tell their relatives their results since it 's their choice and there is no legal law that says that those who took the test must inform their family the results ( Norrgard , 2008 ) .
target: Opponents may argue that it may not be necessary for individuals to tell their relatives their results since it 's their choice and there is no legal law that says that those who took the test must inform their family the results ( Norrgard , 2008 ) .

input: grammar: However , if individuals do not choose to reveal , the potential side-effects and psychological burden may cause severe consequences , such as worsening the condition ( Chang & Haber , 2007 ) .
target: However , if individuals do not choose to reveal , the potential side-effects and psychological burden may cause severe consequences , such as worsening the condition ( Chang & Haber , 2007 ) .

input: grammar: Therefore , it is essential to share their results with their family for their own psychological benefits .
target: Therefore , it is essential to share their results with their family for their own psychological benefits .

input: grammar: Secondly , by telling their family their results , their family will tend to be more health conscious since they will understand that they are potentially at risk too .
target: Secondly , by telling their family their results , their family will tend to be more health conscious since they will understand that they are potentially at risk too .

input: grammar: In some cases , maintaining a balanced lifestyle can reduce the risk of getting the disorder as well ( Rahman , 2009 ) .
target: In some cases , maintaining a balanced lifestyle can reduce the risk of getting the disorder as well ( Rahman , 2009 ) .

input: grammar: If the results are not told , families that have a higher risk may not alter their lifestyle to prevent the genetic disorder that might be prevented .
target: If the results are not told , families that have a higher risk may not alter their lifestyle to prevent the genetic disorder that might be prevented .

input: grammar: In addition , if only one parent has a genetic disorder , the offspring will have a fifty percent chance of getting ( Mehlman , 1999 ) .
target: In addition , if only one parent has a genetic disorder , the offspring will have a fifty percent chance of getting it ( Mehlman , 1999 ) .

input: grammar: This means that there 's a fair chance to prevent the potential disorder .
target: This means that there 's a fair chance to prevent the potential disorder .

input: grammar: By not telling this important information about the family having a risk of getting the same disorder , it 's like denying the right to life .
target: By not telling this important information about the family having a risk of getting the same disorder , it 's like denying the right to life .

input: grammar: According to the United Nations ' " Right to life " , Article 10 , " States Parties reaffirm that every human being has the inherent right to life and shall take all necessary measures to ensure its effective enjoyment .
target: According to the United Nations ' " Right to life " , Article 10 , " States Parties reaffirm that every human being has the inherent right to life and shall take all necessary measures to ensure its effective enjoyment .

input: grammar: " ( United Nations , 1948 ) .
grammar: Denying that piece of information about the well being of the family may become a violation to the right to life .
target: Denying that piece of information about the well being of the family may become a violation to the right to life .

input: grammar: Opponents may argue that individuals should not be obliged to tell their family as this will save them a lot of pressure and stress .
target: Opponents may argue that individuals should not be obliged to tell their family as this will save them a lot of pressure and stress .

input: grammar: Indeed , knowing that one has a higher risk of a genetic disorder is stressful and painful , however , through appropriate counseling and leading a healthy lifestyle , the chance of not getting the disorder is relatively high ( Haidle , 2005 ) .
target: Indeed , knowing that one has a higher risk of a genetic disorder is stressful and painful , however , through appropriate counseling and leading a healthy lifestyle , the chance of not getting the disorder is relatively high ( Haidle , 2005 ) .

input: grammar: Therefore , for the physical well being of the whole family , it is best to let the family know the condition .
target: Therefore , for the physical well being of the whole family , it is best to let the family know the condition .

input: grammar: Lastly , by telling the results , families can reduce the chances of the next generation from getting the genetic disorder .
target: Lastly , by telling the results , families can reduce the chances of the next generation from getting the genetic disorder .

input: grammar: Methods like assisted reproductive technology ( ART ) can be used to ensure only unaffected embryos were allowed to develop to term ( Norrgard , 2008 ) .
target: Methods like assisted reproductive technology ( ART ) can be used to ensure that only unaffected embryos are allowed to develop to term ( Norrgard , 2008 ) .

input: grammar: In this way , the chances of the next generation of getting the same genetic disorder will be significantly reduced .
target: In this way , the chances of the next generation of getting the same genetic disorder will be significantly reduced .

input: grammar: Without revealing the results , the family may not be aware of the potential genetic condition .
target: Without revealing the results , the family may not be aware of the potential genetic condition .

input: grammar: Despite this benefit , opponents may argue that some disorder might not affect the rest of the family , so it is not necessary to inform the relatives ( Mehlman , 1999 ) .
target: Despite this benefit , opponents may argue that some disorder might not affect the rest of the family , so it is not necessary to inform the relatives ( Mehlman , 1999 ) .

input: grammar: However , if carriers of genetic disorder , such as HIV , do not tell their family , their family , especially their spouse may have a potential risk of infection unknowingly .
target: However , if carriers of genetic disorder , such as HIV , do not tell their family , the spouse spouse may have a potential risk of infection unknowingly .

input: grammar: Thus , carriers should at least tell their spouse their condition , so that the family as well as the next generation can be protected .
target: Thus , carriers should at least tell their spouse their condition , so that the family as well as the next generation can be protected .

input: grammar: To conclude , revealing of the positive results is essential to help not only the carriers , but also their family psychologically and physically .
target: To conclude , revealing of the positive results is essential to help not only the carriers , but also their family psychologically and physically .

input: grammar: In addition , they can prevent the next generation from getting the same disorder as well .
target: In addition , they can prevent the next generation from getting the same disorder as well .

input: grammar: Though the decision is made ultimately by the individuals , I think that it is necessary for them to inform their family .
target: Though the decision is made ultimately by the individuals , I think it is necessary for them to inform their family .

input: grammar: In recent years of the 21st century , a vast majority of people has arrived at a similar cognitional conjunction of the general idea of genetic testing , which is extensively portrayed as an effective technique to identify crime suspects or catastrophe victims in various popular " crime scene investigation " television programmes .
target: In recent years of the 21st century , a vast majority of people have arrived at a similar cognitional conjunction of the general idea of genetic testing , which is extensively portrayed as an effective technique to identify crime suspects or catastrophe victims in various popular " crime scene investigation " television programmes .

input: grammar: However , the varieties and significance of genetic testing are well understated .
target: However , the varieties and significance of genetic testing are well understated .

input: grammar: Genetic testing has become an increasingly adopted form of medical checkup through means of diagnosing an individual 's vulnerabilities to inherited diseases upon detection of genes and chromosomes mutation ( Guttmacher , 2009 ) .
target: Genetic testing has become an increasingly adopted form of medical checkup through means of diagnosing an individual 's vulnerabilities to inherited diseases upon detection of genes and chromosomes mutation ( Guttmacher , 2009 ) .

input: grammar: If confirmed as the carrier of a particular genetic mutation or having increased risk of developing an inherited disease , those unfortunate subjects are not only instantaneously overwhelmed by negative emotions but also subjected to distress and burdensome in considering the consequences of their health conditions on their family members .
target: If confirmed as the carrier of a particular genetic mutation or having increased risk of developing an inherited disease , those unfortunate subjects are not only instantaneously overwhelmed by negative emotions but also subjected to distress and burdens in considering the consequences of their health conditions on their family members .

input: grammar: Various ethical and social complications arise from the differential opts of those inflicted subjects , to tell or not tell their families or relatives about the positive results of the genetic diagnosis .
target: Various ethical and social complications arise from the different options for the inflicted subjects such as to tell or not tell their families or relatives about the positive results of the genetic diagnosis .

input: grammar: Considering the genetically affected individual 's need of additional care and companion as well as the early detection of similar inherited disorder amongst their blood relatives , an individual of known genetic risk ought to disclose the results of genetic testing to their close relatives .
target: Considering the genetically affected individual 's need of additional care and companionship as well as the early detection of similar inherited disorder amongst their blood relatives , an individual of known genetic risk ought to disclose the results of genetic testing to his close relatives .

input: grammar: As accepting the occurrence or increased risk of developing genetic disorders is rather emotionally burdensome , affected patients should reveal the truth to their family members who are able to provide additional care and companion .
target: As accepting the occurrence or increased risk of developing genetic disorders is rather emotionally burdensome , affected patients should reveal the truth to their family members who are able to provide additional care and companionship .

input: grammar: Emotional outcomes after predictive genetic testing such as increased measures of anxiety , anger , depression , guilt and redemptive adjustments are psychologically destructive ( Davies , Donnai , MacLeod , McAllister , Nicholls & Payne , 2007 ) .
target: Emotional outcomes after predictive genetic testing such as increased measures of anxiety , anger , depression , guilt and redemptive adjustments are psychologically destructive ( Davies , Donnai , MacLeod , McAllister , Nicholls & Payne , 2007 ) .

input: grammar: Moreover , scientific researches provide substantial evidences showing that the frequency of catastrophic outcomes such as suicide , attempted suicide and psychiatric hospitalization are significantly higher amongst those receiving Huntington 's disease predictive-testing results ( Almqvist , Bloch , Brinkman , Craufurd & Hayden , 1999 ) .
target: Moreover , scientific researches provide substantial evidence showing that the frequency of catastrophic outcomes such as suicide , attempted suicide and psychiatric hospitalization are significantly higher amongst those receiving Huntington 's disease predictive-testing results ( Almqvist , Bloch , Brinkman , Craufurd & Hayden , 1999 ) .

input: grammar: The devastative psychological effects on risk-prone individuals can be reduced if family members show moral support and intensive care .
target: The devastative psychological effects on risk-prone individuals can be reduced if family members show moral support and intensive care .

input: grammar: In fact , the risk and severity of certain adult onset genetic disorders can be alleviated by preventative measures and treatments .
target: In fact , the risk and severity of certain adult onset genetic disorders can be alleviated by preventative measures and treatments .

input: grammar: With the company and cooperation of family members , constructive lifestyle modification such as adopting healthy diet , exercising as well as reducing alcohol and cigarette consumption can be easily implemented .
target: With the company and cooperation of family members , constructive lifestyle modification such as adopting healthy diet , exercising as well as reducing alcohol and cigarette consumption can be easily implemented .

input: grammar: Thus , revealing one 's genetic condition to family members are proven to be an anecdote to sufferings from psychological pressures more beneficiary as compared to concealing the truth .
target: Thus , revealing one 's genetic condition to family members are proven to be beneficial and alleviate psychological pressure as compared to concealing the truth .

input: grammar: In addition , to inform family and relatives of one self 's unfavourable genetic conditions is an act of responsibility and care by which similar genetic testing can be executed for early detection and treatments .
target: In addition , to inform family and relatives of one unfavourable genetic conditions is an act of responsibility and care by which similar genetic testing can be executed for early detection and treatments .

input: grammar: As the terminology implies , genetically inherited diseases are caused by gene or chromosomes abnormality received from antecedents and passed on to following generations .
target: As the terminology implies , genetically inherited diseases are caused by gene or chromosomes abnormality received from antecedents and passed on to following generations .

input: grammar: The possibilities of other family members and blood relatives carrying similar gene mutation are relatively higher when a family history of the particular genetic disorder is detected .
target: The possibilities of other family members and blood relatives carrying similar gene mutation are relatively higher when a family history of the particular genetic disorder is detected .

input: grammar: The likelihood of the family members and relatives to definitively develop similar genetic disease is hard to estimate due to the influences of different inheritance conditions such as autosomal dominant , autosomal recessive , X-linked dominant and X-linked recessive ( Joaquina , 2009 ) .
target: The likelihood of the family members and relatives to definitively develop similar genetic disease is hard to estimate due to the influences of different inheritance conditions such as autosomal dominant , autosomal recessive , X-linked dominant and X-linked recessive ( Joaquina , 2009 ) .

input: grammar: Moreover , a healthy person not showing any corresponding symptoms of the genetic disease might be the carrier of gene mutation , which might bring about equivalent harmfulness to successive offspring .
target: Moreover , a healthy person not showing any corresponding symptoms of the genetic disease might be the carrier of gene mutation , which might bring about equivalent harmfulness to successive offspring .

input: grammar: Hence , alerting these potential disease carriers is essential such that similar genetic testing can be done , either to rule out any possibilities of carrying that particular DNA mutation or to detect the chances of developing the genetic disorder and apply treatments or preventative measures as early as possible .
target: Hence , alerting these potential disease carriers is essential such that similar genetic testing can be done , either to rule out any possibilities of carrying that particular DNA mutation or to detect the chances of developing the genetic disorder and apply treatments or preventative measures as early as possible .

input: grammar: All in all , carriers have to consider beyond personal concerns and fulfil obligations to inform family members and relatives about their genetic disorders for early detection , prevention and cure .
target: All in all , carriers have to consider beyond personal concerns and fulfil obligations to inform family members and relatives about their genetic disorders for early detection , prevention and cure .

input: grammar: In conclusion , all genetic test participants carrying genetic risk should be obligated to reveal the test results to their family and relatives .
target: In conclusion , all genetic test participants carrying genetic risk should be obligated to reveal the test results to their family and relatives .

input: grammar: After knowing the health conditions of the affected individuals , their family members are able to show extra concern and cooperation in adopting healthier lifestyles , thus relieving their emotional distress and reducing the risk of them committing catastrophic behaviours .
target: After knowing the health conditions of the affected individuals , their family members are able to show extra concern and cooperation in adopting healthier lifestyles , thus relieving their emotional distress and reducing the risk of them committing catastrophic behaviours .

input: grammar: Besides that , family members and close relatives of the affected individual will benefit greatly by participating in similar genetic testing and detecting the genetic disorder as soon as possible for early treatment .
target: Besides that , family members and close relatives of the affected individual will benefit greatly by participating in similar genetic testing and detecting the genetic disorder as soon as possible for early treatment .

input: grammar: Hence , it is undeniably crucial for carriers of genetic diseases to treat the disclosure of genetic test results to their family members and relatives as an obligation to fulfil .
target: Hence , it is undeniably crucial for carriers of genetic diseases to treat the disclosure of genetic test results to their family members and relatives as an obligation to fulfil .

target: Furthermore , Procter ( 2002 ) also points out that the concern of withholding the genetic information is the age of the individual .

input: grammar: However , individuals ' decisions can be influenced by the fear of developing an inherited genetic disorder and the negative genetic results as a result of avoiding close relationships with their family members ( Procter 2002 ) .

target: An important reason why a carrier of a known genetic risk should be obligated to reveal the testing result to relevant third party is that it would help early detection of genetic diseases within the family members .

input: grammar: This would then lead to necessary treatment to save lives .
target: This would then lead to necessary treatment to save lives .

target: In the case of breast cancer , recent studies show that women who suffer from breast cancer would have an increased likelihood of a sister to get the same disease ( EverythingAboutBreastCancer , 2009 ) .

input: grammar: American Cancer Society ( 2005 ) also reveals that 5 % -10 % of the breast cancer patients inherit the mutated genes of BRCA1 and BRCA2 from their first degree relatives .
target: American Cancer Society ( 2005 ) also reveals that 5 % -10 % of the breast cancer patients inherit the mutated genes of BRCA1 and BRCA2 from their first degree relatives .

input: grammar: Since there is no symptom of such disease in the early and most treatable stage , revealing of testing result by the carrier would alert the relevant third party to undergo similar testing and receive necessary treatments if it is a positive result .
target: Since there is no symptom of such disease in the early and most treatable stage , revealing of testing result by the carrier would alert the relevant third party to undergo similar testing and receive necessary treatment if it is a positive result .

target: Some may argue that the third party should have done regular check up to monitor personal health condition instead of starting to do so when there is a carrier in the family .

input: grammar: However , self-examine has low accuracy in detection of breast cancer while other method like mammography is only meant for women who age 40 years old and above ( georgiahealthinfo.gov , n.d. ) .
target: However , self-examination has low accuracy in detection of breast cancer while other methods like mammography is only meant for women aged 40 years old and above ( georgiahealthinfo.gov , n.d. ) .

input: grammar: Another relevant point is that obligation to reveal the testing result to the relatives does play a part in helping them to make important life decisions .
target: Another relevant point is that obligation to reveal the testing result to the relatives does play a part in helping them to make important life decisions .

input: grammar: Genetic result is also desired by the relatives and potential mate if the carrier is carrying mutated gene that can cause death .
target: Genetic result is also desired by the relatives and potential mate if the carrier is carrying mutated gene that can cause death .

input: grammar: For instance , Huntington 's disease is a fatal autosomal dominant disease , which is caused by the death of neurons in certain regions of the brain .
target: For instance , Huntington 's disease is a fatal autosomal dominant disease , which is caused by the death of neurons in certain regions of the brain .

input: grammar: With the advent of advancements in medicine and technology over the recent years , the power of medicine in influencing human procreation has strengthened especially in the area of genetic testing .
target: With the advent of advancements in medicine and technology over the recent years , the power of medicine in influencing human procreation has strengthened especially in the area of genetic testing .

input: grammar: Genetic testing is a technique to examine genes or markers near the genes , chromosomes and proteins to test the signs of a disease or disorder in DNA .
target: Genetic testing is a technique to examine genes or markers near the genes , chromosomes and proteins to test the signs of a disease or disorder in DNA .

input: grammar: Test samples are usually taken from a person 's blood , body fluids or tissues .
target: Test samples are usually taken from a person 's blood , body fluids or tissues .

input: grammar: Genetic testing provides us with information that if someone has a symptom ; shows whether a person is a carrier for a genetic disease ; help expectant parents know whether an unborn child will have a genetic disease etc ( Access Excellence @ National Health Museum ) .
target: Genetic testing provides us with information whether someone has a symptom ; shows whether a person is a carrier for a genetic disease ; helps expectant parents know whether an unborn child will have a genetic disease etc ( Access Excellence @ National Health Museum ) .

input: grammar: The definition of a genetic carrier is a person that has inherited a genetic trait or mutation but does not show the symptoms of the disease ( Wikipedia ) .
target: The definition of a genetic carrier is a person that has inherited a genetic trait or mutation but does not show the symptoms of the disease ( Wikipedia ) .

input: grammar: There are many types of genetic diseases such as the Down Syndrome , Huntington 's disease , cystic fibrosis , hemophilia A , and hereditary breast and ovarian cancer .
target: There are many types of genetic diseases such as Down Syndrome , Huntington 's disease , cystic fibrosis , hemophilia A , and hereditary breast and ovarian cancer .

input: grammar: However , genetic testing has raises numerous ethical issues ; one of them concerning consent and confidentiality of the tested individual identified to be a carrier of a known genetic risk .
target: However , genetic testing has raised numerous ethical issues , one of them concerning consent and confidentiality of the tested individual identified to be a carrier of a known genetic risk .

input: grammar: Although it is the individual 's right to choose not to disclose their genetic information to his or her relatives , in my opinion , he or she is obligated and responsible to disclose the said genetic information for several reasons .
target: Although it is the individual 's right to choose not to disclose their genetic information to his or her relatives , in my opinion , he or she is obligated and responsible to disclose the said genetic information for several reasons .

input: grammar: Firstly , it is important for a carrier of a known genetic risk to disclose his or her genetic information to family members as the latter may be at risk of having the same genetic disorder .
target: Firstly , it is important for a carrier of a known genetic risk to disclose his or her genetic information to family members as the latter may be at risk of having the same genetic disorder .

input: grammar: Whether an individual with the genetic disease choose to disclose the genetic information to the family members depends on how they gauge the risks and benefits of revealing the truth , their sense of responsibility towards them and most importantly how it affects them ( Agatha & Angst 2009 ) .
target: Whether an individual with the genetic disease chooses to disclose the genetic information to the family members depends on how they gauge the risks and benefits of revealing the truth , their sense of responsibility towards them and most importantly how it affects them ( Agatha & Angst , 2009 ) .

input: grammar: It is understood that individuals who carry the disease do not wish to reveal his or her genetic results due to privacy issues or fear that their family members are not ready to accept it .
target: It is understood that individuals who carry the disease do not wish to reveal their genetic results due to privacy issues or fear that their family members are not ready to accept it .

input: grammar: However , by not sharing the information , they are posing a danger to their family members potentially at risk of carrying the disease .
target: However , by not sharing the information , they are posing a danger to their family members potentially at risk of carrying the disease .

input: grammar: For example , strenuous exercise can cause sudden death in people with genetic diseases such as hypertrophic cardiomyopathy ( Agatha &Angst 2009 ) .
target: For example , strenuous exercise can cause sudden death in people with genetic diseases such as hypertrophic cardiomyopathy ( Agatha & Angst , 2009 ) .

input: grammar: It is inherited as an autosomal dominant trait therefore it is high possibility that if an individual tested positive , his or her siblings would has one in two chance of carrying the same genetic mutation .
target: It is inherited as an autosomal dominant trait ; therefore there is high possibility that if an individual tested positive , his or her siblings would have one in two chance of carrying the same genetic mutation .

input: grammar: Thus , it is obligate to notify relatives so that early recognition and treatment of the disease , if present , can be done .
target: Thus , it is obligatory to notify relatives so that early recognition and treatment of the disease , if present , can be done .

input: grammar: To share one 's genetic results to relatives also in a way protect their own safety at work or any other situations .
target: To share one 's genetic results with relatives also in a way protects their own safety at work or any other situations .

input: grammar: This is so as in some workplaces , such as factories or laboratories that deal with chemical substances , will increase the susceptibility to the toxic or carcinogenic effects of environmental agents of a person having genetic disorders ( Andre & Velasquez , 2008 ) .
target: This is so as in some workplaces , such as factories or laboratories that deal with chemical substances , will increase the susceptibility to the toxic or carcinogenic effects of environmental agents of a person having genetic disorders ( Andre & Velasquez , 2008 ) .

input: grammar: For example , individuals who carry the sickle cell trait may increase the risk of sickle cell anaemia if exposed to carbon monoxide or cyanide .
target: For example , individuals who carry the sickle cell trait may increase the risk of sickle cell anaemia if exposed to carbon monoxide or cyanide .

input: grammar: Also , for those people who are carriers of thalassemia when exposed to lead or benzene , it is hazardous to their health and causes adverse effects .
target: Also , when those people who are carriers of thalassemia are exposed to lead or benzene , it is hazardous to their health and causes adverse effects .

input: grammar: By revealing their genetic testing results to their relatives , their family members will be able to help them take note of what he or she should avoid and assess the occupational risks at their workplace .
target: By revealing their genetic testing results to their relatives , their family members will be able to help them take note of what they should avoid and assess the occupational risks at their workplace .

input: grammar: Thus , an individual with known genetic risk should be obligated to tell his or her relatives to protect themselves from potential dangerous environments and ensure their personal safety .
target: Thus , an individual with known genetic risk should be obligated to tell his or her relatives to protect themselves from potentially dangerous environments and ensure their personal safety .

input: grammar: However , some argue that individual right to consent , privacy and confidentiality are important and it is the individual 's decision whether to disclose personal genetic results to relatives or otherwise .
target: However , some argue that individual right to consent , privacy and confidentiality are important and it is the individual 's decision whether to disclose personal genetic results to relatives or otherwise .

input: grammar: There is also a legal requirement , the privacy rule of the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act of 1996 that the health care providers have to respect and protect patients ' privacy of health information ( Agatha & Angst 2009 ) .
target: There is also a legal requirement , the privacy rule of the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act of 1996 that the health care providers have to respect and protect patients ' privacy of health information ( Agatha & Angst , 2009 ) .

input: grammar: However , this legal requirement is decided on a case-to- case basis as there are situations that a clinician may consider necessary intervention ; that is , notifying their family members for some life- threatening cases .
target: However , this legal requirement is decided on a case-by-case basis as there are situations when a clinician may consider necessary intervention , that is , notifying their family members for some life- threatening cases .

input: grammar: For example , individuals with mutations that predispose them to malignant hyperthermia may die if they were under the use of certain surgical anaesthesia ( Agatha & Angst 2009 ) .
target: For example , individuals with mutations that predispose them to malignant hyperthermia may die if they were under the use of certain surgical anaesthesia ( Agatha & Angst , 2009 ) .

input: grammar: Hence , it is important to notify relatives to let them know the risk and they could seek early treatment to prevent the risk and danger .
target: Hence , it is important to notify relatives to let them know the risk and they could seek early treatment to prevent the risk and danger .

input: grammar: In conclusion , the carrier of a known genetic risk should be obligated to tell his or her relatives to protect his or her family 's health as well as protecting his or hers ' own safety .
target: In conclusion , the carrier of a known genetic risk should be obligated to tell his or her relatives to protect his or her family 's health as well as protect his or her own safety .

input: grammar: Nowadays , as scientific advances are no longer a norm , our understanding of genes and how they affect our health and cause diseases has deepened .
target: Nowadays , , our understanding of genes and how they affect our health and cause diseases has deepened .

input: grammar: A diagnostic test capable of identifying diseases causing genes known as genetic testing was developed along with our knowledge on gene .
target: A diagnostic test capable of identifying diseases causing genes known as genetic testing was developed along with our knowledge on genes .

input: grammar: Just like property rights , the result of genetic testing should belong to the owner .
target: Just like property rights , the result of genetic testing should belong to the owner .

input: grammar: Individuals who undergo the test should therefore have the rights to decide whether the result should be disclosed to a third party since public access to the result can yield undesirable consequences .
target: Individuals who undergo the test should therefore have the rights to decide whether the result should be disclosed to a third party since public access to the result can yield undesirable consequences .

input: grammar: The disclosure of genetic test result , particularly a result that shows a person has a risk of getting a certain diseases or disorder will lead to social discrimination during employment and during purchase of insurance .
target: The disclosure of a genetic test result , particularly a result that shows a person has a risk of getting a certain diseases or disorder will lead to social discrimination during employment and during purchase of insurance .

input: grammar: Therefore , an individual should not be obliged to notify a third party , even his relatives , about his test result .
target: Therefore , an individual should not be obliged to notify a third party , even his relatives , about his test result .

input: grammar: Furthermore , according to the Universal declaration of Human Rights , an individual holds the rights to decide what he wants to do with the result .
target: Furthermore , according to the Universal declaration of Human Rights , an individual holds the rights to decide what he wants to do with the result .

input: grammar: In addition , there are three vulnerable groups of people in our society that requires protection if they were to undergo genetic testing .
target: In addition , there are three vulnerable groups of people in our society that require protection if they were to undergo genetic testing .

input: grammar: They are the children , adolescents and mentally impaired .
target: They are the children , adolescents and mentally impaired .

input: grammar: Firstly , the discovery of a policy holder 's test result , which showed that he might have a risk for certain disease , may prompt the insurance company to increase the price of the premium the policy holder has to pay in order to be fair to other policies holder .
target: Firstly , the discovery of a policy holder 's test result , which showed that he might have a risk for certain disease , may prompt the insurance company to increase the price of the premium the policy holder has to pay in order to be fair to other policy holders .

input: grammar: Although in this way , it seemed fair to the rest of the society , the individual having the risk is being discriminated against .
target: Although in this way , it seems fair to the rest of the society , the individual having the risk is being discriminated against .

input: grammar: Furthermore , by allowing access to the test result , it can cause problems in the workplace .
target: Furthermore , allowing access to the test result can cause problems in the workplace .

input: grammar: Employers have the tendency to employ the people with little or possibly no health problems .
target: Employers have the tendency to employ the people with few or possibly no health problems .

input: grammar: A genetic result could place a potential employee at a disadvantage by suggesting risk of getting a disease or disorder .
target: A genetic result could place a potential employee at a disadvantage by suggesting risk of getting a disease or disorder .

input: grammar: In 2005 , Eddy Curry from the Chicago Bulls refused a genetic test to find out whether he was susceptible to heart ailment .
target: In 2005 , Eddy Curry from the Chicago Bulls refused a genetic test to find out whether he was susceptible to heart ailment .

input: grammar: By doing so , he was traded by the team to the New York Knicks .
target: By doing so , he was traded by the team to the New York Knicks .

input: grammar: ( Harmon , 2008 ) Secondly , the society has to accept the fact that all humans have basic human rights .
target: ( Harmon , 2008 ) Secondly , the society has to accept the fact that all humans have basic human rights .

input: grammar: According to the Universal Declaration of Human rights , " No one shall be subjected to arbitrary interference with his privacy , family , home or correspondence , or to attacks upon his honour and reputation .
target: According to the Universal Declaration of Human rights , " No one shall be subjected to arbitrary interference with his privacy , family , home or correspondence , or to attacks upon his honour and reputation .

input: grammar: " If the carrier of a genetic risk should decide not to tell his relatives or a third party about the outcome , he should not be compelled further to as this violets his rights a living .
target: " If the carrier of a genetic risk should decide not to tell his relatives or a third party about the outcome , he should not be compelled further to as this violates his .

input: grammar: Moreover , Professor Lim Pin recommends that the results from the test should only be used to advantage an individual or his family in prevention and management of disease .
target: Moreover , Professor Lim Pin recommends that the results from the test should only be used to advantage an individual or his family in prevention and management of disease .

input: grammar: He agreed that informed consent from the owner of the test result should be sought before disclosure is allowed .
target: He agreed that informed consent from the owner of the test result should be sought before disclosure is allowed .

input: grammar: Thirdly , there are three special categories of people in our society that need considerations .
target: Thirdly , there are three special categories of people in our society that need consideration .

input: grammar: The children , adolescents and mentally impaired that undergo genetic testing will not know how to handle their results .
target: The children , adolescents and mentally impaired that undergo genetic testing will not know how to handle their results .

input: grammar: As they are young and handicap , they might be immature to know the consequences after they reveal their results of genetic testing .
target: As they are young or handicapped , they might be immature to know the consequences after they reveal their results of genetic testing .

input: grammar: Then , in this case , should they be obliged to tell their relatives or the public ?
target: In this case , should they be obliged to tell their relatives or the public ?

input: grammar: The possible unduly stress and social stigmatism that they could face might prove difficult for them to handle at such tender age .
target: The possible undue stress and social stigmatism that they could face might prove difficult for them to handle at such tender age .

input: grammar: In the United States , even though there is Americans with Disabilities Act protecting them from social discrimination , no one can guarantee that all employers followed the law .
target: In the United States , even though there is Americans with Disabilities Act protecting them from social discrimination , no one can guarantee that all employers will follow the law .

input: grammar: Even if an employee with known risk for disease is allowed to continue working , he will come under stress and possible discrimination by his colleagues .
target: Even if an employee with known risk for disease is allowed to continue working , he will come under stress and possible discrimination by his colleagues .

input: grammar: Initially , he only has the risk of getting a health problem but now with psychological stress , he could get depression instead .
target: Initially , he only has the risk of getting a health problem but now with psychological stress , he could get depression instead .

input: grammar: Either way , letting the employer know the test result is not benefitting the individual .
target: Either way , letting the employer know the test result is not benefitting the individual .

input: grammar: Critics might argue that since genetic test result only show the risk of getting a particular disease or disorder , it does not necessary imply the individual has them and therefore , they should share the test result with their relatives to allow them to seek early prevention .
target: Critics might argue that since genetic test result only shows the risk of getting a particular disease or disorder , it does not necessarily imply the individual has them and therefore , they should share the test result with their relatives to allow them to seek early prevention .

input: grammar: However , they failed to consider his relatives ' reactions towards him just like how people react to Human Immunodeficiency Virus ( HIV ) patients .
target: However , they fail to consider his relatives ' reactions towards him just like how people react to Human Immunodeficiency Virus ( HIV ) patients .

input: grammar: In conclusion , individual should not feel obligated to disclose their genetic test result .
target: In conclusion , individuals should not feel obligated to disclose their genetic test result .

input: grammar: In fact , they should have all the rights to decide what to do with it because the repercussions that arose from the act of revealing are very serious .
target: In fact , they should have all the rights to decide what to do with it because the repercussions that arise from the act of revealing it are very serious .

input: grammar: Thus , individual should decide what is best for him .
target: Thus , the individual should decide what is best for him .

input: grammar: Medical related technology has improved to a stage in which genetic disorders can be predicted via genetic testing .
target: Medical related technology has improved to a stage in which genetic disorders can be predicted via genetic testing .

input: grammar: It is a technique to examine the DNA molecule ( building blocks of genes ) for several purposes such as predicting or diagnosing inheritable genetic disorders , prenatal or newborn screening and to aid in forensic science .
target: It is a technique to examine the DNA molecule ( building blocks of genes ) for several purposes such as predicting or diagnosing inheritable genetic disorders , prenatal or newborn screening and to aid in forensic science .

input: grammar: For an inheritable genetic disease , the carrier refers to the person who has the gene related to the disease , but the disease may not necessarily be expressed in his or her but it may be manifested in their offsprings .
target: For an inheritable genetic disease , the carrier refers to the person who has the gene related to the disease , but the disease may not necessarily be expressed in him or her but it may be manifested in their offsprings .

input: grammar: Although genetic testing is made possible , the after effect of knowing and dealing with the disease is another issue .
target: Although genetic testing is made possible , the after effect of knowing and dealing with the disease is another issue .

input: grammar: Thus , a dilemma arises in whether the carrier should be obligated to tell his or her relatives .
target: Thus , a dilemma arises in whether the carrier should be obligated to tell his or her relatives .

input: grammar: In my opinion , the carrier should be obligated to do so as this will aid in family planning , garnering support from family and also to prompt other relatives to test whether they are at risk too .
target: In my opinion , the carrier should be obligated to do so as this will aid in family planning , garnering support from family and also to prompt other relatives to test whether they are at risk too .

input: grammar: Firstly , family planning is imperative to a carrier as he or she may pass down the undesirable gene to the children .
target: Firstly , family planning is imperative to a carrier as he or she may pass down the undesirable gene to the children .

input: grammar: This means that the child have to bear with the possibility of the onset of the disease and subsequent repercussion if the genetic disease is confirmed .
target: This means that the child has to bear with the possibility of the onset of the disease and subsequent repercussion if the genetic disease is confirmed .

input: grammar: Therefore , a carrier should inform the spouse of the genetic disorder so that they can discuss and plan whether or not to take the risk of having a child .
target: Therefore , a carrier should inform the spouse of the genetic disorder so that they can discuss and plan whether or not to take the risk of having a child .

input: grammar: Some may argue that it is not necessary for the carrier to inform the spouse as even if the child is tested positive for the genetic disease while still in the womb , measures such as abortion can be taken .
target: Some may argue that it is not necessary for the carrier to inform the spouse as even if the child is tested positive for the genetic disease while still in the womb , measures such as abortion can be taken .

input: grammar: However , from the ethical point of view , it is inhuman to terminate a life , and this event can be prevented if there is proper family planning .
target: However , from the ethical point of view , it is inhuman to terminate a life , and this event can be prevented if there is proper family planning .

input: grammar: Thus , a carrier should be obligated to tell his or her spouse so as to prevent subsequent tension and ordeal in the family .
target: Thus , a carrier should be obligated to tell his or her spouse so as to prevent subsequent tension and ordeal in the family .

input: grammar: Secondly , a well-informed relative of the carrier 's genetic disease is crucial as they can provide support towards the carrier .
target: Secondly , a well-informed relative of the carrier 's genetic disease is crucial as they can provide support towards the carrier .

input: grammar: If carriers of the genetic disease who are not mentally strong decided to keep mum about their genetic disease , they may lead an anxious and depressed life ( Gilbar , 2007 ) .The situation is aggravated if they have children as they may feel guilty of the possibility of passing down the disease .
target: If carriers of the genetic disease who are not mentally strong decided to keep mum about their genetic disease , they may lead an anxious and depressed life ( Gilbar , 2007 ) .The situation is aggravated if they have children as they may feel guilty of the possibility of passing down the disease .

input: grammar: Hence , by letting the relatives know about the genetic risk , they can offer moral support such as giving words of encouragement , paying more attention to the carriers and assuring them that it is not their fault that they have the undesirable gene .
target: Hence , by letting the relatives know about the genetic risk , they can offer moral support such as giving words of encouragement , paying more attention to the carriers and reassuring them that it is not their fault that they have the undesirable gene .

input: grammar: Hence , the support garnered from family members may boost the carriers ' self-esteem and motivational level , knowing that they do n't have to walk this journey alone .
target: Hence , the support garnered from family members may boost the carriers ' self-esteem and motivational level , knowing that they do not have to walk this journey alone .

input: grammar: Thus , it is crucial for the carrier to inform his or her relatives about their genetic risk so as to get the required support to help them through .
target: Thus , it is crucial for the carrier to inform his or her relatives about their genetic risk so as to get the required support to help them through .

input: grammar: Thirdly , family members who are aware of the genetic risk of the carrier may consider going for the genetic test themselves so as to avoid or delay the onset of disease if it is possible .
target: Thirdly , family members who are aware of the genetic risk of the carrier may consider going for the genetic test themselves so as to avoid or delay the onset of disease if it is possible .

input: grammar: For instance , diabetes can be due to genetic causes and one way to prevent or delay the onset of this genetic risk is to lead a healthy lifestyle which excludes excessive intake of sugar .
target: For instance , diabetes can be due to genetic causes and one way to prevent or delay the onset of this genetic risk is to lead a healthy lifestyle which excludes excessive intake of sugar .

input: grammar: Hence , the carrier should be obligated to tell his or her relatives so that they may also be aware of their genetic risk of the disease .
target: Hence , the carrier should be obligated to tell his or her relatives so that they may also be aware of their genetic risk of the disease .

input: grammar: Critics may argue that the cost of conducting genetic testing is not justifiable and may not be accurate .
target: Critics may argue that the cost of conducting genetic testing is not justifiable and may not be accurate .

input: grammar: However , accuracy of the test can be improved through the passage of time as technology nowadays is more sophisticated .
target: However , accuracy of the test can be improved through the passage of time as technology nowadays is more sophisticated .

input: grammar: Moreover , should the high cost of the testing compromise one 's health or life ?
target: Moreover , should the high cost of the testing compromise one 's health or life ?

input: grammar: In conclusion , even though a carrier of a known genetic risk has the right to disclose his or her condition , the disadvantages far outweigh the advantages .
target: In conclusion , even though a carrier of a known genetic risk has the right to disclose his or her condition , the disadvantages far outweigh the advantages .

input: grammar: Proper family planning , encouragement from relatives and the awareness of the genetic risk in their family are crucial and therefore the carrier should be obligated to tell his or her relatives .
target: Proper family planning , encouragement from relatives and the awareness of the genetic risk in their family are crucial and therefore the carrier should be obligated to tell his or her relatives .

target: References

target: Retrieved October 28 , 2009 , from http : //www.nature.com/scitable/topicpage/Ethics-of-Genetic-Testing-Medical-Insurance-and-651

input: grammar: Genetic testing is a type of medical test that identifies changes in chromosomes and genes and the results can determine a person 's chance of developing or passing on inherited disorders like Huntington 's disease and cancer .
target: Genetic testing is a type of medical test that identifies changes in chromosomes and genes and the results can determine a person 's chance of developing or passing on inherited disorders like Huntington 's disease and cancer .

input: grammar: However , the results of the test can stir up much controversy in whether a carrier of a known genetic risk should be obligated to tell his family .
target: However , the results of the test can stir up much controversy in whether a carrier of a known genetic risk should be obligated to tell his family .

input: grammar: Although there is an ethical obligation to disclose the results to one 's family so that constructive life changes can be made , there currently is no legal requirement to do so .
target: Although there is an ethical obligation to disclose the results to one 's family so that constructive life changes can be made , there currently is no legal requirement to do so .

input: grammar: Furthermore , the disclosure can cause negative social consequences such as potential discrimination .
target: Furthermore , the disclosure can cause negative social consequences such as potential discrimination .

input: grammar: In my opinion , since the decision of an individual to undergo genetic testing is voluntary , they have already had the " final say " to decide whether they want their potential disorders to be revealed hence , the individual should not have the final say only after the test as long as they have signed the agreement under well informed circumstances and that the disclosure is only made to relevant third parties .
target: In my opinion , since the decision of an individual to undergo genetic testing is voluntary , they have already had the " final say " to decide whether they want their potential disorders to be revealed hence , the individual should not have the final say only after the test as long as they have signed the agreement under well informed circumstances and that the disclosure is only made to relevant third parties .

input: grammar: One argument to obligate is that family members have their rights to information about themselves and their loved ones .
target: One argument for the obligation is that family members have their rights to information about themselves and their loved ones .

input: grammar: With the information one gains from testing , one can make constructive life changes .
target: With the information one gains from testing , one can make constructive life changes .

input: grammar: Many genetic disorders worsen over time and have long-term health consequences thus the disclosure of the results for an inherited disease is beneficial for early treatment and prevention of the disorder to save lives .
target: Many genetic disorders worsen over time and have long-term health consequences ; thus the disclosure of the results for an inherited disease is beneficial for early treatment and prevention of the disorder to save lives .

input: grammar: In the case of incurable diseases , knowing one 's condition could influence many family planning decisions and other life choices .
target: In the case of incurable diseases , knowing one 's condition could influence many family planning decisions and other life choices .

input: grammar: One can decide whether to have children of his own and risk passing the gene on to his children or consider using technology to assist selective reproduction .
target: One can decide whether to have children of his own and risk passing the gene on to his children or consider using technology to assist selective reproduction .

input: grammar: Also , decisions like the retirement age and the amount of savings for the future can be made when they are better informed .
target: Also , decisions like the retirement age and the amount of savings for the future can be made when they are better informed .

input: grammar: When family members are aware of the truth , at risk family members can be notified early and others can provide support for the carrier to overcome the difficulties he will be facing in the fight against his disorder .
target: When family members are aware of the truth , at risk family members can be notified early and others can provide support for the carrier to overcome the difficulties he will be facing in the fight against his disorder .

input: grammar: The disclosure is thus not only beneficial to the third parties but also the carrier himself .
target: The disclosure is thus not only beneficial to the third parties but also the carrier himself .

input: grammar: However , individuals may choose not to reveal the results due to fear of the negative social consequences associated with the disorder .
target: However , individuals may choose not to reveal the results due to fear of the negative social consequences associated with the disorder .

input: grammar: The results of genetic testing may open doors for potential discrimination in terms of job opportunities and insurances .
target: The results of genetic testing may open doors for potential discrimination in terms of job opportunities and insurance policies .

input: grammar: An employer might not want to keep an employee who is likely to be diagnosed with some disorder .
target: An employer might not want to keep an employee who is likely to be diagnosed with some disorder .

input: grammar: Similarly , a person who is known to have a high risk for a genetic condition may have difficulty obtaining insurance because he or she is likely to run up medical bills that would be costly to the insurance company .
target: Similarly , a person who is known to have a high risk for a genetic condition may have difficulty obtaining insurance because he or she is likely to run up medical bills that would be costly to the insurance company .

input: grammar: The obligation to make known the results of genetic testing will thus be a disincentive for people to even undergo genetic testing to help themselves .
target: The obligation to make known the results of genetic testing will thus be a disincentive for people to even undergo genetic testing to help themselves .

input: grammar: As we can not control our genes , it is unfair to discriminate against a person 's genetic predispositions .
target: As we can not control our genes , it is unfair to discriminate against a person 's genetic predispositions .

input: grammar: A federal measure , the Genetic Information Nondiscrimination Act ( GINA ) , was signed into law in the United States , to provide protections against genetic discrimination ( Norrgard 2008 ) .
target: A federal measure , the Genetic Information Nondiscrimination Act ( GINA ) , was signed into law in the United States , to provide protection against genetic discrimination ( Norrgard 2008 ) .

input: grammar: Insurance companies were prevented from charging higher rates to customers based on genetic information and from collecting genetic data or requiring applicants to undergo genetic testing .
target: Insurance companies were prevented from charging higher rates to customers based on genetic information and from collecting genetic data or requiring applicants to undergo genetic testing .

input: grammar: With the legislation being law , the carriers should feel safer to share the test results .
target: With the legislation being law , the carriers should feel safer to share the test results .

input: grammar: In conclusion , the individual requesting genetic testing should be obligated to make known the results to relevant third parties for the benefits of both the carrier and the people around him .
target: In conclusion , the individual requesting genetic testing should be obligated to make known the results to relevant third parties for the benefits of both the carrier and the people around him .

input: grammar: Hopefully , with the recent passage of GINA in the U.S. , discrimination of inheritable carriers can be removed and people will feel comfortable working with genetic counselors who can provide information about the pros and cons of the genetic test and discuss the social and emotional aspects of testing to undergo genetic tests and disclose the results that contribute to better management of health care and life choices .
target: Hopefully , with the recent passage of GINA in the U.S. , discrimination of inheritable carriers can be removed and people will feel comfortable working with genetic counselors who can provide information about the advantages and disadvantages of the genetic test and discuss the social and emotional aspects of choosing to undergo genetic tests and disclose the results that contribute to better management of health care and life choices .
