target: Motion : " Should a carrier of a known genetic risk be obligated to tell his or her relatives ?

input: grammar: " YES .
target: " YES .

input: grammar: With medical technology advances today , genetic testing have been commonly used to detect any disorders or diseases that is present in our genes .
target: With medical technology advances today , genetic testing has been commonly used to detect any disorders or diseases that are present in our genes .

input: grammar: It is a method where the person 's DNA is taken and isolated to test for the presence of any defects or a specific genes that could cause any future onset of disorders or diseases ( Genetic testing , n.d. ) .
target: It is a method where the person 's DNA is taken and isolated to test for the presence of any defects or specific genes that could cause any future onset of disorders or diseases ( Genetic testing , n.d. ) .

input: grammar: Since the test involves genes and in general , every human has it , the carrier of a known genetic risk should be obligated to tell his or her relatives .
target: Since the test involves genes and in general , , the carrier of a known genetic risk should be obligated to tell his or her relatives .

input: grammar: Firstly , genetic testing helps to prevent further spread of diseases in the family lineage .
target: Firstly , genetic testing helps to prevent further spread of diseases in the family lineage .

input: grammar: In family lineage , family members and relatives are related .
target: In family lineage , family members and relatives are related .

input: grammar: If the carrier is known to have a genetic risk , there may be a chance where other family members or relatives get that disorder or disease which may be found in their genes .
target: If the carrier is known to have a genetic risk , there may be a chance that other family members or relatives have that disorder or disease which may be found in their genes .

input: grammar: When they go for the testing , they are able to know if they are positive or negative for the presence of the specific defective gene .
target: When they go for the testing , they are able to know if they are positive or negative for the presence of the specific defective gene .

input: grammar: This will then help other family members or relatives to plan ahead of their future generation .
target: This will then help other family members or relatives to plan ahead of their future generation .

input: grammar: For example , they are able to plan whether to start a family , the location and type of house to buy ( in an area with family , an abundance of nursing homes , close to a specialized medical center , easily modifiable for a person with disabilities ) , health , life and disability insurance , financial arrangements ( wills and trusts , paying off debts ) and et cetera ( Drellishak R. , May 25 , 2003 ) .
target: For example , they are able to plan whether to start a family , the location and type of house to buy ( in an area with family , an abundance of nursing homes , close to a specialized medical center , easily modifiable for a person with disabilities ) , health , life and disability insurance , financial arrangements ( wills and trusts , paying off debts ) and et cetera ( Drellishak R. , May 25 , 2003 ) .

input: grammar: Hence , the carrier should tell his or her relatives in order for them to make future plans and have a good family life .
target: Hence , the carrier should tell his or her relatives in order for them to make future plans and have a good family life .

input: grammar: Secondly , genetic testing allows oneself to be prepared upon knowing that a relative of theirs has a genetic risk .
target: Secondly , genetic testing allows oneself to be prepared upon knowing that a relative of theirs has a genetic risk .

input: grammar: This will allows them to take precautious and preventive measures about their health condition .
target: This will allow them to take precautions and preventive measures about their health condition .

input: grammar: Some diseases that can be detected by genetic testing like Marfan syndrome - a connective tissue disorder causing long limbs and heart defects ( Haldeman- Englert , C. , May 15 , 2008 ) can be controlled and treated .
target: Some diseases that can be detected by genetic testing like Marfan syndrome - a connective tissue disorder causing long limbs and heart defects ( Haldeman- Englert , C. , May 15 , 2008 ) can be controlled and treated .

input: grammar: When the other family members or relatives have an early detection of such diseases like Marfan syndrome , they are able to take preventive measures early like consulting a doctor , take medications that could slow down the heart rate in order to prevent stress on the aorta and avoid having sports in prevention of injuring the heart ( Haldeman-Englert , C. , May 15 , 2008 ) .
target: When the other family members or relatives have an early detection of such diseases like Marfan syndrome , they are able to take preventive measures early like consulting a doctor , taking medications that could slow down the heart rate in order to prevent stress on the aorta and avoiding having sports to prevent of injuring the heart ( Haldeman-Englert , C. , May 15 , 2008 ) .

input: grammar: Lastly , genetic testing promotes in developing a support group system .
target: Lastly , .

input: grammar: This is where a positive carrier of a specific genetic risk knows that they are not alone and they could give provide referrals for respite care , medical and hospice services , tips for care-giving and et cetera ( Drellishak R. , May 25 , 2003 ) .
target: This is where a positive carrier of a specific genetic risk knows that they are not alone and referrals for respite care , medical and hospice services , tips for care-giving and et cetera ( Drellishak R. , May 25 , 2003 ) .

input: grammar: So , when other family members or relatives is tested positive for the disorder or disease , at least they know that they are not alone and they could rely on the support group for any advices or any moral or emotional support from them .
target: So , when other family members or relatives are tested positive for the disorder or disease , at least they know that they are not alone and they could rely on the support group for any advice or any moral or emotional support from them .

input: grammar: In conclusion , the carrier of a known genetic risk is obligated to tell his or her relatives so that to prevent further spread of the genetic disorder , to take early preventive measures and to give moral support to those who have the same genetic risk .
target: In conclusion , the carrier of a known genetic risk is obligated to tell his or her relatives so as to prevent further spread of the genetic disorder , to take early preventive measures and to give moral support to those who have the same genetic risk .

input: grammar: " The individual requesting genetic testing should have the final say in whether to reveal the results of such testing .
target: " The individual requesting genetic testing should have the final say in whether to reveal the results of such testing .

input: grammar: "
grammar: The results of a genetic test can determine an individual 's possibility of developing a genetic disorder or confirm a suspected genetic disease .
target: The results of a genetic test can determine an individual 's possibility of developing a genetic disorder or confirm a suspected genetic disease .

input: grammar: This has brought about many controversial issues on ethical , social and legal concerns surrounding the use of genetic testing .
target: This has brought about many controversial issues on ethical , social and legal concerns surrounding the use of genetic testing .

input: grammar: While some argue that under certain circumstances , the non-disclosure of relevant genetic information brings harms to the individual and a third party , it in fact helps to protect an individual 's right to confidentiality , safeguard against discrimination and reduce psychological stress .
target: While some argue that under certain circumstances , the non-disclosure of relevant genetic information brings harm to the individual and a third party , it in fact helps to protect an individual 's right to confidentiality , safeguard against discrimination and reduce psychological stress .

input: grammar: Hence , the individual undergoing genetic testing should have the final say in revealing the results of such genetic testing .
target: Hence , the individual undergoing genetic testing should have the final say in revealing the results of such genetic testing .

input: grammar: There are three implications of genetic testing .
target: There are three implications of genetic testing .

input: grammar: Firstly , genetic testing protects an individual 's right to confidentiality .
target: Firstly , genetic testing protects an individual 's right to confidentiality .

input: grammar: An individual has the right of keeping his or her genetic test result confidential , and without granting consent of the individual , the test result should not be disclosed .
target: An individual has the right of keeping his or her genetic test result confidential , and without securing consent of the individual , the test result should not be disclosed .

input: grammar: Admittedly , genetic testing raises legal issue , however , an individual who tested positive for a genetic disease has to decide whether to make known the results of genetic testing to relevant third parties such as family members or relatives who have the possibility of passing on the similar disease .
target: Admittedly , genetic testing raises legal issues ; however , an individual who tested positive for a genetic disease has to decide whether to make known the results of genetic testing to relevant third parties such as family members or relatives who have the possibility of passing on the similar disease .

input: grammar: Regardless of the individual 's right to confidentiality , the test results are disclosed under certain circumstances such as the non- disclosure of relevant genetic test results brings harms to the individual and also the third parties ( Lee , 2005 ) .
target: Regardless of the individual 's right to confidentiality , the test results are disclosed under certain circumstances such as when the non- disclosure of relevant genetic test results brings harm to the individual and also the third parties ( Lee , 2005 ) .

input: grammar: Thus , the risks of non-disclosure override the risks of breaching confidentiality .
target: Thus , the risks of non-disclosure override the risks of breaching confidentiality .

input: grammar: Secondly , genetic testing safeguards against discrimination .
target: Secondly , genetic testing safeguards against discrimination .

input: grammar: In the United States , federal law Genetic Information Non-discrimination Act ( GINA ) has passed on to protect the individuals at risk for genetic diseases from facing discrimination by insurance companies and employers based on the results obtained from genetic testing ( Public Law , 2008 ) .
target: In the United States , federal law Genetic Information Non-discrimination Act ( GINA ) was passed to protect the individuals at risk for genetic diseases from facing discrimination by insurance companies and employers based on the results obtained from genetic testing ( Public Law , 2008 ) .

input: grammar: Under this act , it prohibits employers from making unfavourable employment decisions and prohibits insurance companies from reducing insurance coverage .
target: Under this act , employers are prohibited from making unfavourable employment decisions and insurance companies are prohibited from reducing insurance coverage .

input: grammar: Although some argue that genetic testing raises social issue , these individuals may face discrimination from employers , insurance providers and society .
target: Although some argue that genetic testing raises social issues , these individuals may face discrimination from employers , insurance providers and society .

input: grammar: It is more difficult for these individuals in applying for job employments and life and health insurance coverage .
target: It is more difficult for these individuals in applying for employment and life and health insurance coverage .

input: grammar: As a result , they feel socially stigmatised .
target: As a result , they feel socially stigmatised .

input: grammar: Thirdly , genetic testing reduces the amount of psychological stress .
target: Thirdly , genetic testing reduces the amount of psychological stress .

input: grammar: Although some argue that genetic testing raises ethical issue , the individual faced a lot of psychological stress such as anxiety , fear and guilt when undergoing the process of genetic testing .
target: Although some argue that genetic testing raises ethical issues , the individual faces much psychological stress such as anxiety , fear and guilt when undergoing the process of genetic testing .

input: grammar: The individual is in ethical dilemma of whether sharing the genetic test results within the families .
target: The individual is in ethical dilemma of whether to share the genetic test results within the families .

input: grammar: However , family members who are unaffected by the genetic disease may feel guilty and this condition is known as survivor guilt .
target: However , family members who are unaffected by the genetic disease may feel guilty and this condition is known as survivor guilt .

input: grammar: To reduce the amount of psychological stress , physicians should arrange post-test genetic counselling for patients .
target: To reduce the amount of psychological stress , physicians should arrange post-test genetic counselling for patients .

input: grammar: In conclusion , the decision in disclosing the results of genetic testing should solely be made by the individual at risk for genetic disorder .
target: In conclusion , the decision in disclosing the results of genetic testing should solely be made by the individual at risk for genetic disorder .

input: grammar: The non-disclosure of genetic information protects an individual 's right to confidentiality , safeguards against discrimination and reduces the amount of psychological stress .
target: The non-disclosure of genetic information protects an individual 's right to confidentiality , safeguards against discrimination and reduces the amount of psychological stress .

target: Thus , revealing genetic test results to relatives is critical to draw their attention on the hereditary diseases .

target: Subsequently , they might choose to go for genetic tests .

input: grammar: As a result , the chances of suffering from those inherited disorders can be lowered .

target: In addition , positive genetic test results will lead to emotional distress to patients or carriers .

target: They will undoubtedly fall into the state of severe depression and anxiety .

target: There is no denying that family is the most intimate and important spiritual pillar to everyone .

target: Therefore , sharing test results with family might relieve those emotional effects and keep them away from gloomy thoughts .

input: grammar: Genetic testing is whereby an individual 's gene is tested for abnormalities , susceptibility for diseases or any genetic disorder that can lead to either physical or mental problems , including both .

input: grammar: It is beneficial as it points out the underlying genetic condition of an individual who is prone to a particular genetic disorder , giving the individual the opportunity to seek treatment before the genetic disease comes into effect ( Nuffiel Council , 1997 ) .
target: It is beneficial as it points out the underlying genetic condition of an individual who is prone to a particular genetic disorder , giving the individual the opportunity to seek treatment before the genetic disease comes into effect ( Nuffiel Council , 1997 ) .

input: grammar: Since the affected individual shares similar gene within the family , he or she is obligated to let his or relatives know about the genetic condition .

input: grammar: Although it can affect the rest of the family and relatives , as having to know one 's genetic condition can bring about genetic discrimination such as denied insurance coverage , loss of employment , it basically prepares them psychologically for the future and there are certain regulations implemented to help those who are genetically discriminated .
target: Although it can affect the rest of the family and relatives , as having to know one 's genetic condition can bring about genetic discrimination such as denied insurance coverage , loss of employment , it basically prepares them psychologically for the future and there are certain regulations implemented to help those who are genetically discriminated .

input: grammar: Firstly , it may help prevent the individual from encountering a situation where he is denied of insurance coverage when the health insurer finds out the affected individual could prone to a one or more genetic disease due to family history .
target: Firstly , it may help prevent the individual from encountering a situation where he is denied of insurance coverage when the health insurer finds out the affected individual could be prone to a one or more genetic diseases due to family history .

input: grammar: Such cases happen due to the health insurer is bent on making money , with no care on whether the person is in ill health ( Townsend , 1997 ) .
target: Such cases happen due to the health insurer being bent on making money , with no care towards the person in ill health ( Townsend , 1997 ) .

input: grammar: There are policies such as in Britain , which insurance companies should adhere to , where any genetic screening is not a prerequisite in the application and obtaining insurance .
target: There are policies such as in Britain , which insurance companies should adhere to , where any genetic screening is not a prerequisite in the application and obtaining insurance .

input: grammar: Even if it is to be declared , there will not be a change in premium charges as compared to those who declared who has a family history but has not gone for genetic tests .
target: Even if it is to be declared , there will not be a change in premium charges as compared to those who declared that they have a family history but have not gone for genetic tests .

input: grammar: Thereby , it can help ensure that the affected person is able to be under insurance coverage , providing some security especially financial security including for the family members .
target: Thereby , it can help ensure that the affected person is able to be under insurance coverage , providing some security especially financial security for the family members .

input: grammar: Secondly , having one genetic condition assessed , it gives the affected individual the freedom of making an informed choice concerning the type of job or employment that he or she can undertake , with the inclusion of one 's safety and health .
target: Secondly , having one genetic condition assessed , it gives the affected individual the freedom to make an informed choice concerning the type of job or employment that he or she can undertake , with the inclusion of one 's safety and health .

input: grammar: This helps the individual to avoid certain occupations that might increase the risk of having to be ill health or end up in a life threatening situation during one 's course of work ( Nuffiel Council , 1997 ) .

input: grammar: An example would the Huntington 's disease , a neurological disorder where loss of motor control is one of the symptoms , if a particular employee in a construction yard has such a disease , not only it poses high risk to himself but also to the other employees ( Mclean , 2008 ) .
target: An example would be the Huntington 's disease , a neurological disorder where loss of motor control is one of the symptoms , if a particular employee in a construction yard has such a disease , not only does it pose high risk to himself but also to the other employees ( Mclean , 2008 ) .

target: However , although having the knowledge of one 's susceptibility to a particular disorder may cost the employee 's his or her job employment , so as to reduce costs and improve efficiency for the employer , there are regulations to help such employees .

target: In the United Kingdom , there is the Employment Protection ( Consolidation ) Act 1978 which helps to ensure fairness to the employee after a genetic screening .

input: grammar: Thirdly,by letting the family members and relatives made known of an individual genetic risk a particular disorder such as Huntington 's Disease , it made them aware that such a genetic disease runs within the family .

target: If an individual discovers after a genetic test that he has a high risk of developing certain diseases , it would mean that his family member who share similar genes may be at risk as well ( Forrest K , 2003 ) .

target: Not only is it his responsibility to share his genetic testing results with his family ( Forrest K , 2003 ) , informing his family members will give them a chance for early detection of the disease as well as to make necessary family planning ( Agatha M , Denise B and Kathleen A , 2009 ) .

target: Hence , carriers of a known genetic risk is obligated to tell their family members his genetic test result .

target: Firstly , it is the responsibility of the carrier of a known genetic risk to inform his family member of their increased likelihood of having the same genetic risk ( Forrest K , 2003 ) .

target: Hence , to fulfill the responsibility as a member of the family , the carrier of genetic risk should tell his relatives his genetic test result .

input: grammar: Secondly , sharing of the fact that one has a greater risk of genetic disease will encourage his relatives to go for genetic testing ( Forrest K , 2003 ) .
target: Secondly , sharing of the fact that one has a greater risk of genetic disease will encourage his relatives to go for genetic testing ( Forrest K , 2003 ) .

input: grammar: The relatives can make an informed decision as to whether they want to have a genetic testing done themselves .
target: The relatives can make an informed decision as to whether they want to have genetic testing done themselves .

input: grammar: If they are tested with the same increased genetic risk , it will allow them to have early preventive medical treatment ( US National Institute of Health , 1998 ) .
target: If they are tested with the same increased genetic risk , it will allow them to have early preventive medical treatment ( US National Institute of Health , 1998 ) .

input: grammar: The family members can also then consider family planning based on the severity of the disease and the likelihood of passing the disease to the next generation ( Agatha M et al. , 2009 ) .
target: The family members can also then consider family planning based on the severity of the disease and the likelihood of passing the disease to the next generation ( Agatha M et al. , 2009 ) .

input: grammar: Opponents of this position argue that the family members may hastily undergo a genetic test on receiving the negative news without careful consideration of the possible discrimination that they may face after the genetic test ( Agatha M et al. , 2009 ) .
target: Opponents of this position argue that the family members may hastily undergo a genetic test on receiving the negative news without careful consideration of the possible discrimination that they may face after the genetic test ( Agatha M et al. , 2009 ) .

input: grammar: Admittedly , it is true that one may face discrimination at work and from insurance companies after a genetic test ( US National Institute of Health , 1998 ) .
target: Admittedly , it is true that one may face discrimination at work and from insurance companies after a genetic test ( US National Institute of Health , 1998 ) .

input: grammar: However , with the setting up of legislative law by governments , such as the Genetic Information Nondiscrimination Act in the United States , the risk of discrimination at work or from insurance companies will be kept to a minimum ( US National Institute of Health , 1998 ) .
target: However , with the setting up of legislative law by governments , such as the Genetic Information Nondiscrimination Act in the United States , the risk of discrimination at work or from insurance companies will be kept to a minimum ( US National Institute of Health , 1998 ) .

input: grammar: Thus , genetic risk carrier should not hesitate to tell his relatives so that they can benefit from the information medically .
target: Thus , the genetic risk carrier should not hesitate to tell his relatives so that they can benefit from the information medically .

input: grammar: In conclusion , revealing of the genetic test result by the carrier of genetic risk is not only his responsibility to his family members ; it also allows his relatives to have a chance of early detection of the disease and possible treatment as a result .
target: In conclusion , revealing of the genetic test result by the carrier of genetic risk is not only his responsibility to his family members ; it also allows his relatives to have a chance of early detection of the disease and possible treatment as a result .

input: grammar: No doubt that this may bring emotional stress to the relatives , but if managed properly , the medical benefits that the relatives can get from the information outweigh this initial risk .
target: No doubt that this may bring emotional stress to the relatives , but if managed properly , the medical benefits that the relatives can get from the information outweigh this initial risk .

input: grammar: Therefore , carrier of a known genetic risk is obligated to tell his family members his genetic testing result .
target: Therefore , carrier of a known genetic risk is obligated to tell his family members his genetic testing result .

input: grammar: Genetic Testing grants us the ability to determine an individual 's paternity and his chances of getting a genetic disorder such as Down syndrome .
target: Genetic Testing grants us the ability to determine an individual 's paternity and his chances of getting a genetic disorder such as Downs syndrome .

input: grammar: There are three forms of genetic testing - Gene tests , chromosomal test and biochemical test .
target: There are three forms of genetic testing - Gene tests , chromosomal test and biochemical test .

input: grammar: Since Genetic testing is voluntary , the individual should have the final say in whether to reveal the results .
target: Since Genetic testing is voluntary , the individual should have the final say in whether to reveal the results .

input: grammar: This is because there are many social and emotional aspects with regards to genetic testing .
target: This is because there are many social and emotional aspects with regards to genetic testing .

input: grammar: Revealing an individual 's genetic makeup and results without their consent can also lead to an infringement of human rights and privacy .
target: Revealing an individual 's genetic makeup and results without their consent can also lead to an infringement of human rights and privacy .

input: grammar: Also , these individuals may face discriminations from family members and also from the society , such as their employers and insurance companies .
target: Also , these individuals may face discriminations from family members and also from the society , such as their employers and insurance companies .

input: grammar: Therefore , the carrier of a known genetic risk should not be obligated to tell his or her relatives to prevent such genetic testing results from being passed on to other third parties without consent .
target: Therefore , the carrier of a known genetic risk should not be obligated to tell his or her relatives to prevent such genetic testing results from being passed on to other third parties without consent .

input: grammar: An individual is not obligated to reveal the results of genetic testing to third parties due to the infringement of privacy and human rights .
target: An individual is not obligated to reveal the results of genetic testing to third parties due to the infringement of privacy and human rights .

input: grammar: Like medical records , results of genetic testing should be kept confidential and they should not be disclosed without permission ( Mehlman1999 ) .
target: Like medical records , results of genetic testing should be kept confidential and they should not be disclosed without permission ( Mehlman1999 ) .

input: grammar: Since genetic testing requested by an individual involves the use of own genetic makeup , it is therefore against human rights to reveal the genetic testing results without their contest .
target: Since genetic testing requested by an individual involves the use of own genetic makeup , it is therefore against their human right to reveal the genetic testing results without their contest .

input: grammar: Every individual should be given the right to decide whether to disclose the genetic testing results to their relatives by weighing the advantages and disadvantages on their own .
target: Every individual should be given the right to decide whether to disclose the genetic testing results to their relatives by weighing the advantages and disadvantages on their own .

input: grammar: This is based on the fact that everyone is unique and they have different background and personal constraints to take into considerations when deciding whether to reveal their genetic testing results .
target: This is based on the fact that everyone is unique and they have different background and personal constraints to take into considerations when deciding whether to reveal their genetic testing results .

input: grammar: Thus , the carrier of a known genetic risk is not obligated to tell his or her relatives .
target: Thus , the carrier of a known genetic risk is not obligated to tell his or her relatives .

input: grammar: Another reason such why genetic testing results should not be revealed to relatives is because other third parties may have the chance to get hold of these results and use them against the individuals .
target: Another reason such why genetic testing results should not be revealed to relatives is because other third parties may have the chance to get hold of these results and use them against the individuals .

input: grammar: There are many controversies on the fairness in the use of genetic information by other third parties such as insurers , employers , adoption agencies , schools , military and courts .
target: There are many controversies on the fairness in the use of genetic information by other third parties such as insurers , employers , adoption agencies , schools , military and the courts .

input: grammar: It is not fair for insurers to deny insurance or raise premiums base for individuals that have positive results from genetic testing ( Mehlman1999 ) .
target: It is not fair for insurers to deny insurance or raise premiums base for individuals that have positive results from genetic testing ( Mehlman1999 ) .

input: grammar: Andre and Velasquez mentioned that being a carrier for a genetic disorder does not mean that the individuals will get the disorder for sure .
target: Andre and Velasquez mentioned that being a carrier for a genetic disorder does not mean that the individuals will get the disorder for sure .

input: grammar: Therefore , it is justified for the carriers to buy insurance so that they can get a sufficient amount of coverage as compensation for any mishap that may or may not happen .
target: Therefore , it is justified for the carriers to buy insurance so that they can get a sufficient amount of coverage as compensation for any mishap that may or may not happen .

input: grammar: Raising premium for such individuals is seen as taking advantage of them .
target: Raising premium for such individuals is seen as taking advantage of them .

input: grammar: Also , employers may stereotype these individuals as non-productive and inefficient workers and choose not to hire them ( Weiss 1999 ) .
target: Also , employers may stereotype these individuals as non-productive and inefficient workers and choose not to hire them ( Weiss 1999 ) .

input: grammar: Therefore , the carriers of genetic disorder should not be obligated to reveal the results to anyone to prevent from having to face discriminations at societal level .
target: Therefore , the carriers of genetic disorder should not be obligated to reveal the results to anyone to prevent from having to face discriminations at societal level .

input: grammar: Proponents in favour for the revealing of results argue that revealing the results to third parties such as relatives can aid in emotional support .
target: Proponents in favour for the revealing of results argue that revealing the results to third parties such as relatives can aid in emotional support .

input: grammar: Relatives can provide necessary help to the carriers by providing more care and concern .
target: Relatives can provide necessary help to the carriers by providing more care and concern .

input: grammar: This is necessary because carriers of genetic disorders undergo tremendous stress and it would be great if there is someone close to be there with them to face all kinds of problems .
target: This is necessary because carriers of genetic disorders undergo tremendous stress and it would be great if there is someone close to be there with them to face all kinds of problems .

input: grammar: Furthermore , revealing the results to the relatives can encourage them to be more health conscious and also to remind that to take go for frequent checkups since they might run the risk of having the same disorder too ( Weiss 1999 ) .
target: Furthermore , revealing the results to the relatives can encourage them to be more health conscious and also to remind that to go for frequent checkups since they might run the risk of having the same disorder too ( Weiss 1999 ) .

input: grammar: However , this does not apply to all individuals and there is a possibility that they may even face discriminations from their own family members and relatives .
target: However , this does not apply to all individuals and there is a possibility that they may even face discriminations from their own family members and relatives .

input: grammar: Some may feel that the individuals are likely to be a burden to them and may start to shun or keep away from them , causing them to feel even more upset or depressed .
target: Some may feel that the individuals are likely to be a burden to them and may start to shun or keep away from them , causing them to feel even more upset or depressed .

input: grammar: Therefore , the final decision on whether to reveal the genetic testing results should lie in the hands of the carriers themselves .
target: Therefore , the final decision on whether to reveal the genetic testing results should lie in the hands of the carriers themselves .

input: grammar: In conclusion , the revealing of genetic testing results may bring more problems than solutions to the individual and therefore they should be given the final say in whether to reveal the results .
target: In conclusion , the revealing of genetic test results may bring more problems than solutions to the individual and therefore they should be given the final say in whether to reveal the results .

input: grammar: Many problems such as discrimination and psychological stigmatisation attributed from the release of genetic testing should be taken into consideration when deciding whether to reveal the genetic testing results as they can worsen an individual 's health condition .
target: Many problems such as discrimination and psychological stigmatisation attributed from the release of genetic testing should be taken into consideration when deciding whether to reveal the genetic testing results as they can worsen an individual 's health condition .

input: grammar: Should a carrier of a known genetic risk be obligated to tell 3rd parties ?
target: Should a carrier of a known genetic risk be obligated to tell 3rd parties ?

input: grammar: Genetic testing is a medical test which looks at the DNA makeup of an individual .
target: Genetic testing is a medical test which looks at the DNA makeup of an individual .

input: grammar: The advantages of genetic testing include diagnosis of current or future diseases , prevention or early treatment and reduced disease risk in future generations ( American Association for Clinical Chemistry [ AACC ] , 2009 ; Riper , 2005 ) .
target: The advantages of genetic testing include diagnosis of current or future diseases , prevention or early treatment and reducing disease risk in future generations ( ; Riper , 2005 ) .

input: grammar: Some possible disadvantages include anxiety , stress and strained family relationships ( AACC , 2009 ; Riper , 2005 ) .
target: Some possible disadvantages include anxiety , stress and strained family relationships ( Riper , 2005 ) .

input: grammar: After an individual has undergone genetic testing , is it necessary for him to share his test results with 3rd parties ( someone other than his doctor ) ?
target: After an individual has undergone genetic testing , is it necessary for him to share his test results with 3rd parties ( someone other than his doctor ) ?

input: grammar: While sharing can improve workplace safety and family health , it may also lead to genetic discrimination or unnecessary stress for both the patient and his family ( Nuffield Council on Bioethics [ NCB ] , 1993 ; Sobel and Bursztajn , 2000 ) .
target: While sharing can improve workplace safety and family health , it may also lead to genetic discrimination or unnecessary stress for both the patient and his family ( Sobel and Bursztajn , 2000 ) .

input: grammar: However , there are antidiscrimination laws and stressed individuals can seek genetic counseling ( AACC , 2009 ; Human Genome Management Information System [ HGMIS ] , 2008 ) .
target: However , there are antidiscrimination laws where stressed individuals can seek genetic counseling ( .

input: grammar: Hence , an individual should be obligated to tell 3rd parties his genetic test results .
target: Hence , an individual should be obligated to tell third parties his or her genetic test results .

input: grammar: Firstly , sharing of genetic test results benefits the individual with regards to working environment .
target: Firstly , sharing of genetic test results benefits the individual with regards to the working environment .

input: grammar: Some work environments may increase disease risk in individuals with a particular genetic makeup .
target: Some work environments may increase disease risk in individuals with a particular genetic makeup .

input: grammar: For example , individuals with the genetic disorder , alpha-1-antitrypsin deficiency have higher risk of getting related diseases when exposed to smoky environments ( NCB , 1993 ) .
target: For example , individuals with the genetic disorder , alpha-1-antitrypsin deficiency have higher risk of getting related diseases when exposed to smoky environments ( NCB , 1993 ) .

input: grammar: Thus , employers can have alternative work arrangements for these at-risk employees .
target: Thus , employers can have alternative work arrangements for these at-risk employees .

input: grammar: Opponents of this position argue that revelation of genetic test results to 3rd parties will cause individuals to face genetic discrimination .
target: Opponents of this position argue that revelation of genetic test results to third parties will cause individuals to face genetic discrimination .

input: grammar: Sobel & Bursztajn ( 2000 ) reported that the American Management Associated did a survey on this and results showed that 7 % of employers use employee 's genetic information for employing and job advancement decisions .
target: Sobel & Bursztajn ( 2000 ) reported that the American Management Associated did a survey on this and results showed that 7 % of employers use employee 's genetic information for employing and job advancement decisions .

input: grammar: For instance , an employer fired an office worker with a genetic disease due to not wanting to cover her high treatment costs under the company 's health care benefits for workers ( Sobel & Bursztajn , 2000 ) .
target: For instance , an employer fired an office worker with a genetic disease due to not wanting to cover her high treatment costs under the company 's health care benefits for workers ( Sobel & Bursztajn , 2000 ) .

input: grammar: However , there are antidiscrimination laws ( Sobel & Bursztajn , 2000 ) .
target: However , there are antidiscrimination laws ( Sobel & Bursztajn , 2000 ) .

input: grammar: Genetic Information Nondiscrimination Act ( GINA ) was signed into law by President George W. Bush on May 2008 ( HGMIS , 2008 ) .
target: Genetic Information Nondiscrimination Act ( GINA ) was signed into law by President George W. Bush on May 2008 ( HGMIS , 2008 ) .

input: grammar: GINA forbids genetic discrimination by employers and health insurers ( HGMIS , 2008 ) .
target: GINA forbids genetic discrimination by employers and health insurers ( HGMIS , 2008 ) .

input: grammar: Therefore , revelation of genetic test results to others , benefits the individual .
target: Therefore , revelation of genetic test results to others , benefits the individual .

input: grammar: Secondly , sharing of genetic test results can improve family health .
target: Secondly , sharing of genetic test results can improve family health .

input: grammar: When an individual is identified to have a gene mutation associated with a disease , his family and relatives may also have that gene mutation .
target: When an individual is identified as having a gene mutation associated with a disease , his family and relatives may also have that gene mutation .

input: grammar: His direct family has 50 percent chance of having the same mutation while his extended family has 25 percent chance of having the same mutation ( Norrgard , 2008 ) .
target: His direct family has a fifty percent chance of having the same mutation while his extended family has 25 percent chance of having the same mutation ( Norrgard , 2008 ) .

input: grammar: Hence , that individual should inform his family and relatives so as to advise them to take genetic testing .
target: Hence , that individual should inform his family and relatives so as to advise them to take genetic testing .

input: grammar: If his family or relatives are found to have the same gene mutation , early treatment or preventive measures can be taken .
target: If his family or relatives are found to have the same gene mutation , early treatment or preventive measures can be taken .

input: grammar: Critics argue that genetic information may cause negative emotional and psychological effects on family and relatives ( AACC , 2009 ) .
target: Critics argue that genetic information may cause negative emotional and psychological effects on family and relatives ( AACC , 2009 ) .

input: grammar: However , genetic counseling is available , to help them cope with their psychological problems ( AACC , 2009 ) .
target: However , genetic counseling is available , to help them cope with their psychological problems ( AACC , 2009 ) .

input: grammar: Thus , the revelation of one 's genetic test results to family and relatives , benefits them .
target: Thus , the revelation of one 's genetic test results to family and relatives , benefits them .

input: grammar: In conclusion , an individual should reveal his genetic test results to 3rd parties as it improves workplace safety and family health .
target: In conclusion , an individual should reveal his genetic test results to 3rd parties as it improves workplace safety and family health .

input: grammar: Sharing of genetic results not only benefits himself , but also his family and relatives .
target: Sharing of genetic results not only benefits himself , but also his family and relatives .

input: grammar: If one loves his family , one should let them know his genetic test results .
target: If one loves his family , one should let them know his genetic test results .

input: grammar: Carriers of a Known Genetic Risk Should Tell Their Relatives
target: Carriers of a Known Genetic Risk Should Tell Their Relatives

input: grammar: As science develops rapidly , genetic testing , one of the most advanced technology , has become a common component of medical care .
target: As science develops rapidly , genetic testing , one of the most advanced technologies , has become a common component of medical care .

input: grammar: According to the definition from BIO ( Biotechnology Industry Organization ) , genetic testing is " the analysis of an individual 's genetic material " ( 2009 ) .
target: According to the definition from BIO ( Biotechnology Industry Organization ) , genetic testing is " the analysis of an individual 's genetic material " ( 2009 ) .

input: grammar: This new technology can help to identify genetic disease .
target: This new technology can help to identify genetic disease .

input: grammar: However , the controversy is that if the individual who carries a genetic risk should tell their relatives the results of genetic testing .
target: However , the controversy is that if the individual who carries a genetic risk should tell their relatives the results of genetic testing .

input: grammar: Some emphasize the significance of personal privacy , and show the concern of genetic discrimination .
target: Some emphasize the significance of personal privacy , and show the concern of genetic discrimination .

input: grammar: However , because the whole family shares the same set of genes , they have the right to know the result of the genetic test .
target: However , because the whole family shares the same set of genes , they have the right to know the result of the genetic test .

input: grammar: For the carriers , telling the result to their families is not only showing their responsibility to the family and society , but also the best way to ensure they get the best care .
target: For the carriers , telling the result to their families is not only showing their responsibility to the family and society , but also the best way to ensure they get the best care .

input: grammar: Firstly , it is their responsibility to tell the relatives the result of the genetic test .
target: Firstly , it is their responsibility to tell the relatives the result of the genetic test .

input: grammar: According to the article Genetic testing is all in the family by Jeffery P. Kahn , Director of Centre for Bioethics , University of Minnesota , the family has the right to know the result of the genetic test of any member in the family .
target: According to the article Genetic testing is all in the family by Jeffery P. Kahn , Director of Centre for Bioethics , University of Minnesota , the family has the right to know the result of the genetic test of any member in the family .

input: grammar: Since the whole family shares the same set of genes , the information the individual provides through the genetic testing may have just as much meaning for the family as for him or herself ( Kahn , 2000 ) .
target: Since the whole family shares the same set of genes , the information the individual provides through the genetic testing may have just as much meaning for the family as for him or herself ( Kahn , 2000 ) .

input: grammar: Therefore , these results should be told , no matter they are good or bad .
target: Therefore , these results should be told , no matter if it is good or bad .

input: grammar: However , some may claim that the individuals have the right to protect their privacy ( Kahn , 2000 ) , and like other private information , genetic information should be protected properly , and people have the final say whether to reveal it to others .
target: However , some may claim that the individuals have the right to protect their privacy ( Kahn , 2000 ) , and like other private information , genetic information should be protected properly , and people have the final say whether to reveal it to others .

input: grammar: However , here there is something more important than privacy .
target: However , here there is something more important than privacy .

input: grammar: Genetic disorder only can be treated if those carriers of a known genetic risk decide to reveal their genetic result .
target: Genetic disorder only can be treated if those carriers of a known genetic risk decide to reveal their genetic result .

input: grammar: Moreover , we can only protect our children from inherited disease if we know whether there is a genetic risk .
target: Moreover , we can only protect our children from inherited disease if we know whether there is a genetic risk .

input: grammar: As a result , the carriers of a known genetic risk should tell their relatives .
target: As a result , the carriers of a known genetic risk should tell their relatives .

input: grammar: Secondly , it ensures that those carriers of genetic risk get the best care from family and society if they are willing to tell the test results .
target: Secondly , it ensures that those carriers of genetic risk get the best care from family and society if they are willing to tell the test results .

input: grammar: As we all know , genetic disorder is not contagious and there is no risk for those people who want to offer help .
target: As we all know , genetic disorders are not contagious and there is no risk for those people who want to offer help .

input: grammar: However , sometimes when there is high pressure , like knowing they are having genetic disorder , the individuals can not make decisions properly , while their family and professional can take good care of them and make the best decision for them ( Forrest et al. , 2007 ) .
target: However , sometimes when there is high pressure , like knowing they are having a genetic disorder , the individuals can not make decisions properly , while their family and professional can take good care of them and make the best decision for them ( Forrest et al. , 2007 ) .

input: grammar: Someone may claim that other people 's decision may lead potential dangers for the person concerned ( Forrest et al. , 2007 ) , since we are not them and can not know exactly what they need .
target: Someone may claim that other people 's decision may lead to potential dangers for the person concerned ( Forrest et al. , 2007 ) , since we are not them and can not know exactly what they need .

input: grammar: However , as known to all , a group with several professionals will have more knowledge and experience than the individual , and the family members of the carriers will selflessly take care of them .
target: However , as known to all , a group with several professionals will have more knowledge and experience than the individual , and the family members of the carriers will selflessly take care of them .

input: grammar: Therefore it is better for the carriers to tell their relatives the test results .
target: Therefore it is better for the carriers to tell their relatives the test results .

input: grammar: To draw a conclusion , for the carriers of genetic risk , it is better to tell the genetic test results to their relatives because it is an action not only showing their responsibility to the family and society , but also ensuring that they can get the best care .
target: To draw a conclusion , for the carriers of genetic risk , it is better to tell the genetic test results to their relatives because it is an action not only showing their responsibility to the family and society , but also ensuring that they can get the best care .

input: grammar: Retrieved September 17 , 2009 from HYPERLINK " http : //archives.cnn.com/2000/HEALTH/07/25/ethics.matters/ " http : //archives.cnn.com/2000/HEALTH/07/25/ethics.matters/

input: grammar: The results of genetic testing
target: The results of genetic testing

input: grammar: Nowadays , as the technology of genetic testing has been well-developed , people who are at risk of genetic disorder may request for such testing to determine their health condition .
target: Nowadays , as the technology of genetic testing has developed , people who are at risk of genetic disorders may request for such testing to determine their health condition .

input: grammar: To some extent , the results of genetic testing can help people to detect certain disease and take measures to reduce the risk .
target: To some extent , the results of genetic testing can help people to detect certain disease and take measures to reduce the risk .

input: grammar: However , the abuse of the results may cause many issues .
target: However , the abuse of the results may cause many issues .

input: grammar: Revealing the results of individual genetic testing without individual 's permission may lead to invasion of privacy and social discrimination .
target: Revealing the results of individual genetic testing without an individuals permission may lead to the invasion of privacy and social discrimination .

input: grammar: Hence , the individual requesting genetic testing should have the final say in whether to reveal the results of such testing .
target: Hence , the individual requesting genetic testing should have the final say in whether to reveal the results of such testing .

input: grammar: An important reason why individual should have the final say in whether to reveal the results of genetic testing is because people have the right to protect their privacy .
target: An important reason why an individual should have the final say in whether to reveal the results of genetic testing is because people have the right to protect their privacy .

input: grammar: The decision of informing family members the results should be a personal choice .
target: The decision of informing family members the results should be a personal choice .

input: grammar: Because the results of genetic testing not only affect the person who takes the test but also relate to his family members , sometimes people may encounter dilemmas .
target: Because the results of genetic testing not only affect the person who takes the test but also relates to his family members , sometimes people may encounter dilemmas .

input: grammar: Individuals may make different decision depending on their situations .
target: Individuals may make different decisions depending on their situations .

input: grammar: For example , after undergoing genetic testing , people may find out that their siblings also have the same genetic disorder with themselves .
target: For example , after undergoing genetic testing , people may find out that their siblings also have the same genetic disorder as them .

input: grammar: However , informing them may result in huge changes in their life decisions .
target: However , informing them may result in huge changes in their life decisions .

input: grammar: Thus , whether to tell them the results or not is a cautious decision that should be made by individuals ( Norrgard 2008 ) .
target: Thus , whether to tell them the results or not is a cautious decision that should be made by individuals ( Norrgard 2008 ) .

input: grammar: Some may suggest that it is an ethical responsibility for people who are found to have genetic disorder to inform the results to their family members .
target: Some may suggest that it is an ethical responsibility for people who are found to have genetic disorders to inform the results to their family members .

input: grammar: However , since currently there is no legislation forcing people to do so , the results should be treated as privacy and should be protected ( Norrgard 2008 ) .
target: However , since currently there is no legislation forcing people to do so , the results should be treated as private and should be protected ( Norrgard 2008 ) .

input: grammar: Another reason is that the misuses of genetic testing results may cause social discrimination .
target: Another reason is that the misuses of genetic testing results may cause social discrimination .

input: grammar: If the results of individual genetic testing are revealed to employers and insurance companies , employers may not hire people who are diagnosed by with certain disease .
target: If the results of individual genetic testing are revealed to employers and insurance companies , employers may not hire people who are diagnosed with certain diseases .

input: grammar: Likewise , insurance companies may also refuse to serve people who have high risk of some disease ( Maxwell & Mehlman 1999 ) .
target: Likewise , insurance companies may also refuse to serve people who have high risk of some diseases ( Maxwell & Mehlman 1999 ) .

input: grammar: Opponents may argue that law can be used as a mean to protect against genetic discrimination .
target: Opponents may argue that the law can be used as a means to protect against genetic discrimination .

input: grammar: They cited that a number of laws have been enacted to prohibit insurance companies from collecting information of genetic testing and using them to discriminate against people ( Maxwell & Mehlman 1999 ) .
target: They cited that a number of laws have been enacted to prohibit insurance companies from collecting information of genetic testing and using them to discriminate against people ( Maxwell & Mehlman 1999 ) .

input: grammar: However , this approach is not effective .
target: However , this approach is not effective .

input: grammar: Firstly , most laws only restrict types of genetic information , but they do not ensure that people will be fairly charged if they reveal genetic testing results ( Norrgard 2008 ) .
target: Firstly , most laws only restrict types of genetic information , but they do not ensure that people will be fairly charged if they reveal genetic testing results ( Norrgard 2008 ) .

input: grammar: Secondly , laws still have limitation of prohibiting employers from refusing people who have genetic disorder ( Maxwell & Mehlman 1999 ) .
target: Secondly , laws still have limitation of prohibiting employers from refusing people who have genetic disorder ( Maxwell & Mehlman 1999 ) .

input: grammar: Hence , using legal power to limit discrimination is incomplete .
target: Hence , using legal power to limit discrimination is incomplete .

input: grammar: To conclude , since genetic testing results are people 's privacy and revealing them may cause social discrimination , the individual requesting genetic testing should have the final say in whether to reveal the results of such testing .
target: To conclude , since genetic testing results deals with people 's privacy and revealing them may cause social discrimination , the individual requesting genetic testing should have the final say in whether to reveal the results of such testing .

input: grammar: References
target: References

input: grammar: Maxwell J , Mehlman JD .
target: Maxwell J , Mehlman JD .

input: grammar: 1999 .

target: The Privacy of genetic information [ Internet ] [ cited 2009 Oct 24 ] .Available from : { http : //www.thedoctorwillseeyounow.com/articles/bioethics/geneticinfo_1/index.shtml } [ HYPERLINK : http : //www.thedoctorwillseeyounow.com/articles/bioethics/geneticinfo_1/index.shtml ]

input: grammar: Norrgard K. 2008 .
target: Norrgard K. 2008 .
