target: Ethics of Genetic Testing : Medical Insurance and Genetic Discrimination .

input: grammar: Scitable [ Internet ] [ cited 2009 Oct 24 ] .Available from : http : //www.nature.com/scitable/topicpage/Ethics-of-Genetic-Testing-Medical-Insurance-and-651
target: Scitable [ Internet ] [ cited 2009 Oct 24 ] .Available from : http : //www.nature.com/scitable/topicpage/Ethics-of-Genetic-Testing-Medical-Insurance-and-651

input: grammar: Oxford Dictionary defines genetic testing as the sequencing of human DNA in order to discover genetic differences , anomalies , or mutations that may prove pathological .
target: The Oxford Dictionary defines genetic testing as the sequencing of human DNA in order to discover genetic differences , anomalies , or mutations that may prove pathological .

input: grammar: One of the many ethical issues associated with genetic testing involves the question of whether a known carrier of a genetic condition is obligated to tell his or her relatives .
target: One of the many ethical issues associated with genetic testing involves the question of whether a known carrier of a genetic condition is obligated to tell his or her relatives .

input: grammar: While the individual has no legal or professional obligation to inform his relatives , he nevertheless has a very strong moral obligation to do so as his relatives who may have inherited the condition can take action to improve the prognosis as well as prepare themselves mentally and socially , not revealing this information can be interpreted as negligence on the part of the carrier , and telling his relatives will allow them to anticipate lifestyle changes to accommodate his condition as well as readies them for possible financial strain that may be brought about .
target: While the individual has no legal or professional obligation to inform his relatives , he nevertheless has a very strong moral obligation to do so as his relatives who may have inherited the condition can take action to improve the prognosis as well as prepare themselves mentally and socially , not revealing this information can be interpreted as negligence on the part of the carrier , and telling his relatives will allow them to anticipate lifestyle changes to accommodate his condition as well as ready them for possible financial strain that may come about .

input: grammar: First of all , it is a known fact that genetic conditions may be hereditary and thus indirectly involves the relatives of the carrier as well , putting the carrier 's relatives at a possible risk having the condition as well .
target: First of all , it is a known fact that genetic conditions may be hereditary and thus indirectly involve the relatives of the carrier as well , putting the carrier 's relatives at a possible risk of having the condition as well .

input: grammar: The carrier is at least morally obligated to inform his relatives from an altruistic point of view .
target: The carrier is at least morally obligated to inform his relatives from an altruistic point of view .

input: grammar: In the event that one of the carrier 's relatives discover that he is affected by the disorder , preventive measures can be taken in anticipation of the disease and in the event that the disease is incurable , palliative steps can be planned .
target: In the event that one of the carrier 's relatives discover that he is affected by the disorder , preventive measures can be taken in anticipation of the disease and in the event that the disease is incurable , palliative steps can be planned .

input: grammar: An example of prevention would be an individual affected by the BRCA gene undergoing a mastectomy which would reduce the chances of developing breast cancer from 85 % to 1 % ( http : //www.medscape.com/viewarticle/573060 ) .
target: An example of prevention would be an individual affected by the BRCA gene undergoing a mastectomy which would reduce the chances of developing breast cancer from 85 % to 1 % ( http : //www.medscape.com/viewarticle/573060 ) .

input: grammar: Beyond telling them , the decision to undergo genetic testing is purely up to the relatives themselves .
target: Beyond telling them , the decision to undergo genetic testing is purely up to the relatives themselves .

input: grammar: While some might say that there is no point of knowing if a disease has no cure , knowing has its benefits as it not only prepares the individual in the physical aspects of the disease but also the psychological aspects .
target: While some might say that there is no point in knowing if a disease has no cure , knowing has its benefits as it not only prepares the individual for the physical aspects of the disease but also the psychological aspects .

input: grammar: In the event that a relative tests positive for a genetic condition , it is not only the physical aspects of the diseases that must be considered , but also the psychosocial aspects of the disease .
target: In the event that a relative tests positive for a genetic condition , it is not only the physical aspects of the diseases that must be considered , but also the psychosocial aspects of the disease .

input: grammar: Having known that he is at risk of a genetic condition , an individual will be able to anticipate the possibility that he might be afflicted with the disease and mentally prepare for that possibility .
target: Having known that he is at risk of a genetic condition , an individual will be able to anticipate the possibility that he might be afflicted with the disease and mentally prepare for that possibility .

input: grammar: He will be able to work towards acceptance of the fact that he might have the condition and be able to adapt easily to it in the event that the condition manifests ; as opposed to the condition striking suddenly without prior warning .
target: He will be able to work towards acceptance of the fact that he might have the condition and be able to adapt easily to it in the event that the condition manifests itself itself , as opposed to the condition striking suddenly without prior warning .

input: grammar: Furthermore , he will be able to also mentally prepare for any stigma or discrimination that he may face in society as it has been shown that identifying patients in need of psychosocial support will enhance effect on well being ( Mind and cancer : does psychosocial intervention improve survival and psychological well- being ? ) .
target: Furthermore , he will be able to also mentally prepare for any stigma or discrimination that he may face in society as it has been shown that identifying patients in need of psychosocial support will enhance effect on well being ( Mind and cancer : does psychosocial intervention improve survival and psychological well- being ? ) .

input: grammar: Although some people prefer to be carefree and prefer not to know at all as they cite the fact that knowing will make them anxious and stressed , the onus is on them to go for the genetic testing to determine any abnormalities .
target: Although some people prefer to be carefree and prefer not to know at all as they cite the fact that knowing will make them anxious and stressed , the onus is on them to go for the genetic testing to determine any abnormalities .

input: grammar: If ignorance is their choice , it is their right to go along with it .
target: If ignorance is their choice , it is their right to go along with it .

input: grammar: While the obligation for a carrier to tell his relatives may be considered as a breach of privacy , not telling them at all is tantamount to negligence , especially if the genetic condition is known to be hereditary .
target: While the obligation for a carrier to tell his relatives may be considered as a breach of privacy , not telling them at all is tantamount to negligence , especially if the genetic condition is known to be hereditary .

input: grammar: It is only responsible to inform someone if there is a possibility that their life may be severely affected because of a disease .
target: It is only responsible to inform someone if there is a possibility that their life may be severely affected because of a disease .

input: grammar: If you knew there was a murderer in your neighbor 's house , would you not inform them ?
target: If you knew there was a murderer in your neighbor 's house , would you not inform them ?

input: grammar: In the perspective of a carrier 's relative , most people would definitely want to be informed if they are at an increased risk of having a genetic condition .
target: In the perspective of a carrier 's relative , most people would definitely want to be informed if they are at an increased risk of having a genetic condition .

input: grammar: Undoubtedly , for some genetic risks , there will be a stronger case for the duty to warn relatives about it especially in serious conditions like breast cancer ( BRCA-1 ) and Huntington 's Disease ( On warning families about genetic risk : the ghost of Tarasoff ) While there is an issue of a not having confidentiality on the matter , at least the carrier can sleep well at night knowing that he has fulfilled his responsibility .
target: Undoubtedly , for some genetic risks , there will be a stronger case for the duty to warn relatives about it especially in serious conditions like breast cancer ( BRCA-1 ) and Huntington 's Disease ( On warning families about genetic risk : the ghost of Tarasoff ) While there is an issue of a not having confidentiality on the matter , at least the carrier can sleep well at night knowing that he has fulfilled his responsibility .

input: grammar: It must also be noted that several genetic conditions are highly debilitating and will inevitably have a huge impact on family members , who are usually the main care givers physically as well as socially .
target: It must also be noted that several genetic conditions are highly debilitating and will inevitably have a huge impact on family members , who are usually the main care givers physically as well as socially .

input: grammar: If this is the case , family members have a right to know what to expect of the disease and to what extent they will have to adjust their lives to accommodate the carrier .
target: If this is the case , family members have a right to know what to expect of the disease and to what extent they will have to adjust their lives to accommodate the carrier .

input: grammar: In this sense , the carrier is thus obliged to inform his family members of his genetic test in order for his family members to prepare for a possible change in lifestyle .
target: In this sense , the carrier is thus obliged to inform his family members of his genetic test in order for his family members to prepare for a possible change in lifestyle .

input: grammar: It will also allow the family to assess the extent of the disease and make preparations in the event that they are unable to accommodate the carrier such as sending the carrier to a nursing home or employing a full-time nurse to assist in care giving .
target: It will also allow the family to assess the extent of the disease and make preparations in the event that they are unable to accommodate the carrier such as sending the carrier to a nursing home or employing a full-time nurse to assist in care giving .

input: grammar: This is opposed to have the disease suddenly dropped on them like a bombshell which would cause severe disruption in their lives .
target: This is opposed to have the disease suddenly dropped on them like a bombshell which would cause severe disruption in their lives .

input: grammar: For example , it is shown that the majority of people with Alzheimer 's disease are cared for in the home , which may affect the work situation of the caregivers , their own health , and their finances ( http : //family.jrank.org/pages/70/Alzheimer-s-Disease- Impact-on-Family.html ) .
target: For example , it is shown that the majority of people with Alzheimer 's disease are cared for in the home , which may affect the work situation of the caregivers , their own health , and their finances ( http : //family.jrank.org/pages/70/Alzheimer-s-Disease- Impact-on-Family.html ) .

input: grammar: A negative point to this is that family members may view the carrier as a burden even before the condition manifests and this may be a source of tension in the family .
target: A negative point to this is that family members may view the carrier as a burden even before the condition manifests and this may be a source of tension in the family .

input: grammar: Nevertheless , it should be pointed out that it is better to be safe and sorry as in this case , the burden has a strong potential to manifest and it would be better to sort out any misgivings before the condition strikes rather than after .
target: Nevertheless , it should be pointed out that it is better to be safe and sorry as in this case , the burden has a strong potential to manifest and it would be better to sort out any misgivings before the condition strikes rather than after .

input: grammar: Finally , the financial effect of the disease on the carrier and his relatives must also be considered in the ethical reasoning of this argument as the financial aspects of a disease may be far reaching especially for families in the low income group .
target: Finally , the financial impact of the disease on the carrier and his relatives must also be considered in the ethical reasoning of this argument as the financial aspects of a disease may be far reaching , especially for families in the low income group .

input: grammar: This especially applies more to certain diseases like diabetes mellitus or cancer in which the cost of treatment puts a severe strain on the finances of a family .
target: This especially applies more to certain diseases like diabetes mellitus or cancer in which the cost of treatment puts a severe strain on the finances of a family .

input: grammar: A carrier is thus obliged to tell his family members in order for them to start thinking ahead by starting initiatives like saving plans or taking up more jobs .
target: A carrier is thus obliged to tell his family members in order for them to start thinking ahead by starting initiatives like saving plans or taking up more jobs .

input: grammar: The family will also be able to start looking for avenues of financial assistance even before the disease strikes .
target: The family will also be able to start looking for avenues of financial assistance even before the disease strikes .

input: grammar: To emphasize this point , studies have shown that economic hardship requires households to make difficult decisions between care and basic living expenses , which at times compromises necessary treatments and health care ( economic hardship requires households to make difficult decisions between care and basic living expenses , which at times compromises necessary treatments and health care ) .
target: To emphasize this point , studies have shown that economic hardship requires households to make difficult decisions between care and basic living expenses , which at times compromises necessary treatments and health care ( economic hardship requires households to make difficult decisions between care and basic living expenses , which at times compromises necessary treatments and health care ) .

input: grammar: While some might argue that there is little that people in the low income groups can do to prepare for this and it might simply cause unnecessary stress for them ; it must be pointed out that it is even more important for this group of people to plan ahead for the future as they will very likely lack sufficient resources to deal with it when the problem surfaces .
target: While some might argue that there is little that people in the low income groups can do to prepare for this and it might simply cause unnecessary stress for them ; it must be pointed out that it is even more important for this group of people to plan ahead for the future as they will very likely lack sufficient resources to deal with it when the problem surfaces .

input: grammar: Considering all the points put forth above , I would very much think that there is a strong moral obligation for a carrier of a genetic defect has to tell his relatives about the results of his genetic test .
target: Considering all the points put forth above , I would very much think that there is a strong moral obligation for a carrier of a genetic defect has to tell his relatives about the results of his genetic test .

input: grammar: Allowing them to know will serve as a warning for them to take preventive measure or prepare for the worst as well as readying family members for the possibility that the condition associated with the genetic abnormality may one day surface .
target: Allowing them to know will serve as a warning for them to take preventive measure or prepare for the worst as well as readying family members for the possibility that the condition associated with the genetic abnormality may one day surface .

input: grammar: Despite the arguments of privacy of the individual , feelings of helplessness , possible family tension and increasing the level of stress within a family , I still feel that the moral obligation to let the carrier 's relatives know far outweighs these points .
target: Despite the arguments of privacy of the individual , feelings of helplessness , possible family tension and increasing the level of stress within a family , I still feel that the moral obligation to let the carrier 's relatives know far outweighs these points .

input: grammar: Ultimately , it must be recognized that the carrier of a genetic abnormality is only obliged to tell his relatives ; subsequent action taken beyond that is out of the scope of the obligation of the carrier .
target: Ultimately , it must be recognized that the carrier of a genetic abnormality is only obliged to tell his relatives ; subsequent action taken beyond that is out of the scope of the obligation of the carrier .

input: grammar: The advancement in science and technology has enabled the determination of genetic risk of disease development by means of genetic testing .
target: The advancement in science and technology has enabled the determination of genetic risk of disease development by means of genetic testing .

input: grammar: Although it is an improvement in the scientific world in view of combating diseases , ethical dilemma is born in the communication of genetic risk in families .
target: Although it is an improvement in the scientific world in view of combating diseases , ethical dilemma is born in the communication of genetic risk in families .

input: grammar: Some have suggested that the issue is related to privacy concern and the disclosure of genetic information may cause anxiety , guilt , depression and other disadvantages in both individuals and their relatives ( Norrgard , 2008 ) .
target: Some have suggested that the issue is related to privacy and the disclosure of genetic information may cause anxiety , guilt , depression and other disadvantages in both individuals and their relatives ( Norrgard , 2008 ) .

input: grammar: However the importance of the moral obligation individuals have for their family and the consequences for family planning and personal health of at-risk relatives should not be neglected .
target: However the importance of the moral obligation individuals have for their family and the consequences for family planning and personal health of at-risk relatives should not be neglected .

input: grammar: In fact the potential for harm to uninformed relatives outweighs the individual 's right to confidentiality and therefore the carrier of a known genetic risk should be obligated to tell his or her relatives .
target: In fact the potential for harm to uninformed relatives outweighs the individual 's right to confidentiality and therefore the carrier of a known genetic risk should be obligated to tell his or her relatives .

input: grammar: Forrest and her team stated that " the responsibility of disseminating genetic information to family members lies largely with the individual " ( Forrest , Delatycki , Skene , Aitken , 2007 , para.2 ) .
target: Forrest and her team stated that " the responsibility of disseminating genetic information to family members lies largely with the individual " ( Forrest , Delatycki , Skene , Aitken , 2007 , para.2 ) .

input: grammar: Individuals may possess duty of care and/or moral obligations to communicate the potential genetic risk to relatives .
target: Individuals may possess duty of care and/or moral obligations to communicate the potential genetic risk to relatives .

input: grammar: According to a documented research done by Clarke , Richards , and Kerzin-Storrar , among the 40,000 clients attending genetics clinics over a 1-year period world-wide , only 65 were reported as non- disclosure cases a frequency of non-disclosure that was shown to be less than 1 % of all genetics consults .
target: According to a documented research done by Clarke , Richards , and Kerzin-Storrar , among the 40,000 clients attending genetics clinics over a 1-year period world-wide , only 65 were reported as non- disclosure cases , a frequency of non-disclosure that was shown to be less than 1 % of all genetics consults .

input: grammar: ( Clarke , Richards , Kerzin-Storrar , 2005 ) Indeed , the moral obligation of individuals to their family and relatives is a compelling argument supported by " kinship bonds and an assumed desire to protect family members from harm " ( Forrest et al , 2007 ) .
target: ( Clarke , Richards , Kerzin-Storrar , 2005 ) Indeed , the moral obligation of individuals to their family and relatives is a compelling argument supported by " kinship bonds and an assumed desire to protect family members from harm " ( Forrest et al , 2007 ) .

input: grammar: Some have argued that individuals may not disclose genetic information because they prefer not to contact relatives personally ( Consent and Confidentiality in Genetic Practice : Guidance on Genetic Testing and Sharing Genetic Information , 2005 ) , and they are embarrassed about reporting bad news ( Wertz , 2003 ) , or they are unable to communicate directly with family members ( Ethical Aspects of Human Genetic Testing : An Information Paper , 2000 ) .
target: Some have argued that individuals may not disclose genetic information because they prefer not to contact relatives personally ( Consent and Confidentiality in Genetic Practice : Guidance on Genetic Testing and Sharing Genetic Information , 2005 ) , and they are embarrassed about reporting bad news ( Wertz , 2003 ) , or they are unable to communicate directly with family members ( Ethical Aspects of Human Genetic Testing : An Information Paper , 2000 ) .

input: grammar: Nevertheless , one can seek assistance from genetic health professionals to address the above problems by " having the genetic health professionals to communicate the genetic information to family members at the client 's request " ( Forrest et al , 2007 ) .
target: Nevertheless , one can seek assistance from genetic health professionals to address the above problems by " having the genetic health professionals to communicate the genetic information to family members at the client 's request " ( Forrest et al , 2007 ) .

input: grammar: Genetic information is relevant to both the carrier of a known genetic risk and his or her relatives due to " genetic heritage " ( Wertz , 2003 , p.50 ) , thus for relatives who are unaware of their risk may experience consequences for personal health and family planning ( Forrest et al , 2007 ) .
target: Genetic information is relevant to both the carrier of a known genetic risk and his or her relatives due to " genetic heritage " ( Wertz , 2003 , p.50 ) . Thus relatives who are unaware of their risk may experience consequences for personal health and family planning ( Forrest et al , 2007 ) .

input: grammar: In fact many published guidelines for genetic information disclosure have listed down explicit statements such as 'family ' , 'family members ' or 'relatives ' to broadly include some who are at risk of a genetic condition .
target: In fact many published guidelines for genetic information disclosure have listed explicit statements such as 'family ' , 'family members ' or 'relatives ' to broadly include some who are at risk of a genetic condition .

input: grammar: More explicit statements can be seen from five organizations by " specifying 'blood relatives ' , 'the whole family , ascendants , descendants , collaterals , and possibly spouses ' , 'future children ' , 'relatives , including offspring ' , or 'family , [ which ] needs to be understood as covering an extended set of relatives linked by blood ties or by marriage or by both ' " ( Forrest et al , 2007 , p.614 ) .
target: More explicit statements can be seen from five organizations by " specifying 'blood relatives ' , 'the whole family , ascendants , descendants , collaterals , and possibly spouses ' , 'future children ' , 'relatives , including offspring ' , or 'family , [ which ] needs to be understood as covering an extended set of relatives linked by blood ties or by marriage or by both ' " ( Forrest et al , 2007 , p.614 ) .

input: grammar: Sermijn had done a research involving family relatives who revealed a lack of understanding and awareness that a genetic risk was present in their family ( Sermijn et al , 2004 ) .
target: Sermijn had done a research involving family relatives who revealed a lack of understanding and awareness that a genetic risk was present in their family ( Sermijn et al , 2004 ) .

input: grammar: However this may not be a reason for individuals to withhold genetic information from their relatives .
target: However this may not be a reason for individuals to withhold genetic information from their relatives .

input: grammar: UK Nuffield Council on Bioethics states that " both individuals and family members have responsibilities to be willing to give and receive genetic information " ( Forrest et al , 2007 , p614 ) .
target: UK Nuffield Council on Bioethics states that " both individuals and family members have responsibilities to be willing to give and receive genetic information " ( Forrest et al , 2007 , p614 ) .

input: grammar: Effective communication strategies can be employed to achieve a positive outcome of communication by assessing the vulnerability and receptivity of family relatives .
target: Effective communication strategies can be employed to achieve a positive outcome of communication by assessing the vulnerability and receptivity of family relatives .

input: grammar: This can be achieved through personal understanding or advices given by genetic health professionals ( Gaff , 2007 ) .
target: This can be achieved through personal understanding or advice given by genetic health professionals ( Gaff , 2007 ) .

input: grammar: In summary , the carrier of a known genetic risk should be obligated to tell his or her relatives because the sense of responsibility to inform the relatives with crucial genetic information outweighs concern about affecting the individual by imparting " bad " or potentially unwelcome news .
target: In summary , the carrier of a known genetic risk should be obligated to tell his or her relatives because the sense of responsibility to inform the relatives with crucial genetic information outweighs concerns about affecting the individual by imparting " bad " or potentially unwelcome news .

input: grammar: Potential harm to uninformed family relatives has to be considered although the disclosure may not be smooth due to lack of understanding by relatives .
target: Potential harm to uninformed family relatives has to be considered although the disclosure may not be smooth due to lack of understanding by relatives .

input: grammar: Fortunately the latter can be solved by seeking the help of genetic health professionals who can provide effective communication strategies to help produce a positive outcome of communication .
target: Fortunately the latter can be solved by seeking the help of genetic health professionals who can provide effective communication strategies to help produce a positive outcome of communication .

input: grammar: Gene is the basic heredity unit in all living organism its properties concerns families and kinship of all humans .
target: The gene is the basic heredity unit in all living organisms . Its properties concerns families and kinship of all humans .

input: grammar: It is the study of how characteristics are passed down through generations .
target: Genetics is the study of how characteristics are passed down through generations .

input: grammar: The ability to identify more genes which are related to specific disorders increases dramatically as the genetic technology develops vigorously in this modern time .
target: The ability to identify more genes which are related to specific disorders increases dramatically as the genetic technology develops vigorously .

input: grammar: It allows new possibilities of genetic testing and more to come ( Clarke & Parsons , 1997 ) .
target: It allows new possibilities of genetic testing and more to come ( Clarke & Parsons , 1997 ) .

input: grammar: In the case of diseases that have an onset in adulthood , such as Huntington 's disease , people can get themselves tested before symptoms develop to discover the likelihood of getting the disorder .
target: In the case of diseases that have an onset in adulthood , such as Huntington 's disease , people can get themselves tested before symptoms develop to discover the likelihood of getting the disorder .

input: grammar: Some of those who receive positive testing result , despite the shock and the devastating situation that they face , will consider the interests of other family members and inform their relatives of the existence of this genetic risk in the family .
target: Some of those who receive a positive testing result , despite the shock and the devastating situation that they face , will consider the interests of other family members and inform their relatives of the existence of this genetic risk in the family .

input: grammar: But not all patients will have the moral obligation to do .
target: But not all patients will have the moral obligation to do .

input: grammar: Thus , there is a need for carrier of a known genetic risk to be legally obligated to tell his or her relatives .
target: Thus , there is a need for a carrier of a known genetic risk to be legally obligated to tell his or her relatives .

input: grammar: Carriers of known genetic risks should be obligated to tell their relatives because it prevents severe harm such as loss of lives .
target: Carriers of known genetic risks should be obligated to tell their relatives because it prevents severe harm such as loss of lives .

input: grammar: If they are being alerted of such condition , they will be able to seek possible treatments and receive warnings to avoid detrimental environment stimuli .
target: If they are being alerted to such a condition , they will be able to seek possible treatments and receive warnings to avoid detrimental environment stimuli .

input: grammar: For example , malignant hyperthermia syndrome is an autosomal dominant disorder where life-threatening condition will be triggered by regular anesthesia .
target: For example , malignant hyperthermia syndrome is an autosomal dominant disorder where life-threatening conditions will be triggered by regular anesthesia .

input: grammar: Prior warning of a carrier can actually prevent unexpected death of blood relatives during their surgeries ( Andrews , 1994 ) .
target: Prior warning of a carrier can actually prevent unexpected death of blood relatives during surgery ( Andrews , 1994 ) .

input: grammar: Moreover , information of genetic risk from a carrier will serve as guidance in his or her relatives ' reproductive decision makings .
target: Moreover , information of genetic risk from a carrier will serve as guidance in his or her relatives ' reproductive decision making .

input: grammar: After knowing of possible genetic condition , one may think twice before deciding to conceive a child .
target: After knowing of a possible genetic condition , one may think twice before deciding to conceive a child .

input: grammar: The rate of abortion upon learning of fetus defection will then decrease , hence preventing meaningless loss of lives .
target: The rate of abortion upon learning of fetus defection will then decrease , hence preventing meaningless loss of lives .

input: grammar: Likewise , obligation of carrier to tell his or her relatives allows those who indeed will suffer from dormant genetic diseases or are suffering from genetic condition to plan their lives ahead .
target: Likewise , obligation of carrier to tell his or her relatives allows those who indeed will suffer from dormant genetic diseases or are suffering from genetic condition to plan their lives ahead .

input: grammar: They will tend to avoid passing on the undesirable condition to their children , hence they may seek proper guidance through counseling before consider to conceive a child .
target: They will tend to avoid passing on the undesirable condition to their children , hence they may seek proper guidance through counseling before considering to conceive a child .

input: grammar: For example , Huntington 's disease 's symptoms normally only appear when one is approaching his or her middle age .
target: For example , Huntington 's disease 's symptoms normally only appear when one is approaching his or her middle age .

input: grammar: Knowing of this dormant genetic disease earlier certainly allows the patients to make decision whether to build a family or not to , or for those who already have their own families - whether to conceive children or not to because there is a 50 % chance of passing the mutated gene to the offspring for each pregnancy .
target: Knowing of this dormant genetic disease earlier certainly allows the patients to make decision whether to build a family , or for those who already have their own families - whether to conceive children because there is a 50 % chance of passing the mutated gene to the offspring for each pregnancy .

input: grammar: In addition , informed relatives who then find out their genetic condition - whether they are a carrier or sufferer of that particular genetic disease or not , are given a chance to secure financial schemes for future use .
target: In addition , informed relatives who then find out their genetic condition - whether as carrier or sufferer of that particular genetic disease , are given a chance to secure financial schemes for future use .

input: grammar: Furthermore , their family members are granted the time to equip themselves with the knowledge and ability to take care of said patients for an extended period of time in future .
target: Furthermore , their family members are granted the time to equip themselves with the knowledge and to take care of said patients for an extended period of time in future .

input: grammar: Undoubtedly , privacy advocates criticizes that such enforced obligation violates an individual 's autonomy .
target: Undoubtedly , privacy advocates criticize that such enforced obligation violates an individual 's autonomy .

input: grammar: They argue that for family interest to outweigh one 's autonomy is unethical because there may be cases where relatives use one 's genetic disorder information to their own advantages , rendering said individual to material loss and mishap social status .
target: They argue that for family interest to outweigh one 's autonomy is unethical because there may be cases where relatives use one 's genetic disorder information to their own advantage , rendering material loss and mishap social status to the individual .

input: grammar: For example , a woman can easily claim custody of her children from her formal husband who has Huntington 's disease , by asserting he will not have the ability to take care of their children in near future .
target: For example , a woman can easily claim custody of her children from her formal husband who has Huntington 's disease , by asserting he will not have the ability to take care of their children in the near future .

input: grammar: While it is true that the extreme circumstances mentioned do exist in the society , one must agree that relatives have their reserved rights too , to know about the presence of genetic risk within the family because no one has exclusive rights over his or her genes as they are shared among the family .
target: While it is true that the extreme circumstances mentioned do exist in society , one must agree that relatives have their rights too , to know about the presence of genetic risk within the family because no one has exclusive rights over his or her genes as they are shared among the family .

input: grammar: Spouses too have the rights to know when it comes to making a family just as he or she has equal rights over the children .
target: Spouses too have the right to know when it comes to making a family just as he or she has equal rights over the children .

input: grammar: Indeed , powerful protection has always been given to autonomy , privacy and confidentiality .
target: Indeed , powerful protection has always been given to autonomy , privacy and confidentiality .

input: grammar: However , these ethics can be breached when the action has an essential purpose , such as safeguarding others from harm , which unquestionably outweighs those said principles ( Andrews , 1994 ) .
target: However , these ethics can be breached when the action has an essential purpose , such as safeguarding others from harm , which unquestionably outweighs those said principles ( Andrews , 1994 ) .

input: grammar: The absolute priority that they possess should be balanced by awareness of averting medical harm to fellow humans ( Wang , 2001 ) .
target: The absolute priority that they possess should be balanced by awareness of averting medical harm to fellow humans ( Wang , 2001 ) .

input: grammar: Therefore , carrier of known genetic risk should be legally obligated to inform relatives , not just morally responsible to do that .
target: Therefore , a carrier of known genetic risk should be legally obligated to inform relatives , not just morally responsible to do that .

input: grammar: In conclusion , legal obligation of carriers with known genetic risk to tell their relatives should be implemented as it bring about advantages such as preventing loss of lives and reducing uncertainties in potential patients ' futures .
target: In conclusion , legal obligation of carriers with known genetic risk to tell their relatives should be implemented as it brings about advantages such as preventing loss of lives and reducing uncertainties in potential patients ' futures .

target: Conversely , the implications of test results raise social and ethical concerns .

Individual genetic information should not be revealed to a third party without authorisation of the tested individual because the fundamental right to privacy should be respected .

target: Also , the predictive nature of genetic testing suggests that there is no need to allow the results to be made public .

target: In addition , it is feared that the effortless access of such information by the concerned party might be utilised inappropriately and be used adversely on an individual .

input: grammar: Firstly , based on the context of confidentiality and privacy , individuals ' right to privacy ought to maintain confidentiality of the genetic makeup .
target: Firstly , based on the context of confidentiality and privacy , individuals have a right to maintain confidentiality of the genetic makeup .

target: and Matlaw,J ( 2005 ) emphasized that individual genetic information gained from testing should be subjected to confidentiality and protected from harm that might result from improper disclosure or use of the information .

input: grammar: One may perceive privacy as an overrated right.. .
target: One may perceive privacy as an overrated right .

target: Secondly , although genetic testing can be useful for assessment of genetic predispositions and diagnosis of medical conditions , it is essential to take note that the testing does not deal with certainties .

input: grammar: It does not identify all of the possible gene mutations that cause a particular condition .
target: It does not identify all of the possible gene mutations that cause a particular condition .

input: grammar: Thus , a positive or a negative outcome does not rule out the possibility for one to contract certain genetic disorder since it only gives a probabilistic indicator of the chances to develop certain diseases based on inherited conditions .
target: Thus , a positive or a negative outcome does not rule out the possibility for one to contract certain genetic disorders since it only gives a probabilistic indicator of the chances to develop certain diseases based on inherited conditions .

input: grammar: Since the clinical outcomes are not definitive , it should not be regarded as medical advice .
target: Since the clinical outcomes are not definitive , it should not be regarded as medical advice .

target: Whilst some insisted that the disclosure of the results is necessary because it leads to early detection of a disease and thus enhances preventability and treatability .

target: It is through the maintenance of healthy lifestyle coupled with routine medical checkups .

target: Thirdly , upon providing genetic material , individuals lose control over who can access results .

target: Genetic testing is a specific medical test to look out for a particular part of the genes .

input: grammar: It is often used to diagnose inherited diseases and to determine a child 's genetic parents .
target: It is often used to diagnose inherited diseases and to determine a child 's genetic parents .

input: grammar: With the main focus on fine tuning its processes to increase its accuracy , ethical issues have not been well addressed .
target: With the main focus on fine tuning its processes to increase its accuracy , ethical issues have not been well addressed .

input: grammar: Ethical issue such as whether an individual requesting genetic testing should have the final say in revealing the results remains shady .
target: Ethical issues such as whether an individual requesting genetic testing should have the final say in revealing the results remains shady .

input: grammar: Many argue that they should not have the final say as it benefits the general public as a whole .
target: Many argue that they should not have the final say as it benefits the general public .

input: grammar: In fact , by knowing the results , it might create unnecessary fear among people .
target: In fact , knowing the results might create unnecessary fear among people .

input: grammar: Not only that , the society might in turn discriminate the individual with an undesired result .
target: Not only that , the society might in turn discriminate against the individual with an undesired result .

input: grammar: Furthermore , it is morally wrong to reveal the results without the individual 's consent as it intrudes one 's privacy .
target: Furthermore , it is morally wrong to reveal the results without the individual 's consent as it intrudes into one 's privacy .

input: grammar: Therefore , individuals should have the final say in revealing the results of their genetic test .
target: Therefore , individuals should have the final say in revealing the results of their genetic test .

input: grammar: First and foremost , revealing the genetic test results without one 's consent is an invasion of privacy .
target: First and foremost , revealing the genetic test results without one 's consent is an invasion of privacy .

input: grammar: Some might argue that the results benefit the whole population as it might be useful an already statistically- scarce medical research .
target: Some might argue that the results benefit the whole population as it might be useful an already statistically- scarce medical research .

input: grammar: However , it is disrespectful to the individual since it is the individual who decides to undertake this genetic test in the first place .
target: However , it is disrespectful to the individual since it is the individual who decides to undertake this genetic test in the first place .

input: grammar: Moreover , having the final say in disclosing the results does not mean not revealing the results at all .
target: Moreover , having the final say in disclosing the results does not mean not revealing the results at all .

input: grammar: One may initially find it hard to accept the reality and may decide to reveal the results at a later stage when ready .
target: One may initially find it hard to accept the reality and may decide to reveal the results at a later stage when ready .

input: grammar: In this case , that individual still can aid in the medical research .
target: In this case , that individual still can aid in the medical research .

input: grammar: Secondly , by revealing the results without the individual 's final say might cause unnecessary stress to others especially to their relatives .
target: Secondly , revealing the results without the individual 's final say might cause unnecessary stress to others , especially their relatives .

input: grammar: An individual might chose not to reveal the outcome of the test as it might create anxiety on their loved ones .
target: An individual might chose not to reveal the outcome of the test as it might create anxiety amongst their loved ones .

input: grammar: This in turn would create unnecessary stress and might affect the way they lead their lives .
target: This in turn would create unnecessary stress and might affect the way they lead their lives .

input: grammar: With this , some might argue that this will impose more strain on the individual who is already facing the stress from reality , and therefore , revealing the results might unburden him or her .
target: Some might argue that this will impose more strain on the individual who is already facing the stress from reality , and therefore , revealing the results might unburden him or her .

target: However , there are genetic counselors trained in this field to address any concerns , and thus there is no need to reveal the results without the individual 's final say .

input: grammar: Thirdly , by knowing the results of the genetic test on the individuals might cause discriminations against them .
target: Thirdly , knowing the results of the genetic test on the individuals might cause discriminations against them .

input: grammar: As our genes are not controlled by us , it will be unfair to discriminate individuals based on their genetic makeup ( Norrgard , 2008 ) .
target: As our genes are not controlled by us , it will be unfair to discriminate against individuals based on their genetic makeup ( Norrgard , 2008 ) .

target: For example , a 30 year old employee who is as competent as any other staff , was recently genetically tested positive for Huntington 's disease .

target: Individuals with Huntington 's disease develop their symptoms such as uncontrolled movements and mental declination only at an average age of 35-44 years old .

target: Knowing that the employee could not remain committed to the company in the next 5-10 years , the employer decides to retrench that employee .

target: As such , the employee 's potential will be hindered as he or she would still be able to work normally until the symptoms set in 5-10 years from now .

input: grammar: This not only hinder one 's potential , it will also affect the way the individual walk his or her remaining path of life .
target: This not only hinders one 's potential , but also affects the way the individual walks his or her remaining path of life .

target: Similarly , a health insurance company might deny an individual an insurance plan or charge them a higher rate if such results are disclosed to it. .

target: Some might argue that this is necessary to prevent people from benefitting off those insurance companies .

target: However , we must not forget the fact that we have no control over our genetic make-up .

target: As such it is not because they want to benefit off these companies , it is more of what they have to do in order to survive financially .

target: Besides , the very purpose of health insurance companies is to provide healthcare and to ensure the well-being of the people .

target: As important as it is to increase the accuracy of genetic testing , individuals should have the final say in revealing the results .

input: grammar: "
grammar: Over the years , genetic testing has been increasing used in clarifying a diagnosis for more targeted treatments and allowing families to avoid having children with devastating diseases .
target: Over the years , genetic testing has been increasingly used in clarifying a diagnosis for more targeted treatments and allowing families to avoid having children with devastating diseases .

input: grammar: However , may also be a precarious tool capable of invading an individual 's privacy and breaching confidentiality , thus , having a significantly negative impact on future public health .
target: However , It may also be a precarious tool capable of invading an individual 's privacy and breaching confidentiality , thus having a significantly negative impact on future public health .

input: grammar: In addition , abuse of genetic testing information may result in employment discrimination .
target: In addition , abuse of genetic testing information may result in employment discrimination .

input: grammar: Therefore , individual should have the final say whether to reveal the results of their own genetic testing .
target: Therefore , individuals should have the final say whether to reveal the results of their own genetic testing .

input: grammar: Firstly , privacy is important in maintaining individuals ' autonomy and individuality as individuals define themselves by deciding how much personal information to disclose ( Privacilla , 2001 ) .
target: Firstly , privacy is important in maintaining individuals ' autonomy and individuality as individuals define themselves by deciding how much personal information to disclose ( Privacilla , 2001 ) .

input: grammar: Similarly , privacy also relates to the individuals ' power over genetic information confidentiality .
target: Similarly , privacy also relates to the individuals ' power over genetic information confidentiality .

input: grammar: Moreover , genetic information is protected in several ways ; Common Law Principles , Statutory protection in the Data Protect Act 1984 , Doctor 's professional codes of practice and contracts of healthcare providers ' employment .
target: Moreover , genetic information is protected in several ways ; Common Law Principles , Statutory protection in the Data Protect Act 1984 , Doctor 's professional codes of practice and contracts of healthcare providers ' employment .

input: grammar: According to these documents , anyone including all healthcare providers has no right to disclose individuals ' genetic information to a third party without the individual 's consent .
target: According to these documents , anyone , including all healthcare providers , has no right to disclose individuals ' genetic information to a third party without the individual 's consent .

input: grammar: However , genetic information of an individual susceptible to a particular genetic disease inevitably concerns family members who usually also share the same set of genes .
target: However , genetic information of an individual susceptible to a particular genetic disease inevitably concerns family members who usually also share the same set of genes .

input: grammar: Hence , advocates may argue that if an individual holds the final say , yet chooses to withhold the information from their family members , this could have serious implications on the other family members susceptible to a particular disease .
target: Hence , advocates may argue that if an individual holds the final say , yet chooses to withhold the information from their family members , this could have serious implications on the other family members susceptible to a particular disease .

input: grammar: On the other hand , if the individual chooses to freely release such information to family members who may not be susceptible , could cause undue anxiety .
target: On the other hand , if the individual chooses to freely release such information to family members who may not be susceptible , cause undue anxiety .

input: grammar: Admittedly , the imbalance control can result in negative consequences , but one can also adopt the view that a responsible person would wish to communicate relevant information to their family members who are interested in that information , and a responsible person is interested in that information , particularly where it may have a significance in future decisions that they might hold .
target: Admittedly , can result in negative consequences , but one can also adopt the view that a responsible person would wish to communicate relevant information to their family members who are interested in that information , and another responsible person is interested in that information , particularly where it may have a significance in future decisions that they might hold .

input: grammar: Supporting this notion , evidences from a government case study suggests that individual withholding genetic information from people , who may need to know , is not a common occurrence .
target: Supporting this notion , evidence from a government case study suggests that individuals withholding genetic information from people who may need to know is not a common occurrence .

input: grammar: In addition , desirability of sharing information with family members is also emphasized through counseling and doctor 's persuading , but not made a condition as it does not supersede the individual 's right to privacy .
target: In addition , the desirability of sharing information with family members is also emphasized through counseling and doctor 's persuading , but not made a condition as it does not supersede the individual 's right to privacy .

input: grammar: Furthermore , it is false that family members are not protected , because the court passes on laws to reveal an individuals ' genetic information .
target: Furthermore , it is false that family members are not protected , because the court passes on laws to reveal an individuals ' genetic information .

input: grammar: This however , is judged on a case by case basis , and is only approved if an individual 's decision causes potential damage rather than mere inconvenience and if the reason for refusal to give permission has evidences of malice .
target: This , however , is judged on a case by case basis , and is only approved if an individual 's decision causes potential damage rather than mere inconvenience and if the reason for refusal to give permission has evidence of malice .

input: grammar: Most importantly , confidence and trust can also be shattered if doctors fail to respect confidentiality .
target: Most importantly , confidence and trust can also be shattered if doctors fail to respect confidentiality .

input: grammar: In the long run , public health might be affected as doctors are discredited as a source of education and patients do not come forward .
target: In the long run , public health might be affected as doctors are discredited as a source of education and patients do not come forward .

input: grammar: Therefore , individual should still have the final say because the interest of the family members does not supersede individuals ' privacy and there is an assumed responsibility of individual to share relevant information , but even without doing so , family members would still be protected by the laws .
target: Therefore , individuals should still have the final say because the interest of the family members does not supersede individuals ' privacy and there is an assumed responsibility of individuals to share relevant information , but even without doing so , family members would still be protected by the laws .

input: grammar: Also , breaching patients ' confidentiality has significantly negative impact on future public health .
target: Also , breaching patients ' confidentiality has significantly negative impact on future public health .

input: grammar: Secondly , the disclosure of individuals ' genetic information to employers may result in employment discrimination .
target: Secondly , the disclosure of individuals ' genetic information to employers may result in employment discrimination .

input: grammar: Competition in market forces and drive for economic efficiency can invoke employers to exploit the genetic information as opportunities to reduce cost and improve work efficiency .
target: Competition in market forces and drive for economic efficiency can invoke employers to exploit the genetic information as opportunities to reduce cost and improve work efficiency .

input: grammar: Employers would prefer to hire a " healthy worker " because they have a lower frequency of being absent through illness which translates to lower cost in work impairments , hiring temporary replacements and fewer precautions to be taken to deal with health and safety risks .
target: Employers would prefer to hire a " healthy worker " because they have a lower frequency of being absent through illness which translates to lower cost in work impairments , hiring temporary replacements and less precaution to be taken to deal with health and safety risks .

input: grammar: Moreover , genetic information can also deny a person with late onset of the disease of a particular job , for example a person with Huntington 's disease , being healthy most of his or her life time .
target: Moreover , genetic information can also deny a person with late onset of a disease of a particular job , for example a person with Huntington 's disease , being healthy most of his or her lifetime .

input: grammar: Though some employers claimed that knowing individuals ' genetic information can help them to take specific measures to protect individuals at risk of occupational diseases , it might not be feasible to the financial status of a company if such measures were to incur huge sums of money .
target: Though some employers claimed that knowing individuals ' genetic information can help them to take specific measures to protect individuals at risk of occupational diseases , it might not be feasible for the financial status of a company if such measures were to incur huge sums of money .

input: grammar: The overriding truth is that employers would inevitably be more concerned about the company 's profitability .
target: The overriding truth is that employers would inevitably be more concerned about the company 's profitability .

input: grammar: In fact , disclosure of genetic information has no benefits to people at risk of non- occupational diseases , but serves to reduce their chances of employment .
target: In fact , disclosure of genetic information has no benefits to people at risk of non- occupational diseases , but serves to reduce their chances of employment .

input: grammar: Moreover , there is currently no legal protection against genetic discrimination in most parts of the world .
target: Moreover , there is currently no legal protection against genetic discrimination in most parts of the world .

input: grammar: Therefore , individual should still hold the right and freedom to the final say because of possible employment discrimination as they have no legal protections .
target: Therefore , individuals should still hold the right and freedom to have the final say because of possible employment discrimination as they have no legal protection .

input: grammar: In conclusion , individual should have the final say in revealing their own genetic testing results .
target: In conclusion , individuals should have the final say in revealing their own genetic testing results .

input: grammar: It is an assumed that individuals should be responsible in sharing relevant information with their family member after counseling .
target: It is assumed that individuals should be responsible in sharing relevant information with their family members after counseling .

target: However , if their actions can result in a direct effect or harm on a third party the court may pass on laws to override such privacy .

input: grammar: Genetic testing is a scientific process that studies changes in chromosomes , genes or proteins .
target: Genetic testing is a scientific process that studies changes in chromosomes , genes or proteins .

target: Confirming or ruling out a suspected genetic condition or determine a person 's chance of developing or passing on a genetic disorder depends on the results of the genetic test .

input: grammar: As there are ethical , legal and social concerns with revealing the results of such testing , the decision lies in the carrier of the known genetic risk .
target: As there are ethical , legal and social concerns with revealing the results of such testing , the decision lies in the carrier of the known genetic risk .

input: grammar: Thus , the individual should not be obligated to tell his relatives .
target: Thus , the individual should not be obligated to tell his relatives .

input: grammar: Firstly , one of the implications in revealing the results to our relatives is the threat of facing genetic discrimination when the information is leaked out ( Norrgard , 2008 ) .
target: Firstly , one of the implications in revealing the results to our relatives is the threat of facing genetic discrimination when the information is leaked out ( Norrgard , 2008 ) .

input: grammar: Employers and insurance companies may make use of the information about genetic tests while ignoring the issue of privacy and confidentiality .
target: Employers and insurance companies may make use of the information about genetic tests while ignoring the issue of privacy and confidentiality .

input: grammar: For example , if an employer discovers that the chance that an employee is diagnosed with Huntington 's disease is high , the employer may not retain the employee .
target: For example , if an employer discovers that the chance that an employee is diagnosed with Huntington 's disease is high , the employer may not retain the employee .

input: grammar: As a result , individuals may be discriminated against by employers or be denied needed and deserved insurance coverage .
target: As a result , individuals may be discriminated against by employers or be denied needed and deserved insurance coverage .

input: grammar: This is extremely unfair to an individual by discriminating against his genetic predispositions because we can not control our genes .
target: This is extremely unfair to an individual by discriminating against his genetic predispositions because we can not control our genes .

input: grammar: Hence , the carrier of a known genetic risk should not be obligated to inform his relatives for fear of information being leaked out , which can lead to potential discrimination .
target: Hence , the carrier of a known genetic risk should not be obligated to inform his relatives for fear of information being leaked out , which can lead to potential discrimination .

input: grammar: Secondly , an implication in revealing the results leads to the threat of eugenics ( Devore , 1992 ) .
target: Secondly , an implication in revealing the results leads to the threat of eugenics ( Devore , 1992 ) .

input: grammar: Childbearing decisions are based on genetic information , thus adding social or political pressure on people .
target: Childbearing decisions are based on genetic information , thus adding social or political pressure on people .

input: grammar: Reproduction is encouraged between those presumed to have inheritable desirable traits while those have genetic defects are discouraged to reproduce .
target: Reproduction is encouraged between those presumed to have inheritable desirable traits while those who have genetic defects are discouraged to reproduce .

input: grammar: For example , if you discovered that you had inherited the Huntington 's disease mutation , you would decide not to have children of your own so as not to risk passing the gene on to your children .
target: For example , if you discovered that you had inherited the Huntington 's disease mutation , you would decide not to have children of your own so as not to risk passing the gene on to your children .

input: grammar: In addition , relatives may encourage women carrying foetuses with genetic abnormalities to go for abortion .
target: In addition , relatives may encourage women carrying foetuses with genetic abnormalities to go for abortion .

target: Thus , these women may develop feelings of guilt and depression and affect their well-being .

target: Therefore , the carrier should not be obligated to tell our relatives about the genetic risk .

target: Lastly , it is a violation of basic human rights when the carrier of a known genetic risk is obligated to inform his relatives ( Jones , 2005 ) .

input: grammar: The individual has privacy right to decide if he wants others to know of his genetic condition .
target: The individual has the privacy right to decide if he wants others to know of his genetic condition .

target: In this way , the sharing of information improves the welfare of mankind .

input: grammar: Moreover , having learnt about a personal genetic risk , it is thought by some theorists , for example , Wilson ( 2000 ) , Baker , Schuette and Uhlmann ( 1998 ) that the approach to deal with results of genetic testing involves not only medical , surgical and educational intervention , but also provision of social and emotional support , hence a carrier of known genetic risk should tell his or her close relatives about it .
target: Moreover , having learnt about a personal genetic risk , some theorists , for example , Wilson ( 2000 ) , Baker , Schuette and Uhlmann ( 1998 ) , believe that the approach to deal with results of genetic testing involves not only medical , surgical and educational intervention , but also provision of social and emotional support ; hence , a carrier of known genetic risk should tell his or her close relatives about it .

input: grammar: Some may argue that there should be no obligations to tell a relative about one 's condition as a genetic condition is not contagious like some viral or bacterial infections ( Hubbard & Wald , 1999 ) .
target: Some may argue that there should be no obligations to tell a relative about one 's condition as a genetic condition is not contagious like some viral or bacterial infections ( Hubbard & Wald , 1999 ) .

input: grammar: Consequently , some may think that informing relatives about their conditions is not necessary and thus are not in favour of the idea .
target: Consequently , some may think that informing relatives about their conditions is not necessary and thus are not in favour of the idea .

input: grammar: However , genetic diseases may impact every phase of the human life cycle ( Alford , 1999 ) .
target: However , genetic diseases may impact every phase of the human life cycle ( Alford , 1999 ) .

input: grammar: Even though there may be an initial delay in acceptance , and unnecessary worry , eventual acceptance by family , friends and relatives often corresponds to ongoing effective and supportive encouragement and motivation which may have beneficial impacts on their health .
target: Even though there may be an initial delay in acceptance , and unnecessary worry , eventual acceptance by family , friends and relatives often corresponds to ongoing effective and supportive encouragement and motivation which may have beneficial impacts on their health .

input: grammar: A carrier of a known genetic risk who takes an active approach in informing his or her relatives is in fact showing respect for the relative 's autonomy .
target: A carrier of a known genetic risk who takes an active approach in informing his or her relatives is in fact showing respect for the relative 's autonomy .

input: grammar: Choosing not to inform one 's relatives is in fact interfering with the patient 's right and opportunity to consider the problem , select diagnostic and management options .
target: Choosing not to inform one 's relatives is in fact interfering with the patient 's right and opportunity to consider the problem , select diagnostic and management options .

input: grammar: Studies have shown that the primary reason accounting for the unwillingness to communicate genetic test results to a relative is that the relative 's opinion , attitude and reaction is unknown ( Barsevick , Montgomery , Ruth , Ross , Egleston , Bingler , Malick , Miller , Cescon , & Daly , 2008 ) .
target: Studies have shown that the primary reason accounting for the unwillingness to communicate genetic test results to a relative is that the relative 's opinion , attitude and reaction is unknown ( Barsevick , Montgomery , Ruth , Ross , Egleston , Bingler , Malick , Miller , Cescon , & Daly , 2008 ) .

input: grammar: In addition , the opinion of World Health Organization ( 2009 ) is that choosing not to inform is a well-intentioned decision which do not to add extra problems and unduly distress to others .
target: In addition , the opinion of World Health Organization ( 2009 ) is that choosing not to inform is a well-intentioned decision which does not to add extra problems and undue distress to others .

input: grammar: However , these arguments put forth in support of not informing the relative are faulty .
target: However , these arguments put forth in support of not informing the relatives are faulty .

input: grammar: By not informing about the risks his or her relative may face , the tendency of the carrier to shift from beneficence to paternalism has in fact taken away the ability of the relative to choose for herself ( Kultgen , 1995 ) .
target: By not informing about the risks his or her relative may face , the tendency of the carrier to shift from beneficence to paternalism has in fact taken away the ability of the relative to choose for herself ( Kultgen , 1995 ) .

input: grammar: For example , some genetic diseases such as " Al antitrypsin deficiency " undeniably involve the family ( Torgny & Wilcke , 1998 ) .
target: For example , some genetic diseases such as " Al antitrypsin deficiency " undeniably involve the family ( Torgny & Wilcke , 1998 ) .

input: grammar: As Torgny and Wilcke states , information can allow a relative who has considerably increased risk of a disease from smoking to make her own decisions about smoking and take precautions when deciding on a career which are needful to have a positive impact on her future .
target: As Torgny and Wilcke state , information can allow a relative who has considerably increased risk of a disease from smoking to make her own decisions about smoking and take precautions when deciding on a career which is needful to have a positive impact on her future .

input: grammar: In conclusion , a carrier of a known genetic risk is obligated to tell his or her relatives as communication of genetic test results can bring about improved management and well-being of carriers and their families , resolution of concerns , possible reduction in disease occurrence , as well as effective prevention , treatments and even cures .
target: In conclusion , a carrier of a known genetic risk is obligated to tell his or her relatives as communication of genetic test results can bring about improved management and well-being of carriers and their families , resolution of concerns , possible reduction in disease occurrence , as well as effective prevention , treatments and even cures .

input: grammar: In general , the benefits of knowing the potential risk far outweigh the adverse consequences of not knowing .
target: In general , the benefits of knowing the potential risk far outweigh the adverse consequences of not knowing .

input: grammar: Therefore , sharing of information between relatives should be encouraged .
target: Therefore , sharing of information between relatives should be encouraged .
