input: grammar: Genetic testing has been made possible with the advances of technology in the medical field .
target: Genetic testing has been made possible with the advances of technology in the medical field .

input: grammar: It has increased in numbers , capabilities and preciseness over the recent years ( Goh , 2005 ) .
target: It has increased in numbers , capabilities and preciseness over the recent years ( Goh , 2005 ) .

input: grammar: Potential individuals who are at risk of developing a genetic disorder or disease normally undergo for genetic testing .
target: Potential individuals who are at risk of developing a genetic disorder or disease normally undergo genetic testing .

input: grammar: Genetic testing may uncover the underlying mutation in genes which causes the genetic disorder .
target: Genetic testing may uncover the underlying mutation in genes which causes the genetic disorder .

input: grammar: Thus , genetic testing can be beneficial to affected patients and their relatives .
target: Thus , genetic testing can be beneficial to affected patients and their relatives .

input: grammar: It helps in early detection of genetic disorders that are inherited in families and family planning .
target: It helps in early detection of genetic disorders that are inherited in families and family planning .

input: grammar: Genetic testing has also resulted in the rise of privacy , confidentiality and ethical issues in our society despite the benefits gained ( Young & Leonard , 1999 ) .
target: Genetic testing has also resulted in the rise of privacy , confidentiality and ethical issues in our society despite the benefits gained ( Young & Leonard , 1999 ) .

input: grammar: However , it has been known that genetic testing may detect mutation in genes and hence , genetic counselling can be given to relatives of affected patients .
target: However , it has been known that genetic testing may detect mutation in genes and hence , genetic counselling can be given to relatives of affected patients .

input: grammar: Therefore , affected individuals should let their relatives know about their genetic testing results .
target: Therefore , affected individuals should let their relatives know about their genetic testing results .

input: grammar: One of the reasons why affected individuals should let their relatives know about their genetic disorders is for early detection purposes ( Goh , 2005 ) .
target: One of the reasons why affected individuals should let their relatives know about their genetic disorders is for early detection purposes ( Goh , 2005 ) .

input: grammar: An early detection of genetic disorders can be obtained by genetic testing in order for further and early treatments to be conducted .
target: An early detection of genetic disorders can be obtained by genetic testing in order for further and early treatments to be conducted .

input: grammar: For example , genetic testing enables patients and their relatives who are at risk of developing genetic disorders but show no symptoms at the beginning , to predict the chances of them inheriting the genetic disorders ( Goh , 2005 ) .
target: For example , genetic testing enables patients and their relatives who are at risk of developing genetic disorders but show no symptoms at the beginning , to predict the chances of them inheriting the genetic disorders ( Goh , 2005 ) .

input: grammar: The predisposition of the relatives of affected patients towards the genetic disorders can also be predicted .
target: The predisposition of the relatives of affected patients towards the genetic disorders can also be predicted .

input: grammar: When a genetic disorder that runs through a certain family is known , the extent of the genetic disorder can be obtained ( Goh , 2005 ) .
target: When a genetic disorder that runs through a certain family is known , the extent of the genetic disorder can be obtained ( Goh , 2005 ) .

input: grammar: Genetic information is not confined to one person but it could be related to more than one person such as tested patients ' relatives .
target: Genetic information is not confined to one person but it could be related to more than one person such as tested patients ' relatives .

input: grammar: This enables healthcare professionals to know the extent of the genetic mutation in the genes and hence , provide advice or genetic counselling to patients and their relatives .
target: This enables healthcare professionals to know the extent of the genetic mutation in the genes and hence , provide advice or genetic counselling to patients and their relatives .

input: grammar: However , this has also resulted in a raise of privacy and confidentiality concerns .
target: However , this has also resulted in a raise of privacy and confidentiality concerns .

input: grammar: The revelation of genetically tested patients ' results may lead to discrimination by society ( Mehlman , 1999 ) .
target: The revelation of genetically tested patients ' results may lead to discrimination by the society ( Mehlman , 1999 ) .

input: grammar: There is no guarantee that relatives of genetically tested patients will keep the genetic results information to themselves .
target: There is no guarantee that relatives of genetically tested patients will keep the genetic results information to themselves .

input: grammar: This information can be spread verbally , be it accidental or intentional without the consent of the tested patient .
target: This information can be spread verbally , be it accidental or intentional without the consent of the tested patient .

input: grammar: However , there are laws that protect genetically patients from genetic discrimination by society that have been imposed ( Bombard , 2007 ) .
target: However , there are laws that protect genetically patients from genetic discrimination by the society ( Bombard , 2007 ) .

input: grammar: These laws have been implemented in the United States and many other countries ( Bombard , 2007 ) .
target: These laws have been implemented in the United States and many other countries ( Bombard , 2007 ) .

input: grammar: Genetic discrimination can be reduced with the existing of these laws as legal actions can be taken against those who discriminate .
target: Genetic discrimination can be reduced with the existing of these laws as legal actions can be taken against those who discriminate .

input: grammar: Hence , genetic testing results should be revealed to family members for early detection purposes .
target: Hence , genetic testing results should be revealed to family members for early detection purposes .

input: grammar: Besides that , relatives of genetically tested patients should know about their genetic testing results so that a proper family planning ( Anonymous , 1999 ) .
target: Besides that , relatives of genetically tested patients should know about their genetic testing results so that a proper family planning can be made ( Anonymous , 1999 ) .

input: grammar: Family planning is essential as it serves as a platform to briefly set up a guideline for future purposes .
target: Family planning is essential as it serves as a platform to briefly set up a guideline for future purposes .

input: grammar: This might enable individuals and their families to decide on how they would like their lifestyle to be and set fertility judgements ( Anonymous , 1999 ) .
target: This might enable individuals and their families to decide on how they would like their lifestyle to be and set fertility judgements ( Anonymous , 1999 ) .

input: grammar: For example , pregnant women have the option of deciding on whether to go for prenatal examinations or not to see if their new-borns would suffer from any genetic disorders such as Huntington 's disease and Down 's Syndrome .
target: For example , pregnant women have the option of deciding on whether to go for prenatal examinations or not to see if their new-borns would suffer from any genetic disorders such as Huntington 's disease and Down 's Syndrome .

input: grammar: This may prevent the future generation from inheriting the mutated genes or become carriers of the genetic disorders .
target: This may prevent the future generation from inheriting the mutated genes or become carriers of the genetic disorders .

input: grammar: Ethical issues have been raised despite this advantage .
target: Ethical issues have been raised despite this advantage .

input: grammar: This is because no one has the rights to give his or her consent regarding the decision on whether to undergo for the prenatal examinations or not ( Anonymous , 1999 ) .
target: This is because no one has the rights to give his or her consent regarding the decision on whether to undergo the prenatal examinations or not ( Anonymous , 1999 ) .

input: grammar: Embryos , foetuses and new-borns do not hold the responsibility in making this decision and they are unable to make it by themselves .
target: Embryos , foetuses and new-borns do not hold the responsibility in making this decision and they are unable to make it by themselves .

input: grammar: This leaves the decision into their parents ' hands .
target: This leaves the decision into their parents ' hands .

input: grammar: However , medical advances have made in-vitro fertilisation possible nowadays .
target: However , medical advances have made in-vitro fertilisation possible nowadays .

input: grammar: If an embryo has a mutated gene after undergoing in-vitro fertilisation , this embryo can be discarded before being implanted in the uterus ( Anonymous , 1999 ) .
target: If an embryo has a mutated gene after undergoing in-vitro fertilisation , this embryo can be discarded before being implanted in the uterus ( Anonymous , 1999 ) .

input: grammar: This may prevent the diseases from being passed down to the future generation .
target: This may prevent the diseases from being passed down to the future generation .

input: grammar: The risk of the future generation in inheriting genetic diseases can also be reduced .
target: The risk of the future generation in inheriting genetic diseases can also be reduced .

input: grammar: Thus , revelations of genetic testing results to family members are essential in family planning .
target: Thus , revelations of genetic testing results to family members are essential in family planning .

input: grammar: In conclusion , we can see that genetically tested results revealed by patients to their family members do bring advantages .
target: In conclusion , we can see that genetically tested results revealed by patients to their family members do bring advantages .

input: grammar: It can help in early detection and family planning .
target: It can help in early detection and family planning .

input: grammar: Besides that , moral support and encouragement which are vital can be gained from family members .
target: Besides that , moral support and encouragement which are vital can be gained from family members .

input: grammar: This is important as genetically tested patients may have emotional and psychological problems as a consequence of undergoing genetic testing .
target: This is important as genetically tested patients may have emotional and psychological problems as a consequence of undergoing genetic testing .

input: grammar: These problems may not be cured by taking medications .
target: These problems may not be cured by taking medications .

input: grammar: Therefore , family members play a very important role in supporting them .
target: Therefore , family members play a very important role in supporting them .

input: grammar: In today 's medical world , many health concerns raised by people have been taken care of by the perpetual advancement in technology .
target: In today 's medical world , many health concerns raised by people have been taken care of by the perpetual advancement in technology .

input: grammar: One of the innumerable concerns is genetic disorder , which is an illness caused by abnormalities in genes or chromosomes .
target: One of the innumerable concerns is genetic disorder , which is an illness caused by abnormalities in genes or chromosomes .

input: grammar: This concern brought about the inauguration of genetic testing a medical test to determine if a particular disease is stimulated by the abnormality .
target: This concern has brought about the inauguration of genetic testing as a medical test to determine if a particular disease is caused by the abnormality .

input: grammar: An issue raised here is that one 's decision to reveal the test results to one 's relatives has chained to even more concerns .
target: An issue raised here is that one 's decision to reveal the test results to one 's relatives may bring about even more concerns .

input: grammar: Revealing the results could assist one 's relatives in preparing for constructive life changes and allow researchers to find a cure for a particular genetic disorder .
target: Revealing the results could assist one 's relatives in preparing for constructive life changes and allow researchers to find a cure for a particular genetic disorder .

input: grammar: Admittedly , it could result in negative social consequences .
target: Admittedly , it could result in negative social consequences .

input: grammar: Nevertheless , revealing the test results benefits more people than hiding it .
target: Nevertheless , revealing the test results benefits more people than hiding them .

input: grammar: Hence , a carrier of a known genetic risk should be obligated to tell his or her relatives .
target: Hence , a carrier of a known genetic risk should be obligated to tell his or her relatives .

input: grammar: Firstly , the revelation of a known genetic risk to one 's relatives allows them to prepare for constructive changes in their lives .
target: Firstly , the revelation of a known genetic risk to one 's relatives allows them to prepare for constructive changes in their lives .

input: grammar: One such change would be to make new decisions for family planning .
target: One such change would be to make new decisions for family planning .

input: grammar: Due to the lack of treatment strategies of some genetic disorders , a carrier might have a short lifespan .
target: Due to the lack of treatment strategies of some genetic disorders , a carrier might have a short lifespan .

input: grammar: Therefore , it is both essential to plan for an early retirement or to start a family .
target: Therefore , it is both essential to plan for an early retirement or to start a family .

input: grammar: A carrier could devise a financial plan so that one would have sufficient monetary resources to support oneself even after an early retirement .
target: A carrier could devise a financial plan so that one would have sufficient monetary resources to support oneself even after an early retirement .

input: grammar: One main objection to starting a family is that the affected genes or chromosomes might be passed on to the children .
target: One main objection to starting a family is that the affected genes or chromosomes might be passed on to the children .

input: grammar: This , however , can be prevented using an expensive technology , Assisted Reproductive Technology ( ART ) such as pre-implantation of genetic diagnosis whereby " only unaffected embryos are allowed to develop to term " ( Norrgard , 2008 ) .
target: This , however , can be prevented using an expensive technology , Assisted Reproductive Technology ( ART ) such as pre-implantation of genetic diagnosis whereby " only unaffected embryos are allowed to develop to term " ( Norrgard , 2008 ) .

input: grammar: Thus , a carrier could still start a family without passing the genetic disorder to the children .
target: Thus , a carrier could still start a family without passing the genetic disorder to the children .

input: grammar: Furthermore , this could lead to another constructive change for the carrier 's relatives .
target: Furthermore , this could lead to another constructive change for the carrier 's relatives .

input: grammar: For relatives who are planning to have children , they must either be financially prepared for ART as well as the future medical bills , or choose not to have children .
target: For relatives who are planning to have children , they must either be financially prepared for ART as well as for the future medical bills , or choose not to have children .

input: grammar: As for those who already have children , they must also be financially prepared .
target: As for those who already have children , they must also be financially prepared .

input: grammar: On top of that , they would have to choose the right time to convey to their children that they might be carriers of a certain genetic disorder .
target: On top of that , they would have to choose the right time to convey to their children that they might be carriers of a certain genetic disorder .

input: grammar: These changes and preparations can not be achieved overnight , and therefore , revealing a known genetic risk to one 's relatives is necessary .
target: These changes and preparations can not be achieved overnight , and therefore , revealing a known genetic risk to one 's relatives is necessary .

input: grammar: Secondly , by divulging one 's genetic risk to one 's relatives , the chances of researchers finding a cure for that risk would be higher .
target: Secondly , by divulging one 's genetic risk to one 's relatives , the chances of researchers finding a cure for that risk would be higher .

input: grammar: As genetic disorders only happen to a minority , there would not be many encounters and so the chances of a researcher being able to inquire into these disorders would be considerably low .
target: As genetic disorders only happen to a minority , there would not be many encounters and so the chances of a researcher being able to inquire into these disorders would be considerably low .

input: grammar: This was further lowered by opponents who are against the revelation of genetic results due to intrusion of privacy .
target: This will be further lowered by opponents who are against the revelation of genetic results due to intrusion of privacy .

input: grammar: However , it did not occur to them that the revelation of results could increase the chances of medical researchers finding a remedy to the disorders .
target: However , it may not occur to them that the revelation of results could increase the chances of medical researchers finding a remedy to the disorders .

input: grammar: Moreover , there would be a possibility that a known genetic risk could be brought to an end and subsequent generations would not have to suffer .
target: Moreover , there would be a possibility that a known genetic risk could be brought to an end and subsequent generations would not have to suffer .

input: grammar: Therefore , only when one tells a known genetic risk to one 's relatives , would there be a chance for medical researchers to find a cure for it , and eventually saving many lives from genetic disorders .
target: Therefore , only when one tells a known genetic risk to one 's relatives , would there be a chance for medical researchers to find a cure for it , eventually saving many lives from genetic disorders .

input: grammar: One main concern about the revelation of genetic risk to one 's relatives is the negative social consequences .
target: One main concern about the revelation of genetic risk to one 's relatives is the negative social consequences .

input: grammar: When an employee is diagnosed to have certain genetic disorders , the employer may not want to retain the employee .
target: When an employee is diagnosed to have certain genetic disorders , the employer may not want to retain the employee .

input: grammar: This is because the carrier would have to follow up on their medical appointments and as a result , the efficiency and productivity of the company would be adversely affected .
target: This is because the carrier would have to follow up on their medical appointments and as a result , the efficiency and productivity of the company would be adversely affected .

input: grammar: Furthermore , due to the need for regular health checkup , the carrier would not be allowed to purchase insurance as the insurance company would be footing the carrier 's medical bills .
target: Furthermore , due to the need for regular health checkup , the carrier would not be allowed to purchase insurance as the insurance company would be footing the carrier 's medical bills .

input: grammar: However , these acts of genetic discrimination could be prevented by a law called the Privacy Rule , which is enforced by the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act ( HIPAA ) in April 2003 ( Norrgard , 2008 ) .
target: However , these acts of genetic discrimination could be prevented by a law called the Privacy Rule , which is enforced by the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act ( HIPAA ) in April 2003 ( Norrgard , 2008 ) .

input: grammar: This rule helps to keep individual 's medical information confidential .
target: This rule helps to keep an individual 's medical information confidential .

input: grammar: Therefore , whether one has genetic disorders or not , one would not have to face the negative social consequences .
target: Therefore , whether one has genetic disorders or not , one would not have to face the negative social consequences .

input: grammar: Genetic testing is a scientific method that is used to determine a person 's chance of developing an inherited disease .
target: Genetic testing is a scientific method that is used to determine a person 's chance of developing an inherited disease .

input: grammar: Every person carries copies of genes that were passed down from their parents .
target: Every person carries copies of genes that were passed down from their parents .

input: grammar: There is a high chance for a genetic disease carrier to pass down defected genes to the next generation .
target: There is a high chance for a genetic disease carrier to pass down defected genes to the next generation .

input: grammar: The defected genes may or may not develop into a disease .
target: The defected genes may or may not develop into a disease .

input: grammar: A defected genes carrier can only determine whether he or she have a genetic disease by running a genetic test .
target: A defective genes carrier can only determine whether he or she have a genetic disease by running a genetic test .

input: grammar: Since genetic disease runs in the family , a genetic disease carrier 's family members and relatives will have high chance of developing the same inherited disease .
target: If a genetic disease runs in the family , a genetic disease carrier 's family members and relatives will have a high chance of developing the same inherited disease .

input: grammar: There is a higher chance of curing a genetic disease if it is detected early .
target: There is a higher chance of curing a genetic disease if it is detected early .

input: grammar: Hence , a carrier of a known genetic risk should warn their family members and relatives about the genetic risk .
target: Hence , a carrier of a known genetic risk should warn their family members and relatives about the genetic risk .

target: Oregon National Primate Research Center successfully came up with a technique that could stop future generations from inheriting genetic diseases from their parents .

target: ( Henderson , 2009 ) If a carrier of a genetic risk were to hide his or her condition , the genetic disease would continue to run in the family line , passing down to future generations .

target: A possible excuse people choose to hide their affliction is because they are afraid of the discrimination they would face from their family members and relatives .

input: grammar: After all , the burden of carrying a genetic disease is not something that one would want to make known to others .
target: After all , the burden of carrying a genetic disease is not something that one would want to make known to others .

input: grammar: Perhaps a better reason for people to keep the problem to themselves is because they are not aware that genetic diseases are not isolated to just themselves .
target: Perhaps a better reason for people to keep the problem to themselves is because they are not aware that genetic diseases are not isolated to just themselves .

input: grammar: This is a case of ignorance in which is not at all bliss .
target: This is a case of ignorance which is not at all bliss .

input: grammar: There is no good reason for a genetic disease carrier to hide his or her condition from his or her family members or relatives if the person is aware of the implication of the genetic disorder .
target: There is no good reason for a genetic disease carrier to hide his or her condition from his or her family members or relatives if the person is aware of the implication of the genetic disorder .

input: grammar: This is a question of morality .
target: This is a question of morality .

input: grammar: A person who understands his role and responsibility as part of a family would not want to see his future generation be it his own , or his immediate families ' to suffer from genetic diseases that could otherwise have been prevented if he had discussed his condition .
target: A person who understands his role and responsibility as part of a family would not want to see his future generation or his immediate families to suffer from genetic diseases that could otherwise have been prevented if he had discussed his condition .

input: grammar: Genetics plays the role in every disease .
target: Genetics plays the role in every disease .

input: grammar: Genetic testing informs individuals and family of their genetic status ; this knowledge may enable them to take adaptive measures against a genetic disease ( Jacobs & Deatrick , 1999 ) , if the disease is treatable .
target: Genetic testing informs individuals and family of their genetic status ; this knowledge may enable them to take adaptive measures against a genetic disease ( Jacobs & Deatrick , 1999 ) , if the disease is treatable .

input: grammar: One is morally obligated to inform the relatives of the genetic test results since family members generally inherit the same set of genetic codes from their parents .
target: One is morally obligated to inform the relatives of the genetic test results since family members generally inherit the same set of genetic codes from their parents .

input: grammar: Firstly , informing relatives allows them to take preventive measures against diseases .
target: Firstly , informing relatives allows them to take preventive measures against diseases .

input: grammar: Having the same parents can mean that certain disease can run within the family and they are morally obligated to warn their relatives of the possible hazards that may trigger disease , For example , to prevent relatives from eating fava beans when one is detected to have G6PD deficiency .
target: Having the same parents can mean that certain disease can run within the family and they are morally obligated to warn their relatives of the possible hazards that may trigger disease , for example , to prevent relatives from eating fava beans when one is detected to have G6PD deficiency .

input: grammar: One can even educate relatives of the preventive measures of certain diseases .
target: One can even educate relatives of the preventive measures of certain diseases .

input: grammar: For example , to educate relatives to eat less fatty meals when their genes predispose too weak blood vessels integrity that are prone to rupture .
target: For example , to educate relatives to eat less fatty meals when their genes predispose too weak blood vessels integrity that are prone to rupture .

input: grammar: Secondly , informing relatives of their genetic results will enable better care of self .
target: Secondly , informing relatives of their genetic results will enable better care of him- or herself .

input: grammar: Usually , when a disease manifested itself , it requires many preliminary testing , and the turnaround time ( TAT ) , from doctor 's request , to laboratory test , to reporting of results may take more than a day - and that is only to rule out certain illnesses .
target: Usually , when a disease manifests itself , it requires many preliminary tests , and the turnaround time ( TAT ) , from doctor 's request , to laboratory test , to reporting of results may take more than a day . That is only to rule out certain illnesses .

input: grammar: After which , the doctor would order for more specific tests to narrow down to the specific cause , and this may take a few days in specialist clinics .
target: After these preliminary tests , the doctor would order more specific tests to narrow down to the specific cause , and this may take a few days in specialist clinics .

input: grammar: However , with the knowledge of the possibility of genetic disease , it enables the medical physician to narrow down to specific testing and get the correct diagnosis earlier .
target: However , the knowledge of the possibility of a genetic disease enables the medical physician to narrow down to specific testing and get the correct diagnosis earlier .

input: grammar: This would then enable earlier medical interventions and ensures higher survival rate .
target: This would then enable earlier medical interventions and ensures higher survival rate .

input: grammar: However , some argued that genetic testing can potentially unravel family secrets ; namely adoptions and illegitimate child ( Doukas & Berg , 2001 ) .
target: However , some argue that genetic testing can potentially unravel family secrets , namely adoptions and illegitimate child ( Doukas & Berg , 2001 ) .

input: grammar: But such issues can be solved since we can select results to be in terms of potential disease , instead of paternity testing .
target: But such issues can be solved since we can select tests to find out potential diseases , instead of paternity testing .

input: grammar: Therefore , a carrier of a known genetic risk should be obligated to tell his or her relatives for the betterment of the relatives to take preventive measures and also be equipped with related knowledge to save their own lives .
target: Therefore , a carrier of a known genetic risk should be obligated to tell his or her relatives for the betterment of the relatives to take preventive measures and also be equipped with related knowledge to save their own lives .

input: grammar: The advent of genetic testing has created a scientific breakthrough in identifying risk factors for disease .
target: The advent of genetic testing has created a scientific breakthrough in identifying risk factors for disease .

input: grammar: The increasing awareness of the usefulness of genetic testing has prompted many to undergo such testing .
target: The increasing awareness of the usefulness of genetic testing has prompted many to undergo such testing .

input: grammar: However , genetic testing result may not only concern the tested individual themselves but also their family members as they share the same genetic make-up and are equally at risk of contracting a certain disease ( Genetic testing helps cancer survivors fight for their loved ones , 2007 ) .
target: However , genetic testing result may not only concern the tested individual himself or herself but also their family members as they share the same genetic make-up and are equally at risk of contracting a certain disease ( Genetic testing helps cancer survivors fight for their loved ones , 2007 ) .

input: grammar: This has sparked many debates on the obligation of an individual to share the test result with genetic relatives .
target: This has sparked many debates on the obligation of an individual to share the test result with genetic relatives .

input: grammar: While the common consensus is that every individual should have the final decision on whether to reveal the result to others , a decision made not to reveal the result to relatives may have it consequences .
target: While the common consensus is that every individual should have the final decision on whether to reveal the result to others , a decision made not to reveal the result to relatives may have it consequences .

input: grammar: In addition , withholding the result may also have a negative effect on the individual psychologically .
target: In addition , withholding the result may also have a negative effect on the individual psychologically .

input: grammar: Thus , a carrier of a known genetic risk should be obligated to tell his or her relatives .
target: Thus , a carrier of a known genetic risk should be obligated to tell his or her relatives .

input: grammar: Firstly , individual who have undergone genetic testing , should be obligated inform his or her relatives of the genetic testing result as they may also be equally at risk .
target: Firstly , individual who have undergone genetic testing , should be obligated to inform his or her relatives of the genetic testing result as they may also be equally at risk .

input: grammar: By informing relatives of the result , they are able make necessary lifestyle and dietary changes in order to reduce the risk of getting the disease ( Genetic testing helps cancer survivors fight for their loved ones , 2007 ) .
target: By informing relatives of the result , they are able make necessary lifestyle and dietary changes in order to reduce the risk of getting the disease ( Genetic testing helps cancer survivors fight for their loved ones , 2007 ) .

input: grammar: This also allows family members to step up their preventive measures against the diseases by undergoing regular medical screening .
target: This also allows family members to step up their preventive measures against the diseases by undergoing regular medical screening .

input: grammar: Furthermore , they can be subjected to early treatment should they get diagnosed with the disease ( Babowice , 2008 ) .
target: Furthermore , they can be subjected to early treatment should they get diagnosed with the disease ( Babowice , 2008 ) .

input: grammar: Such early treatment will greatly increase the prospects of recovery as it will prevent the disease from developing further and causing more complication .
target: Such early treatment will greatly increase the prospects of recovery as it will prevent the disease from developing further and causing more complications .

input: grammar: Some may argue that it is the individual 's right as to whether to reveal the result to others as the genetic test result belongs to him or her .
target: Some may argue that it is the individual 's right as to whether to reveal the result to others as the genetic test result belongs to him or her .

input: grammar: Therefore , they should have the final say as to whether to share it with others and should not be obligated to do so .
target: Therefore , they should have the final say as to whether to share it with others and should not be obligated to do so .

input: grammar: However , the reticence of one 's genetic test result would mean that family members are unaware of the possible danger to their health .
target: However , the reticence of one 's genetic test result would mean that family members are unaware of the possible danger to their health .

input: grammar: Furthermore , it may be too late to be treated should the disease be discovered at a later stage .
target: Furthermore , it may be too late to be treated should the disease be discovered at a later stage .

input: grammar: Thus , the possibility of preventing harm to others should never be jeopardised over one 's privacy .
target: Thus , the possibility of preventing harm to others should never be jeopardised over one 's privacy .

input: grammar: A research conducted by the United States ' National Institute of Health , has shown that 98 % of the respondents share their test results with their family members and 82.2 % of them did that to inform them of their medical risk ( Stoffel , Ford , Mercado , Punglia , Kohlmann , Conrad , Blanco , Shannon , Powell , Gruber , Terdiman , Chung , Syngal , 2008 ) .
target: A research conducted by the United States ' National Institute of Health , has shown that 98 % of the respondents share their test results with their family members and 82.2 % of them did that to inform them of their medical risk ( Stoffel , Ford , Mercado , Punglia , Kohlmann , Conrad , Blanco , Shannon , Powell , Gruber , Terdiman , Chung , Syngal , 2008 ) .

input: grammar: This research result is a testimony that majority of those who went for genetic testing acknowledge that by sharing their genetic result with their family members , something can be done to reduce the risk of contracting a disease .
target: This research result is a testimony that majority of those who went for genetic testing acknowledge that by sharing their genetic result with their family members , something can be done to reduce the risk of contracting a disease .

input: grammar: Another reason as to why an individual should be obligated to inform the genetic test result to his or her relatives is so that they may be able to receive emotional support from the family ( Newstaff , 2009 ) .
target: Another reason as to why an individual should be obligated to inform the genetic test result to his or her relatives is so that they may be able to receive emotional support from the family ( Newstaff , 2009 ) .

input: grammar: Many a time , a tested individual chose not to share such result with their loved one so as not to add unnecessary distress and anxiety to them .
target: Many a time , a tested individual chose not to share such result with their loved one so as not to add unnecessary distress and anxiety to them .

input: grammar: However , bottling up their feeling will only aggravate their problem as it will have an adverse psychological effect on them .
target: However , bottling up their feelings will only aggravate their problem as it will have an adverse psychological effect on them .

input: grammar: By sharing such information with family members , individuals may share their problems and worries with them .
target: By sharing such information with family members , individuals may share their problems and worries with them .

input: grammar: On top of that , they may lighten the burden off their shoulder .
target: On top of that , they may lighten the burden on their shoulder .

input: grammar: According to a research conducted by Georgetown University Medical Centre , those who disclosed their genetic test results to their family members are much contented with their decision than those who did not ( Newstaff , 2009 ) .
target: According to a research conducted by Georgetown University Medical Centre , those who disclosed their genetic test results to their family members are much contented with their decision than those who did not ( Newstaff , 2009 ) .

input: grammar: Many have also shared their views that informing the test result to their family members had led to a better communication relationship .
target: Many have also shared their views that informing the test result to their family members had led to a better communication relationship .

input: grammar: Critics argue that genetic testing result is not fully accurate and by informing relatives regarding the result , it will impose unnecessary psychological burden to the family .
target: Critics argue that genetic testing result is not fully accurate and by informing relatives regarding the result , it will impose unnecessary psychological burden to the family .

input: grammar: This may result in family members responding negatively to the news and thus , straining the ties between the tested individual and his or her family members .
target: This may result in family members responding negatively to the news and thus , straining the ties between the tested individual and his or her family members .

input: grammar: Therefore , contrary to gaining emotional support from family members , individual may instead be subjected to further psychological damage .
target: Therefore , contrary to gaining emotional support from family members , individual may instead be subjected to further psychological damage .

input: grammar: As this may be true , the argument is not entirely valid .
target: As this may be true , the argument is not entirely valid .

input: grammar: Research conducted by Angela Bradbury , an oncologist at Chase Fox , has shown that such worries are uncalled for ( Newstaff , 2009 ) .
target: Research conducted by Angela Bradbury , an oncologist at Chase Fox , has shown that such worries are uncalled for ( Newstaff , 2009 ) .

input: grammar: Only a small portion of the respondents have reported to receive negative responses from their family members .
target: Only a small portion of the respondents have reported to receive negative responses from their family members .

input: grammar: Many have given feedback that their relatives have handled the news well and have taken a pragmatic approach to the situation .
target: Many have given feedback that their relatives have handled the news well and have taken a pragmatic approach to the situation .

input: grammar: Counseling will also be provided by physicians not only to the individual but also his or her family members ( Stoffel et al. , 2008 ) .
target: Counseling will also be provided by physicians not only to the individual but also his or her family members ( Stoffel et al. , 2008 ) .

input: grammar: This will make it easier for family members to come to term with the situation and to handle it appropriately .
target: This will make it easier for family members to come to term with the situation and to handle it appropriately .

input: grammar: Critics also fail to acknowledge that it is part of the " social responsibility " on the part of the tested individual to inform genetic relatives of a hereditary condition and the sharing of financial , emotional and psychological burdens among family members .
target: Critics also fail to acknowledge that it is part of the " social responsibility " on the part of the tested individual to inform genetic relatives of a hereditary condition and the sharing of financial , emotional and psychological burdens among family members .

input: grammar: It is undeniable that an individual have the final say as to whether to reveal his or her genetic test result .
target: It is undeniable that an individual has the final say as to whether to reveal his or her genetic test result .

input: grammar: However , one should always remember that choosing not to do so will only further implicate more problems to oneself as well as to others .
target: However , one should always remember that choosing not to do so will only further implicate more problems to oneself as well as to others .

input: grammar: Disclosure of such information to relatives will instead bring about many benefits .
target: Disclosure of such information to relatives will instead bring about many benefits .

input: grammar: Thus , carrier of a known genetic risk should be obligated to tell his or her relatives .
target: Thus , a carrier of a known genetic risk should be obligated to tell his or her relatives .

input: grammar: The new millennium brought about promising medical advancements that have positive impacts on human 's lives .
target: The new millennium brought about promising medical advancements that have had positive impacts on human 's lives .

input: grammar: Remarkable breakthroughs , particularly in the field of genetics , allow humans to better understand the cause of diseases , so as to formulate cure or preventive drugs that can be tailored to individual idiosyncrasies .
target: Remarkable breakthroughs , particularly in the field of genetics , allow humans to better understand the cause of diseases , so as to formulate cure or preventive drugs that can be tailored to individual idiosyncrasies .

input: grammar: This is made possible through a series of genetic tests on an individual .
target: This is made possible through a series of genetic tests on an individual .

input: grammar: Genetic testing is the detection of abnormalities in the human genomes , to indentify presence of genetic disorder and to assess the possible risk of developing genetic disorder in the future .
target: Genetic testing is the detection of abnormalities in the human genomes , to indentify presence of genetic disorder and to assess the possible risk of developing genetic disorder in the future .

input: grammar: Some examples of such genetic disorders include single gene defects , multifactorial problems and teratogenic problems ( Weill Medical College of Cornell University 2003 ) .
target: Some examples of such genetic disorders include single gene defects , multifactorial problems and teratogenic problems ( Weill Medical College of Cornell University 2003 ) .

input: grammar: Though the benefits of genetic testing are numerous , individuals are forced to face an ethical dilemma of whether they are obligated to reveal the results to their relatives .
target: Though the benefits of genetic testing are numerous , individuals are forced to face an ethical dilemma of whether they are obligated to reveal the results to their relatives .

input: grammar: In my opinion , I believe that individuals should be obligated to reveal such information to their relatives .
target: In my opinion , I believe that individuals should be obligated to reveal such information to their relatives .

input: grammar: Proponents who felt that individuals should be obligated to reveal genetic test results asserted that these individuals will have a more open communication relationship with their families .
target: Proponents who felt that individuals should be obligated to reveal genetic test results asserted that these individuals will have a more open communication relationship with their families .

input: grammar: This is coherent to a study done by Gerogetown university medical center on mothers who shared their cancer genetic test results with children .
target: This is coherent to a study done by Georgetown university medical center on mothers who shared their cancer genetic test results with children .

input: grammar: The research findings shows that mothers who chose to disclose the results are generally satisfied with their decision because they are able to receive the necessary support and understanding from families ( Karen 2009 ) .
target: The research findings shows that mothers who chose to disclose the results are generally satisfied with their decision because they are able to receive the necessary support and understanding from families ( Karen 2009 ) .

input: grammar: Individuals are able to reduce the huge mental burden imposed on them by sharing it with families , which in certain cases can be overwhelming .
target: Individuals are able to reduce the huge mental burden imposed on them by sharing it with families , which in certain cases can be overwhelming .

input: grammar: This can lead to better mental health and well-being of the individuals .
target: This can lead to better mental health and well-being of the individuals .

input: grammar: Though families will be distraught by the results , accepting the fact and supporting each other in the course might lead to a stronger relationship within the family .
target: Though families will be distraught by the results , accepting the fact and supporting each other in the course might lead to a stronger relationship within the family .

input: grammar: Moreover , disclosing the results to their immediate families will better prepare them for any unforeseen circumstances , financially and mentally .
target: Moreover , disclosing the results to their immediate families will better prepare them for any unforeseen circumstances , financially and mentally .

input: grammar: Thus the revealing of genetic results can reduce the mental burden of an individual and bring about better communication and understanding with his or her relatives .
target: Thus the revealing of genetic results can reduce the mental burden of an individual and bring about better communication and understanding with his or her relatives .

input: grammar: Another point that supports the need of revealing such results to the individual 's relatives is to allow early detection of inheritable diseases that his or her relatives might be prone to .
target: Another point that supports the need of revealing such results to the individual 's relatives is to allow early detection of inheritable diseases that his or her relatives might be prone to .

input: grammar: The cancer of the large intestine , which is an inherited disorder , has subtle early stage symptoms that can progress almost undetected till the terminal stages .
target: The cancer of the large intestine , which is an inherited disorder , has subtle early stage symptoms that can progress almost undetected till the terminal stages .

input: grammar: When individuals chose to reveal such information to their relatives , relatives will be able to undergo aggressive and constant monitoring of the colon growth which can prevent the disease into becoming fatal ( Burt and Jasperson 2008 ) .
target: When individuals chose to reveal such information to their relatives , relatives will be able to undergo aggressive and constant monitoring of the colon growth which can prevent the disease into becoming fatal ( Burt and Jasperson 2008 ) .

input: grammar: Such early prevention and cure to fatal diseases are only possible if relatives are notified beforehand , and that responsibility lies on the individual who underwent genetic testing .
target: Such early prevention and cure to fatal diseases are only possible if relatives are notified beforehand , and that responsibility lies on the individual who underwent genetic testing .

input: grammar: Such information will also allow family members and relatives to make more fully informed choices regarding their future , including decisions on marriage and career , as well as lifestyle habits .
target: Such information will also allow family members and relatives to make more fully informed choices regarding their future , including decisions on marriage and career , as well as lifestyle habits .

input: grammar: Thus individual of known genetic risk should be obligated to reveal test results to relatives because it brings awareness concerning the risk of inheriting the disease to the foreground , not only to the person tested , but for his or her relatives as well .
target: Thus an individual of known genetic risk should be obligated to reveal test results to relatives because it brings awareness concerning the risk of inheriting the disease to the foreground , not only to the person tested , but for his or her relatives as well .

input: grammar: Arguments brought forward by opponents claimed that the personal rights of the individual are being violated .
target: Arguments brought forward by opponents claimed that the personal rights of the individual are being violated .

input: grammar: This is a bias claim because it failed to consider at-risk relatives ' rights to know about the test results .
target: This is a biased claim because it failed to consider at-risk relatives ' rights to know about the test results .

input: grammar: Relatives have the rights to be informed of the results because they are prone to inheriting the same disease or disorder which can be fatal if discovered too late .
target: Relatives have the rights to be informed of the results because they are prone to inheriting the same disease or disorder which can be fatal if discovered too late .

input: grammar: When individuals chose not to reveal the results , it is mainly because of the following reasons : the fear of discrimination , fear of being a burden to the family or not wanting to worry their families .
target: When individuals choose not to reveal the results , it is mainly because of the following reasons : the fear of discrimination , fear of being a burden to the family or not wanting to worry their families .

input: grammar: This is a selfish thinking and is an illogical way of avoiding the problem .
target: This is selfish thinking and is an illogical way of avoiding the problem .

input: grammar: The failure of disclosure of genetics test results frequently cause relatives to be enraged and upset , and this had lead to numerous lawsuits against the genetics provider , as they felt that it should be these genetic providers ' responsibilities to inform them , but in fact is the responsibility of the person being tested ( Falk , J .
target: The failure of disclosure of genetics test results frequently cause relatives to be enraged and upset , and this had lead to numerous lawsuits against the genetics provider , as they felt that it should be these genetic providers ' responsibilities to inform them , but in fact is the responsibility of the person being tested ( Falk , J .

grammar: Thus detrimental effects on both parties can be seen due to the failure of disclosing genetic test results to relatives .
target: Thus detrimental effects on both parties can be seen due to the failure of disclosing genetic test results to relatives .

input: grammar: In conclusion , individuals should be obligated to reveal such information to their relatives because it is a personal responsibility , and can lead to improvement of their well-being .
target: In conclusion , individuals should be obligated to reveal such information to their relatives because it is a personal responsibility , and can lead to their well-being .

input: grammar: Moreover , relatives should also be informed about the potential dangers of inheriting such disorders so that they are able to make choices and decisions that can change their future for the better .

target: It also provides an insight to the chances of developing terminal illnesses .

target: Such genetic risks have a high percentage chance of appearing in the family thus the question lies if the information be revealed by the carrier to his or her relatives for the bigger picture , or to be kept to him or herself .

target: The carrier of a known genetic risk should to tell his or her relatives to inform them of the health implications , to gain emotional support and to adhere to the ethical and legal obligations .

input: grammar: Firstly , the carrier should inform his or her relatives of the health implications that the genetic test results would affect them .
target: Firstly , the carrier should inform his or her relatives of the health implications that the genetic test results would affect them .

input: grammar: Most genetic disorders have a high percentage possibility of inheritance and also due to genetic similarities , appear in family members .
target: Most genetic disorders have a high percentage possibility of inheritance and also due to genetic similarities , appear in family members .

input: grammar: Thus family members should be informed so that precautionary measures could be taken by them to prepare for the possibility of the illness in the future .
target: Thus family members should be informed so that precautionary measures could be taken by them to prepare for the possibility of the illness in the future .

input: grammar: The relatives could go for regular monitoring of their health conditions .
target: The relatives could go for regular monitoring of their health conditions .

target: Furthermore , relatives could go for their own testing to ascertain their chances to the genetic disorder as an individual .

input: grammar: With the testing the relatives could make adjustments to their lifestyle to lower the risk and also to prepare case of ever developing the illness ( Sturm , Varga 2008 ) .
target: With the testing the relatives could make adjustments to their lifestyle to lower the risk and also to prepare case of ever developing the illness ( Sturm , Varga 2008 ) .

input: grammar: It can be argued that the carrier might be causing unnecessary worrying to his or her relatives as the accuracy of genetic test results varies and also dependent on various factors ( Goh , 2003 ) .
target: It can be argued that the carrier might be causing unnecessary worry to his or her relatives as the accuracy of genetic test results varies and also dependent on various factors ( Goh , 2003 ) .

target: Yet with the knowledge of the existence of such risk , the relatives can better prepare for themselves both physically and emotionally so as to be able to recover or overcome the stress if the genetic disorder turning into a medical condition .

target: Secondly , by telling his or her relatives , the carrier would be able to gain emotional support and understanding to overcome such trying times .

input: grammar: After knowing the results , the carrier might be in distraught and lost over what to do for the future .
target: After knowing the results , the carrier might be in distraught and lost over what to do for the future .

input: grammar: In such situation , the care and concern of the family members are crucial in helping reduce the stress .
target: In such situation , the care and concern of the family members are crucial in helping reduce the stress .

input: grammar: This is even more so if the genetic testing showed the possibility of the other family members and relatives may also have the genetic disorder .
target: This is even more so if the genetic testing showed the possibility of the other family members and relatives may also have the genetic disorder .

input: grammar: The family would be able to understand each other and provide the comfort that they are overcoming the problem together .
target: The family would be able to understand each other and provide the comfort that they are overcoming the problem together .

input: grammar: With regards to the health conditions , having family and relative support also help in taking care of each other physically should medical conditions develop .
target: With regards to the health conditions , having family and relative support also help in taking care of each other physically should medical conditions develop .

input: grammar: Some may be concerned that relatives might reject the risks and in turn discriminate the carrier for his or her genetic disorder especially if the developed illness is communicable .
target: Some may be concerned that relatives might reject the risks and in turn discriminate the carrier for his or her genetic disorder especially if the developed illness is communicable .

input: grammar: Yet we could not undermine the power of family bonds and the support they can give .
target: Yet we could not undermine the power of family bonds and the support they can give .

input: grammar: The situation of discrimination is subjective and does not amount to a general trend in family relationships .
target: The situation of discrimination is subjective and does not amount to a general trend in family relationships .

target: Lastly , the carrier is required to conform to the ethical and legal obligations in which genetic testing results is needed to be revealed in certain situations .

input: grammar: The American Society of Clinical Oncology concurs that disclosure may be permitted if the carrier refuse to disclose the information ; the disease caused by the disorder is highly probable to occur , serious , yet preventable and treatable or with early monitoring could reduce its risk .
target: The American Society of Clinical Oncology concurs that disclosure may be permitted if the carrier refuse to disclose the information ; the disease caused by the disorder is highly probable to occur , serious , yet preventable and treatable or with early monitoring could reduce its risk .

input: grammar: When an individual is tested positive as a carrier of a particular known genetic risk , such as 1 antitrypsin deficiency- where an insignificant adjustment in the style of living can prevent one from an " early death " ( Wilcke 1998 ) , or Huntington 's disease-where there is no approach to change the consequences of the result ( Wilcke 1998 ) , he or she will be in a state of dilemma- should he or she be obliged to inform his or her family members ?
target: When an individual is tested positive as a carrier of a particular known genetic risk , such as 1 antitrypsin deficiency- where an insignificant adjustment in the style of living can prevent one from an " early death " ( Wilcke 1998 ) , or Huntington 's disease-where there is no approach to change the consequences of the result ( Wilcke 1998 ) , he or she will be in dilemma dilemma- should he or she be obliged to inform his or her family members ?

input: grammar: Some suggested that when one 's relatives are informed of the result , it can cause additional anxiety on the relatives concerned and invade on their lives , thus the positive result should not be disclosed to one 's relatives .
target: Some suggested that when one 's relatives are informed of the result , it can cause additional anxiety on the relatives concerned and invade on their lives , thus the positive result should not be disclosed to one 's relatives .

input: grammar: However , by informing ones ' relatives of the result not only allow them to escape from early deaths through small adjustments in their lifestyles but also ensure the safety of third parties .
target: However , by informing ones ' relatives of the result not only allow them to escape from early deaths through small adjustments in their lifestyles but also ensure the safety of third parties .

input: grammar: Thus , the reveal of the result to relatives has effectuated significant advantages .
target: Thus , the reveal of the result to relatives has effectuated significant advantages .

input: grammar: Hence , a carrier of a known genetic risk should be obligated to tell his or her relatives .
target: Hence , a carrier of a known genetic risk should be obligated to tell his or her relatives .

input: grammar: Firstly , when the relatives of a carrier of a known genetic risk are informed of the positive test result , the chance of early deaths of the relatives is minimised .
target: Firstly , when the relatives of a carrier of a known genetic risk are informed of the positive test result , the chance of early deaths of the relatives is minimised .

input: grammar: This is because certain genetic diseases may be accentuated by external factors .
target: This is because certain genetic diseases may be accentuated by external factors .

input: grammar: When an individual is made known to the external factors , he or she can make adjustments to his or her daily lifestyle .
target: When an individual is made known to the external factors , he or she can make adjustments to his or her daily lifestyle .

input: grammar: Consequently , the chance of an early death due to the genetic disease is reduced since one is not exposed to the decisive risk factor .
target: Consequently , the chance of an early death due to the genetic disease is reduced since one is not exposed to the decisive risk factor .

input: grammar: For instance , one is tested positive for 1 antitrypsin deficiency- a genetic disease in which smoking is the decisive risk factor ( Wilcke 1998 ) .
target: For instance , one is tested positive for 1 antitrypsin deficiency- a genetic disease in which smoking is the decisive risk factor ( Wilcke 1998 ) .

input: grammar: When the carrier informed his or her relatives of the positive result , the relatives can restrain themselves from smoking .
target: When the carrier informed his or her relatives of the positive result , the relatives can restrain themselves from smoking .

input: grammar: This not only minimises the chance of them developing the disease but more importantly reduces the chance of dying early .
target: This not only minimises the chance of them developing the disease but more importantly reduces the chance of dying early .

input: grammar: Secondly , the reveal of the result to relatives ensures the safety of third parties .
target: Secondly , the reveal of the result to relatives ensures the safety of third parties .

input: grammar: When one is tested positive for genetic diseases which can cause one to expose others to danger , one should reveal the result to his or her relatives .
target: When one is tested positive for genetic diseases which can cause one to expose others to danger , one should reveal the result to his or her relatives .

input: grammar: This is because one 's relative could be in professions such as train conductor , air traffic controller and airline pilot ( Wachbroit 1996 ) .
target: This is because one 's relative could be in professions such as train conductor , air traffic controller and airline pilot ( Wachbroit 1996 ) .

input: grammar: These relatives might have a condition that would hamper their job performance in such a way as to expose other people to danger ( Wachbroit 1996 ) .
target: These relatives might have a condition that would hamper their job performance in such a way as to expose other people to danger ( Wachbroit 1996 ) .

input: grammar: For example , one is tested positive for Huntington 's disease- a disease that causes rampant movements .
target: For example , one is tested positive for Huntington 's disease- a disease that causes rampant movements .

input: grammar: When one 's relative is in a particular profession such as airline pilot and the relative is not informed of the positive result , he or she will continue in his or her profession .
target: When one 's relative is in a particular profession such as airline pilot and the relative is not informed of the positive result , he or she will continue in his or her profession .

input: grammar: However , the relative might not be able to control his or her movements while on the midst of controlling the aeroplane due to the Huntington 's disease .
target: However , the relative might not be able to control his or her movements while on the midst of controlling the aeroplane due to the Huntington 's disease .

input: grammar: This may cause a disastrous accident which results in the death of many passengers .
target: This may cause a disastrous accident which results in the death of many passengers .

input: grammar: Meanwhile , this disastrous accident may be prevented if the relative is informed of the result by the carrier .
target: Meanwhile , this disastrous accident may be prevented if the relative is informed of the result by the carrier .

input: grammar: This is because the relative may go for genetic testing and if one is confirmed to have the disease , he or she will not continue in his or her profession and thus will not expose others to danger .
target: This is because the relative may go for genetic testing and if one is confirmed to have the disease , he or she will not continue in his or her profession and thus will not expose others to danger .

input: grammar: Hence , the reveal of the testing result ensures the safety of third parties .
target: Hence , the reveal of the testing result ensures the safety of third parties .

input: grammar: It has been claimed that the disclosure of the testing result can create unnecessary distress on the relatives concerned and may invade radically on their lives .
target: It has been claimed that the disclosure of the testing result can create unnecessary distress on the relatives concerned and may invade radically on their lives .

input: grammar: However , the relatives might have significant effects if they are not informed of the result .
target: However , the relatives might have significant effects if they are not informed of the result .

input: grammar: This is because they might make themselves vulnerable to the decisive risk determinants of any particular genetic disease ( Wilcke 1998 ) .
target: This is because they might make themselves vulnerable to the decisive risk determinants of any particular genetic disease ( Wilcke 1998 ) .

input: grammar: If they are informed of the result , they might avoid the risk of developing the disease .
target: If they are informed of the result , they might avoid the risk of developing the disease .

input: grammar: Thus , the consequences of being informed of the result are more preferable than staying in ignorance .
target: Thus , the consequences of being informed of the result are more preferable than staying in ignorance .

target: Results from a genetic testing can help to ascertain the percentage of chances of a person developing or passing on a genetic disease .

input: grammar: Genetic testing is done voluntary by a person and often , the question " should a person who is found to be a carrier of genetic disorder through the genetic testing tell his or her family " arises when it comes to releasing the results of the test .
target: Genetic testing is done voluntary by a person and often , the question " should a person who is found to be a carrier of genetic disorder through the genetic testing tell his or her family " arises when it comes to releasing the results of the test .

input: grammar: In my opinion , the carrier of a known genetic disease should be obligated to tell his or her family members .
target: In my opinion , the carrier of a known genetic disease should be obligated to tell his or her family members .

input: grammar: One should be obligated to reveal his or her own genetic test 's results to his family members as the results can help in family planning .
target: One should be obligated to reveal his or her own genetic test 's results to his family members as the results can help in family planning .

input: grammar: A person who is thinking of marrying , should let his partner know that he has genetic problem as the other party is going to spend the rest of her life with him and it will be unfair to keep her in the dark .
target: A person who is thinking of marrying , should let his partner know that he has genetic problem as the other party is going to spend the rest of her life with him and it will be unfair to keep her in the dark .

input: grammar: Not only that , those who are already married should also reveal the results to his spouse so that they can come up with a plan for their family like how many children they want and whether they want to take the risk of having a child .
target: Not only that , those who are already married should also reveal the results to his spouse so that they can come up with a plan for their family like how many children they want and whether they want to take the risk of having a child .

input: grammar: Taking care of children with serious genetic disorder is not an easy task , and as such , a couple should inform each other of their genetic problem first and try to discuss the consequences and think of a solution together instead of keeping it a secret .
target: Taking care of children with serious genetic disorder is not an easy task , and as such , a couple should inform each other of their genetic problem first and try to discuss the consequences and think of a solution together instead of keeping it a secret .

input: grammar: However , critics may say that it is not necessary to inform his spouse about his condition as sometimes the baby will not inherit the disease and even if the baby do inherit the disorder , abortion can still be done while the foetus is still inside the mother 's womb .
target: However , critics may say that it is not necessary to inform his spouse about his condition as sometimes the baby will not inherit the disease and even if the baby does inherit the disorder , abortion can still be done while the foetus is still inside the mother 's womb .

input: grammar: However , this is not an ethical thing to do and inhuman to terminate a life .
target: However , this is not an ethical thing to do and it is to terminate a life .

target: It will be much better if they have discuss and plan earlier and thus a desperate measure such as abortion need not be made .

input: grammar: Besides that , a carrier of a known genetic problem should be obligated to tell his family members so that the chances of treating or at least improving his disease will be much more higher .
target: Besides that , a carrier of a known genetic problem should be obligated to tell his family members so that the chances of treating or at least improving his disease will be much more higher .

target: This is because , when his family members know that he is suffering from a genetic problem , they will try all means to help him to improve his condition .

target: In the case of Huntington 's disease , the related family member will have a 50 percent possibility of having the disease ( Norrgard , 2008a ) .

input: grammar: If so unfortunately the related family member were to develop the disease and carry on with giving birth , his/her child will in turn have a 50 percent chance of having the disease .
target: If so unfortunately the related family member were to develop the disease and carry on with giving birth , his/her child will in turn have a 50 percent chance of having the disease .

input: grammar: When this cycle carries on , it will create a social problem as the disease has now been spread into the society .
target: When this cycle carries on , it will create a social problems as the disease has now been spread into the society .

input: grammar: Thus , the individual should be obligated to inform his/her relatives to avoid such situation .
target: Thus , the individual should be obligated to inform his/her relatives to avoid such situation .

input: grammar: On the contrary , others may feel that the individual will be discriminated due to his/her disease .
target: On the contrary , others may feel that the individual will be discriminated due to his/her disease .

input: grammar: However , there are laws which protect the individual from discrimination ( Norrgard , 2008b ) .
target: However , there are laws which protect the individual from discrimination ( Norrgard , 2008b ) .

input: grammar: This can give the individual a sense of assurance that they have equal chances ( in looking for a job ) as compared to others .
target: This can give the individual a sense of assurance that they have equal chances ( in looking for a job ) as compared to others .

input: grammar: There are those who feel that an individual of a known genetic risk should not be obligated to inform his/her relatives as genetic results is private and of high confidentiality ( HOPES , 2002 ) .
target: There are those who feel that an individual of a known genetic risk should not be obligated to inform his/her relatives as genetic results is private and of high confidentiality ( HOPES , 2002 ) .

input: grammar: While it is true that genetic test result are confidential , in the case where another life is at risk , we should be more considerate and help save another life .
target: While it is true that genetic test result are confidential , in the case where another life is at risk , we should be more considerate and help save another life .

input: grammar: In conclusion , an individual of a known genetic risk should be obligated to inform his/her relatives as both ethical and social implications will occur .
target: In conclusion , an individual of a known genetic risk should be obligated to inform his/her relatives as both ethical and social implications will occur .
