input: grammar: Surveillance technology such as RFID technology is used for the purpose of monitoring changes , behaviour , activities and keeping track of mainly humans and sometimes , animals .
target: Surveillance technology such as RFID technology is used for the purpose of monitoring changes , behaviors and activities and keeping track of mainly humans and sometimes , animals .

input: grammar: RFID technology has been around for more than 10 years and it is used by different bodies or organizations ( Ramdasi , 2009 ) .
target: RFID technology has been around for more than 10 years and it is used by different bodies or organizations ( Ramdasi , 2009 ) .

input: grammar: Thus , it is not something uncommon among our society as it is incorporated in many applications of our daily lives such as tracking people and animals .
target: Thus , it is not something uncommon in our society as it has been incorporated into many applications of our daily lives such as tracking people and animals .

input: grammar: The acronym RFID stands for Radio Frequency Identification and it is widely used in different industries .
target: The acronym RFID stands for Radio Frequency Identification and it is widely used in different industries .

input: grammar: We may rely too much on RFID technology that it may take a toll on some of us .
target: We may rely too much on RFID technology that it may take a toll on some of us .

input: grammar: This has resulted in the raise of privacy and ethical issues within our society .
target: This has resulted in the emergence of privacy and ethical issues within our society .

input: grammar: However , it has been known that RFID technology brings benefits to various elements of our lives and it helps in solving problems that we may encounter while handling different tasks and even correct human errors .
target: However , it has been known that RFID technology brings benefits to various aspects of our lives such as helping in solving problems that we may encounter while handling different tasks and even correcting human errors .

input: grammar: Hence , RFID technology such as human implants and RFID tags should be used to monitor people .
target: Hence , RFID technology such as human implants and RFID tags should be used to monitor people .

input: grammar: One of the vital advantages of the use of RFID technology is that it can boost the security level effectively in a few areas within certain proximity ( Ramdasi , 2009 ) .
target: One of the vital advantages of the use of RFID technology is that it can boost the security level effectively in a few areas ( Ramdasi , 2009 ) .

input: grammar: Safety and security is the primary concern when it comes to managing a business .
target: Safety and security is the primary concern when it comes to managing a business .

input: grammar: For example , RFID tags are widely used in jewellery stores , supermarkets and boutiques .
target: For example , RFID tags are widely used in jewellery stores , supermarkets and boutiques .

input: grammar: Merchandises in the respective stores are tagged with RFID tags and RFID readers will be placed at the checkout counters ( Ramdasi , 2009 ) .
target: Merchandises in the respective stores are tagged with RFID tags and RFID readers will be placed at the checkout counters ( Ramdasi , 2009 ) .

input: grammar: Once an RFID tagged item is brought out via an RFID reader , it will trigger the alarm and security guards will be alerted upon hearing the alarm .
target: Once an RFID tagged item is brought out , it will trigger the alarm and security guards will be alerted upon hearing the alarm .

input: grammar: Thus , this decreases the chances of thefts .
target: this decreases the chances of theft .

input: grammar: Besides that , RFID tags come in various shapes and sizes and the information contained in the RFID tags are not easily duplicated ( Ramdasi , 2009 ) .
target: Besides that , RFID tags come in various shapes and sizes and the information contained in the RFID tags are not easily duplicated ( Ramdasi , 2009 ) .

input: grammar: This increases the security level and efficacy of the surveillance systems in a particular area that incorporates the RFID technology .
target: This increases the security level and efficacy of the surveillance system in a particular area that incorporates the RFID technology .

input: grammar: Besides that , RFID technology is also important in the healthcare industry as it can save lives ( Rapid Adoption of RFID in Healthcare , 2006 ) .
target: Besides that , RFID technology is also important in the healthcare industry as it can save lives ( Rapid Adoption of RFID in Healthcare , 2006 ) .

input: grammar: Dull and monotonous procedures can be removed or reduced and patients would not feel trapped or isolated and be more carefree ( Rapid Adoption of RFID in Healthcare , 2006 ) .
target: Dull and monotonous procedures can be removed or reduced and patients would not feel trapped or isolated and be more carefree ( Rapid Adoption of RFID in Healthcare , 2006 ) .

input: grammar: For example , patients are tagged with RFID wristbands that contain information about their health conditions , medications , drug allergies and microchips that enable healthcare professionals to monitor the patients ( RFID Applications in Healthcare , 2006 ) .
target: For example , patients are tagged with RFID wristbands that contain information about their health conditions , medications , drug allergies and microchips that enable healthcare professionals to monitor the patients ( RFID Applications in Healthcare , 2006 ) .

input: grammar: If any of the patients experience any difficulties such as breathlessness , nurses will be able to track the patient and immediately attend to him or her .
target: If any patient experiences any difficulties such as breathlessness , nurses will be able to track the patient and immediately attend to him or her .

input: grammar: This saves time and can potentially save a life .
target: This saves time and can potentially save a life .

input: grammar: Since RFID automates procedures such as protecting the patients from danger , it reduces the amount of personal contacts between patients and nurses ( Rapid Adoption of RFID in Healthcare , 2006 ) .
target: Since RFID automates such procedures that protect patients from danger , it reduces the amount of personal contact between patients and nurses ( Rapid Adoption of RFID in Healthcare , 2006 ) .

input: grammar: Information on patients ' diseases and surgeries can also be obtained from the RFID wristbands .
target: Information on patients ' diseases and surgeries can also be obtained from the RFID wristbands .

input: grammar: Reports can be accessed by the healthcare professionals such as the doctors and nurses without a hassle .
target: Thus , reports can be accessed by the healthcare professionals such as the doctors and nurses without a hassle .

input: grammar: Further medical treatments can be conducted if another doctor reads the reports .
target: Further medical treatments can be conducted if another doctor reads the reports .

input: grammar: However , there are arguments that are against the use of RFID technology in monitoring and tracking people and animals despite the benefits gained .
target: However , there are arguments that are against the use of RFID technology in monitoring and tracking people and animals despite the benefits gained .

input: grammar: One of the arguments that have been brought up is the difficulty in reading the information provided by the RFID tags incorporated in liquids and metal products ( Pandey , 2009 ) .
target: One of the arguments that has been brought up is the difficulty in reading the information provided by the RFID tags incorporated in liquids and metal products ( Pandey , 2009 ) .

input: grammar: These substances may reflect the radio waves which make the information hard to read .
target: These substances may reflect the radio waves which makes the information hard to read .

input: grammar: The RFID tags also have to be placed in proper positions , taking into account its angles and alignment in order to obtain a proper reading .
target: The RFID tags also have to be placed in proper positions , taking into account their angles and alignment in order to obtain a proper reading .

input: grammar: This can be quite a hassle and it requires a lot of concentration .
target: This can be quite a hassle and it requires a lot of concentration .

input: grammar: However , RFID tags are usually placed in an area with optimum frequency which enables the RFID readers to obtain the information contained in the tags correctly .
target: However , RFID tags are usually placed in an area with optimum frequency which enables the RFID readers to obtain the information contained in the tags correctly .

input: grammar: Active RFID tags which are tags that use batteries to increase the range of frequency of a system can be used to solve this problem .
target: Active RFID tags , which are tags that use batteries to increase the range of frequency of a system , can be used to solve this problem .

input: grammar: Hence , the use of RFID technology would still be effective and beneficial to us .
target: Hence , the use of RFID technology would still be effective and beneficial to us .

input: grammar: In conclusion , we can see that the use of RFID technology does bring important advantages to our society .
target: In conclusion , we can see that the use of RFID technology does bring important advantages to our society .

input: grammar: Therefore , the use of RFID technology should be promoted and enhanced .
target: Therefore , the use of RFID technology should be promoted and enhanced .

input: grammar: RFID technology provides a better security than other surveillance gadgets such as CCTV and reduces thefts in our society .
target: RFID technology provides better security than other surveillance gadgets such as CCTV and reduces thefts in our society .

input: grammar: Besides that , monitoring of animals is made easy because of the versatility of the RFID tags .
target: Besides that , monitoring of animals is made easy because of the versatility of the RFID tags .

input: grammar: Therefore , if we would like to minimise our workload , save time , ensure that we live in a safer environment and save lives , RFID technology should be used to carry out these intentions .
target: Therefore , if we would like to minimise our workload , save time , ensure that we live in a safer environment and save lives , RFID technology should be used to carry out these intentions .

input: grammar: A Radio Frequency Identification ( RFID ) tag is a small microchip designed for identification of the object it is attached to .
target: A Radio Frequency Identification ( RFID ) tag is a small microchip designed for identification of the object it is attached to .

input: grammar: It is capable of transmitting many stored digital information to receivers via radio waves and has many applications in consumers ' products ( Cormode 2006 ) .
target: It is capable of transmitting much stored digital information to receivers via radio waves and has many applications in terms of consumers ' products ( Cormode 2006 ) .

input: grammar: However , privacy issues arise when the same technology is used for tracking of human ( Cormode 2006 ) .
target: However , privacy issues arise when the same technology is used for tracking humans ( Cormode 2006 ) .

input: grammar: When RFID and other surveillance technology are used to track children movement , we are not only invading the children privacy but also undermining their dignity ( Anonymous 2005 ) .
target: When RFID and other surveillance technologies are used to track children 's movement , we are not only invading the children 's privacy but also undermining their dignity ( Anonymous 2005 ) .

input: grammar: Usage of RFID implants in the medical field to store patients ' medical data has also been linked to increased possibility of developing cancer ( Gutierrez 2008 ) .
target: Usage of RFID implants in the medical field to store patients ' medical data has also been linked to increased possibility of developing cancer ( Gutierrez 2008 ) .

input: grammar: With such detrimental effects on health and on human rights of privacy , usage of surveillance technology such as RFID to track people should be banned .
target: With such detrimental effects on health and on human rights in terms of privacy , usage of surveillance technology such as RFID to track people should be banned .

input: grammar: First of all , when RFID is used to tag and track a person , the privacy of the person being tracked is compromised .
target: First of all , when RFID is used to tag and track a person , the privacy of the person being tracked is compromised .

input: grammar: The United Nations Universal Declaration of Human Rights states that " No one shall be subjected to arbitrary interference with his privacy , family , home or correspondence , nor to attacks upon his honour and reputation .
target: The United Nations Universal Declaration of Human Rights states that " No one shall be subjected to arbitrary interference with his privacy , family , home or correspondence , nor to attacks upon his honour and reputation .

input: grammar: " With RFID , private information of the individual other than his location can be picked up by anyone with a radio receiver and the individual with the RFID will not know who is taking the information and what private information is being stolen ( Cormode 2006 ) .
target: " With RFID , private information of the individual other than his location can be picked up by anyone with a radio receiver and the individual tagged by the RFID will not know who is taking the information and what private information is being stolen ( Cormode 2006 ) .

input: grammar: The information may be misused for consumer profiling by the company collecting all these personal information ( Cormode 2006 ) .
target: The information may be misused for consumer profiling by the company collecting all this personal information ( Cormode 2006 ) .

input: grammar: Advocates of RFID argue that the technology will prevent terrorist from entering the nation by reducing forgery of passport ( US Department of Homeland Security ) .
target: Advocates of RFID argue that the technology will prevent terrorists from entering the nation by reducing forgery of passports ( US Department of Homeland Security ) .

input: grammar: However , the United Sates Department of Homeland Security ( DHS ) reported that the ability of RFID to counter forgery comes from its use of encrypted digital data storage and not from its radio transmission capability .
target: However , the United Sates Department of Homeland Security ( DHS ) has reported that the ability of RFID to counter forgery comes from its use of encrypted digital data storage and not from its radio transmission capability .

input: grammar: The DHS also added that other forms of digital data storage technology such as contact chips can provide the same function against passport forgery while preventing invasion of human privacy .
target: The DHS has also added that other forms of digital data storage technology such as contact chips can provide the same function against passport forgery while preventing invasion of human privacy .

input: grammar: Thus , RFID should not be used to track people since it infringe into human privacy .
target: Thus , RFID should not be used to track people since it infringes on human privacy .

input: grammar: Secondly , an article on Electronic Privacy Information Center ( Anonymous 2005 ) highlighted that using RFID to track children movement and location not only invades their privacy but can also be very detrimental to their dignity .
target: Secondly , an article on Electronic Privacy Information Center ( Anonymous 2005 ) highlighted that using RFID to track children 's movements and locations not only invades their privacy but can also be very detrimental to their dignity .

input: grammar: The article also compared tagging our children with RFID with tagging of products in markets or tagging of livestock in farms .
target: The article also compared tagging our children with RFID with tagging of products in markets or tagging of livestock in farms .

input: grammar: From this comparison , it shows that the dignity of children is being affected by the usage of RFID to track them .
target: this comparison shows that the dignity of children is being affected by the usage of RFID to track them .

input: grammar: Opponents to this position argue that RFID can be used to locate the child position in the event of a kidnap ( Lane 2003 ) .
target: Opponents to this position argue that RFID can be used to locate a child 's location in the event of a kidnap ( Lane 2003 ) .

input: grammar: However , Lane ( 2003 ) argues that due to the limited range of RFID , it will not serve the purpose of locating the kidnapped child well .
target: However , Lane ( 2003 ) argues that due to the limited range of RFID , it will not serve the purpose of locating the kidnapped child well .

input: grammar: On top of that , Lane ( 2003 ) also pointed out that these surveillance technologies may give the children and parents a false sense of security .
target: On top of that , Lane ( 2003 ) also points out that these surveillance technologies may give the children and parents a false sense of security .

input: grammar: Instead of teaching their children the importance of personal safety and the danger of wandering off with strangers , parents may end up relying too much on these technologies for the safety of their children .
target: Instead of teaching their children the importance of personal safety and the danger of wandering off with strangers , parents may end up relying too much on these technologies for the safety of their children .

input: grammar: Hence , RFID should not be used for tracking of children .
target: Hence , RFID should not be used for the tracking of children .

input: grammar: Lastly , usage of RFID implant to track patients and to store medical information of cognitive decline individual have been linked to an increased risk of developing skin cancer in areas near the implant ( Gutierrez 2008 ) .
target: Lastly , usage of RFID implants to track patients and to store medical information of cognitively declined individuals has been linked to an increased risk of developing skin cancer in areas near the implant ( Gutierrez 2008 ) .

input: grammar: Although the RFID implant aids in getting medical information from these individual with lower intellect , the increase risk of cancer greatly outweighs this benefit .
target: Although the RFID implant aids in getting medical information from these individuals with lower intellect , the increased risk of cancer greatly outweighs this benefit .

input: grammar: Thus , usage of RFID implants for tracking of patients or for storing of medical records should be banned .
target: Thus , usage of RFID implants for tracking of patients or for storing of medical records should be banned .

input: grammar: In conclusion , usage of RFID or other surveillance technology to track people not only infringe human rights of privacy and undermine the dignity of our children , it also poses a serious health issue in the case of a RFID implant .
target: In conclusion , usage of RFID or other surveillance technologies to track people not only infringes on human rights of privacy and undermines the dignity of our children , it also poses a serious health issue in the case of RFID implants .

input: grammar: As such , RFID or other surveillance technology to track people should be banned .
target: As such , RFID or other surveillance technologies to track people should be banned .

input: grammar: A thorough inspection in surveillance
target: A thorough inspection in surveillance

input: grammar: With the maturity of surveillance technology , a myriad of surveillance technologies is now widely utilized for administration , security purpose and public welfare , etc .
target: With the maturity of surveillance technology , a myriad of surveillance technologies is now widely utilized for administration , security purpose and public welfare .

input: grammar: However , individuals of course would feel very uncomfortable when noticing a surveillance camera on an ATM machine or even in workplace .
target: However , individuals would of course feel very uncomfortable when noticing a surveillance camera on an ATM machine or even in the workplace .

input: grammar: A seemingly unavoidable debate thus arises .
target: A seemingly unavoidable debate thus arises .

input: grammar: Surveillance technology mainly involves the invention and application of informative , accurate and reliable modern equipment monitoring the behaviours , activities , or other changing information , usually in a clandestine manner .
target: Surveillance technology mainly involves the invention and application of informative , accurate and reliable modern equipment monitoring the behaviours , activities , or other , usually in a clandestine manner .

input: grammar: Surveillance was conducted by the governments for national and social security issues underground at the very beginning .
target: Surveillance was conducted by the governments for national and social security issues underground at the very beginning .

input: grammar: However , surveillance equipment has become usual and developed into various types .
target: However , surveillance equipment has become common and developed into various types .

input: grammar: The vast and most frequent surveillance is on the internet , the presumed free space .
target: The most common and widespread form of surveillance is on the Internet , the presumed free space .

input: grammar: ( Daffier , Whitfield , 2008 ) ) For instance , the information awareness office , NSA , FBI in U.S. all have unauthorised access to all the data and traffic on the internet .
target: ( Daffier , Whitfield , 2008 ) ) For instance , the intelligence offices , the NSA and the FBI in the US all have unauthorised access to all the data and traffic on the Internet .

input: grammar: Billions are spent every year to develop , purchase , maintain and implement the surveillance system to intercept and analyze online information .
target: Billions are spent every year to develop , purchase , maintain and implement the surveillance system to intercept and analyze online information .

input: grammar: The tapping of telephone line by government organisations for monitor citizens and collecting miscellaneous information is also widespread in almost every country .
target: The tapping of telephone lines by government organisations for monitoring citizens and collecting miscellaneous information is also widespread in almost every country .

input: grammar: Another common surveillance system is that of the surveillance cameras hidden in public areas such as streets , hotels , hospital , shopping mall , bank etc , for administrative purposes or financial security .
target: Another common surveillance system is that of the surveillance cameras hidden in public areas such as streets , hotels , hospitals , shopping malls , banks and so on for administrative purposes or financial security .

target: RFID tapping is the use of small devices implanted in human bodies or products to identify and locate them , which is already applied in some companies to monitor their workers on the job .

input: grammar: Some criticize ferociously that such mass surveillance is the step towards the totalitarian world described in Jorge Orwell 's 1984.They fear the fictional Orwellian may even become true , which will be a disaster for human beings .
target: Some warn that such mass surveillance is the step towards the totalitarian world described in Jorge Orwell 's 1984.They fear the fictional Orwellian may even become true , which will be a disaster for human beings .

input: grammar: Numerous civil right groups and privacy groups oppose and regard it as a severe violation of the tight of privacy and freedom .
target: Numerous civil rights groups and privacy groups oppose and regard mass surveillance as a severe violation of the right to privacy and freedom .

input: grammar: The supporters believe that surveillance system is indispensible in indentifying and capturing terrorists and criminals , which is for public welfare .It 's also effective for administrative purpose .
target: However , supporters believe that surveillance systems are indispensible in identifying and capturing terrorists and criminals , which is for public welfare .Mass surveillance is also effective for administrative purposes .

target: They argue that in today 's context , terrorists can make use of computer software to access others ' information , there is no reason why governments cannots do so on behalf of the whole country .

input: grammar: They also point out governments did n't abuse the information at their hand since they are also monitored by people .Additionally , surveillance create everyone a feeling of being watched , so they become self-policing , which can decrease criminal rate and save administrative expenditure ( Michel Foucault,1979 ) .
target: They also point out that governments would not abuse the information on their hands since they are also monitored by the people .Additionally , surveillance creates in everyone a feeling of being watched , so one becomes self-policing , which can decrease crime rates and save administrative expenditure ( Foucault , 1979 ) .

input: grammar: Realistically , in my view , the usage of surveillance is necessary in some area and has its value in the benefit of whole society and therefore can not be all banned .
target: Realistically , in my view , the usage of surveillance is necessary in some areas and has its value benefiting the whole society and therefore can not be totally banned .

target: There are always some ready to behave undesirably in any conditions everywhere .

input: grammar: We are compelled to sacrifice some to counter them ; otherwise we lose more .
target: We are compelled to sacrifice some to counter them ; otherwise we lose out more .

input: grammar: The true meaning of freedom is that with sacrifice of some freedom , one can enjoy much more freedom .Obviously ; the whole society can not function properly if everyone insists on nothing but his own interest .
target: The true meaning of freedom is that with the sacrifice of some freedom , one can enjoy much more freedom .Obviously ; the whole society can not function properly if everyone insists on nothing but his own interest .

target: In the case of surveillance technology , we should concentrate on how to use it appropriately .

input: grammar: Technological advancement has led to the invention of several surveillance technologies .
target: Technological advancement has led to the invention of several surveillance technologies .

input: grammar: One such example is Radio Frequency Identification ( RFID ) technology .
target: One such example is Radio Frequency Identification ( RFID ) technology .

input: grammar: The use of such technology has made it possible to track people and their activities through their belongings without their knowledge .
target: The use of such technology has made it possible to track people and their activities through their belongings without their knowledge .

input: grammar: This has brought about many debates on the ethical and moral issues surrounding the use of the device ( Anonymous , 2005 ) .
target: This has brought about many debates on the ethical and moral issues surrounding the use of the technology ( Anonymous , 2005 ) .

input: grammar: While opponents of RFID suggest that the use of RFID bring benefits such as convenience and protection to patients and children , others view it as a form of security threat and intrusion of privacy ( Data Privacy & Integrity Advisory Committee , 2006 ) .
target: While proponents of RFID suggest that the use of RFID brings benefits such as convenience and protection to patients and children , others view it as a form of security threat and intrusion of privacy ( Data Privacy & Integrity Advisory Committee , 2006 ) .

input: grammar: The use of RFID can also cause the growth of tumors if chips are implanted into the human body ( Anti-chip.com , n.d ) .
target: The use of RFID can also cause the growth of tumors if chips are implanted into the human body ( Anti-chip.com , n.d ) .

input: grammar: Thus , the use of RFID should be banned as the consequences it brings outweigh the few benefits that it provides .
target: Thus , the use of RFID should be banned as the consequences it brings outweigh the few benefits that it provides .

input: grammar: Firstly , the use of RFID to track people has raised concerns on privacy issues as they are tracked without their knowledge ( Data Privacy & Integrity Advisory Committee , 2006 ) .
target: Firstly , the use of RFID to track people has raised concerns on privacy issues as they are tracked without their knowledge ( Data Privacy & Integrity Advisory Committee , 2006 ) .

input: grammar: Their whereabouts and activities can be constantly monitored and information shared .
target: Their whereabouts and activities can be constantly monitored and such information shared .

input: grammar: It can be argued that the use of RFID tags to check on patients with Alzheimer 's conditions and children may be a form of protection .
target: It can be argued that the use of RFID tags to check on patients with Alzheimer conditions and children may be a form of protection .

input: grammar: For instance , in 2006 , Verichip , the manufacturer of RFID chips for human attempted to chip 200 Alzheimer 's patients from Chattanooga , Tennessee to test the effectiveness of the product ( Antichip.com , n.d ) .
target: For instance , in 2006 , Verichip , the manufacturer of RFID chips for humans attempted to chip 200 Alzheimer patients from Chattanooga , Tennessee to test the effectiveness of the product ( Antichip.com , n.d ) .

input: grammar: However , this has raised a series of heated debate as it is not ethical to chip cognitively impaired individuals who are unable to give informed consent ( Antichip.com , n.d ) .
target: However , this raised a series of heated debates as it is not ethical to chip cognitively impaired individuals who are unable to give informed consent for the experiment ( Antichip.com , n.d ) .

input: grammar: Hence , the use of RFID should be banned as it invades the privacy of people .
target: Hence , the use of RFID should be banned as it invades the privacy of people .

input: grammar: Secondly , the use of RFID to track people may provide a false sense of security ( Hook , 2005 ) .
target: Secondly , the use of RFID to track people may provide a false sense of security ( Hook , 2005 ) .

input: grammar: RFID tags can be incorporated in one 's belongings such as passports and identification cards to track and identify people .
target: RFID tags can be incorporated into one 's belongings such as passports and identification cards to track and identify people .

input: grammar: This may increase cases of skimming on personal information .
target: This may increase cases of skimming on personal information .

input: grammar: Opponents of RFID may debated that encryption can be used to limit the access of information to unauthorized people ( Data Privacy & Integrity Advisory Committee , 2006 ) .
target: Supporters of RFID may argue that encryption can be used to limit the access of information to unauthorized people ( Data Privacy & Integrity Advisory Committee , 2006 ) .

input: grammar: Furthermore , it can be argued that RFID technology would reduce delay at checkpoints and entrances which in turn improve efficiency and speed ( Data Privacy & Integrity Advisory Committee , 2006 ) .
target: Furthermore , it can be argued that RFID technology can reduce delays at checkpoints and entrances which in turn would improve efficiency and speed ( Data Privacy & Integrity Advisory Committee , 2006 ) .

input: grammar: Nevertheless , experiments by security research firm Riscure have shown that the encrypted passport can be intercepted and excessive information is revealed to an unauthorized person , which may promote identity theft ( Hasbrouck , 2006 ) .
target: Nevertheless , experiments by security research firm Riscure have shown that the encrypted passport can be intercepted and excessive information can be revealed to an unauthorized person , which may promote identity theft ( Hasbrouck , 2006 ) .

input: grammar: Therefore , RFID should be banned as the device is flawed .
target: Therefore , RFID should be banned as the technology is flawed .

input: grammar: Lastly , implanting RFID chips in human can be a potential health risk .
target: Lastly , implanting RFID chips in humans can be a potential health risk .

input: grammar: A series of studies has shown that chip implants had induced malignant tumors in some lab mice and rats ( Lewan , 2007 ) .
target: A series of studies showed that chip implants induced malignant tumors in some lab mice and rats ( Lewan , 2007 ) .

input: grammar: This shows that implanting chips in human may cause cancer .
target: This shows that implanting chips in humans may cause cancer .

input: grammar: However , leading cancer specialists reviewed that animal test results do not necessarily apply to humans ( Lewan , 2007 ) .
target: However , leading cancer specialists that animal test results do not necessarily apply to humans ( Lewan , 2007 ) .

input: grammar: Moreover , Verichip Corp insists that the chips are safe and has been implanted in millions of domestic pets without major problem ( Lewan , 2007 ) .
target: Moreover , Verichip Corp insists that the chips are safe and has been implanted in millions of domestic pets without major problems ( Lewan , 2007 ) .

input: grammar: Nevertheless , implanting RFID in human body should be banned before any cause of detrimental health effect to the individuals .
target: Nevertheless , implanting RFID in the human body should be banned detrimental health effects on individuals .

input: grammar: In conclusion , the use of RFID to track people should be banned as it can be a security threat and it intrudes the privacy of people .
target: In conclusion , the use of RFID to track people should be banned as it can be a security threat and it intrudes on the privacy of people .

input: grammar: Implanting RFID chips may also result in cancer .
target: Implanting RFID chips into humans may also result in cancer .

input: grammar: The disadvantages of the use of RFID outweigh the benefits .
target: The disadvantages of the use of RFID outweigh the benefits .

input: grammar: Surveillance technology systems are mechanisms , which can identify , monitor and track movements and data .
target: Surveillance technology systems are mechanisms which can identify , monitor and track movements and data .

input: grammar: Research laboratories envision tools that could identify and track just about every person , anywhere -- and sound alarms when the systems encounter hazardous objects or chemical compounds .
target: Research laboratories envision tools that can identify and track just about every person anywhere -- and sound the alarm when the systems encounter hazardous objects or chemical compounds .

input: grammar: Together these developments herald a high-tech surveillance society that is beyond previous generation imagination-- one in which virtually every advance brings benefits as well as intrusions .
target: Together these developments herald a high-tech surveillance society that is beyond previous generations ' imagination-- one in which virtually every advance brings benefits as well as intrusions .

input: grammar: However since the benefits reaped from surveillance technology overpowers the inconvenience it results in , surveillance technology should indeed be used to track people .
target: However , since the benefits reaped from surveillance technology outweigh the inconvenience it results in , surveillance technology should indeed be used to track people .

input: grammar: Surveillance technology should be used to track people to ensure national security by preventing crime .
target: Surveillance technology should be used to track people to ensure national security by preventing crime .

input: grammar: Ever since this technology has become immensely sophisticated , real benefits have been achieved in the development of surveillance technology systems .
target: Ever since this technology has become immensely sophisticated , real benefits have been achieved in the development of surveillance technology systems .

input: grammar: The most common type of surveillance technology is the security cameras .
target: The most common type of surveillance technology is the security camera .

input: grammar: Take for instance , the pinhole cameras in most banks machines .
target: Take , for instance , the pinhole cameras in most bank machines .

input: grammar: These devices play a part in deterring potential criminals from carrying out their nefarious activities knowing that their images are caught on tape and maybe used for capture and prosecution .
target: These devices play a part in deterring potential criminals from carrying out their nefarious activities knowing that their images are caught on tape and may be used for arrest and prosecution .

input: grammar: In addition , this technology also complements the work of security personnel and thus provides added protection against sneaky terrorist attacks .
target: In addition , this technology also complements the work of security personnel and thus provides added protection against furtive terrorist attacks .

input: grammar: This is evident in the Singapore MRT stations that are equipped with the 24-hour camera surveillance .
target: This is evident in the Singapore MRT stations that are equipped with the 24-hour camera surveillance .

input: grammar: Furthermore surveillance technology helps to combat threats .
target: Furthermore , surveillance technology helps to combat threats .

input: grammar: This is proven during the introduction of the newly-developed Infrared Fever Screening System ( IFSS ) which is a useful contribution in national effort against SARS .
target: This has been proven through the introduction of the newly-developed Infrared Fever Screening System ( IFSS ) which was a useful contribution in national efforts against SARS .

input: grammar: Some may argue that surveillance technology should not be used to track people as it may have substantial implications in privacy .
target: Some may argue that surveillance technology should not be used to track people as it may have substantial implications on privacy .

input: grammar: Privacy usually refers to the interest that individuals have in sustaining a personal space free from interference by other people and organizations .
target: Privacy refers to the interest that individuals have in sustaining a personal space free from interference by other people and organizations .

input: grammar: It is acknowledged that the usage of surveillance technology seems to invade and violate the right to privacy .
target: It is acknowledged that the usage of surveillance technology seems to invade and violate the right to privacy .

input: grammar: People often think of privacy as some kind of right .
target: People often think of privacy as some kind of right .

input: grammar: However , the concept of this right is a problematic way to define as it is very easy to get confused between legal rights on one hand and natural or moral rights on the other .
target: However , the concept of this right is a problematic way to define privacy as it is very easy to get confused between legal rights on one hand and natural or moral rights on the other .

input: grammar: One may claim it is his right to stay in a country that is safe whereas the other may claim that it is their right not to want the practice of surveillance technology .
target: One may claim it is his right to stay in a country that is safe whereas the other may claim that it is their right not to want the practice of surveillance technology .

input: grammar: In such situations , it is impossible for both parties to have their rights .
target: In such situations , it is impossible for both parties to have their rights .

input: grammar: One will have to give up the right to absolute privacy to reap the benefits of the rights to feel safe and secure .
target: One will have to give up the right to absolute privacy to reap the benefits of the right to feel safe and secure .

input: grammar: Besides having absolute privacy is just an ideal .
target: In addition , having absolute privacy is just an ideal .

input: grammar: The practice of surveillance technology is necessary for the benefit of majority as it adopted to improve our quality of life .
target: The practice of surveillance technology is necessary for the benefit of the majority as it has been adopted to improve our quality of life .

input: grammar: It will be denying more people rights if surveillance is not practiced .
target: It will be denying more people their rights if surveillance is not practiced .

input: grammar: For now , the public seems to find that trade-off acceptable .
target: For now , the public seems to find that trade-off acceptable .

input: grammar: Furthermore scientists around the world have intensified efforts to perfect the art of surveillance , hoping to catch villains before they strike .
target: Furthermore , scientists around the world have intensified efforts to perfect the art of surveillance , hoping to catch villains before they strike .

input: grammar: This will assure public that it is worth it to allow the technology to invade in their privacy .
target: This will assure the public that it is worth it to allow the technology to invade their privacy .

input: grammar: In conclusion , although each uptick in protection will typically come at the cost of more intrusion into the privacy of ordinary people , surveillance technology has come up with the best possible inventions to assure that this trade-off will be worth it .
target: In conclusion , although each uptick in protection will typically come at the cost of more intrusion into the privacy of ordinary people , the development of surveillance technology has come up with the best possible inventions to assure that this trade-off will be worth it .

input: grammar: Rather than not doing anything to deal with the problems we have , the implementation of such technologies should be allowed for the benefits of majority .
target: Rather than not doing anything to deal with the problems we have , the implementation of such technologies should be allowed for the benefit of the majority .

input: grammar: Surveillance technology such as RFID ( radio-frequency identification ) should not be used to track people
target: Surveillance technology such as RFID ( radio-frequency identification ) should not be used to track people

target: There are a number of technologies by which the location of all kinds of material can be tracked .

target: Some advance surveillance technology like GPS and RFID can even track people 's location and health status by using a tiny tag and a reader .

input: grammar: However , disputation rises as the issue comes to tracking of human being .
target: However , disputes arise when the issue comes to tracking of human beings .

input: grammar: In my opinion , these surveillance technologies should not be used to track people .
target: In my opinion , these surveillance technologies should not be used to track people .

input: grammar: First and foremost , privacy comes into our mind when we mention of being tracked all the time .
target: First and foremost , privacy comes into our mind when we mention being tracked all the time .

input: grammar: No one would like to have a pair of eyes watching him anytime or anywhere , leaving him an uncomfortable feeling .
target: No one would like to have a pair of eyes watching them anytime or anywhere , leaving them an uncomfortable feeling .

input: grammar: The Universal Declaration of Human Rights ( UDHR ) has clearly stated out that all human beings are born free and equal in dignity and rights .
target: The Universal Declaration of Human Rights ( UDHR ) has clearly stated that all human beings are born free and are equal in dignity and rights .

input: grammar: Everyone should have their own rights to move freely without being monitored .
target: Everyone should have their own right to move about freely without being monitored .

input: grammar: Secondly , the importance or urge to use surveillance technology to track people is subtle .
target: Secondly , the importance of using surveillance technology to track people is doubtful .

input: grammar: Some may argue that these technologies can keep people from danger by tracking their health status especially in some working places with high radioactive level , track someone 's location in case he 's kidnapped .
target: Some may argue that these technologies can keep people from danger by tracking their health status especially in some working places with high radioactive levels , or in tracking someone 's location in case he 's kidnapped .

input: grammar: Workers can still have medical check regularly to ensure they are healthy as health problems would n't come in a sudden , it must accumulate over time .
target: However , workers can still have medical checks regularly to ensure they are healthy as health problems would n't come all of a sudden ; they usually accumulate over time .

input: grammar: Furthermore for parents fearing of the chance of their children being kidnapped , it 's unfortunate that through electromagnetic isolation , they wo n't be able to track their children also .
target: Furthermore , for parents fearing the chance of their children being kidnapped , it 's unfortunate that through electromagnetic isolation , they would not be able to track their children even if their children were RFID tagged .

input: grammar: Moreover , the children may get hurt if the kidnappers decide to remove the tag or chip implanted under the children 's skin .
target: Moreover , these children may get hurt if the kidnappers decide to remove the tag or chip implanted under the children 's skin .

input: grammar: Besides that , the confidentiality of such data transmitted between a tag or chip and device is questionable .
target: Besides that , the confidentiality of such data transmitted between a tag or chip and device is questionable .

input: grammar: Someone who has the device and the way to encrypt the code can actually have access to these data .
target: Someone who has the device and knows the way to encrypt the code can actually have access to the data .

input: grammar: It 's a horrible scene if someone is tracked by a person who does n't have the authority .
target: It would be a dangerous situation if someone is tracked by a person who does n't have the authority to do so .

input: grammar: Even though high security level can be developed , there will always be loopholes .
target: Even though a high security level can be developed , there will always be loopholes .

input: grammar: The best way to prevent the leakage of personal data is not to use it .
target: Thus , the best way to prevent the leakage of personal data is not to use it .

input: grammar: Last but not least , a report released by The { American Medical Association } [ HYPERLINK : http : //www.ama-assn.org/ ] ( AMA ) indicated that RFID devices may present physical risks to the patient .
target: Last but not least , a report released by The American Medical Association [ HYPERLINK : http : //www.ama-assn.org/ ] ( AMA ) indicated that RFID devices may present physical risks to patients .

input: grammar: Though they are removable , their small size allows them to migrate under the skin , making them potentially difficult to extract .
target: Though they are removable , their small size allows them to migrate under the skin , making them potentially difficult to extract .

input: grammar: The report went on to add this warning : " RFID tags may cause electromagnetic interference , which may interfere with electrosurgical devices and defibrillators .
target: The report went on to add this warning : " RFID tags may cause electromagnetic interference , which may interfere with electrosurgical devices and defibrillators .

input: grammar: Finally , it has not been determined whether RFID tags might affect the efficacy of pharmaceuticals .
target: Finally , it has not been determined whether RFID tags might affect the efficacy of pharmaceuticals .

input: grammar: Over the years as technology advances , the improvement in surveillance technology such as Radio-frequency identification ( RFID ) and surveillance cameras has brought about the increase in usage of such technology .
target: Over the years as technology advances , the improvement in surveillance technology such as Radio-frequency identification ( RFID ) and surveillance cameras has brought about the increase in usage of such technology .

input: grammar: Surveillance technology refers to the technology developed for observers to keep track of activities done by the observed .
target: Surveillance technology refers to the technology developed for observers to keep track of activities done by the observed .

input: grammar: Such technology is widely used on human beings in the 21st century for social , political or economical purposes .
target: Such technology is widely used on human beings in the 21st century for social , political or economical purposes .

input: grammar: Despite the long-running controversy over whether such technology should be used to track people due to human rights issues , it is evident that the advantages outweigh the negative impacts .
target: Despite the long-running controversy over whether such technology should be used to track people due to human rights issues , it is evident that the advantages outweigh the negative impacts .

input: grammar: Therefore , I do not agree that surveillance technology should not be used to track people .
target: Therefore , I do not agree that surveillance technology should not be used to track people .

input: grammar: Firstly , the use of surveillance technology such as RFID is useful in maintaining security in the country .
target: Firstly , the use of surveillance technology such as RFID is useful in maintaining security in the country .

input: grammar: The use of RFID at immigration borders and checkpoints enables a country to identify suspected terrorists and keep away unwelcomed immigrants who may post a threat to the welfare of the country and her people .
target: The use of RFID at immigration borders and checkpoints enables a country to identify suspected terrorists and keep away unwelcomed immigrants who may pose a threat to the welfare of the country and her people .

input: grammar: ( HYPERLINK " http : //www.dhs.gov " http : //www.dhs.gov ) This will in turn help to improve and safeguard safety in the country and indirectly help in the economical aspect .
target: ( ) This will in turn help to improve and safeguard safety in the country and indirectly help in the economical aspect .

input: grammar: Therefore , this form of tracking of people should not be avoided .
target: Therefore , this form of tracking of people should not be avoided .

input: grammar: Secondly , using surveillance technology to track patients helps to ensure their safety and thus should not be denied .
target: Secondly , using surveillance technology to track patients helps to ensure their safety and thus should not be denied .

input: grammar: The use of RFID-based wristbands helps to keep track of the locations of Alzheimer 's and pediatric patients to make sure that they do not wander off from the hospital or enter any unauthorized areas .
target: The use of RFID-based wristbands helps to keep track of the locations of Alzheimer and pediatric patients to make sure that they do not wander off from the hospital or enter any unauthorized areas .

input: grammar: { ( Awang , 2008 ) } [ HYPERLINK : http : //www.intanbk.intan.my/psimr/vol2.2/Article % 205 % 20- % 20Nor % 20Hazilawati.pdf ] It is essential for hospital to have such devices to track down patients to prevent the occurrence of unwanted incidents .
target: { ( Awang , 2008 ) } [ HYPERLINK : http : //www.intanbk.intan.my/psimr/vol2.2/Article % 205 % 20- % 20Nor % 20Hazilawati.pdf ] It is essential for hospitals to have such devices to track down patients to prevent the occurrence of unwanted incidents .

input: grammar: Furthermore , the use of battery-powered RFID tags can also help hospitals to track down locations of patients in times of disaster when the lives of patients are at threat .
target: Furthermore , the use of battery-powered RFID tags can also help hospitals to track down locations of patients in times of disaster when the lives of patients are at threat .

input: grammar: { ( Gould , 2009 ) } [ HYPERLINK : http : //www.psfk.com/2009/08/using-rfid-to-track-hospital-patients.html ] Such usage of surveillance technology to track people is necessary , and hence should not be denied of usage .
target: Such usage of surveillance technology to track people is necessary , and hence should not be denied of usage .

input: grammar: In addition , the use of surveillance technology such as surveillance cameras to track people is believed to aid in the reduction of crime rate in the country , which will be beneficial to the society .
target: In addition , the use of surveillance technology such as surveillance cameras to track people is believed to aid in the reduction of crime rate in the country , which will be beneficial to the society .

input: grammar: With the presence of surveillance cameras , potential criminals will thus think twice before they act .
target: With the presence of surveillance cameras , potential criminals will thus think twice before they act .

input: grammar: This may hence deter crimes from happening .
target: This may hence deter crimes from happening .

input: grammar: Even though it may not be an ideal and effective way to curb criminal offenses , it can on the other hand allow authorities to work more efficiently when an incident occur .
target: Even though it may not be an ideal and effective way to curb criminal offenses , it can on the other hand allow authorities to work more efficiently when an incident occurs .

input: grammar: { ( Shah Alam , 2007 ) } [ HYPERLINK : http : //malaysiacrimewatch.lokety.com/closed-circuit-television-cameras-to-fight-crime-in-selangor/ ] The use of surveillance technology to track people , under such circumstances , has once again proved to be useful and thus should not be stopped from using it .
target: The use of surveillance technology to track people , under such circumstances , has once again proved to be useful and thus should not be stopped from using it .

input: grammar: Despite the positive impacts of the usage of surveillance technology to track people , there are many arguments pertaining to how surveillance technology should not be used to track people .
target: Despite the positive impacts of the usage of surveillance technology to track people , there are many arguments pertaining to how surveillance technology should not be used to track people .

input: grammar: One of the main issues will be the concern of intrusion of human rights .
target: One of the main issues will be the concern of intrusion of human rights .

input: grammar: When companies first started introducing the implantation of RFID chips into the body of their employees , protests were raised by both related and unrelated parties because they felt that it is clearly a violation of the privacy of one .
target: When companies first started introducing the implantation of RFID chips into the body of their employees , protests were raised by both related and unrelated parties because they felt that it is clearly a violation of the privacy of one .

input: grammar: The workers claimed that it is a way of bereaving them from human rights when their motions are being watched around the clock .
target: The workers claimed that it is a way of bereaving them from human rights when their movements are being watched around the clock .

input: grammar: Christian critics even claimed that such acts will lead to apocalypse as stated in the bible .
target: Christian critics even claimed that such acts will lead to apocalypse as stated in the bible

input: grammar: ( Lewan , 2007 ) However , such arguments regarding religious issues and human rights are unpractical because there is no substantial evident to prove that implantation of microchips is going to lead to the end of the world , and the argument of violation of human rights is made weak with the definition of human rights being ambiguous .
target: ( Lewan , 2007 . However , such arguments regarding religious issues and human rights are unpractical because there is no substantial evidence to prove that implantation of microchips is going to lead to the end of the world , and the argument of violation of human rights is made weak with the definition of human rights being ambiguous .

input: grammar: Conversely , the purpose of implanting RFID chips into the employees is clear- to deny access of employees into restricted and highly confidential areas .
target: Conversely , the purpose of implanting RFID chips into the employees is clear- to deny access of employees into restricted and highly confidential areas .

input: grammar: The concern is that should interests of the company override the right of human beings .
target: The concern is whether interests of the company should override the right of human beings .

input: grammar: Therefore in this case , it is difficult to determine whether surveillance technology should or should not be used to track people .
target: Therefore in this case , it is difficult to determine whether surveillance technology should or should not be used to track people .

input: grammar: Furthermore , the use of surveillance technology may result in adverse psychological impacts on human beings .
target: Furthermore , the use of surveillance technology may result in adverse psychological impacts on human beings .

input: grammar: The open-street camera surveillance that has been used widely by many countries in current society is likely to result in an unhealthy psychological impact on the citizens of the country .
target: The open-street camera surveillance that has been used widely by many countries in the current society is likely to result in an unhealthy psychological impact on the citizens of the country .

input: grammar: Knowing that every movement of him is being watched over , one may feel stress and uneasy , and this will in turn affects his behavior .
target: Knowing that every movement is being watched over , one may feel stress and uneasy , and this will in turn affects his behavior .

target: { ( Butarelli , 2009 ) } [ HYPERLINK : http : //www.edps.europa.eu/EDPSWEB/webdav/shared/Documents/EDPS/Publications/Speeches/2009/09-06-19_Vienna_surveillance_EN.pdf ] Societal surveillance may also give rise to " mistrust between citizens and citizens and the state .

input: grammar: " { ( Chellew , 2009 ) } [ HYPERLINK : http : //basicsnewsletter.blogspot.com/2009/06/dangers-of-public-surveillance.html ] Due to this negative consequence in this case , surveillance technology should not be used to track people .
target: " { ( Chellew , 2009 ) } [ HYPERLINK : http : //basicsnewsletter.blogspot.com/2009/06/dangers-of-public-surveillance.html ] Due to this negative consequence in this case , surveillance technology should not be used to track people .

input: grammar: In conclusion , with the positive impacts outweighing the negative consequences of using surveillance technology to track people , I will not agree to the statement that such technology should not be used to track people .
target: In conclusion , with the positive impacts outweighing the negative consequences of using surveillance technology to track people , I will not agree to the statement that such technology should not be used to track people .

input: grammar: The use of surveillance technology such as RFID ( Radio frequency identification ) to track people should be banned .
target: The use of surveillance technology such as RFID ( Radio frequency identification ) to track people should be banned .

input: grammar: Technological advances in the recent century have led to many improved methods to trace people .
target: Technological advances in the recent century have led to many improved methods to trace people .

input: grammar: Surveillance technology is widely known to do observations from a certain distance by means of electronic devices .
target: Surveillance technology is widely known to do observations from a certain distance by means of electronic devices .

input: grammar: Technologies such as Radio-frequency identification ( RFID ) are used for the sole purpose of tracking people as well as products using radio waves ( Syed & Mohammad , 2008 ) .
target: Technologies such as Radio-frequency identification ( RFID ) are used for the sole purpose of tracking people as well as products using radio waves ( Syed & Mohammad , 2008 ) .

input: grammar: Most people might think that this new form of technology will be very beneficial to mankind as it ensures easy identification .
target: Most people might think that this new form of technology will be very beneficial to mankind as it ensures easy identification .

input: grammar: However , the increasing usage of surveillance technology to track people should be banned as it indirectly intrudes human privacy , leads to many security issues pertaining to the usage of RFID technology and questions the cost efficiency of RFID tags ( Syed & Mohammad , 2008 ) .
target: However , the increasing usage of surveillance technology to track people should be banned as it indirectly intrudes human privacy , leads to many security issues pertaining to the usage of RFID technology and questions the cost efficiency of RFID tags ( Syed & Mohammad , 2008 ) .

input: grammar: RFID technology should be barred as this form of surveillance technology is still not considered totally safe for consumers .
target: RFID technology should be banned as this form of surveillance technology is still not considered totally safe for consumers .

input: grammar: One of the most serious threats is data theft .
target: One of the most serious threats is data theft .

input: grammar: As RFID tags are made to contain information , there is a very high probability of data theft by well hidden RFID scanners ( Syed & Mohammad , 2008 ) .
target: As RFID tags are made to contain information , there is a very high probability of data theft by well hidden RFID scanners ( Syed & Mohammad , 2008 ) .

input: grammar: Moreover , these RFID scanners are very cheap in comparison to a RFID tag .
target: Moreover , these RFID scanners are very cheap in comparison to a RFID tag .

input: grammar: This will eventually lead to the problem of data ownership and the information unique to an individual might be made known to other people ( Syed & Mohammad , 2008 ) .
target: This will eventually lead to the problem of data ownership and the information unique to an individual might be made known to other people ( Syed & Mohammad , 2008 ) .

input: grammar: Another issue is the possibility of data corruption .
target: Another issue is the possibility of data corruption .

input: grammar: As RFID tags are rewritable and if they are not security locked , there exists a potential for pranksters to change the data on the tags with false information ( Syed & Mohammad , 2008 ) .
target: As RFID tags are rewritable and are not securely locked , there exists a potential for pranksters to change the data on the tags with false information ( Syed & Mohammad , 2008 ) .

input: grammar: On the contrary , some people might think that using shielding techniques on RFID tags is already an effective protection mechanism against data theft and data corruption ( Syed & Mohammad , 2008 ) .
target: On the contrary , some people might think that using shielding techniques on RFID tags is already an effective protection mechanism against data theft and data corruption ( Syed & Mohammad , 2008 ) .

input: grammar: Although it is true that aluminium shielding can prevent hackers to steal one 's data to a certain extent , it also makes transmission more difficult and might not be completely effective in preventing it ( Syed & Mohammad , 2008 ) .
target: Although it is true that aluminium shielding can prevent hackers to steal one 's data to a certain extent , it also makes transmission more difficult and might not be completely effective in preventing it ( Syed & Mohammad , 2008 ) .

input: grammar: Further research needs to be done to make the shielding techniques safer for consumers .
target: Further research needs to be done to make the shielding techniques safer for consumers .

input: grammar: Therefore , RFID technology should be banned for the safety of consumers .
target: Therefore , RFID technology should be banned for the safety of consumers .

input: grammar: There is a need to prohibit RFID technology as it indirectly intrudes one 's life and privacy .
target: There is a need to prohibit RFID technology as it indirectly intrudes one 's life and privacy .

input: grammar: Nowadays , RFID scanners are highly portable and have a further effective reading range ( Syed & Mohammad , 2008 ) .
target: Nowadays , RFID scanners are highly portable and have a further effective reading range ( Syed & Mohammad , 2008 ) .

input: grammar: Furthermore , there is no need for the tags to be scanned to retrieve the information ( Syed & Mohammad , 2008 ) .
target: Furthermore , there is no need for the tags to be scanned to retrieve the information ( Syed & Mohammad , 2008 ) .

input: grammar: This implies that RFID tags can now be read without one 's knowledge .
target: This implies that RFID tags can now be read without one 's knowledge .

input: grammar: As such , human privacy is being violated .
target: As such , human privacy is being violated .

input: grammar: This situation regarding violating human privacy worsened after the Food and Drug Administration in the United States approved the human implants of RFID chips ( Aly , 2007 , Governor Schwarzenegger Signs SB 362 into Law , para .
target: This situation regarding violating human privacy worsened after the Food and Drug Administration in the United States approved the human implants of RFID chips ( Aly , 2007 , Governor Schwarzenegger Signs SB 362 into Law , para .

input: grammar: 3 ) .
grammar: Many concerns have been raised regarding the privacy of people as they can now be easily tracked wherever they are due to the RFID technology implanted in them ( Syed & Mohammad , 2008 ) .
target: Many concerns have been raised regarding the privacy of people as they can now be easily tracked wherever they are due to the RFID technology implanted in them ( Syed & Mohammad , 2008 ) .

input: grammar: On the other hand , some people may argue that RFID technology is a form of crime prevention .
target: On the other hand , some people may argue that RFID technology is a form of crime prevention .

input: grammar: It makes the search for missing people much easier and this helps to deter criminals from committing crimes like kidnapping .
target: It makes the search for missing people much easier and this helps to deter criminals from committing crimes like kidnapping .

input: grammar: However , a stop check will expose this sham reality .
target: However , a stop check will expose this sham reality .

input: grammar: A criminal in a real scenario would not hesitate to capture his prey just because the target has a RFID chip inside him .
target: A criminal in a real scenario would not hesitate to capture his prey just because the target has a RFID chip inside him .

input: grammar: RFID chips can be easily removed and a kidnapper would not think twice to cut the RFID chip out of a child to take out the implant .
target: RFID chips can be easily removed and a kidnapper would not think twice to cut the RFID chip out of a child to take out the implant .

input: grammar: This in turn makes the child more vulnerable to injuries due to the use of RFID technology .
target: This in turn makes the child more vulnerable to injuries due to the use of RFID technology .

input: grammar: Hence , RFID technology should not be made available to the general public as it endangers one 's life and privacy .
target: Hence , RFID technology should not be made available to the general public as it endangers one 's life and privacy .

input: grammar: RFID technology should also be excluded as surveillance technology to track people as it is rather costly ( Syed & Mohammad , 2008 ) .
target: RFID technology should also be excluded as surveillance technology to track people as it is rather costly ( Syed & Mohammad , 2008 ) .

input: grammar: Each RFID reader is worth at least a thousand dollar ( Syed & Mohammad , 2008 ) .
target: Each RFID reader is worth at least a thousand dollars ( Syed & Mohammad , 2008 ) .

input: grammar: Those companies which have decided to use RFID technology to keep track of its workers or products have to purchase thousands of RFID readers to cover all their workplaces and factories ( Syed & Mohammad , 2008 ) .
target: Those companies which have decided to use RFID technology to keep track of its workers or products have to purchase thousands of RFID readers to cover all their workplaces and factories ( Syed & Mohammad , 2008 ) .

input: grammar: In addition , each RFID tag is rather expensive hence it is not practical to be used in large quantity to identify both people and products ( Syed & Mohammad , 2008 ) .
target: In addition , each RFID tag is rather expensive hence it is not practical to be used in large quantities to identify both people and products ( Syed & Mohammad , 2008 ) .

input: grammar: Due to the impracticality of RFID technology , RFID technology should not be used to track people .
target: Due to its impracticality , RFID technology should not be used to track people .

input: grammar: Though the use of RFID technology has its merits such as crime prevention , it should still be barred because the use of surveillance technology such as RFID to track people not only infiltrate one 's privacy ; it is also not cost effective and likely to result in data theft and data loss .
target: Though the use of RFID technology has its merits such as crime prevention , it should still be barred because the use of surveillance technology such as RFID to track people not only infiltrate one 's privacy ; it is also not cost effective and likely to result in data theft and data loss .
