input: grammar: The use of RFID to track people
target: The use of RFID to track people

input: grammar: As a type of surveillance technology , Radio Frequency Identification ( RFID ) has been widely used in our lives .
target: As a type of surveillance technology , Radio Frequency Identification ( RFID ) has been widely used in our lives .

input: grammar: The use of RFID to track people is drawing increasing attention and has caused many conflicts .
target: The use of RFID to track people is drawing increasing attention and has caused many conflicts .

input: grammar: Advocators suggest that using RFID to conduct social control and suspects tracking can benefit the whole society .
target: Advocators suggest that using RFID to conduct social control and suspects tracking can benefit the whole society .

input: grammar: However , RFID is in fact not as ideal as they think .
target: However , RFID is in fact not as ideal as they think .

input: grammar: On the contrary , it raises serious problems on invasion of privacy and health issues .
target: On the contrary , it raises serious problems on invasion of privacy and health issues .

input: grammar: Hence , using RFID to track people should be banned .
target: Hence , using RFID to track people should be banned .

input: grammar: An important reason why the use of RFID to track people should be banned is because the abuse of RFID risks the invasion of privacy .
target: An important reason why the use of RFID to track people should be banned is because the abuse of RFID risks the invasion of privacy .

input: grammar: On one hand , some tracking are conducted without people 's awareness and permission .
target: On the one hand , some tracking are conducted without people 's awareness and permission .

input: grammar: For instance , in an Oklahoma Wal-Mart store , RFID tags were hidden in Procter & Gamble Lipfinity lipstick on shelves without declaration .
target: For instance , in an Oklahoma Wal-Mart store , RFID tags were hidden in Procter & Gamble Lipfinity lipstick on shelves without declaration .

input: grammar: When customers interacted with the lipsticks , they were not aware that they were being observed by the Procter & Gamble executives ( Albrecht and McIntyre 2004 ) .
target: When customers interacted with the lipsticks , they were not aware that they were being observed by the Procter & Gamble executives ( Albrecht and McIntyre 2004 ) .

input: grammar: Likewise , many companies use RFID tagged product to track consumers ' behaviors and collect information without their knowledge and consent , which seriously invades consumers ' privacy .
target: Likewise , many companies use RFID tagged product to track consumers ' behaviors and collect information without their knowledge and consent , which seriously invades consumers ' privacy .

input: grammar: On the other hand , although in some cases people are informed , they are still under the risk of losing privacy .
target: On the other hand , although in some cases people are informed , they are still under the risk of losing privacy .

input: grammar: It is because within a certain distance , anyone who has the reading device is able to read RFID tags .
target: It is because within a certain distance , anyone who has the reading device is able to read RFID tags .

input: grammar: Thus , besides the real tracking conductors , criminals can also take advantages of RFID to achieve their criminal intent .
target: Thus , besides the real tracking conductors , criminals can also take advantage of RFID to achieve their criminal intent .

input: grammar: A security expert Bruce Schneier said that " When RFID chips are embedded in your ID cards , your clothes , your possessions , you are effectively broadcasting who you are to anyone within range .
target: A security expert Bruce Schneier said that " When RFID chips are embedded in your ID cards , your clothes , your possessions , you are effectively broadcasting who you are to anyone within range .

input: grammar: The level of surveillance possible , not only by the government but by corporations and criminals as well , will be unprecedented .
target: The level of surveillance possible , not only by the government but by corporations and criminals as well , will be unprecedented .

input: grammar: There simply will be no place to hide " ( Sieberg D 2006 ) .
target: There simply will be no place to hide " ( Sieberg D 2006 ) .

input: grammar: In short , since the abuse of RFID to track people leads to the invasion of human privacy , its use should be banned .
target: In short , since the abuse of RFID to track people leads to the invasion of human privacy . Its use should be banned .

input: grammar: Another concern about using RFID to track people is the health problems .
target: Another concern about using RFID to track people is the health problems .

input: grammar: Research has shown that implantable RFID chips caused cancer in animal and they may also cause cancer in humans .
target: Research has shown that implantable RFID chips causes cancer in animals and they may also cause cancer in humans .

input: grammar: In addition , research also showed that the { inflammation } [ HYPERLINK : http : //www.naturalnews.com/inflammation.html ] caused by surgical implantation of a foreign object can increase the instance of tumor development ( Jean 2007 ) .
target: In addition , research also showed that the caused by surgical implantation of a foreign object can increase the instance of tumor development ( , 2007 ) .

input: grammar: Concerning these health issues , it is immoral to ask people implant RFID chips and meanwhile let them take the risk of having disease .
target: Concerning these health issues , it is immoral to ask people to RFID chips and meanwhile let them take the risk of having diseases .

input: grammar: Therefore , the use of RFID to track people should be banned .
target: Therefore , the use of RFID to track people should be banned .

input: grammar: Advocators may argue that RFID should not be banned because it can be used as an effective and efficient means to conduct social control .
target: Advocators may argue that RFID should not be banned because it can be used as an effective and efficient means to conduct social control .

input: grammar: For example , RFID equipped cards can help control the access to some restricted areas .
target: For example , RFID equipped cards can help control the access to some restricted areas .

input: grammar: However , the fact is that because the information in RFID equipped cards can be skimmed by hackers , it can not guarantee securities of society .
target: However , the fact is that because the information in RFID equipped cards can be skimmed by hackers , it can not guarantee security for the society

input: grammar: Experiment has shown that an RFID identification card can be skimmed and cloned by a hacker .
target: Experiment has shown that an RFID identification card can be skimmed and cloned by a hacker .

input: grammar: Furthermore , using the cloned card , the hacker was able to pass into the restricted area through the secure and locked entrance ( Jones 2008 ) .
target: Furthermore , by using the cloned card , the hacker was able to pass into the restricted area through the secure and locked entrance ( , 2008 ) .

input: grammar: Hence , using RFID equipped cards to track and control entrances is not secure nor effective at all .
target: Hence , using RFID equipped cards to track and control entrances is not secure nor effective at all .

input: grammar: To some extent , they even create opportunities for criminals to collect useful information and commit crimes .
target: To some extent , they even create opportunities for criminals to collect useful information and commit crimes .

input: grammar: In conclusion , using RFID to track people not only raises the possibilities of privacy invasion , but also causes health problems .
target: In conclusion , using RFID to track people not only raises the possibilities of privacy invasion , but also causes health problems .

input: grammar: Instead of benefitting from it , people bear many fear and risk of it .
target: Instead of benefitting from it , people become fearful .

input: grammar: Thus , although using RFID to conduct tracking may be helpful in some aspects , compared with the disadvantages of it , the use of RFID to track people should be banned .
target: Thus , although using RFID to conduct tracking may be helpful in some aspects , compared with the disadvantages of it , the use of RFID to track people should be banned .

input: grammar: The use of RFID to track people should not be banned
target: The use of RFID to track people should not be .

input: grammar: Nowadays there is a fierce debate over the use human implant Radio Frequency Identification ( RFID ) to track people .
target: Nowadays there is a fierce debate over the use human implant Radio Frequency Identification ( RFID ) to track people .

input: grammar: Some people say that the use of RFID invades people 's privacy ; others maintain that the use of RFID can bring us a lot of benefits .
target: Some people say that the use of RFID invades people 's privacy ; others maintain that the use of RFID can bring us a lot of benefits .

input: grammar: In my point of view , the use of RFID should not be banned with the following reasons .
target: In my point of view , the use of RFID should not be banned for the following reasons .

input: grammar: Firstly , it is undeniable that RFID is very useful in daily life .
target: Firstly , it is undeniable that RFID is very useful in our daily life .

input: grammar: RFID is more efficient and convenient in tracking early released criminals than other surveillance technology as it simplifies the locating process .
target: RFID is more efficient and convenient in tracking early released criminals than other surveillance technology as it simplifies the locating process .

input: grammar: In addition , with this technology , parents can easily find their lost children and doctors can easily find elderly people who suffer from degenerative brain conditions CITATION Dav06 \ l 2052 ( Wood , 2006 ) .
target: In addition , with this technology , parents can easily find their lost children and doctors can easily find elderly people who suffer from degenerative brain conditions ( Wood , 2006 ) .

input: grammar: Hence , it is not necessary to ban the use of RFID which can bring us so much convenience .
target: Hence , it is not necessary to ban the use of RFID which can bring us so much convenience .

input: grammar: Secondly , we can take actions to minimize the negative effects of RFID such as the invasion of personal privacy .
target: Secondly , we can take actions to minimize the negative effects of RFID such as the invasion of personal privacy .

input: grammar: Many people are afraid that personal information installed in the chip is vulnerable to be copied or changed by hackers .
target: Many people are afraid that personal information installed in the chip is vulnerable to be copied or changed by hackers .

input: grammar: This opinion stems from the general misunderstanding of the technology or the inaccurate hearsay .
target: This opinion stems from the general misunderstanding of the technology or inaccurate hearsay .

input: grammar: RFID chips are not served as personal information storages ; instead they are pointers which point to a highly secured back-end database in which the personal information resides .
target: RFID chips are not served as personal information storages ; instead they are pointers which point to a highly secured back-end database in which the personal information resides .

input: grammar: As mentioned before , the database is highly secured thus it is very difficult for hackers to attack .
target: As mentioned before , the database is highly . Thus it is very difficult for hackers to attack .

input: grammar: What is more , just like we have antivirus software to deal with computer virus , we will be able to prevent personal information from being hacked by coming up with corresponding approaches CITATION Ban07 \ l 2052 ( Banks , Hanny , Pachano , & Thompson , 2007 ) .
target: What is more , just like we have antivirus software to deal with computer virus , we will be able to prevent personal information from being hacked by coming up with corresponding approaches ( Banks , Hanny , Pachano , & Thompson , 2007 ) .

input: grammar: Another concern from some people is that with RFID , the government and some intelligent institutions will easily know where we are if we are implanted with RFID .
target: Another concern from some people is that with RFID , the government and some intelligent institutions will easily know where we are if we are implanted with RFID .

input: grammar: In my point of view , this worry can be handled by making corresponding laws to regulate the use of RFID .
target: In my point of view , this worry can be handled by making corresponding laws to regulate the use of RFID .

input: grammar: For example , people themselves will have the right to decide whether to use RFID or not , and in this way their privacy will not be invaded .
target: For example , people themselves will have the right to decide whether to use RFID or not , and in this way their privacy will not be invaded .

input: grammar: What is more , it is also not practical to get everybody implanted with RFID , since it will cost a lot .
target: What is more , it is also not practical to get everybody implanted with RFID , since it will cost a lot .

input: grammar: To sum up , RFID is a useful technology and like each technology , it has its pros and cons .
target: To sum up , RFID is a useful technology and like each technology , it has its pros and cons .

input: grammar: The question lies in the appropriate use of RFID .
target: The question lies in the appropriate use of RFID .

input: grammar: Since RFID has so many advantages that bring us efficiency and convenience , and the negative effects RFID might bring about such as invasion of privacy could be offset , the use of RFID should not be banned .
target: Since RFID has so many advantages that bring us efficiency and convenience , and the negative effects RFID might bring about such as invasion of privacy could be offset , the use of RFID should not be banned .

target: Memories of the terrorist attacks that happened around the world will always serve as a stark reminder to everyone that a lapse in security will result in heavy casualties .

target: One of the ways to prevent these from happening is to make use of surveillance technology such as surveillance camera and the RFID .

target: If a RFID tag had been used , the terrorist would not have been able to escape easily .

target: Besides that , having security cameras around would always serve as deterrence to potential criminals ( Quek , 2008 ) .

input: grammar: Thus , surveillance technology should be deployed to monitor people , especially the terrorists .
target: Thus , surveillance technology should be deployed to monitor people , especially the terrorists .

target: In Singapore , hospital bed shortages have been a perennial problem for the government .

input: grammar: The high occupancy rate would mean that more healthcare professionals are needed to look after the patients .
target: The high occupancy rate would mean that more healthcare professionals are needed to look after the patients .

target: In order to improve the overall efficiency of the medical team , Tan Tock Seng Hospital has rolled out RFID in 2007 to monitor more than 1,200 patients ( Friedlos , 2009 ) .

input: grammar: The benefits of RFID includes locating the patients easily for tests and administering of medicine , and a lower response time of the housekeeping department in clearing the bed once a patient is discharged , which will then reduce an individual 's waiting time for a bed ( Friedlos 2009 ) .
target: The benefits of RFID includes locating the patients easily for tests and administering of medicine , and a lower response time of the housekeeping department in clearing the bed once a patient is discharged , which will then reduce an individual 's waiting time for a bed ( Friedlos , 2009 ) .

input: grammar: This surveillance technology has allowed the healthcare professionals to perform their jobs efficiently and improve the well-being of the patients .
target: This surveillance technology has allowed the healthcare professionals to perform their jobs efficiently and improve the well-being of the patients .

input: grammar: However , as the population continues to age , elderly who are not seriously ill might have to be discharged and nursed their injuries or illnesses at home or in a nursing home ( Tan 2007 ) .
target: Moreover , as the population continues to age , elderly who are not seriously ill might have to be discharged to nurse their injuries or illnesses at home or in a nursing home ( Tan , 2007 ) .

input: grammar: In order not to compromise their health , RFID should be utilized to monitor them ( Broache 2007 ) .
target: In order not to compromise their health , RFID should be utilized to monitor them ( Broache , 2007 ) .

input: grammar: This will not only ensure that they are being looked after by a dedicated healthcare team but it will also alleviate the problem of bed shortages .
target: This will not only ensure that they are being looked after by a dedicated healthcare team but it will also alleviate the problem of bed shortages .

input: grammar: Hence , the usage of surveillance technology to track people should not be prohibited .
target: Hence , the use of surveillance technology to track people should not be prohibited .

target: Critics have long been condemning the use of surveillance technology on humans .

input: grammar: Since the explosion of technology during the last few decades , there has been a new method to track people , which is surveillance technology .
target: Since the explosion of technology during the last few decades , there has been a new method to track people , which is surveillance technology .

input: grammar: However , whether using of this technology to track people is acceptable or not has always been a big concern .
target: However , whether using of this technology to track people is acceptable or not has always been a big concern .

input: grammar: People who think that surveillance technology should not be used to track people claim that it invade the privacy right of people .
target: People who think that surveillance technology should not be used to track people claim that it invades the privacy right of people .

input: grammar: However , surveillance technology , if is used appropriately , can benefit our life so much that it should not be banned .
target: However , surveillance technology , if used appropriately , can benefit our life so much that it should not be banned .

input: grammar: Firstly , one undeniable advantage of surveillance technology is it might help us to protect people and their belongings .
target: Firstly , one undeniable advantage of surveillance technology is it might help us to protect people and their belongings .

input: grammar: Simple systems such as cameras or voice recording can be used to observe shopping malls , buildings and other public places .
target: Simple systems such as cameras or voice recording can be used to observe shopping malls , buildings and other public places .

input: grammar: It might help to maintain the security of those places as well as find out if there is any robber or thief , thus may reduce the crime rate ( The Economist print edition , 2008 ) .
target: It might help to maintain the security of those places as well as find out if there is any robber or thief , thus reducing the crime rate ( The Economist print edition , 2008 ) .

input: grammar: Cameras are usually used in high security or restricted access workplaces to protect these places .
target: Cameras are usually used in high security or restricted access workplaces to protect these places .

input: grammar: Moreover , police can also use surveillance technology to track potential criminals , for instance , to supervise a person who was imprisoned in the past for a short time to ensure that he wo n't commit a crime again .
target: Moreover , police can also use surveillance technology to track potential criminals , for instance , to supervise a person who was imprisoned in the past for a short time to ensure that he will not commit a crime again .

input: grammar: Surveillance technology helps us much in follow dangerous criminals such as gangsters , mafia chief .
target: Surveillance technology helps us much in following dangerous criminals such as gangsters or a mafia chief .

input: grammar: Although people who oppose the use of this technology may claim that it would be years before they can pick a terrorist out of a crowd ( Yang , 2005 ) , some intelligent system now can learn the context in which behavior is probably threatening ( The Economist print edition , 2008 ) .
target: Although people who oppose the use of this technology may claim that it would be years before they can pick a terrorist out in a crowd ( Yang , 2005 ) , some intelligent system can now learn the context in which behavior is probably threatening ( The Economist print edition , 2008 ) .

input: grammar: Hence , we may easily filter the suspects and more concentrate on their acts to know if they are really criminals .

target: It is a tool which is not only used to monitor a person or a group 's behavior , but it also has the ability to track the locations of people and identify them .

input: grammar: Some may express their concern on the use of surveillance technology regarding privacy and security issues and should therefore be banned .
target: Some may express their concern on the use of surveillance technology regarding privacy and security issues and argue that it should therefore be banned .

target: However , it would be too extreme to impose such a ban .

input: grammar: As by doing so , we are throwing the baby out of the water bath .
target: As by doing so , we are throwing the baby out with the bath water .

target: The use of this technology should not be totally banned but more regulations should be imposed and more should be invested in enhancing the security of this technology .

input: grammar: This is because surveillance technology will help in crime prevention , improve medical healthcare and also identify a person via biometrics .
target: This is because surveillance technology will help in crime prevention , improve medical healthcare and also identify a person via biometrics .

target: With the help of surveillance technology , crime rate can be reduced and prevented .

target: For instance , the installment of Closed-Circuit Television ( CCTV ) in the multi-storey parking lots of a building will enable the security guards to monitor the situation and to pick out suspicious behavior .

input: grammar: Hence , the officers on duty can take immediate action to prevent a crime from happening .
target: Hence , the officers on duty can take immediate action to prevent a crime from happening .

input: grammar: Detractors from my point of view will argue that too much money has been pumped in to the installation of CCTV and doubt the effectiveness of it ( Privacy International , 1997 ) .
target: Detractors from my point of view will argue that too much money has been pumped in to the installation of CCTV and doubt the effectiveness of it ( Privacy International , 1997 ) .

input: grammar: However , in a recent study conducted in Hartlepool , United Kingdom , it was shown that crime rate has reduced by 26 % from 2004-2007 after installing CCTV at certain areas ( SaferHartlepool , 2009 ) .
target: However , in a recent study conducted in Hartlepool , United Kingdom , it was shown that crime rate was reduced by 26 % from 2004-2007 after installing CCTV at certain areas ( SaferHartlepool , 2009 ) .

input: grammar: Thus , surveillance technology can enhance security and therefore should not be banned .
target: Thus , surveillance technology can enhance security and therefore should not be banned .

target: Another reason this technology should not be banned is the improvement it will bring about in the healthcare sector .

target: For instance , it can be used to monitor and locate patients in the hospital .

target: The movement of patients can be tracked and signal will be sent out in an emergency ( Kanellos , 2004 ) .

input: grammar: Thus , prompt action can be taken to prevent undesirable events from happening .
target: Thus , prompt action can be taken to prevent undesirable events from happening .

target: Some may argue that implanting RFID chips may cause physical side effects .

input: grammar: However , according to Applied Digital , a leading provider of identification and security technology , an estimated 1000 chips had been implanted in humans with no harmful physical side effects ( Kanellos , 2004 ) .
target: However , according to Applied Digital , a leading provider of identification and security technology , an estimated 1000 chips had been implanted in humans with no harmful physical side effects ( Kanellos , 2004 ) .

input: grammar: Thus , the use of RFID can benefit us in the healthcare sector by bringing about assurance in knowing that patients are well tracked and monitored .
target: Thus , the use of RFID can benefit us in the healthcare sector by bringing about assurance in knowing that patients are well tracked and monitored .

target: Biometrics is used to identify a person based on his physical or behavioral traits .

target: This can be done by analyzing finger prints , recognizing facial features and scanning of the iris .

target: Hence , biometrics which is part of surveillance technology can be used for authentication purposes ( Smith , 2009 ) as for instance , the biometric passport which can be used to prevent identity theft and also to conduct automatic immigration clearances .

input: grammar: This will improve the efficiency of custom clearing process , thus saving time for travelers and improving the overall image of the country .
target: This will improve the efficiency of custom clearing process , thus saving time for travelers and improving the overall image of the country .

input: grammar: Surveillance technology can be a form of deterrence for potential criminals , or as a form of evidence when a crime is committed .
target: Surveillance technology can be a form of deterrence for potential criminals , or as a form of evidence when a crime is committed .

input: grammar: Drivers will be more conscious of their speed limits when speed cameras are around ; shoplifters will think twice before committing when there are various security cameras in the shopping mall .
target: Drivers will be more conscious of their speed limits when speed cameras are around ; shoplifters will think twice before committing a theft when there are various security cameras in the shopping mall .

input: grammar: This has always been the primary means of crime deterrence to maintain a safe and secure society .
target: This has always been the primary means of crime deterrence to maintain a safe and secure society .

input: grammar: When deterrence failed , surveillance cameras would have captured the crime process , thus providing undeniable evidence that could be used to identify and convict the offender ( Long , 2008 ) .
target: When deterrence failed , surveillance cameras would have captured the crime process , thus providing undeniable evidence that could be used to identify and convict the offender ( Long , 2008 ) .

input: grammar: Thus , surveillance technology should be used to track people as it is not only a way to deter crimes , but also to ensure justice .
target: Thus , surveillance technology should be used to track people as it is not only a way to deter crimes , but also to ensure justice .

input: grammar: Some might argue that using surveillance cameras to record evidence is already in itself proving that the " presence of cameras had absolutely zero deterrence value " ( Long , 2008 ) as the criminal still commits the crime even with the knowledge of being watched .
target: Some might argue that using surveillance cameras to record evidence is already in itself proving that the " presence of cameras had absolutely zero deterrence value " ( Long , 2008 ) as the criminal still commits the crime even with the knowledge of being watched .

input: grammar: However , we have to understand that there is no certainty in deterrence .
target: However , we have to understand that there is no certainty in deterrence .

input: grammar: In fact , crime rates would probably be a lot higher if there are totally no surveillance cameras around .
target: In fact , crime rates would probably be much higher if there are totally no surveillance cameras around .

input: grammar: There are others who feel that there is an invasion of privacy when there is unquestioned tracking of people .
target: There are others who feel that there is an invasion of privacy when there is unquestioned tracking of people .

input: grammar: Individuals seem to have lost the right to decide whether they want to be monitored .
target: Individuals seem to have lost the right to decide whether they want to be monitored .

input: grammar: Phone calls could be tapped ; and even along the common streets of orchard road , there are surveillance cameras lurking around .
target: Phone calls could be tapped ; and even along the common streets of Orchard Road , there are surveillance cameras lurking around .

input: grammar: There seems be a loss of personal space for individuals .
target: There seems be a loss of personal space for individuals .

input: grammar: Furthermore , identity theft has been proven to occur easily for RFID technology ( Expanding RFID Use Raises Privacy Concerns , 2009 ) where the signals can be read at a distance away from the subject , without proper consent .
target: Furthermore , identity theft has been proven to occur easily for RFID technology ( Expanding RFID Use Raises Privacy Concerns , 2009 ) where the signals can be read at a distance away from the subject , without proper consent .

input: grammar: Even with further encryption security , this has been proven to be easily overcome .
target: Even with further encryption , security has been proven to be easily overcome .

input: grammar: Thus , sensitive information of individuals could be lost unknowingly , and the idea of 'personal space ' is slowly becoming obscure .
target: Thus , sensitive information of individuals could be lost unknowingly , and the idea of 'personal space ' is slowly becoming obscure .

input: grammar: There are benefits that surveillance technologies could bring us .
target: There are benefits that surveillance technologies could bring us .

input: grammar: In fact , it probably plays quite an integral part in our society .
target: In fact , it probably plays quite an integral part in our society .

input: grammar: This is shown by how common it is within an individual 's everyday life .
target: This is shown by how common it is within an individual 's everyday life .

input: grammar: In the process , there seems to be a loss of personal privacy .
target: In the process , there seems to be a loss of personal privacy .

input: grammar: However , the benefits of using surveillance technology outweigh the limitations as they could be improved with advancement in technology in the future .
target: However , the benefits of using surveillance technology outweigh the limitations as they could be improved with advancement in technology in the future .

input: grammar: Hence , the use of surveillance technology to track people should be continued .
target: Hence , the use of surveillance technology to track people should be continued .

input: grammar: Surveillance technologies have become increasing popular in recent years .
target: Surveillance technologies have become increasing popular in recent years .

input: grammar: Types of surveillance technologies include Cameras ( CCTV ) , Face- Recognition , Biometrics , RFID ( radio-frequency identification ) and even Cookies in web browsers ( Jeffrey A 2009 ) .
target: Types of surveillance technologies include Cameras ( CCTV ) , Face- Recognition , Biometrics , RFID ( radio-frequency identification ) and even Cookies in web browsers ( Jeffrey A , 2009 ) .

input: grammar: There is no denying that surveillance technologies that are extremely useful with wide ranges of uses from monitoring traffic to the detection and prevention of crime ( Jeffrey A 2009 ) .
target: There is no denying that surveillance technologies that are extremely useful with wide ranges of uses from monitoring traffic to the detection and prevention of crime ( Jeffrey A , 2009 ) .

input: grammar: However , the use of surveillance technologies to track people without prior consent will deny the person of privacy which he or she is entitled to .
target: However , the use of surveillance technologies to track people without prior consent will deny the person of privacy which he or she is entitled to .

input: grammar: Therefore surveillance technology should not be used to track people useless with prior permission .
target: Therefore surveillance technology should not be used to track people except with prior permission .

input: grammar: Examples on how tracking people can compromise privacy can be drawn from the surveillance technology , RFID .
target: Examples on how tracking people can compromise privacy can be drawn from the surveillance technology , RFID .

input: grammar: One of the most common uses of RFID is for inventory management .
target: One of the most common uses of RFID is for inventory management .

input: grammar: Positive uses of RFID in inventory management include tracking items with toxic substances , tracking manufactured products through the supply chain and tracking pharmaceuticals to point of sale to ensure proper handling through the supply chain ( Alan RP 2005 ) .
target: Positive uses of RFID in inventory management include tracking items with toxic substances , tracking manufactured products through the supply chain and tracking pharmaceuticals to point of sale to ensure proper handling through the supply chain ( Alan RP , 2005 ) .

input: grammar: However , the main concern is when the product reaches the consumer .
target: However , the main concern is when the product reaches the consumer .

input: grammar: There are three possible situations where privacy could be compromised , which are the pre-sale stage , during the sales transaction and post-sale stage .
target: There are three possible situations where privacy could be compromised , which are the pre-sale stage , during the sales transaction and post-sale stage .

input: grammar: In the pre-sale stage , when a RFID tagged item is examined by a customer , the store can monitor customers ' actions .
target: In the pre-sale stage , when a RFID tagged item is examined by a customer , the store can monitor customers ' actions .

input: grammar: Profiling and monitoring can then be used to track individuals and their choice of products ( Alan RP 2005 ) .
target: Profiling and monitoring can then be used to track individuals and their choice of products ( Alan RP , 2005 ) .

input: grammar: Although this may just be the store trying to use of RFID systems to try to increase sales , it violates the personal privacy of the customer ( Alan RP 2005 ) .
target: Although this may just be the store trying to use of RFID systems to try to increase sales , it violates the personal privacy of the customer ( Alan RP , 2005 ) .

input: grammar: One example would be the company Prada , which uses RFID systems in dressing rooms to suggest accessories ( Alan RP 2005 ) .
target: One example would be the company Prada , which uses RFID systems in dressing rooms to suggest accessories ( Alan RP , 2005 ) .

input: grammar: When the sales transaction takes place , the store can permanently store all personal information about the customer , including credit cards and telephone numbers and associate it with the specific item ( Alan RP 2005 ) .
target: When the sales transaction takes place , the store can permanently store all personal information about the customer , including credit cards and telephone numbers and associate it with the specific item ( Alan RP , 2005 ) .

input: grammar: These information could then be used for many purposes like marketing activities and personal profiling based on past purchases ( Alan RP 2005 ) .
target: This information could then be used for many purposes like marketing activities and personal profiling based on past purchases ( Alan RP , 2005 ) .

input: grammar: Post-sales monitoring using RFID also poses a threat to privacy .
target: Post-sales monitoring using RFID also poses a threat to privacy .

input: grammar: The RFID tags used remains attached on items even after they are purchased , which could subsequently be read when they encounter an RFID transceiver anywhere ( Alan RP 2005 ) .
target: The RFID tags used remain attached on items even after they are purchased , which could subsequently be read when they encounter an RFID transceiver anywhere ( Alan RP , 2005 ) .

input: grammar: With the information , it is possible to identify the person as well as personal information such as shopping records and credit history ( Alan RP 2005 ) .
target: With the information , it is possible to identify the person as well as personal information such as shopping records and credit history ( Alan RP , 2005 ) .

input: grammar: Invasive custom marketing activities could be developed through reading of tagged items and in the worst case scenario , individual movements could be tracked by just being in possession of the items ( Alan RP 2005 ) .
target: Invasive custom marketing activities could be developed through reading of tagged items and in the worst case scenario , individual movements could be tracked by just being in possession of the items ( Alan RP , 2005 ) .

input: grammar: However , it does not mean that the use of RFID for tracking people will compromise privacy .
target: However , it does not mean that the use of RFID for tracking people will compromise privacy .

input: grammar: There is currently a program called NEXUS which allows U.S. and Canadian citizens to register their fingerprints , photo , and other personal data and , if approved , receive a card with an RFID tag ( Alan RP 2005 ) .
target: There is currently a program called NEXUS which allows U.S. and Canadian citizens to register their fingerprints , photo , and other personal data and , if approved , receive a card with an RFID tag ( Alan RP , 2005 ) .

input: grammar: When individuals wish to travel between the U.S. and Canada , the RFID tag allows them to be cleared though inspection in less than five seconds ( Alan RP 2005 ) .
target: When individuals wish to travel between the U.S. and Canada , the RFID tag allows them to be cleared though inspection in less than five seconds ( Alan RP , 2005 ) .

input: grammar: Not only is it convenience , because the individual already gave prior permission , it is not consider to be a breach of privacy .
target: Not only is it convenient , because the individual already gave prior permission , but it is also not considered to be a breach of privacy .

input: grammar: In conclusion , as useful as surveillance technologies such as RFID may be , unless prior permission is given by the individual , they should not be used to track people as it is considered a breach of privacy .
target: In conclusion , as useful as surveillance technologies such as RFID may be , unless prior permission is given by the individual , they should not be used to track people as it is considered a breach of privacy .

input: grammar: With the development of science and technology , human beings are capable of tracking products , animals or even other people by using RFID ( Radio-frequency identification ) .
target: With the development of science and technology , human beings are capable of tracking products , animals or even other people by using RFID ( Radio-frequency identification ) .

input: grammar: This has sparked a heated controversy ( RFID-everything on RIFD , 2005 ) whether the surveillance , especially RFID , should be banned or not .
target: This has sparked a heated controversy ( RFID-everything on RIFD , 2005 ) whether the surveillance , especially RFID , should be banned or not .

input: grammar: Although many people argue that RFID violates human rights and may raise the illegal tracking of RFID tags ( RFID-everything on RIFD , 2005 ) , its advantages still outweigh disadvantages overwhelmingly , as RFID can not only protect human beings ' possessions and security , but also enhance the efficiency of business ' operation period .
target: Although many people argue that RFID violates human rights and may raise the illegal tracking of RFID tags ( RFID-everything on RIFD , 2005 ) , its advantages still outweigh disadvantages overwhelmingly , as RFID can not only protect human beings ' possessions and security , but also enhance the efficiency of business ' operation period .

input: grammar: Therefore , surveillance technology should not be banned in our community .
target: Therefore , surveillance technology should not be banned in our community .

input: grammar: There are three main aspects that RFID will benefit human beings .
target: There are three main aspects in which RFID will benefit human beings .

input: grammar: Firstly , it will contribute to ensuring the security of society , like " airport security , airline security and cruise ship security " ( Greene , 2004 ) .
target: Firstly , it will contribute to ensuring the security of society , like " airport security , airline security and cruise ship security " ( Greene , 2004 ) .

input: grammar: It is because RFID is able to efficiently detect terrorists and criminals who hide drugs in their bodies , all objects made by mental , all explosive devices and so on .
target: It is because RFID is able to efficiently detect terrorists and criminals who hide drugs in their bodies , all objects made of metal , all explosive devices and so on .

input: grammar: In this way , public 's benefits are protected as much as possible .
target: In this way , the public 's benefits are protected as much as possible .

input: grammar: Besides , in school , RFID can assist officers in checking people who enter and leave school so that they are capable of taking students ' attendance and ensuring no unauthorized people come in simultaneously .
target: Besides , in school , RFID can assist officers in checking people who enter and leave school so that they are capable of taking students ' attendance and ensuring no unauthorized people come in simultaneously .

input: grammar: Hence , RFID makes great contribution to our society .
target: Hence , RFID makes great contribution to our society .

input: grammar: The second advantage of RFID is that it may save operation costs and gain more profits for companies .
target: The second advantage of RFID is that it may save operation costs and gain more profits for companies .

input: grammar: For example , analysts from Sanford C. Bernstein ( Radio Frequency Identification Technology , n.d. ) say that the world 's biggest retailer , Wal-Mart , saves as much as 8.35 billion dollars per year by applying RFID in its physical counts of inventory .
target: For example , analysts from Sanford C. Bernstein ( Radio Frequency Identification Technology , n.d. ) say that the world 's biggest retailer , Wal-Mart , saves as much as 8.35 billion dollars per year by applying RFID in its physical counts of inventory .

input: grammar: It is because RFID helps to reduce Wal-Mart 's operation period overwhelmingly .
target: It is because RFID helps to reduce Wal-Mart 's operation period overwhelmingly .

input: grammar: It takes only five minutes to finish the job which human beings need more than one day to do .
target: It takes only five minutes to finish the job which human beings need more than one day to do .

input: grammar: Therefore , RFID is a good assistant for companies , as well as our society .
target: Therefore , RFID is a good assistant for companies , as well as our society .

input: grammar: However , those who disagree with the use of RFID express their concerns about the illicit tracking of RFID tags ( Radio-Frequency Identification , 2008 ) .
target: However , those who disagree with the use of RFID express their concerns about the illicit tracking of RFID tags ( Radio-Frequency Identification , 2008 ) .

input: grammar: Admittedly , such actions may result in the abuse of tracking people and products by some hackers or criminals for bad purposes .
target: Admittedly , such actions may result in the abuse of tracking people and products by some hackers or criminals for bad purposes .

input: grammar: Nevertheless , the advantages of surveillance technology still outweigh its side effects .
target: Nevertheless , the advantages of surveillance technology still outweigh its side effects .

input: grammar: For instance , it can help police to find missing people and pets ; to trace phone calls and locate the places of potential criminals ; and to secure the safety of each country by applying it for the passports and airports in order to prevent stowaways and criminals from both coming in and going out ( Radio-Frequency Identification , 2008 ) .
target: For instance , it can help police to find missing people and pets ; to trace phone calls and locate the places of potential criminals ; and to secure the safety of each country by applying it for the passports and airports in order to prevent stowaways and criminals from both coming in and going out ( Radio-Frequency Identification , 2008 ) .

input: grammar: Moreover , if government enhances the degree of secrecy of the surveillance technology , these people with evil thoughts may have a hard time to approach it .
target: Moreover , if the government enhances the degree of secrecy of the surveillance technology , these people with evil thoughts may have a hard time to approach it .

input: grammar: As a result , the abuse of surveillance technology may not be a big issue .
target: As a result , the abuse of surveillance technology may not be a big issue .

input: grammar: In conclusion , the surveillance technology , RFID , should not be banned as it is able to benefit our society significantly , not only on the economics aspect , but also the human beings ' security .
target: In conclusion , the surveillance technology , RFID , should not be banned as it is able to benefit our society significantly , not only on the economic aspect , but also the human beings ' security .

input: grammar: Therefore , surveillance , such as RFID , should be used in people 's daily life .
target: Therefore , surveillance , such as RFID , should be used in people 's daily life .

input: grammar: RFID is an advanced technology using electrical objects implanting on products , animals , and even human for the purpose of surveillance through radio waves .
target: RFID is an advanced technology using electrical objects implanting on products , animals , and even human for the purpose of surveillance through radio waves .

input: grammar: It has been applied widely to many areas : passport , transport payments , animal surveillance , product tracking in companies , and even human tracking .
target: It has been applied widely to many areas : passport , transport payments , animal surveillance , product tracking in companies , and even human tracking .

input: grammar: However , the aspects of human are always controversial topics for many years .
target: However , the aspects of human surveillance are always controversial topics for many years .

input: grammar: People argue that the use of RFID for tracking people should be banned , and in my perspective , I totally agree with that statement .
target: People argue that the use of RFID for tracking people should be banned , and in my perspective , I totally agree with that statement .

input: grammar: The first obvious reason for banning the use of RFID to track people is the privacy .
target: The first obvious reason for banning the use of RFID to track people is the privacy .

input: grammar: Since human is different from animals , as well as unemotional objects , they have some basic human rights .
target: Since human is different from animals , as well as unemotional objects , they have some basic human rights .

input: grammar: The most important right is the right for keeping some privacy .
target: The most important right is the right for keeping some privacy .

input: grammar: The use of RFID is effective for animal tracking , but it " seems to cross a line when technology that 's used for inventory management or keeping track of pets is then placed in human beings " ( Sieberg,2006 ) .
target: The use of RFID is effective for animal tracking , but it " seems to cross a line when technology that 's used for inventory management or keeping track of pets is then placed in human beings " ( Sieberg,2006 ) .

input: grammar: When using RFID for surveillance for finding crime , for instance , the official authorities you have to look at lots of sensitive and even intimate information .
target: When using RFID for surveillance for finding criminals , for instance , the official authorities will have to look at much sensitive and even intimate information .

input: grammar: The individual , aware or not aware of this using , will have his serious loss of privacy .
target: The individual , aware or not aware of this use , will have his serious loss of privacy .

input: grammar: The second reason is the degree of security of using RFID for tracking people .
target: The second reason is the degree of security of using RFID for tracking people .

input: grammar: Although in a government system , the information obtained from RFID is kept , there is still a chance for hackers to read the card information and exploit the human 's medical status or steal the personal identities , for example .
target: Although in a government system , the information obtained from RFID is kept , there is still a chance for hackers to read the card information and exploit the human 's medical status or steal the personal identities , for example .

input: grammar: Through this , the hackers can assault the individual 's life , or more seriously , exploit those information to assault the government and military systems .
target: Through this , the hackers can assault the individual 's life , or more seriously , exploit that information to assault the government and military systems .

input: grammar: This places our society in extreme danger .
target: This places our society in extreme danger .

input: grammar: Finally , though some may argue that RFID is a scientific progress , and we should not hinder it , the use of RFID on human may make RFID a useless , or even dangerous , technology .
target: Finally , though some may argue that RFID is a scientific progress , and we should not hinder it , the use of RFID on human may make RFID a useless , or even dangerous , technology .

input: grammar: Let 's remind us of inventing nuclear weapons and creating wars everywhere .
target: Let us remind ourselves of inventing nuclear weapons and creating wars everywhere .

input: grammar: Is that a real scientific progress ?
target: Is that a real scientific progress ?

input: grammar: In conclusion , I advocate the ban of RFID to track people .
target: In conclusion , I advocate the ban of RFID to track people .

input: grammar: Using RFID is like a double knife .
target: Using RFID is like a double knife .

input: grammar: It is advantageous , but do not go too far , or it will kill ourselves .
target: It is advantageous , but we should not go too far , or it will kill us .

input: grammar: The word 'Surveillance ' originally came from France where it means 'to watch over ' in French .
target: The word 'Surveillance ' originally came from France where it means 'to watch over ' in French .

input: grammar: Surveillance technology has a history dated back as early as 1965 , where the first closed circuit television ( CCTV ) was used in the police force in the United States in public places ( Roberts , 2005 ) .
target: Surveillance technology has a history dated back to as early as 1965 , where the first closed circuit television ( CCTV ) was used in the police force in the United States in public places ( Roberts , 2005 ) .

input: grammar: The definition of surveillance technology is the ongoing monitoring of people or information to detect changes in trends or distribution to initiate investigative or control measures ( The Joint Comission , 2006 ) .
target: The definition of surveillance technology is the ongoing monitoring of people or information to detect changes in trends or distribution to initiate investigative or control measures ( The Joint Comission , 2006 ) .

input: grammar: The two most common and effective types of surveillance today is the global positioning system ( GPS ) and the radio frequency identification ( RFID ) .
target: The two most common and effective types of surveillance today is the global positioning system ( GPS ) and the radio frequency identification ( RFID ) .

input: grammar: The benefits of surveillance technology conspicuously outweigh the concerns about human privacy issues that are so often brought up by human rights bodies and the law ( Michael & Rose , 2007 ) .
target: The benefits of surveillance technology conspicuously outweigh the concerns about human privacy issues that are so often brought up by human rights bodies and the law ( Michael & Rose , 2007 ) .

input: grammar: This is because this intelligent technology aids in crime prevention , social control and threat monitoring .
target: This is because this intelligent technology aids in crime prevention , social control and threat monitoring .

input: grammar: Surveillance technology helps prevent crime .
target: Surveillance technology helps prevent crime .

input: grammar: The presentation of crime across the media for the past 30 years via television news , drama series , reality televisions , etc. , has indicated that crime is a feature of modern life , and the government can not protect the public by itself ( Knepper , Doak , & Shapland , 2009 ) .
target: The presentation of crime across the media for the past 30 years via television news , drama series , reality televisions , etc. , has indicated that crime is a feature of modern life , and the government can not protect the public by itself ( Knepper , Doak , & Shapland , 2009 ) .

input: grammar: It is therefore important to allow surveillance technology to work hand-in-hand with the police force to overcome criminal puzzles without the redundant concerns over human privacy .
target: It is therefore important to allow surveillance technology to work hand-in-hand with the police force to overcome criminal puzzles without the redundant concerns over human privacy .

input: grammar: For example , GPS 24/7 continuous real-time tracking of and individual , and is considered several times more powerful than the traditional visual surveillance often exercised by the police force ( Michael & Rose , 2007 ) .
target: For example , GPS 24/7 continuous real-time tracking of an individual individual , and is considered several times more powerful than the traditional visual surveillance often exercised by the police force ( Michael & Rose , 2007 ) .

input: grammar: According to FOXNews.com on the 21st Of May , 2006 , the authorities can now track dangerous sex offenders with GPS without keeping them in prison at taxpayer 's expenses , even after serving their time .
target: According to FOXNews.com on the 21st Of May , 2006 , the authorities can now track dangerous sex offenders with GPS without keeping them in prison at the taxpayers expenses , even after serving their time .

input: grammar: In 1999 , the murder case of Valiree by William 'Brad ' Jackson was solved with concrete evidence when the police force obtained a warrant to install a GPS transmitter on his truck and successfully tracked his movement to certain places which led to the discovery of the victim 's body .
target: In 1999 , the murder case of Valiree by William 'Brad ' Jackson was solved with concrete evidence when the police force obtained a warrant to install a GPS transmitter on his truck and successfully tracked his movement to certain places which led to the discovery of the victim 's body .

input: grammar: While there are opponents raising the issue of invasion of privacy towards an individual and also the trustworthiness of the law enforcement personnel to act appropriately , justification can be done by the effectiveness of surveillance technology in bringing justice ( Michael & Rose , 2007 ) .
target: While there are opponents raising the issue of invasion of privacy towards an individual and also the trustworthiness of the law enforcement personnel to act appropriately , justification can be done by the effectiveness of surveillance technology in bringing justice ( Michael & Rose , 2007 ) .

input: grammar: It would be absurd to compromise the credibility of tracking and bringing a criminal case into light just to preserve the basic individual right to privacy .
target: It would be absurd to compromise the credibility of tracking and bringing a criminal case into light just to preserve the basic individual right to privacy .

input: grammar: Surveillance technology also aids social control .
target: Surveillance technology also aids social control .

input: grammar: RFID-tagging in certain commercial products has been widely practiced in the retail stores in the United States , namely Wal-Mart , for the purpose of convenient inventory tracking .

input: grammar: " Should the use of surveillance technology such as RFID to track people should be banned ?
target: " Should the use of surveillance technology such as RFID to track people be banned ?

input: grammar: "

grammar: Radio-frequency identification ( RFID ) technology has advanced from industrial and animal tagging applications to being able to track people 's movements ( Friedlos , 2009 ; Kanellos , 2004 ; Masters & Michael , 2006 ) .
target: Radio-frequency identification ( RFID ) technology has advanced from industrial and animal tagging applications to being able to track people 's movements ) .

input: grammar: This technology has brought about privacy and security issues ( Kanellos , 2004 ; Masters & Michael , 2006 ) .
target: This technology has brought about privacy and security issues ( Kanellos , 2004 ; Masters & Michael , 2006 ) .

input: grammar: However , the benefits of RFID outweigh these issues .
target: However , the benefits of RFID outweigh these issues .

input: grammar: Hence , the use of surveillance technology such as RFID to track people should not be banned .
target: Hence , the use of surveillance technology such as RFID to track people should not be banned .

input: grammar: Firstly , RFID enhances personnel management .
target: Firstly , RFID enhances personnel management .

input: grammar: Efficient employee monitoring can be accomplished by tagging employees with RFID tags and installing readers within building premises .
target: Efficient employee monitoring can be accomplished by tagging employees with RFID tags and installing readers within building premises .

input: grammar: Some companies made it compulsory for their staff to wear RFID tags to facilitate personnel identification and access control ( Masters & Michael , 2006 ) .
target: Some companies have made it compulsory for their staff to wear RFID tags to facilitate personnel identification and access control ( Masters & Michael , 2006 ) .

input: grammar: RFID critics argue that the start-up cost for a fully operational RFID system is high .
target: RFID critics argue that the start-up cost for a fully operational RFID system is high .

input: grammar: Companies have to purchase tags ( US $ 0.20 - $ 50 each ) , readers ( UHF reader : US $ 500 - $ 3,000 ) , middleware ( may be US $ 183,000 ) , upgrade system networks and pay installation fees ( RFID Journal , 2005 ) .
target: Companies have to purchase tags ( US $ 0.20 - $ 50 each ) , readers ( UHF reader : US $ 500 - $ 3,000 ) , middleware ( may be US $ 183,000 ) , upgrade system networks and pay installation fees ( RFID Journal , 2005 ) .

input: grammar: However , companies will reap benefits in the long run .
target: However , companies will reap benefits in the long run .

input: grammar: Also , costs will come down as technology improves ( RFID Journal , 2005 ) .
target: Also , costs will come down as technology improves ( RFID Journal , 2005 ) .

input: grammar: Thus , RFID can be used to improve management .
target: Thus , RFID can be used to improve management .

input: grammar: Secondly , RFID helps to reduce and solve crimes .
target: Secondly , RFID helps to reduce and solve crimes .

input: grammar: RFID can be used to monitor people who may pose a threat to society .
target: RFID can be used to monitor people who may pose a threat to society .

input: grammar: Knowing that they are being spied on , they will have less tendency to commit crimes .
target: Knowing that they are being spied on , they will have a lesser tendency to commit crimes .

target: Prison violence was reduced by up to 60 % in some United States prisons that had RFID installed ( Kanellos , 2004 ) .

input: grammar: Furthermore , data retrieved from RFID readers can serve as evidence against suspects to solve crimes ( Kanellos , 2004 ) .
target: Furthermore , data retrieved from RFID readers can serve as evidence against suspects to solve crimes ( Kanellos , 2004 ) .

input: grammar: Opponents of RFID technology argue that implanted RFID tags cause cancer .
target: Opponents of RFID technology argue that implanted RFID tags cause cancer .

target: Implanted RFID tags were observed to cause tumours in laboratory animals ( Albrecht , 2007 ) .

input: grammar: This concern is not necessary , because external tags can be used .
target: This concern is not necessary , because external tags can be used .

target: Overall , RFID is effective and beneficial in reducing and solving crimes .

input: grammar: Thirdly , RFID allows optimal patient care and safety in hospitals .
target: Thirdly , RFID allows optimal patient care and safety in hospitals .

input: grammar: Tracking of medical professionals allows them to receive notification immediately when a patient needs help .
target: Tracking of medical professionals allows them to receive notification immediately when a patient needs help .

target: Tracking of patients ensures patient 's safety by noticing if the patient is at the right place at the right time .

target: For example , in the United States , South Tyneside District Hospital tagged newborns with RFID tags , and hid RFID readers at exit points ( Masters & Michael , 2006 ) .

input: grammar: Unauthorized removal of baby would trigger the alarm thus enhancing baby safety ( Masters & Michael , 2006 ) .
target: Unauthorized removal of a baby would trigger the alarm thus enhancing baby safety ( Masters & Michael , 2006 ) .

target: Currently , Tan Tock Seng Hospital is using ThermoSensors , a new RFID tag which is capable of patient location tracking and body temperature monitoring ( Friedlos , 2009 ) .

target: Unfortunately , there are several security and privacy concerns .

target: But , these concerns can be addressed by giving individuals the choice of using RFID technology and freedom to remove tags when desired ( Masters & Michael , 2006 ) .

target: It helps to enhance management , reduce crimes and enable optimal patient care .

input: grammar: Surveillance technology is necessary in today 's society ( Evans , 2008 ) , although some people may feel that it is an invasion of privacy ( Kanellos , 2004 ) .

input: grammar: Using surveillance technology to track people has benefitted people in three areas , socially , in the medical field and in the military sector .
target: Using surveillance technology to track people has benefitted people in three areas , socially , in the medical field and in the military sector .

input: grammar: It should therefore not be banned .
target: It should therefore not be banned .

input: grammar: Socially , surveillance technology is used to track people .
target: Socially , surveillance technology is used to track people .

input: grammar: Radio frequency identification ( RFID ) chips and tags are used to track people .
target: Radio frequency identification ( RFID ) chips and tags are used to track people .

input: grammar: It is a boon for parents looking for their children amidst a large crowd , like in an amusement park ( Fortune magazine , 2004 ) .
target: It is a boon for parents looking for their children amidst a large crowd , like in an amusement park ( Fortune magazine , 2004 ) .

input: grammar: Employers can also track the location of their employees to ensure that they are safe , especially at hazardous worksites ( Intelleflex Corporation , 2009 ) using RFID badges .
target: Employers can also track the location of their employees to ensure that they are safe , especially at hazardous worksites ( Intelleflex Corporation , 2009 ) using RFID badges .

input: grammar: Another way would be to implant RFID chips under their skin .
target: Another way would be to implant RFID chips under their skin .

input: grammar: Citywatcher.com , a surveillance company , is one of those companies to have RFID chips implanted in their employees ' arms ( Gruber , n.d. ) for safety measures .
target: Citywatcher.com , a surveillance company , is one of those companies to have RFID chips implanted in their employees ' arms ( Gruber , n.d. ) as a safety measure .

input: grammar: However , RFID chips implanted under the skin are difficult to remove as they could migrate under the skin ( American Medical Association , 2008 ) and not all employees want to be implanted with these chips .
target: However , RFID chips implanted under the skin are difficult to remove as they could migrate under the skin ( American Medical Association , 2008 ) and not all employees want to be implanted with these chips .

input: grammar: This however is not a problem as many states have banned employers from forcing employees to receive a RFID implant ( Jones , 2007 ) .
target: This however is not a problem as many states have banned employers from forcing employees to receive a RFID implant ( Jones , 2007 ) .

input: grammar: Therefore , surveillance technology should not be banned since there are counter-measures in place and less invasive methods like the RFID tags available .
target: Therefore , surveillance technology should not be banned since there are counter-measures in place and less invasive methods like the RFID tags available .

input: grammar: Another sector using surveillance technology to track people would be the medical field .
target: Another sector using surveillance technology to track people would be the medical field .

target: Maternity wards in hospitals ensure that babies are not swapped accidentally with the help of RFID tags ( Fortune magazine , 2004 ) .

input: grammar: RFID tags are also used to monitor patients with Alzheimer 's disease according to Kanellos ( 2004 ) to prevent them from getting lost .
target: RFID tags are also used to monitor patients with Alzheimer 's disease according to Kanellos ( 2004 ) to prevent them from getting lost .

input: grammar: The RFID tags are broken once patients are discharged so the bed can be prepared for new patients so waiting time would be reduced .
target: The RFID tags are broken once patients are discharged so the bed can be prepared for new patients and waiting time would be reduced .

input: grammar: Consequently , if nurses did not break the tag , disorder might result since the bed is no longer occupied but the housekeeping team is not informed .
target: Consequently , if nurses did not break the tag , disorder might result since the bed is no longer occupied but the housekeeping team is not informed .

input: grammar: Surgeries can also proceed smoothly and timely as both staff and patients can be tracked since they are wearing the tags .
target: Surgeries can also proceed smoothly and timely as both staff and patients can be tracked since they are wearing the tags .

input: grammar: This clearly shows that surveillance technology brings about many benefits so it should not be banned .
target: This clearly shows that surveillance technology brings about many benefits so it should not be banned .

input: grammar: Surveillance technology is essential in the military sector to track enemies and to search and rescue soldiers .
target: Surveillance technology is essential in the military sector to track enemies and to search and rescue soldiers .

input: grammar: Technology like the Global positioning system ( GPS ) is used to track enemies from the air ( Gately , 2009 ) , while the artesian radar and SPY-1 radar is used to monitor the sea ( Evans , 2008 ) .
target: Technology like the Global positioning system ( GPS ) is used to track enemies from the air ( Gately , 2009 ) , while the artesian radar and SPY-1 radar is used to monitor the sea ( Evans , 2008 ) .

input: grammar: All these technologies are to deter and detect enemies so countries are not caught unawares should enemies invade .
target: All these technologies are to deter and detect enemies so countries are not caught unawares should enemies invade .

input: grammar: However , these systems are not without flaws as it was reported that Korean Air Lines Flight 007 strayed and was shot down in a Soviet no-fly zone ( Gately , 2009 ) .
target: However , these systems are not without flaws as it was reported that Korean Air Lines Flight 007 strayed and was shot down in a Soviet no-fly zone ( Gately , 2009 ) .

input: grammar: To address this issue , civilians are now able to use the GPS to ensure that they do no stray into these zones although usage is limited ( Gately , 2009 ) .
target: To address this issue , civilians are now able to use the GPS to ensure that they do no stray into these zones although usage is limited ( Gately , 2009 ) .

input: grammar: Downed pilots are also located and rescued efficiently .
target: Downed pilots are also located and rescued efficiently .

input: grammar: U.S. Air Force pilot , Captain Scott O'Grady was rescued within hours with the help of the GPS ( LANDAIRSEA , 2009 ) .
target: U.S. Air Force pilot , Captain Scott O'Grady was rescued within hours with the help of the GPS ( LANDAIRSEA , 2009 ) .

input: grammar: Hence , these technologies should not be banned as it efficiently locates enemies , save lives and at the same time ensures that civilians are not harmed by the new regulations .
target: Hence , these technologies should not be banned as it efficiently locates enemies , saves lives and at the same time ensures that civilians are not harmed by the new regulations .

target: In conclusion , there are some issues about using surveillance technologies to track people in the social , medical and military aspects .

target: Nevertheless , using surveillance technology to track people has brought about many benefits and there are regulations to ensure that these technologies would not be abused .

input: grammar: First , it will intrude other people 's privacy , for example the usage of RFID in smart card that includes a microchip that stores ID , phone number , bank account , or address which are such critical information on each individual ( RFID Journal,2003 ) .
target: First , it will intrude into other people 's privacy . For example the usage of RFID in a smart card that includes a microchip that stores ID , phone number , bank account , or address which are such critical information on each individual ( RFID Journal,2003 ) .

target: The problem arises when there are hackers who can access the information that is stored in a RFID smart card .

input: grammar: Second , the usage of RFID by company to track other company 's data , such that all fax , telephone , or email are intercepted so that all of the vital and very useful data of one company can be detected by other company ( Bogonikolos,1999 ) .
